reviews.review: When ever i crave sushi "sushime" is the spot to go to.I love the overall atmosphere and quality of sushi they provide. They always take good care of me. A++

reviews.name: Kristie A.
reviews.review: Great sushi! We got Alaskan roll, tuna roll, and spicy tuna roll. I loved the spicy tuna! It was actually spicy. We also like the rice that they use.I also had tempura udon. Mhmmmm loved the noodles! They have gazillion specialty rolls. We didn't want to spend so much so we didn't order any but they all look so good. Their menu has pictures which really help!

reviews.name: Ali S.
reviews.review: Great sushi that can be very filling. They have a lot of different and creative options on their sushi menu.   I'm not very impressed with their food dishes though. Can definitely see myself returning because of the sushi and great location.   In my opinion, Peters sushi still is the best sushi place in town.

reviews.name: Lexie S.
reviews.review: They have some really unique rolls, the fruit ones are my favorite, but they tend to fall apart. The rolls are too big and nothing is worse than hot soy soaked sushi because it broke while dipping. Other than that, it is one of my favorite places.

reviews.name: Austin H.
reviews.review: Have been here a few times and had a bad experience every single time. The service is friendly but the food falls short. The seafood is never fresh and their menus stay filthy with stains and left over roe. Not going there again. Sushi O Sushi is much better and just across the street.

reviews.name: Augusta P.
reviews.review: My boyfriend and I recently got a Groupon to this place and we loved it. We have been twice since and we are still very satisfied with both the food and service. Their bento box is really good. Typically, we split it and get and extra side of fried rice. It's plenty of food for the both of us. Love it!

reviews.name: Stephen L.
reviews.review: Tonight was great! They seated us in the back and quickly. We had 8 people and they accommodated us well. We ordered all kinds of dishes and not one disappointed. It was only my second time here and it was highly a better experience than the last. I will  def come back here sooner than the last time I visited. The service was a tad slow and the waitress forgot a lot, but we were not in a hurry so it was okay.

reviews.name: Luis C.
reviews.review: This place is expensive for what it is and the quality. They use too much rice to little sushi. They put too much cream cheese and too much sauce ovee powering the sushi taste.Then they charge 50cents for extra wasabi!!!!!!!!??????? Unacceptable.

reviews.name: Valerie L.
reviews.review: Love this place.  We come all the time.  Food is fantastic and service is always friendly.

reviews.name: JC L.
reviews.review: There were so many gnats at the sushi bar that we had to leave. Disgusting! Don't waste your time...go to Wild Ginger!

reviews.name: William G.
reviews.review: The AngryBanana roles are delicious, have a wide variety of choices, salmon, eil, Big Daddy and always has specials.  Prices are very reasonable.

reviews.name: Carmen P.
reviews.review: there are now two standards of measurement for sushi: BS and PS--before sushime and post sushime.  there are some hit and miss reviews here, but trust me, ignore them.  scroll past them.  this place is nomiliscious.  i had the crazy cow and the angry banana. both are spicy.  both changed my life.  both made me forget all the troubles of the last few days. you may think to yourself, what kind of weirdo thinks combining spicy crab and bananas and cream cheese and spicy sauce is a good idea---me!  i wasn't even hungry and i kept stuffing my face full these!  the crazy cow has a bunch of yummy and spicy stuff in it too, i can't remember, but they have a menu, look it up!  the miso soup was the best i've had. seriously.  the best.  none of this is exaggerated.  your sushi life will change. our service was great as well.  oh! also, thursday nights are ladies nights--half price drinks, all drinks!  try the french kiss...it feels weird ordering it "i would like the french kiss" --especially when your husband is with you and your server is a dude, but, you lose all concern once you have the first sip.

reviews.name: Kim N.
reviews.review: We come every week for lunch, fried rice is really good here. I always get chicken fried rice and fire mountain roll. The food here is expensive but you get what you pay for! Quality over quantity

reviews.name: Shafi K.
reviews.review: This is one of my favorite places to eat in Nashville, and so I am surprised to know that it only have 3 stars!:( Their sushi is delicious and completely melts in your mouth. I am really big on spicy sushi, salmon and tuna (I hate tuna except if it is in sushi) and Sushime is the only place in Nashville that has more than 1-2 sushi options with all three of these in it. Some of our favorites are Las Vegas II, Play Boy II, Sushime Special, Sweet 28 II, and  Big Daddy. All of them are so good! The nigiri is quite good too. It works well as an appetizer. TIP: They seem to make the sushi quicker than calamari or other appetizers so I would order together instead of appetizer and then main course after a while. TIP: I am not a big fan of other things here. I have not tried the bento box or anything, but I thought the calamari was a bit overfried. Either way, it's called sushi me and it's best for it's sushi so I am not complaining. :)The service was great and food was served very quickly. I am happy for them because last year whenever we went in there were not that many people, but when we went in last night, there were a ton of people! I'm for sure going to keep coming back.

reviews.name: Leslie W.
reviews.review: First night we had tried to go, we walked in only for the cooks to say they were closing early. Bad start already. The second time we went, we had a 30 minute wait even though there were 4 tables open to seat us. After ordering, the hot tea was watered down, it was difficult to get a refill, and the service was the slowest ever in mankind. Once we were served, only a quarter of our sushi was appetizing. The rest of our sushi was very sickening, to the point that the fried eel made us very sick for the following 2 days. My boyfriend and I are huge sushi lovers, and have had sushi from all over the U.S., but this was bad.

reviews.name: Richard D.
reviews.review: Great sushi for a landlocked state. Fish is fresh and always very good. My wife and I eat here at least once a week, generally twice. The bar staff is attentive and friendly. The sushi chefs are always willing to make my plate exactly what I want. Sushime is most certainly one of the top sushi places in Nashville.

reviews.name: Kelsey M.
reviews.review: I love sushime. It is so close and has a good selection. It can be a little pricey, but I've never had anything that needed to go back. I love their veggie roll and avocado rolls. Their fried rice is excellent as well. I've taken many people there and have yet to be disappointed! Highly recommend.

reviews.name: Stefanie M.
reviews.review: We went around 7 on a Sunday evening and had good service and wonderful sushi.  I can't remember exactly what we had (we always order one roll, eat it, order another, eat it.....keep doing that until we're full so I can never remember what we ate).Either way, the restaurant was clean, a little dark, seafood was extremely fresh and the rolls were rolled nice and tight!

reviews.name: Gregg H.
reviews.review: Read some reviews before coming here and I'm a little confused. "On par with Wild Ginger?" You have to be kidding me. Not in any way close to Wild Ginger. Maybe a little cheaper, but fish had an off taste. Not something I want from a place that serves raw fish. Tiny pieces with an off flavor? Not for me.  I won't be back. I've had Peter's and it is pretty good, and I've been to Sushi o Sushi across the street from this place and it's pretty good, but seriously Wild Ginger is the best place I've found. The bartenders are great and the food has never been anything but perfectly fresh.

reviews.name: Karen C.
reviews.review: Best sushi place I've been to in Nashville..hands down:) I got the Lenox Roll which was a signature dish and then the spicy tuna. Both were VERY good! We had good service too. Highly recommended!!!

reviews.name: Travis S.
reviews.review: Nice dinner. Everything is good food, service and wait time included. But nothing is great.

reviews.name: Tim P.
reviews.review: My little gem.  This place is off the charts.  The nicest folks you'll find and some of the highest quality sushi around.  My brother who's a conneisuer of sorts from San Francisco can't believe we have this quality in little old Nashville, TN.  You can waste your money at Peter's but I'll be living large in Lennox Village!

reviews.name: Jennie W.
reviews.review: I'm in the minority for a positive review and I don't understand the bad reviews for Sushi Me.(people who disagree): Wait, hold up Jennie...you sure about that?Yes, I've an opinion and I'm gonna count the reasons why. Take it or leave it. :)This place has the best sushi in Nashville. Hands down.Since I live around Nashwood (that line where Nashville and Brentwood meet), I don't feel the need to venture all the way out to Downtown or Brentwood (lazy!) to get my sushi fix. Gas ain't cheap yo and public transportation is a complete joke around these parts of town. So it's kind of hard to find a good sushi spot. Peter's is always busy, Hanabi...just no, Miyako..still need to hit that place up, Sushi O Sushi..it's been awhile I need to check it out again, Samurai...Wild Wasabi..Sam's..and Rusans are a little out of the way. However, Sushi Me changed all of that. It also didn't hurt that it's about 12 minutes away.I remembered the first time that I went with my friend. Our stomachs were famished after walking around shopping and catching up making fun of the folks we had the complete misfortune of going to high school with. We played this typical convo game that's probably all too familiar with your friends and family talking in circles if you don't have an strong opinion of where to go:Me: So, where do you wanna eat?Friend: I dunno. Where ever you wanna go is fine by me.Me: I dunno, sushi?Friend: Ok.Me: Do you wanna try out Sushi O Sushi or Sushi Me?Friend: Doesn't matter, let's get some!Me: But where? We can't be in two places at once!Friend: Haha, I'm hungry..just anything!(went on for a few more minutes until we settled on Sushi Me)Yeah, the longer we talked, the more we starved ourselves. Smdh first world problems.When you step inside, you get a modern Asian vibe with all the red, white, and black. Classy, but still casual. A full bar is there if you want your alcohol fix with a TV for sports watching.We were seated at a table and were completely overwhelmed by the sushi menu with pictures. Indecisiveness of several choices doesn't suit well with me, especially if I want to order the whole menu...which is my dream goal. Someday, it'll happen!Service was good. Maybe we always got lucky with the service? The waitress did her job by promptly checking if we're doing okay and refilled our waters.When the waitress brought out our sushi, we were like, "OMGGGG SO PRETTY!" That we didn't want to eat it, but it must be consumed. My friend and I sampled each other's rolls and LOVED every single bite.You won't be disappointed. In presentation and taste, this joint takes the cake..more than Rihanna could ever say! I had the Big Daddy, Angry Banana, Dynamite, Cabo Wabo, Playboy, Green Dragon, Love Me, Mango Tango, Black Dragon, Vampire, and Lenox on my various repeat visits. I bet the other rolls are as great too. Price ranges from $9-15.Main thing here: I'm talking about ordering off the sushi roll signature menu! If the entrees aren't up to your standards...try their sushi. PLEASE IT'S SOOOOOOO WONDERFULLY DELICIOUS! I cannot express that enough.If you don't like sushi, then you need to try it FRIED. Period. Trust me, put that on your bucket list.Why did I give it 4 stars? Because it's pricey, but worth it!

reviews.name: Mistye A.
reviews.review: Outdoor seating is great. Covered & plenty of seating. I've never had a bad meal & I've been there a lot. Martinis are good. The flavored teas - mango is really good.

reviews.name: Jess B.
reviews.review: My husband and I have eaten here at least 25 times in the last 2 years...The fish is fresh and we prefer sashimi and nigiri sushi rather than rolls. They always let us know what the best choice is of daily arrivals. We sit at the bar and have always had great service. They will customize to taste. They have a little trouble getting fried appetizers out if busy. Also if you are into design, they excel. Atmosphere is casual. We really love this place. My only higher choice in Nashville is Samari in Elliston Square next to the Gold Rush and MR. CHOO...THE BEST!!

reviews.name: Tram N.
reviews.review: I only write reviews when I feel a restaurant deserves the business and feel that it's worth my time say nice things about the staff and food.  I have been here three times and each time, the service has been really good.   I've ordered sashimi and sushi rolls, as well as their noodles.  I've sat at their table, eaten at the bar and taken food to go.  This is my sushi spot away from home from CA, therefore it's an awesome place because I'm ever so picky about my food.  The fish portions are not meager as well which is a big plus by my book. The restaurant is clean and the staff is super friendly and attentive to me, so my wish is that this place gets a lot more busier throughout this year.

reviews.name: Caitlin N.
reviews.review: This place has pretty good food, but the atmosphere and service are lacking. The music is ridiculous: terrible awful top 40 and it is way too loud. I really don't care to be distracted by nickelback while I'm trying to eat pretty sushi. And the last time I was there, I was ready for another round of drinks and received a check instead of a question ab my finished cocktail. But like I said, if you're willing to put up with this, the food is good. I love the rolls with fruit in them. Berry berry is my fave and my boyfriend is really into the angry banana roll. Honestly though, I'll probably just continue going to sushi o sushi across the street.

reviews.name: Martí M.
reviews.review: We were looking for a quick Sunday night dinner so us gals could get back to work, but wanted to try something new. So we hopped in the car with our husbands and headed out to Cane Ridge to Sushime.The patio looked enticing and we originally wanted to sit outdoors. But the bugs started to gnaw, so we scurried inside. We were then ushered to a table large enough to accommodate six. Unfortunately, one of the seats placed my husband at the joint of the two tables pushed together. Since the restaurant was not busy, and there were only four of us, I was rather confused as to why we were sat at that particular table. Having already moved once, I decided not to say anything.The service was great throughout our visit, and this small place does have a pretty extensive menu. I opted for my most basic Japanese meal, starting with edamame. Unfortunately, it was awful. It seemed these beans had been allowed to ripen too long, and when boiled (or steamed) they were just too soft and lacked flavor. For the first time in my edamame history, I did not finish the bowl.I also ordered the veggie roll, in which the description stated the roll would consist of avocado and cucumber. When my plate arrived, only four of the six had avocado in them and asparagus had been added to compensate for the veggie MIA. It still tasted alright, but I wasn't thrilled that I had not been served what was "promised".My table mates seemed to enjoy their meals alright with clean plates all around. Perhaps I will just try something different if there is a next time...

reviews.name: Simon K.
reviews.review: Have you ever watched a movie that was so awful that it ends up being entertaining?... I wish that could be true for restaurants.  I went out to eat at Sushi-me, and didn't get to eat anything... that's never happened to me.  The service was so bad that it was comical.  I was in a group of six, and I ordered Vietnamese noodles.  All of my friends got their food, and then the server said that my dish would take a little longer.  As I waited, my friends started their meals.        Half way through, the server came back and said, "Sorry man, turns out we don't have that dish tonight."  Then he gave me the menu back and offered to take another order.       I said, "You're telling me this now?  My friends are almost finished eating."     Then he said, "Yeah I know, that really sucks."     "????"  Then I asked what they planned on doing about the inconvenience.  So he left to find an answer.       After another 15 mins, he came back and said, "The manager would only be willing to compensate 20% off... at the most."Moral of the story:  I should've been better prepared to  negotiate.  "DEAL or NO DEAL?"  My treatment was determined by how well I could barter... which I couldn't do very well; so they won and I ended up not getting to eat anything.  I was naive think that I could order something off the menu and have it served to me.  Congratulations Sushi-me; you've out-smarted me!  However, I do still have one question: What is "20%" of nothing ordered?  That's like saving up for your children's college tuition, without ever having any children... it's a noble sentiment, but you're keeping all the money for yourself.  I wish I could have tried the food to write a review about.  Maybe I will go to law school and learn about negotiation.  Then I can come back; equipped to be able to order food and have it come out to me.  For those who are interested in trying the place out; I can at least tell you that it smelled good.  If you're lucky, you might be able to negotiate "20%" off the aroma.

reviews.name: H R.
reviews.review: Good news:The sushi is good. It is on par with Peter's and Wild Ginger. The price is fair. Bad news:You will need to bring your own toilet paper(BYOTP). The bathrooms are filthy. This may or may not be a problem for you... But I will point out that dirty bathrooms in restaurants that serve raw food are a bad idea.... I'm just saying.

reviews.name: Lumnum W.
reviews.review: My party arrived promptly at 1100a and no one was at the front to seat us. Two sushi chefs were watching us stand there but did nothing to greet us or alert the hostess of our arrival.  When we went to go seat ourselves, we found the hostess cleaning up from the night before-who doesn't clean after the restaurant closes? Now let me state here that sushi me is one of my favorite places to get sushi-I've been here many times. This time was way off. It took a long time to order even though we were the only ones in the place. But once we got the order, it was weird. The roll that was to have blueberries didn't have any and never did anyone state they were out or offer a discount for a half made roll. The other rolls had ingredients that were not supposed to be there-it was a completely lazy job. I had to pop my head over the divider every time I needed the 1 waitress-she was on her laptop in the back of the restaurant. Then I went to the bathroom and you could tell it wasn't cleaned from the night before-who opens without cleaning the bathroom? This place is getting funky fast and the owners need to have some pride in what they do, otherwise everyone will find somewhere new to eat.

reviews.name: Anthony S.
reviews.review: Consistently delicious. My favorite sushi in Nashville so far.

reviews.name: Carolyn S.
reviews.review: Very good, so many unique rolls that taste great and at a wonderful price (for sushi). Their boxes have a ton of food, also at a great price!I would recommend this place!

reviews.name: Cass R.
reviews.review: By far my favorite sushi place in surrounding Nashville area. We drive from Nippers Corner just to get the sushi. Great presentation and service. Freshest ingredients!!! Do know that they aren't open for lunch service (made that mistake a few times). Love love love this place :)

reviews.name: Collin K.
reviews.review: Best sushi in this area love this place... I always get the specialty roll here.. And the people are very nice that work here......

reviews.name: Anthony T.
reviews.review: Stop by for lunch and got combination fried rice. It was great and I HIGHLY  recommend it. The service was also really good, so if u are the area, give it a try.

reviews.name: Cristy H.
reviews.review: I'm updating this review because I no longer eat at this establishment.

reviews.name: Nanette B.
reviews.review: My husband and I eat Sushi at least once a week and if we have the choice we always choose Sushime!! Giant gourmet rolls with scrumptious sauces and fresh fresh fresh!!!  Eaten here countless times and had amazing food 100% of the time!

reviews.name: Travis A.
reviews.review: Finally got a chance to try Sushime tonight. I'll always welcome more good sushi options in town. We had the following: Shrimp Tempura Roll - yes, it's tame... but it's also one of the best I've ever tasted Spicy Scallop Roll - slightly above average Ocean Roll - this was odd... the picture looks nothing like the description and the actual roll was like the picture, not the description. mixture of tuna, yellowtail and some others... very clean and fresh with lots of fish... recommended Eel Diablo Roll - I love unagi, and this roll delivered.. the tempura asparagus in the center really complimented everything White Snake Roll - "Is This Love?" No, sadly it was average at best... kinda disappointed, and I think David Coverdale would be too The presentation was great. Rivals some of the most expensive and trendy sushi spots I've been to around the country. Prices were average for Nashville, but the portions were great. Not too much rice, which is good. Also had a full Japanese menu. I'll have to try it sometime. Glad this place is just down the street. The bad (if I have to be picky): The ginger wasn't that good. No low sodium soy option. The chairs are not comfortable... this place needs more booths.

reviews.name: Tran T.
reviews.review: Pros:Drinks - the fruit teas are yummyyyySeaweed salad - very very fresh and tastySquid salad - average. (I prefer the one from Fulin's)Fried oysters - average. (Want really good ones? Try Whitfield's )Calamari - delicious! (they served the tails, not the body)Chicken Yakitori - the best I ate so far!!! the sauce was so good!!Sushi Rolls - most of the rolls here are really good but my favorite are volcano and sassy rolls!Dessert - we ordered ice cream tempura, green tea ice cream and red bean ice cream. All three were really tasty but I recommend the green tea ice cream, it was delicious and not too sweet!Cons: Waiters are new and working really slow...My waiter didnt give us chopsticks or forks and dishes to eat when brought appetizers out -.-After going here twice, I have to admit the food here are very consistent which I think is very important factor for restaurants to be successful. Sushime has fulfilled this and I rate this restaurant as excellent. I will come back again in the future and hopefully the waiters will have better training!

reviews.name: Stefanie P.
reviews.review: Interior: Red and black colors, clean, and a very friendly staff. The sushi bar is right when you walk in. I'm no interior designer but the lighting of this place is perfectly lit. Big menu's with more specialty rolls than you could ever imagine! They have a few tvs with the sports games on (or did the night I was there) which was another bonus because a big playoff game was on. I feel that this 'plan' to develop this place was very well thought. Roll Report: Fireball Roll -  A massive roll, with massive pieces that was recommended by server. Our fav! Baja roll- Simple (in compared to others) but the jalapeno and cilantro gave it a kick! Angry Banana Roll - Yes, you're reading that right, toasted bananas, whipcream, strawberry sauce and crab. Gross? wrong! Very dessert like. I Make sure you're a big fan of bananas (i am not) because its very very bananay. They suggested this be eaten last as a 'dessert' It's a sorta behind Lenox Village next to a big undeveloped field so its sorta tricky. They do not take American Express, but to take Visa and Mastercard.  Prices: Specialty rolls are anywhere from $8.95-$11.95.

reviews.name: Morgan P.
reviews.review: I came to Sushime with a group girls. One of the girls in the group had eaten here before and really enjoyed it. This was a great spot for a girl's night dinner. We were sat at a long, almost secluded table. They easily dealt with the separate orders. The food did come out a bit piecemeal, which for a group is a tad awkward. I am more of a sushi purist so I wasn't expecting to be amazed by the food. I wasn't amazed. I ordered some pretty basic rolls: tuna, spicy tuna, and yellow tail. I also ordered an order of salmon sashimi. My sushi wasn't bad. It was definitely better than the kind that you can find at the grocery store. If I lived in Lenox Village, I wouldn't mind eating here in a pinch. However, I wouldn't drive out of my way to eat their rolls again. The other girls each ordered two or three rolls and then shared them amongst themselves. They ordered the fancy rolls for the most part. They seemed to enjoy most of the rolls. There was only one or two that lay partially consumed at the end of the meal. They had a really awesome drink special when I visited on a Saturday night: $1 hot sake. I would come back for that deal, seriously one dollar.Our waiter was totally overworked. He brought our checks and had our credit cards long enough for us to notice: probably fifteen or twenty minutes. He wouldn't visit our table for awhile but I saw him running around like a mad man. The other girls thought he was rude. He rushed the salmon for me because I didn't order enough food, so I was a bit more grateful. Honestly I think he we just over worked.

reviews.name: Lisa L.
reviews.review: Love this place! Staff is very helpful and friendly.  The Sushi is very fresh, great variety and good prices.

reviews.name: Katie Jane G.
reviews.review: This place is solid! Service wasn't great at first, and they have since perfected! I would recommend the Cabo Wabo, Sunkissed, Mango Tango, and Suite 28. All spectacular. You will always see celebrities here as well, especially on week nights. Carrie Underwood and Three Doors Down frequent this place. They also have brown rice for $1.00 more. The cocktails are always great. Love the pom cosmopolitan. And Thursdays are Ladies Night! Half off of all drinks til close!

reviews.name: Alex S.
reviews.review: The ambiance of this restaurant seems to fit the type of swank you'd find in a Lennox Village establishment. The first time I visited this restaurant the sushi was impressive. I made the mistake of trying the Pho, and as my auntie says, "I just haven't learned to appreciate it yet". The last time I visited, the sushi was again on par. I had the Love Me roll, and the Firecracker, I believe. My wife tried the Las Vegas, and the Cabo Wabo. The Las Vegas was the clear winner that night. The first visit, customer service was adequate and accommodating. Last time, not so much. I mean, if we both ordered 'spicy' rolls, wouldn't it make sense to make sure that we had water to quench the heat? And not to be nitpicky, but I'm used to at least being checked on a couple of times during the meal, before receiving the check. The Mrs. was peeved to be asked if our meal was going on the same check (did this not look like a date?).Other than that, I think Sushi Me is a decent eatery. However, I do think that we will be returning to our original favorite sushi spot around the corner to get our fix of the rawness.

reviews.name: Alicia B.
reviews.review: Sushi was good, patio was nice. Service was slow but I wasn't in a hurry so no big deal.

reviews.name: Michelle P.
reviews.review: I love the sushi here. I was recomended a roll off of their specialty list,The Las Vegas. It did not disappoint. I have also had a Bento Box and it was FULL of food. So much food I took some hoe to my Fiance and he had a FULL meal too. The area is great and so is the atmosphere. I would recommend this place if you dont feel like going Downtown for some decent sushi.

reviews.name: Trish T.
reviews.review: I can tell the people that say this is "fresh" and "great" tasting sushi have not eaten "fresh" or "great" tasting sushi before.  The first time my husband ordered their cooked sushi. It was mediocre at best.  Their "signature" rolls are nothing different from every other typical 2 star sushi restaurant.  The ingredients are the same, they just named it differently.  I ordered their udon soup.  It was okay tasting.  If I have a craving for it, the place across the street makes it better.     We wanted to give this place another chance because we just moved to TN.  We found a high end sushi place to eat at, but we also want to find a place that doesn't require us to dress up just to eat.  For the second visit, my husband ordered their beef bento box to-go (we live right upstairs), again, their food was mediocre.  It's not something that screams, "order me again."  However, I ordered their sashimi plater.  YUCK!  It was fishy and there was definitely cross contamination with their cleaning products.  In other words, my sashimi had a slight taste of bleach on top of tasting fishy.  After two and a half pieces, I threw it all away. Even if they offered to redo the platter, it's still coming from the same cuts of fish. No thanks and never again.

reviews.name: Joshua B.
reviews.review: I think when you go to a restaurant - the experience is often colored by the ambiance, the table you get, the service you receive and the food you eat.  Sometimes, if most everything is good you can overlook some of the other things that is not so good.So, tonight (a Wednesday Night) we had a group of 7 of us meet for dinner at 7pm.  Most of us, including myself, had never been here.  Three of my friends were already seated when I arrived.  I found that we were seated at a table for 4.  They basically crammed three people on the booth side, they added another chair to the other side of the table where the chairs were and then another one at the end of the table.  It wasn't busy.  There were plenty of other tables.  I'm not sure why they couldn't have pulled up another table to seat us more comfortably...?They took our drink order and it took 15-20 minutes before we actually got our drinks.  I guess 4 sodas and 3 waters takes that long.Appetizers were finally ordered after drinks were delivered and they come about about 10-15 minutes later.  At this point, we have been seated at this incredibly uncomfortable table for about 30-40 minutes and we still haven't been able to order our meals yet.Finally we order our meals - and about 20 minutes later - the food starts to come out   They bring out salads and soups.  Except only 1 person got the soup - and everyone else got salads.  They brought more soups than needed so they just left it at our table and told someone to eat it if they wanted.  The salad was nothing but iceberg lettuce with it drowned in some dressing.  And I mean LITERALLY drowning it this dressing.  There was so much in my bowl it filled up half the bowl with dressing.  Finally - the entrees start to come out...Except - they didn't have ANY of the sushi ready.  So, half the people who ordered 'non' sushi stuff had their food.  The other half didn't.  We were trying to wait for our friends who had ordered sushi...but we kept waiting and waiting - and finally, our friends told us to start without them since our food was hot.  Their food comes out - finally - after most of us were finished with our meal.  They STILL didn't have all the sushi out yet, though.  It was going to be a few more minutes before they could finally have all the sushi.  The opinion of everyone that had the sushi thought it was pretty fresh and tasted pretty good.  However, I got their 'Tempura Dinner' - which is supposed to consist on tempura chicken and vegetables and a warm tempura dipping sauce.  The tempura chicken was nothing more than chicken strips and was very, very bland.  The dipping sauce wasn't included when they brought out my meal so I had to ask for it which basically tasted like watered down soy sauce and it, too, was bland.  It was quite possibly the worst meal I've had all year at a restaurant.  It wasn't that it tasted BAD - it was that it didn't have a taste at all. So, to review:Service was slowThe table was crampedThe salad was badThe entree was blandThe food didn't come out together which is never ideal - leaving others to eat (and finish) before others got their entree.  Had to ask for things that supposedly came with the mealAll in all - I wasn't impressed.  Not with the food.  Not with the service.  Not with the cramped table.  The ambiance was the only thing that was good for me here tonight.  I could have dealt with the cramped table if the service was fast and the food was good - but it wasn't.  Needless to say - SushiMe might be for you - but not for me.  I won't be back.

reviews.name: Sarah H.
reviews.review: You haven't had good sushi in Nashville until you eat here! After eating here for several months, I became friends with the owner and his fiance, who is the bartender, and I can honestly say their ingredients are fresh and they want to please their customers! The rolls are packed with meat and aren't full of rice. While the service is rather slow, if you sit at the bar, you won't have any problems. Their bartender makes some mean drinks and will give you plenty of free tastings! The rolls are also very reasonably priced- cheaper than some of the other trendy sushi places around Nashville.

reviews.name: John M.
reviews.review: Stopped by here today on a whim, and it turned out to be a great find.  I'm not sure about the negative reviews, but my experience here was as good as any other sushi place you can find in Nashville.They have a tremendous list of specialty rolls as well as a variety of unique appetizers.  Their menu can be a bit daunting, but I appreciate the options.  The patio is great on a nice warm spring day, and I wish I had a few more hours to waste away before life's responsibilities called me away.The spring rolls were a nice surprise.  They are essentially Vietnamese served cold and wrapped in rice paper and stuffed with shrimp and fresh herbs.  The peanut sauce they served with the spring rolls was perfect. For sushi, we tried two of the specialty rolls: "Love Me" and "Big Daddy".  You can't go wrong with either roll.  Tremendous presentation and excellent flavor .  I've tried most of the other sushi places here in Nashville and would rank Sushi Me right up there.  Give it a shot and enjoy!

reviews.name: Winn E.
reviews.review: Great ambience, super nice staff and awesome sushi!

reviews.name: Sid G.
reviews.review: This place has some great sushi! We got several rolls but our favorite were the Sushime Special Roll and Paradaise [That's how it's spelled on the menu] Roll. We love that they have several rolls with fruit.The service was a bit lacking but since the sushi was so good, I'll cut them some slack.

reviews.name: Kati H.
reviews.review: We love Sushime! We go here at least once a month and usually order a few regular rolls and a few specialty rolls. It's a little pricier than Sushi O Sushi across the street, and yes, sometimes the service is a little slow, but as long as you aren't in a huge hurry, the sushi is worth it! I would stick with the sushi, though - I got their teriyaki chicken one time and I've honestly had better.

reviews.name: Melissa T.
reviews.review: Our new "go to" sushi spot in Lenox Village, which is a compliment considering our old one wasn't bad either.Trendy interior and great sushi, it makes for a good dinner out. It's usually pretty full, but we've never had a wait. The only downside is the service can be slow and the waiters seem either undertrained on the menu or new. We never go hungry here, as it will be a wait on food and service, but everything else is great.

reviews.name: Lindz B.
reviews.review: This place has horrible customer service! We tried it twice had the exact same kind of experience each time. The waiter seemed distracted, even when we had him again a month later when hopefully he had more practice waiting tables. We waited forever on food and drink refills. With 3 people, he came and brought each of 3 drinks separately, a beer last, which was odd, and he left our sake in the microwave and we had to remind him to go back and get it. They forgot my salad I ordered BOTH times. Do not waste your money. There are way better sushi restaurants right down the street. Midori for one. But honestly, I'd go ANYWHERE before I paid them to wait around while they screw up my order.

reviews.name: Josh K.
reviews.review: I am puzzled by the low reviews. I live in the Lennox Village area and frequent Sushi Me at least twice a month and always have fantastic sushi.  Their rolls are some of the best in Nashville.  Always fresh.  Service does vary from time to time.  It can be a little slow but the food makes up for it.

reviews.name: Sean S.
reviews.review: Sure the food is good, but with so many great sushi places, especially sushi o sushi right across the street, why put up with the bad music, phony vibe, and clearly disgruntled servers? You feel like an inconvenience just for being there.the atmosphere is almost nice and relaxed, but then there's TVs on and top 40s music playing. Seriously, Sushi O Sushi is where it's at.

reviews.name: Lindsey E.
reviews.review: By far my favorite sushi restaurant in Nashville. The food is always amazing and the workers are always very friendly.

reviews.name: Aye K.
reviews.review: Wonderful sushi!

reviews.name: Leslie J.
reviews.review: This place is awesome! I've had sushi all over this town, and this is the best! Service is great and food/drinks are delish! The outdoor patio, happy hour specials, and kids eat free on wed nite are bonuses!  LOVE IT! Big Daddy roll!! Yum!

reviews.name: Amber E.
reviews.review: I've been to this place twice. Both times were really good. On both visits I got the Big Daddy roll. Its so good! A bit pricey for the size, in my opinion, but good nonetheless. Gave them 4 stars for the price. Is a small establishment, but wasn't busy on either visit. Cocktails were good too, but again pricey.

reviews.name: Matt M.
reviews.review: Lunch special bento boxes are a lot of food for the price. Lots of great rolls, but I highly recommend the sunshime special roll.

reviews.name: Eva E.
reviews.review: Mmmm....edamame and sushi. Does it get any better? Yes! Add great ambiance and quick service and you've got a great date night. My husband and I've visited Sushime at least half a dozen times since they've opened and each time it keeps improving.

reviews.name: Anna L.
reviews.review: I had given this place 2 trys. First time I went it took literally 20 mins to get a drink order in then another 10 for the drink to arrive. After arriving the waitress left and said she'll be back but didn't return until I flagged her down about 15 mins later. I ordered a bento and 2 specialty rolls but waited another 20 mins still nothing so I got up and left. Second I went I tried the chicken katsu, spicy tuna, and Delicious roll. The Katsu was really good but it took way too long. Tuna was average and the specialty roll was good. Sushi is mediocre but SERVICE was horrible. Will be back once they hire more experience staff!!!

reviews.name: Greg S.
reviews.review: We tried this place with a group of 6 tonight.  Honestly, the presentation of this sushi rivals any high end restaurant I've been to.  The plates were amazing, ESPECIALLY for the price.  We're big fans of sushi, and Tenno is usually our favorite.  However, Sushime's quality could stand up to Virago, ad their portion sizes are better than anyone in town.  Our server was Kristen, and she was great.  They weren't too busy, so I'm sure that helped, but she was both friendly and attentive, and made sure our drinks were never empty.  She even brought over the sushi chef for us to meet!  The decor is contemporary, the prices are fair, and the food is TOP NOTCH.  Well done, Sashime! We'll DEFINITELY be back.

reviews.name: Pete N.
reviews.review: I'm not a regular sushi eater so my standards are not that refined. We started with Spring Rolls (noncooked) and then had the Sunshine and Firecracker rolls. Food was good and service was attentive.

reviews.name: Rob W.
reviews.review: The sushi was good but the service was questionable. I know the just opened so maybe they were still working out the bugs. But all in all not bad. Will try sushi me again.

reviews.name: Dee a.
reviews.review: We love this place, to the point of driving 30 mins out when there are places down the street. Every roll we've tried is delicious, the bento boxes were very well portioned and the seaweed salad always taste fresh. We call ahead an order for pick up and the food is always ready when we arrive. One of our favorite places!

reviews.name: Rudi P.
reviews.review: Okay, I went back to this place again today. Was just as delicious as the first time. This place has 99 cent saki from 5:00pm to 6:30pm and also offers FLAVORED saki for 75 cents more. I tried the mango & watermelon sakis. They also have a happy hour exclusively for ladies: THURSDAY NIGHT 99 CENT SAKI ALL NIGHT!  I also had the delicious shrimp & chicken tempura today. Out of this world!  Lovin' this place!

reviews.name: Meagan G.
reviews.review: Each time I've been to Sushime, the quality and presentation of the food has been great. Even the cheaper rolls looked like something from a high end restaurant. They definitely don't skimp on the portions, either. However, after eating here multiple times, I have to say their service is pretty consistently terrible. The only time we ever had truly good service was the first time a large group of friends and I went there.

reviews.name: Chelsea B.
reviews.review: We love this place! Great price and quality. The staff is always helpful and great! Definitely our favorite sushi place in town.

reviews.name: Carrie S.
reviews.review: This place has amazing sushi.  My husband and I moved from LA and we have tried every place in town and this is our favorite.  It is a little on the pricey side for Nashville, but you can't deny the flavor and quality is worth it.  They play good music and have a great patio area.  Much better sushi and service than the competitor near by.  We love it

reviews.name: Cathy B.
reviews.review: Cute atmosphere, great service, and the best sushi in Nashville. The sushi is fresh and bright and has a great presentation.  I also enjoy the pictures in the menu so you can see what you are ordering without asking a lot of questions.  The fruit sushi choices are AMAZING.  Prices are very reasonable.  Great patio.  Cant say anything negative!!

reviews.name: erin s.
reviews.review: sushi was fresh, service was ok, but for what it was, I'd say a little pricey and for that reason, we probably won't be back very often because there are other places equally as good, if not better where we can get half price sushi at convenient times.

reviews.name: Ingrid R.
reviews.review: I had lunch with a girlfriend here using a sharing spree, and it was so delicious! We were able to both eat for under $30 and had a ton of food!

reviews.name: Christine L.
reviews.review: this was the closest cfa i could find to downtown / green hills area. my one biggest issue with CFAs in nashville is that THERE ARENT ENOUGH OF THEM. why aren't they within 5 min of each other like in memphis?! yes i know nashville has half the population as memphis does, but everyone is so jam packed in together, u need to have more around the city! anyway, this one was pretty nice for a cfa. its spacious and has all the amenities you would ever want. they're pretty quick about ordering from the inside! I haven't yet been through the drive through but it seems pretty fast moving as well. your typical CFA menu: everything is DELICIOUS!! ! 1 bonus point for this location is that they leave their honey bbq sauce outside (near the ketchup condiments) so you can grab as much as u want! this cfa is located out in west nashville on charlotte pike, so if you're making the trek, make sure to gas up for cheap at costco or something before headed back to your side of the city.

reviews.name: Beth G.
reviews.review: Fast food, not something I rate but...Coffee here is really really good. Bizarre huh? Better than the higher end Java places which sometimes give heartburn or are too bitter. Of course love the chicken and the frozen lemonade. By the way go for the diet frozen lemonade over the regular difference is 300 calories. The servers are so polite at this location. They wear a tie and long sleeve shirt and look very dapper. This location is family oriented. Really really like this one and again coffee is amazing.

reviews.name: Tyler B.
reviews.review: Chick-fil-A is one of my go-to's and this is a great location. The food is always delicious. The spicy chicken sandwich, Asian salad and chicken tortilla soup are my favorites. On Friday and Saturday night they have BOGO milkshakes!The only downsides to this location are it's always crowded (that's a testament to how great it is), and the layout/ordering line is awkward. When you walk in, the ordering counter is right in front of you so they have a line taped off which is confusing for some people. (Or maybe they just like cutting lines... Who knows?)

reviews.name: Tim G.
reviews.review: When I went here I was worried because it was so busy, I thought I would be waiting a long time.However I was pleasantly surprised when the line moved quickly and then my food was ready in an instant - it was quite disarming how quickly the food came out!I recommend this location, I'm glad Nashville finally has a Chick-fil-a on this side of town.

reviews.name: Wynter F.
reviews.review: I crave Chick-fil-a quite a bit now for some reason. This is one of my favorite CFAs. I know that they are taught to be polite and friendly but it just seems like this one does a really good job of being friendly. I always just go to the drive through but they still talk to me as if I was a guest inside. I order the 8 count nuggets with chicken soup instead of fries with a sweet tea. For some reason I am pretty in love with that meal. Their chicken soup is so good. They always make sure to give me a lot of crackers to go with it. They also always ask if i want any sauce for my nuggets. I like a lot of sauce so I always ask for extra buffalo and they always make sure I have everything I need before I drive off.

reviews.name: Brian K.
reviews.review: Love the Spicy Chicken sandwich and the chicken nuggets!  The chicken nuggets are just different from any other fast food place and they are just really good.  Expect a line inside and at the drive-thru but they are really good at keeping the line moving.  Oh and make sure you get the Chick-Fil-A sauce for dipping...awesome!  So simple yet so delicious!

reviews.name: John M.
reviews.review: Honestly, just like every other chick-fil-a I've ever gone to. Very clean atmosphere, very nice people, and of course enough "my pleasure" for everyone. If you have kids, Tuesday's are a good idea because every entree comes with a free kids meal. BUT, if you're like me and childless, stay away from this CFA on Tuesday's! It's nuts.

reviews.name: Randi T.
reviews.review: This Chick-fil-a is everything that I expect from  a Chick-fil-a and more! Food is always fresh, order is always correct, service is extremely speedy and the staff is always friendly. I work on Charlotte Pike and this store is visited by me once a week. Very consistent with everything I listed above. 5 stars every visit.

reviews.name: Mike M.
reviews.review: 5-stars-location! I actively participate in the College Night deal of the week every Monday by inviting fellow Belmont students. Buy a large drink & large fries, get a FREE original chicken sandwich (worth $2.99). Typically, I upgrade my CFA original sandwich to the Spicy Deluxe Chicken Sandwich and pay the difference in price. Also, this location is super friendly! Also, on 08/25, I was given a FREE milkshake. No reason other than, "Would you like a small milkshake today?" And promptly handed me the shake :-)

reviews.name: Larry S.
reviews.review: I never considered chicken as breakfast, but I know the hazards of shopping at Costco on an empty stomach, so I stopped at the Chick-Fil-A across the street.  I had the spicy chicken biscuit, and I really liked it.  I didn't see an option for a chicken and egg biscuit, but maybe I'll ask about it next time.  I asked for orange juice, and got a mini-jug full of juice.The service was fast.  Everyone working there was exceptionally polite and went out of their way to be friendly, even the people sweeping the floor and taking out the trash.

reviews.name: David O.
reviews.review: "Chick-A-Fil-A" is one of those staples of the south that I only got to experience when I moved away from home.   I have to say, it has the best breakfast chicken biscuit I've ever had.While they are still staffing a lot of people because they just opened, they are certainly going the extra mile to make sure you are satisfied with your visit.If you've never had the "Southern Hospitality Fast Food" I certainly recommend stopping in for some Chicken.

reviews.name: Lauren L.
reviews.review: Nice Chick-Fil-A! Everyone here was really nice, and it was very clean including the restrooms. Good food, as well- served hot and well prepared.

reviews.name: Allison B.
reviews.review: Can you really go wrong with Chick Fil-A? I mean, the Brentwood location is preferable, but I haven't had any issues here.

reviews.name: Tran T.
reviews.review: What I love most about this place is they don't close until 10 pm! (Other places close at 9). Yes, they do close on Sunday but hey, there are thousands of places that close on Sunday so I don't see why this is a problem to many people. No complaints from me.They have plenty of parking spaces and 2 drive-thru lanes. I never had to wait more than 10 minutes to get my food from here.For a fast food restaurant, Chick-Fil-As do an amazing job at customer service. The employees are always friendly and helpful.  Last week I ordered a Chik & Strip salad (they stopped making it), so they gave me the Cobb salad instead. The girl who took my order told me that if I didn't like it, I could bring my receipt back and get a refund. Well, I would never do that. The Cobb salad does cost a little bit more but it was definitely tasty! I really loved the crunchy Charred Tomato Crispy Red Bell Pepper added to it. The other new salads also look very yummy. I will come back for those and the best (sweet & more sour) lemonade in town! Actually I do have one complaint...there isn't one close to my house :(2013/#56

reviews.name: Angie L.
reviews.review: They almost need a separate 'star' rating system for fast food locations, based on their low prices, mostly low quality food, and employees who are typically not as sharp as the plastic knives that they are probably out of. I recently asked one at a burger chain what was on a certain combo. He said 'I don't know', then stood there as if to add 'and I don't care either'.At Chick-Fil-A, it's not like that. The guy who took my order was young and friendly. They had their act together and we got our food in a couple of minutes, and they were busy as can be. My grilled sandwich was moist and actually tasted like chicken. The waffle fries were so yummy. As we left we got drink refills. They do this for you and it's cool that when I thanked the guy he said "my pleasure" .

reviews.name: David F.
reviews.review: Food was good but they did not bring it to my table like other Chick-fil-A I have been to. The staff seems nice but the place is dirty. Looks like there cleaning crew quit. Tables all have food on them and the walls look like they have not been cleaned for a wile. Also guess there trying to save money on the free germ wipes in the kids area since its taped up. I have been to a lot of these places and this is the first one i have found stuck on grease on the walls. If the manager reads this take a look at the back side wall in front if the play room. Its sick to look at.

reviews.name: Mike R.
reviews.review: This is my favorite chick-fil-a.  Its always clean, the staff is very friendly. And the food is always good.  This location is very busy during lunch but don't let that stop you from coming on in.  To be that busy the service is extremely fast.  But the real gold star here is Ms. Marie!  Make sure you say hello to her.

reviews.name: Katie I.
reviews.review: The employees are always nice and helpful, especially if you have little kids with you. This place is a godsend in the winter or anytime you need your kids to burn off energy in a confined environment.

reviews.name: Terra H.
reviews.review: Cheap and delicious. Love it!Poorly designed drive-thru layout? Tolerate it.

reviews.name: Cynthia T.
reviews.review: Finally made it out to this location and of course as Chick-Fil-A usually is, it was grrrrreat! :)Fast friendly service and delicious fast-food.  Be advised though that this location is almost always busy, packed with hungry customers!  Conveniently they have a double order station for their drive through and as I went through the other day, it was pretty quick.  I'm not usually a fan of drive throughs as walk-in ordering seems faster for me, but this time, not too bad.  Last tip, Charlotte Pike gets congested in this area too so just be prepared.  At least you'll have your food to munch on in the car or an already satisfied stomach on the way out!

reviews.name: Matt L.
reviews.review: Sometimes it's not about when you fall down: it's about how quickly you get back up.   Mistakes can be  made, but if they are handled properly and courteously, they can be turned around for good.When I went to Chick-Fil-A, I made a simple order, #1, no pickles.  They got me my drink quickly, and I chose a table.  I was almost alone in the place, and my order was simple and small, so after five minutes, I was wondering where my food was.  after ten, I approached the counter, I explained that I had not received my order yet.Realizing they had dropped the ball, they quickly got my order together, and gave me a not one, but two cards for free sandwiches in the future.  I've been places that screw your order up, and then blandly give you your order as if nothing happened once you've pointed it out.  But once I've been mishandled, I want the establishment to go a step beyond.  Chick-Fil-A did just this.Beyond that, they are clean, professional, courteous, and have good wifi.  I like it.

reviews.name: Amy P.
reviews.review: Steven took my order for a party delivery. He was very professional and friendly. He assured me everything would go smoothly for a delivery out near Vanderbilt campus on a busy Graduation Day last month. The nuggets, mini sandwiches and fresh fruit platters were all delicious and huge hits with the guests of all ages. I can't thank Steven and the Charlotte Pike staff enough for making my daughter's graduation (and commissioning into the US Navy) party a great success. This is the second time we have used this location for a party delivery, and they are reliable, prompt, professional and friendly. I highly recommend them!

reviews.name: Justin R.
reviews.review: Don't even lie to yourself. C'mon people, admit it. You love Chick-Fil-A! Everyone loves this place. You know what people don't love, that they are closed on Sundays! Why is it that every time I really want a delicious chicken sandwich and waffle fries, it's on a Sunday? Every single time! That's the only reason I will never give Chick-Fil-A 5 stars. I don't think there is much of a point in reviewing the food here, everyone has been to a Chick-Fil-A before, and if you haven't, get you ass there now (unless its Sunday). This location is fairly new, and extremely clean. The staff is extremely friendly, almost to friendly, if that's possible. Chick-Fil-A, I love you....except on Sundays!

reviews.name: Jennifer P.
reviews.review: Sooooo let's rethink this.In the beginning, I must admit, I was somewhat intoxicated by the idea of a Chick Fila so close to me. I mean, who really wants to drive Brentwood or downtown for some waffle fries? Sadly this particular Chick Fila only deems first impressions important.The last several times I have been there (including last night) the service was horrible. Everything from forgetting multiple items, to giving the wrong sizes of things to just making up what they thought your order was. I ordered a large fruit cup and was given small fries then shewed away. Um, ok? Last night we ordered two large drinks and fries and got one small fry, one large fry, one regular sized drink and one large drink. Not sure where that came from, Chick Fila.Untighten those creepy little ties of yours, lean in and listen to your orders. It's not hard, cross my heart. :D

reviews.name: Lyndi S.
reviews.review: C'mon, it's Chick-Fil-A, people!Being the only fast food restaurant I enjoy, crave, or consider eating altogether, you really can't go wrong here.  It's also the only fast food joint that doesn't make me feel like white trash when I dine-in.  I pretty much want their nuggies on a daily basis, but resist the urge because, well, it's fried.  Also, waffle fries dipped in that Chick-Fil-A sauce is the jam.This new CFA is great, and clean.  And the staff is super friendly.  The kind of friendly that makes you question how THEY got to inject Redbull into their veins but you still can't figure it out.  Hmph.

reviews.name: Sarah C.
reviews.review: Something magical happens when you move south of the Mason-Dixon, you discover Chick-Fil-A.  Despite crossing that boarder years ago it has only been recently that I have savored the true value of "EAT MORE CHICKEN."It was Friday night. The hubs and I were hungry. Chick-Fil-A to the rescue (referred to as Jesus chicken by some)! Not only is this location new but it is fancy-new. I mean double ordering in the drive through, quality speaker systems for ordering and everything is shiny. No, seriously.  I love having a location on the West side of town! One 12 piece chicken nugget #5 combo later and we were greeted at the window with our food. The nuggets are delightful but make sure you hit up the waffle fries! We also noticed that all the men have ties on. It is like everyone is a manager. Classy. Anyway, I'll certainly be going back whenever the hunger pangs for a quick meal. My pleasure, Chick-Fil-A. My pleasure.

reviews.name: Sara S.
reviews.review: Pretty much you cannot NOT give Chick fil a 5 stars. They are always the sweetest people and make you feel good about getting a yummy chicken sandwich and fries. I love that they are so close to home how! The west side really needed this. Very spacious, with flowers on the tables, and a play area for kids. Hands down beats McDonalds any day of the week. I always leave with warm and fuzzies, and I'm sure you will too! (even if its from the chicken and fries you just ate!)

reviews.name: BethAnn S.
reviews.review: Any place with the genius of making cows advertise for eating chicken is my kind of business.  But then again, I'm a fan of talking animal commercials, so consider the source.  That being said, not only is the chicken great here, but the location is SO in need of a great anchor fast food place.  Having experienced the unique flavors of Firehouse Subs wet steamed (read: wet) subs, Chick-Fil-A is a welcome break to the harried mom on a Saturday.  Kids nosh on white meat chicken that actually looks like chicken with real fruit sides and I can score a lower calorie but equally tasty grilled chicken and feed a troop of 4 for $20.The place is super clean and by owner policy, no franchise is open on Sundays.  What really crushes this place though is the grown ups who run it.  They greet you by name, want to have a clean establishment and wholesome quick meal.  You won't see managers snapping at workers but rather pitching in.  Well done Mr. Fil-A.

reviews.name: Dee B.
reviews.review: This is a really busy location. Although the line was wrapped around the establishment with folks parking and walking in as well, it was a quick in and out. I would say tops 7 min by drive thru. They have 2 drive thru monitors so it definately helps speed things thru.

reviews.name: Kristin Marie S.
reviews.review: It's a Chick-Fil-A what more needs to be said.  Well a lot.  Since it just opened they had like 20 people working.  One helping people into line, a few walking around asking people if they wanted refills, more busing tables and even more behind the counter.  It was as efficient as a Chick-Fil-A could get.  Everyone was dressed nicely,  even the men wore ties.  Now to the other part of this trip, which I found incredibly odd and have never witnessed at a Chick-Fil-A. Someone in the back yelled, "Are you happy?"  Then all the employees responded, "Yes I'm H-A-P-P-Y, woo!"  It was bizarre.  Even so I had a wonderful trip and the food was delicious as always.

reviews.name: Gary W.
reviews.review: The Chick-Fil-A experience is a bit saccharin with the clearly corporate-mandated retort, "My Pleasure!" emanating from every employee.  I have only had one service fail at this particular restaurant and they compensated me appropriately.  Eating here I am reminded of how inorganic our poultry farms are nowadays as the meat is oddly too tender and large to be raised in a natural environment.  Nonetheless, this particular location is very child-friendly to the point as coming across as a bit Disney-ish. The staff is generally friendly (although one must ponder their geniune motivation), the facility is clean and bright, and service is usually quick.It is ahamed that the corporation is homophobic. I would eat here much more often if I didn't have to have my morals deep fried and consumed  with every tender, hormone-filled bite.

reviews.name: Brandi H.
reviews.review: I love Chick-Fil-A so much and was so excited to get one down the street from me! No more sudden realizations that I'm in Rivergate or Cool Springs and should take advantage of a Chick-Fil-A. I could go any time!But. What. The. Hell.Apparently Nashvillians don't know how to use a double lane drive through.And may I ask why the drive thru goes around the front of the restaurant instead of the back of the restaurant like every other damn fast food restaurant?Though, kudos for the free WiFi that I can use on my phone while I'm waiting twenty minutes in line at the drive thru.So I avoid this place like the plague. I'll wait til next time I'm in Rivergate or Cool Springs for some amazing waffle fries.

reviews.name: Janelle S.
reviews.review: Who doesn't love waffle fries? The employees have always been friendly every time I've been here and the service is pretty quick.  I'm glad they have a Chick-Fil-A closer to where I live now.  It's a beautiful thing when a CFA craving comes on.  :)

reviews.name: Alison B.
reviews.review: It's always packed even during times that should be "off". What is the fascination? At least the service is semi-fast and the food is good by fast food standards, but not worth the wait.Avoid it like the plague unless you can figure out when they're not busy.  I can't.

reviews.name: Joshua P.
reviews.review: Always fast, always great.

reviews.name: Hope D.
reviews.review: Personally, I think "the Lord's chicken" is overrated. Sorry y'all.

reviews.name: Jessica O.
reviews.review: I love this particular Chick-fil-a. The service there is always fast and friendly and I especially love going with my kids on Tuesday family night!

reviews.name: Stefanie P.
reviews.review: This has to be cleanest, nicest chick-fil-a I've ever gone too. It's like a mini-super-overly nice Disney World. Its like, this magical world of the-best-customer-service that is so over the top I feel like a total loser wearing my shirt that says "Friends-don't-friends-live-in-Detroit" because these people are just SO nice its like I'm offending them. The chicken, fries, and ice cream and sweet tea good --but the people here must be hand picked from a land of rainbows, roses, animated bubble hearts. If the DMV hired all Chic-Fil-A employees the world be a PERFECT place.

reviews.name: Zach G.
reviews.review: Just in case you were wondering.  This one is still closed on Sundays.  AND AND AND...they have chicken in ALL varieties.  Fried.  Grilled.  Spicey (eh not that spicey, but for fast food an A for effort).  Only option that is truly missing from this Chickenstravaganza is my greatest wish from a restaurant....the always elusive "Kill it yourself" option.   Wouldn't that be fun to go in the parking lot and get to choose.  .22 pistol through the neck of the chicken or wring its neck out then go in the back to watch some high school kid freak out trying to figure out how to gut, de-feather (is this a word) and then cook my chicken in the same time frame they get you the fried and grilled options?  It would be like The Running Man, but with Chicken.

reviews.name: Sarah S.
reviews.review: So glad to have a Chick-Fil-A on my side of town!

reviews.name: Scott B.
reviews.review: This place seems to get bad review for service. We had 10 people in our table and the service was good. Everyone seemed to like their meals, but I thought my chicken was dry. One person in our party got the drunken chicken and she said it was one of the best meals she's eaten. So, I guess there's good with bad. I used to frequent Claim Jumper in California when I was out there. They always had a giant salad bar and I loved it. Portion sizes were always better than large and you felt you got your money's worth and then some. Not so much with this restaurant. Don't know if it's a "chain" decision or a local decision not to have the salad bar, but it would've been great here.

reviews.name: Jenelle A.
reviews.review: Don't do it.  I'm pretty laid back but this place super sucked. Out off many ingredients and found out after meals came out. The hostess looked like she would prefer to be getting a root canal rather than greeting and seating customers. Server was friendly but didn't bring water and put in the wrong food order.  Food almost guaranteed to give at least a touch of food poisoning.  Unless every other restaurant in this place is closed and you're about to die of starvation, avoid.Update - the manager just came over and was very nice and apologetic. She comped us for the errors. That's at least promising.

reviews.name: Yvonne K.
reviews.review: I remembered this restaurant from when I lived in California and loved it then so I had to have lunch here when we ran across this one. Lunch portions were not as large as I remember but the fish tacos were good and loved their coleslaw, very different and I think it had a peanut sauce. Good service and nicely decorated.Their desserts are huge and look great if you can save room!Wish I had this restaurant closer to my town.

reviews.name: James S.
reviews.review: Food was really good, very diverse menu selection. Service was good for as crowed as it was. Over all cleanliness for both the seating area and restrooms was good. I would suggest setting up a reservation, we did and when we arrived walk-ins had an hour wait. My only complaint was the noise level, not only was the place packed with loud customers, but the kitchen was open and  the clanking of dishes along with the numerous employees/cooks was over whelming. For this reason I rated this place at a 3. Next time I believe I will try this place for lunch, less crowded so I believe the noise level would be more tolerable, and we could enjoy the meal better.

reviews.name: Marisela S.
reviews.review: I hasn't had claim jumper in years since the one near me closed so I wanted to try it. I have some dietary needs and they had a gluten free menus that had a variety of options which was great! I got the chicken with mashed potatoes that were delish and the service was good and fast and the waiter was very nice and overall it was a great experience.

reviews.name: Chrissie S.
reviews.review: I absolutely love, love, love this restaurant. The 1st one I went to is in Seattle & I haven't been able to get enough since. Their bread is AhMazin! I always get the Club Sammich with the shoestring fries. Always hits the spot! They make a mean & Huge Club! Their cookies with ice cream dessert is Gigantic. Well more than enough for 2 people to share :) The atmosphere here is always very nice & the servers have always seemed very pleasant... so pleasant, in fact, that they convinced us to finally get our Landry's card, which I suggest you do as well if you ever experience this place bcus once you go Claim Jumper, you never go back! :)

reviews.name: Raeanne C.
reviews.review: We had lunch at The Claim Jumper. The food was good. The prices were a little high, but we ordered from the lunch menu. We would recommend the burger sliders, potato soup, and Motherload cake. Worth a try, and be sure to take your coupon from the opry mills coupon book because then your cake is free!

reviews.name: Tyler B.
reviews.review: I went here with my husband last night, and it left a lot to be desired. Our service was very slow. The food wasn't so great either. I got the potato cheddar soup in the sourdough bread bowl. The soup was more like really old potatoes au gratin that had been reheated. It was thick and pasty. My husband got the BBQ chicken sandwich which he said wasn't too bad, but not as good as it usually is (compared to the Claim Jumper we used to go to in California). The shoestring fries, however, are amazing! That was the only good part of the meal. The grand finale cookie we got for dessert was totally not worth the calories. The cookies were hard and dry as if they had been sitting out for a while. I will try this location again since we used to love the Claim Jumper is CA, but my first impression wasn't great.

reviews.name: Michelle B.
reviews.review: 6 of us, all had a wonderful meal and service to go with it.  Great wine selection as well.

reviews.name: Mark N.
reviews.review: Service was great. Got seated right away (lunch time on sat). Food was amazing had the atlantic salmon with a bbq glaze. Cooled just right. Salmon was still moist. Prices are a little expensive but for that quality of food it was worth it.

reviews.name: Sarah S.
reviews.review: It was really busy but we tried to see if we could go to the bar to grab drinks/a bite and were treated rudely. Despite that, we came back to try again for dinner due to a large menu and gluten free menu for one of our dining companions. We were seated with menus... And waited... And waited... Waited...no water or anything. Many servers walked by us and one was standing and chatting with a table that already had their food - nothing food or service related. Finally we got up and walked out. Being ignored for 15 minutes did not bode well for the rest of our dining experience. We went to Chuy's, which was delicious and had great service.

reviews.name: Adam D.
reviews.review: This is your typical chain mall restaurant. The menu is slightly smaller than the Cheesecake Factory, though the decor reminded me of Morton's Steakhouse. Go with the happy hour specials, play it safe,  don't get too fancy, and you should leave content.

reviews.name: Jason S.
reviews.review: Christ o' mighty this waiter cant even keep the tickets right and they forgot another member of our parties food for over an hour...ugh. won't be back.

reviews.name: Melissa B.
reviews.review: Okay, Okay..I am going to try this restaurant again...but NOT anytime soon!!!My daughter and I went here on Saturday about 11:20 to grab a bite of food before going to the movie.  I told the greeter that we were sort of in a hurry because the movie started in about 1 hr..she said "NO Problem" we can get you in and out in NO TIME..The place looked a little empty..so GREAT !!!Well we were seated and about 5 minutes later, waitress showed up..."SORRY" with a smile..I didn't realize someone was already in my station..She took our drink order..I told her "HEY we have a movie in about 45 minutes" so we are in a hurry...OH NO PROBLEM....She brought us our drinks about another five minutes later...we ordered soup...JUST SOUP...she had clam chowder and I had a loaded potato soup..and then our bread they bring to the table....she had tea and I had soda...THAT is it..!!!By the time she dropped off our drinks, and then came back later to get order and then drop off the soup...it is now 11:45...we have been here for 25 minutes...I wanted to leave at noon because the movie started at 12:10...so we ate the soup, I called her over for the check while we are eating...reminding her again we are in a hurry...Now get this......$21 and some change for 2 soups and 2 non alcoholic drinks...I about freaked out!!!I just had two large chinese dinners the night before for less than that..I had a large pizza at Five Points less than that...I was "WHAT????"..I had to check the the ticket three times...$9 for a bowl of clam chowder...I kid you not..this was NOT A HUGE bowl by any means...HEFTY paper products makes bowls larger than this bowl...$9 for soup ...it should have been a large bowl for a large salad for that price...Heck in most locations a 1/2 sandwich and soup cost less than that...or soup and salad combo cost that much...I was Floored !!!!I paid the check, left her a $3.50 tip and then left..with only 10 minutes to spare...Thank goodness I bought my tickets before we went to the restaurant..but it was close ..but we made the movie...

reviews.name: Amber M.
reviews.review: This place was completely of the charts!!!  The food was awesome from the appetizer to the main course to the drinks!  Our waitress was not excellent but overall we LOVED it!!!

reviews.name: Mike R.
reviews.review: Needed to escape the thieves at Opryland, so wandered over to Opry Mills.Staff was excellent, food was good. We ate here twice during the week we were in town; lunch was (not surprisingly) the better value.Not quite the unique, local experience I prefer when traveling, but very good considering it's a chain store in a mall.The food and atmosphere were a 3; I'd add 1/2 star for very good service if I could.

reviews.name: Mike H.
reviews.review: Excellent service, very good food, fair value.  Liked the veggie burger and veggie choices.  Big fan of the Landry's select card which I used on this visit.

reviews.name: Julie B.
reviews.review: Food was good, service was horrible. Food was WAY overpriced. I am a single mom to two teenage boys we don't go out to pricey restaurants like this very often. It was my sons 14th birthday, i told the server and she said she would do something- she never did. She made fun of my oldest for not ordering a "real meal" and even SAT DOWN at our booth and reorganized her register book, complained about how tired she was. She never came back to see if we needed anything. The food was good, but i was so upset that it took so long to get our check, and they were not busy. There was another server who looked high as a kite with dreads down to his waist with no hat or hair net on. GROSS. I will not be coming back. For $65 we could have gotten way better service somewhere else.

reviews.name: Juju W.
reviews.review: I thought the food was pretty good. Caught dinner before Grand Ole Opry w. Darius Rucker.  Service was prompt and loved the ultra high vaulted ceilings w the cool hanging lamps. Two minute walk to Grand Ole. Opry, free parking. Asked for lemon and server brought me a dish of 5 wedges but 4 of them looked pre squeezed. Kinda wierd. Also waiter talked me into adding house salad for add'l $1, but was charged $2.99, but I didn't bother correcting. Otherwise, an okay experience.

reviews.name: Joseph F.
reviews.review: Double check to make sure they put down your reservation. Apparently they didn't pit down ours. Thank god they had an open table, otherwise we be waiting for 30 minutes. But that doesn't really matter when it takes over 45 minutes to get your meal. Service is ok. Waitress is nice. Overall I would recommend if you don't have any other plans after wards.

reviews.name: Terri H.
reviews.review: Very large portions so come hungry or be prepared to take leftovers home. I met my husband here for lunch since he works close and I was off work. Our server was very helpful and did warn us about how big the portions were. My husband and I almost never want the same thing and we like trying different things so we just take leftovers home. I had the Jamaican jerk chicken sweet potato. That was the biggest sweet potato that I gave ever seen. It was stuffed with shredded chicken, green onions, red peppers, cilantro, papaya relish, lemon and a drizzle of honey. It was delicious. I couldn't eat it all but I tried.

reviews.name: Scott S.
reviews.review: So I had left a previous negative review for this property and with a short period of time received a message asking for me to please file the same on corporate account. (I guess a company doesn't want this on a social forum). So I filed on corporate as requested. A week latter receive a phone call from a man in the "service" dept.     Asking for me to go in details. He thank me promised to look into it. But for my time would send me a gift certificate for my time. I promised at that time I would thank his response upon receipt.  Guess what.....no mail.  "A mans word is earned, but can be lost in one action".  So that is my  thiughts

reviews.name: Jani M.
reviews.review: My sister brought me to this here saying that this place is really good. I loved the setup of the place. The staff was very nice and our food came quickly. I got the shrimp fresco. Was disappointed only because this place seems to think pan seared means that it is with batter on too. Wasn't expecting that but other than that it was good.  Just think they should clarify their menu a bit better.

reviews.name: Larz R.
reviews.review: Went for a nice lunch because prices in the Gaylord where I stayed aren't too friendly. The service was excellent! Andrea was very friendly and attentive. She earned every cent of the tip I was happy to give her. My glass was never empty.I had the 7oz sirloin with broccoli and sweet tea. The steak was very tender and seasoned very well. Excellent! The broccoli, though, looked fairly wilted and wasn't that great. The other problem I had was that when I was asked if I might want some onions cooked with my steak, I wasn't told that the little sprinkle of caramelized onion would add $3 to my bill! I would have much rather have spent that money toward a dessert.

reviews.name: Phil J.
reviews.review: This is my 4th time at this Claim Jumpers.  I always sit at the bar & get great service (even tho the bartender is a Buckeye fan....Go Blue).I always start with the clam chowder (delicious).  Usually I get the jambalaya, but last night I got the tri-tips & it was very good.I have never been disappointed with a "Landry Select" restaurant, I just wish there were more in Michigan.I will definitely go back to claim jumpers when I'm back in Nashville at the end of January.

reviews.name: Alex G.
