During the weekends and sporting events, Sam's is ALWAYS full of people, so if you plan to see a championship game, head there early! The servers do a good job with how busy the bar is, and stay on top of the tables. Sam's is great if you are looking for a casual place to watch a game!

reviews.name: Hunter W.
reviews.review: Monday Night Football, great place to watch games. Many large, HD flat screens line the walls. Large U shaped bar, seats about 20+ people. Lots of booths and high top tables. Had the Rib/Chicken Tender combo at recommendation from sever. Ribs we're wet and SUPER tender, fell off the bone. Chicken was in a light batter, almost tempura like, very good. Other items on menu look great, homemade pizzas, burgers to name a few.  Location was great, right in midtown and close to campus. My server Holly was great, though busy. Bartenders are busy with their customers and bar drinks, but overall a wonderful experience.

reviews.name: Gee W.
reviews.review: This is really what a sports bar should be.  Good food, lots of TVs, pitchers of beer, and IT'S NOT A CHAIN!  So, a quick little history...I've been going to this place since it was called 'Jonathan's', which was a long time ago.  There may have been times that I have eaten lunch AND dinner here, but I'm not going to admit to anything.  Sam's is in the heart of Hillsboro Village, which is great.  This place gets SLAMMED every weekend for college football and basketball, but its a really fun place to watch any game.  The food is good and VERY reasonably priced.   Pretty good beer selection with some decent ones on tap.  There's some good happy hour deals to be had here as well.So, unlike a lot of other sports bars, Sam's has really good food, making it a good choice even if there isn't a game that you want to watch.  And given their viewing set up, watching a game here is even better.

reviews.name: kyle t.
reviews.review: A sports bar in a great neighborhood, lots of TV's, beer how can this be a bad place to stop?  I guess the answer would be, it's really a great place to stop at for the three things listed.This is a pretty great place.  Big open area, clean, pretty waitresses, good beer, tv's...all good.  I guess if I wouldn't have ordered the chicken tenders I would have left with a different opinion of the place.  The chicken finders were horrible, not to pricey which was good because they were really bad.  They were breaded with a corn-flake like crust, really soggy and bland!  The chicken was undercooked and chewy but I didn't die!I would stop here again to watch some basketball and grab a beer but I would take my hunger somewhere else.KT

reviews.name: Sarah C.
reviews.review: I popped in for lunch and got the vegetarian pizza. Place was pretty busy but my group was able to find a seat around noon. Service was on par and the food was just right. You know, like mama bear, papa bear, baby bear style. I felt full with a 9" pizza, but not sick and totally capable of returning to the office to complete my day. I must share how impressed I was with the ladies restroom! Totally clean and smelled amazing. Not that I solely judge a place on bathrooms but, come on!

reviews.name: Ian R.
reviews.review: Still can't say enough about this place after all the times I've been here. Great atmosphere to come and watch a game, have some drinks, and enjoy some good food... Yes, it's all typical bar food, but you can't go wrong with anything on the menus. They're pizza is remarkably good for a bar, and is actually one of the better pizzas in town, in my opinion. The staff here is always great, and very accommodating. If there's a game you want on, they'll put it on for you immediately. Great beer selection. Tons of stuff you're familiar with, plus a ton of local brews that are sure to please. If you're looking for somewhere to enjoy a game with some great company and good atmosphere, this is your place.

reviews.name: Cheryl H.
reviews.review: I'll go back to watch my Cubbies/Bears/Wolverines/Rangers! Great, attentive server who brought our drinks incredibly quickly during a very busy NCAA bball packed Thursday night. Got a table right away, but several people arriving after us had trouble. Didn't smell like piss, decent beer selection, food looked good (we didn't eat there, I'll update when we do), and plenty of TVs to watch pretty much any game you want.

reviews.name: Eric P.
reviews.review: Solid place to catch a game. Plenty of TVs and usually a good rowdy crowd. Chicken wings are on point, plenty of beer to choose from. This is a sports bar, what else do I really need to say?

reviews.name: Danny N.
reviews.review: The best sports bar for college sports.  The food is average overall.  The bar pizza is good and three chicken fingers are as well.  A great place to go in the fall.

reviews.name: Lindsay R.
reviews.review: featuring Texas brewed Shiner which is rare; great service and they'll change the tv channel based on request. Waitress remembered every drink order; accommodating options for celiacs

reviews.name: Jim V.
reviews.review: This place has improved by leaps and bounds. They have a strong turnover in the waitress staff which makes me wonder. A great spot to catch your favorite teams game. This place offers great bar food and good drink specials. Sunday is 2 for 1. The management here is excellent. The owner has been there a couple times and its vey nice. The restaurant manager always hustles his butt off to make sure everyone is enjoying themselves and no problems occur when fans get out of hand. Great atmosphere. My go to sports bar

reviews.name: Jim C.
reviews.review: This SAMs is great. We smear at the one in Murfreesboro regularly and the food and atmosphere is very good. Same here. Server Kristin was awesome.

reviews.name: Kristin W.
reviews.review: For not being a "pizza place" their pizza is spot on. Notably the cajun pepperoni pizza. Knocks it out of the ballpark. And as the name implies, a great place to watch a game, especially in the fall for college football. While Nashville doesn't have an official Ohio State bar, there's always a nice little following of buckeyes gathered here for games which is another plus in my eyes!

reviews.name: Brian L.
reviews.review: Solid sports bar with a lot of good food options.  The staff were all really friendly too.  Lots of huge TV's all over the place so this is a great spot for watching games.

reviews.name: Anna E.
reviews.review: We stopped here for a snack and drink so my friend could watch some game.  It was fairly easy to get a seat (for 7) and the atmosphere was pretty fun and casual.  However, our server hated us for being alive.  She looked so annoyed every time we asked for something.  I could understand if there was no one in there and she was going to be sent home, but the place was pretty busy so I'm not sure why she was so unhappy.  Aside from the service, we tried the fried pickles (solid), nachos (surprisingly good with lots of toppings), queso (fine) and mozzarella sticks (hard to mess those up).  Probably wouldn't go back here if there are other options.

reviews.name: Tiffany K.
reviews.review: My crew of guy friends go here religiously every Sunday. It's loaded with TVs, and is a great place to watch any football game. Decent selection of beers, great sweet potato fries, and fun service. Nothing fancy, but that's the beauty of Sam's. Plus - tons of parking in the back!

reviews.name: Melissa B.
reviews.review: Tony and I enjoy this restaurant  slash Bar a lot..... the food is always good , the service is friendly and fast and he enjoys the sports on the many televisions.  Tony and I like to go here during the Happy Hour where he can get " 2 for 1 Beers" on his Budweiser and I enjoyed my usual Iced Tea with lemon and lime!!! We split appetizers..We got the Cajun Spice Pepperoni small pizza and the Spicy Chorizo Queso Dip with Chips... and we both agreed they were both VERY good!!! We would definitely order them both again!!We plan on going here a lot during football season and this is our KEY meal during the games...I highly recommend this restaurant and I highly recommend both dishes..you will be very happy with our recommendation and your choice..No matter what you order!!!

reviews.name: Brandon C.
reviews.review: Great place to catch a game, lunch or dinner.  Parking of course is difficult at times.  Pizza and cheese sticks are awesome!

reviews.name: Kap P.
reviews.review: Really chill bar , great food and awesome drink specials. Usually go during late night happy hour always have a good time . I always order the fish tacos with a cold yazoo beer depending on my mood. Call ahead some days it's crazy packed depending on if there's a big game and what not. Pretty cool location they have parking around back but it's small.

reviews.name: Jason M.
reviews.review: Been here for lunch a few times and i've never been disappointed. The lunch menu fits me and my coworkers budgets and the portions are more than adequate. I would give them 5 stars but their parking lot rules should be outlawed. I have seen 2 guys prey on customers for a 50 dollar boot fee if they question your dedtination after parking. Watch for a red nissan pickup.

reviews.name: Debbie M.
reviews.review: Popped in late with low expectations. Was pleasantly surprised to find a bar with an extensive gluten free menu! The ribs were great, & the service was too!

reviews.name: Jordan P.
reviews.review: Excellent experience. My party and I came around 1 pm on Sunday, hitting the tail end of the lunch group so we had no wait. The patio area is a great way to see the sights of the area and still enjoy some air conditioning. The burgers we had were AMAZING. I highly recommend the Mushroom Swiss. Our waiter was helpful and on top of everything. I really don't have anything negative to say!

reviews.name: Marian C.
reviews.review: Wandered in for bar atmosphere and a good brew...The food was very disappointing. The crunchy fish tacos tasted as if they were straight out of the freezer. The queso was chalky and tasted like velveeta. The draft selection was ok. But the menu didn't have prices. When asking the waitress about prices, she was quite condescending and stated, "well, they're all different prices, darlin'." No crap, they're different prices. That's why I'm asking you since your establishment decides to not post prices on the menu. I ask ab the Yuengling draft. Her response, "I think it is $3,  or $3.25...or $4." Wow. Well, I believe her name was Racine or something, the Yuengling draft I paid for was $3.25. If you don't post prices on your menu, have your wait staff know prices. Was very disappointed overall with the trip. Still on the hunt for a good sports bar with good food since I'm new to town. If you're just coming here to watch games and drink, should be an ok joint. Lots of TVs, hence the 2 stars.

reviews.name: Carolyn S.
reviews.review: Happy hour till 7pm half off all beers (draft or bottles...even on Friday), just your standard bar food, great atmosphere and location though, I really like going here! Don't expect anything too snazzy, sometimes the service can be slower though, and I've had to flag down my server a few times.

reviews.name: Kevin M.
reviews.review: I discovered today that this place forces its servers to pay for tabs that customers walk out on. I'm pretty sure this is illegal.

reviews.name: Mike R.
reviews.review: Pretty cool bar and grill.  I have only been for the lunch scene, I still need to try it some evening.  The sandwiches are all good and reasonable price.  Staff is very cool, great m

reviews.name: Stephanie C.
reviews.review: It was hard to get waited on and  it was standing room only.  Great atmospehere! Get here early if you want a seat! Amazing happy hour! 2 4 1 everyday from 3-6 on any beer and double tall drinks!

reviews.name: Anup S.
reviews.review: Amazing. Best sports bar ever!Now smoke free and great food and drinks at a very reasonable price. Great staff. Will always stop here when I visit Nashville!

reviews.name: Ashleigh A.
reviews.review: This place was a perfectly amenable sports bar. We actually ended up going two days in a row because it was one of the closest sports bars to where we were staying showing the NBA Playoffs that had a patio. It's 72 and sunny - don't stick me inside a dark and dingy bar! For shame, sir. For shame. So we went on Monday evening after a failed attempt at a shopping trip since all the shopping places close at 6 (lame). But thankfully made it in time for happy hour. I know this is a Nashville-wide thing, but the 2-for-1 beer deals still blew my mind. It's insane! How do they make any money? So while the atmosphere was exactly what we were looking for, the food was a bit...lacking. Actually, I take that back. The BF ordered chili, which was really actually good, despite the fact it had beans, but we're not in Texas so I'll give them a pass on that one. But we also ordered chicken strips tossed in wing sauce, and they were kind of a giant disappointment. I will say, it's not technically on the menu, so we have to put some of the blame on ourselves, but still. The breading was completely falling off and the sauce, while it had a decent kick was kind of...Asian-inspired? I couldn't quite put my finger on it, but it just wasn't great. We ended up leaving most of them untouched. So the next day we returned, mainly because our waitress informed us that Tuesday was all-day 2-for-1s (again...how do you make money?!), and there was another game on so we headed back because we figured we'd just eat before, and you can't go wrong with beer, a patio, and big TVs.This night was actually kind of funny, we ended up getting there super early (I was NOT missing shopping again people) and I think ran into a Match.com happy hour or something? Whatever it was, it was great people watching, and it was all clear before the game started. We also did the trivia thing they do on Tuesdays, 'cause we're nerds, and totally lost. But no matter. We still rocked those 2-for-1 drinks.

reviews.name: Austin T.
reviews.review: I went there at lunch and loved the fact that no one was smoking. We were there 11ish and were waited on quickly. Each of us ordered off a lunch special menu, I got Chicken Nachos. They were really hot good and plenty on the plate. Not much on in terms of live sports at that time, but we did catch some highlights of some NBA games from the previous night. Plenty of big TVs were in there. My iced tea was re-filled as soon as I drank about half of it. As we were in a hurry to get back to work (not really, but my boss may be reading this!) we didn't have dessert and of course no beer for us that time (My drinking days are over and now I only drink at night) I did meet friends after work there a couple of weeks ago and had a great time and even though it was somewhat crowded the service was still pretty quick.

reviews.name: Katie K.
reviews.review: I give SAMs a five star for food, affordable prices and for the abundance of tvs they have for sports. Very casual sports bar with lots of tvs! I recommend the wings and burgers! On Saturdays they had 2 for 1 drinks! If you are in a hurry though this is not the place to go being we waited a while for service. If your in the area and looking for a place to watch the game I definitely recommend SAMs!

reviews.name: Jim V.
reviews.review: Located in Hillsboro Village. Sam's Sports Bar is a great place to catch the latest game. They have a great beer selection and a ever changing menu. My favorite thing on the menu hands down are the fried pickles. Sunday has to be their best deal which is 2 for 1 beers. The rest of the week they have great specials too, i just cant think of them off the top of my head. They also have good pizza. If you like Golden Tee Golf like me this is your place. They have 4 or 5 screens a great way to escape the cold and hit the links in a warmer light. I visit Sam's every time I come to Nashville and will continue to in my visits to come.

reviews.name: Dalan C.
reviews.review: Went here for dinner 2 weeks ago as I've been working in Nashville for a few weeks.  As a sports bar I'd give it 4 stars.  Lots of TV's, but the area we sat in was incredibly load.  The servers were good and pretty quick.I had the buffalo wings (they were average but nothing special)Also had the chef salad, which was huge and good Finally, I had sweet potato fries (huge portion)Love that it is smoke free too!!If I want to watch a game I woud consider coming back here.

reviews.name: Teresa B.
reviews.review: Sam's is a great place to hang out with friends, have a couple of beers and something to eat while watching the people go by down 21st.  It's a good hangout for watching the game as well and they usually have some drink specials.

reviews.name: Molly D.
reviews.review: Don't usually add reviews, but the behavior of the servers warranted a comment... Great sports bar, but literally every single employee looked MISERABLE! Not sure what was going on but it wouldn't hurt to crack a smile every once in a while or at least pretend you are happy to be there.

reviews.name: Ashley B.
reviews.review: It is only fitting to start my coverage of Nashville's most memorable places with the one I've spent more time in than my own home: Sam's Sports Grill  in Hillsboro Village. If you're looking for a thrifty, casual happy hour or the perfect spot to watch the game, Sam's is your place.My love affair with Sam's began when visiting my Vandy friends in college, and its solid, dependable, delicious food is what has kept me coming back. Sam's menu features exactly the kind of food you'd expect from a sports bar - wings, pizza, sandwiches and salads - but the thing that makes this place special is that it does these things extremely well. For example, when I told my friend Carson Popkin, 28, that I was writing this post she just said "Wiiiiiings..." and stared off hungrily into the distance before coming to and saying, "They're phenomenal."But wings are not the only thing Sam's is doing right. The Cajun Pepperoni Pizza is a salty, crispy pie with just the right spicy kick, and the Campfire Chili with cheese and onions is simply one of the best bowls of chili I have ever had. And I've had some chili. When soup and chili cheese dogs make up 80% of your diet, you become an expert fast. In short, the food is straight-forward, fresh and very well-executed. Whether you need to grab a club and fries for lunch or cure your hangover with a Blue Moon and a burger, Sam's will do you right.And that is in no small part due to the atmosphere. Sam's is a quintessential sports bar with happy hour from 3-7 every weekday except Tuesday (when it's two-for-one!) and at least 20 TVs broadcasting games at all times. (It is a smoking establishment, so take that into consideration before you pull up a stool.) On any given Saturday there are 100+ sports fans screaming their guts out for their teams, and the wait staff generally does an good job keeping pace with the thirsty legions. It's even better when the weather is nice and they roll up the garage doors on the front side. Breeze + good people watching is the ultimate relaxation-maker.Sam's also has a lively game of trivia on Wednesdays and even livelier karaoke night on Fridays. In short, Sam's is my Cheers (and ironically, Sam was the guy who ran Cheers - coincidence? I think not). I'd suggest that you make it yours too... Except overcrowding would make my standard Saturday table even harder to come by, and we clearly can't have that. But what the hey, go visit them anyway. In no time at all, it'll be the place where everybody knows your name.1803 21st Avenue SouthNashville, TN 37212(615) 383-3601Sam's also has a second location in Hendersonville, so you suburbanites don't have to miss out on the fun.

reviews.name: David O.
reviews.review: The better half once got food poisoning here, so its forbidden that I suggest we return as a couple. I, fortunately, have never had any bad food here.Overall, considering its proximity to Vanderbilt, a pretty speedy place for Lunch fair. You'll be in and out in time to get back to work. The food is pretty much what you'd expect. Maybe I just haven't found the magic dish here, but I can't say that with the "Better Half Embargo" I miss coming here with her.

reviews.name: Anthony S.
reviews.review: Just came for a couple drinks. Beer selection was good. I have heard the food is pretty good and they have some great deals on certain days of the week.

reviews.name: Paul K.
reviews.review: It's hard to review it, it changes every night.  the service can be great, it can be slow, it can be bad.  Food - good for bar food.  They seem to maintain quality at every point I've ever eaten here.  The worst food I ever had was a slightly burned pizza.  The worst food any of my friends have had was some slightly wrong fries and perhaps forgetting to put or take off some condiment.Service - a couple of the waitstaff have been super, a couple have made me question my ever coming back to the place.  I think they made other people question it as I don't see them there any more.  On average it's pretty good when they're not packed to the gills.Booze - a little slow on the booze when the place is nearing 2/3rds capacity.  At that point they generally need an extra bartender, but I don't think I usually see one at that point.  Generally I plan accordingly.  When it's packed, I just order a drink ahead.  Tis a far better fate to suffer slightly warmed beer than to suffer without.Karaoke - kind of a bad (limited) selection and the person they have running it at the moment either needs some new disks or something is wrong with his equipment.  Plenty of times I've watched as people up there struggle to read the hieroglyphics as line after line paints over the old text.  Or where something is a duet and they don't have the words for the second person.  Or where the song just skips and does not pick back up.  That was all at one sitting.  Sam's is a mid-20's bar and the karaoke as of 2 months ago was a mid-50's selection (with best of 2008 thrown in).Crowd - varies - can be a bunch of cool people or sometimes it can get overrun by d-bags and people crying on their cell phone that their new Bentley got crapped on right after it was washed - no really... I'm afraid hearing someone crying over having to get their freakin' brand new car washed twice made me want to throttle some people.  The sports crowd has generally been a nice group when I've been there.  During the day time you can usually catch a more rugged crew... that's the only time I've had a bar patron tell me what to do with my life at Sam's without any word spoken by me.Restrooms - go from OK to "I will hold it for the next 3 hours" quickly.  Generally when the place is d-bag-overrun the mens room needs to be waded into.  I would not wear any non-fluid-tight shoes in there.  If you can fit into the bar though, chances are the bathrooms are at least ok.Larger groups, this place is probably not for you if you want to sit at one table.  A group I was with had 12 people and we managed to sort of hold down an area, but we usually had 2-3 people up.All in all, I like the place.  Their pizza is not the best, but it's still about as good the next couple of days.  It's definitely something to check out.  Parking can be a mess if anything's going on, and the lot is generally patrolled by someone looking for a handout when the crowd is bumping.One thing to note, if you're on a motorcycle, your gear is not safe.  Sam's and Boscos are evidently frequented by drunken kleptomaniacs.  I've had gloves stolen (was doing a Christmas eve ride, so I got to ride home with no gloves in 36 degrees) have seen and stopped someone trying to pick up someone's helmet and have heard tale of completely non-valuable things stolen by drunk people out of open cars.  So if you're a biker, do the uncool thing and take your gear in with you.  If you're a car owner lock everything / keep stuff out of site.  It's not the homeless who wander the area that are stealing, it's drunken college students.

reviews.name: Alexander S.
reviews.review: This is the worst bar experience I've ever had. I'll try to be brief. The three beers I tried to order last night were Sierra Nevada, Sweetwater 420, and Sam Adams Boston Lager. I drink these beers regularly draft and bottle and I am very familiar with them. I ordered a Sierra Nevada and it came out flat and warm. My friend ordered a Yazoo Pale Ale and received a cloudy, orange colored, spicy smelling blue moon. We sent them back and ordered Sweetwater 420 instead. They where also flat and warm.The manager said their must be a problem with the draft system and offered us bottled beer instead. I ordered my standard choice of Sam Adams figuring it was a safe bet.He returned  with a brown bottle with NO LABEL and quickly put it on the table without saying anything or apologizing and walked away. When I took a sip it was one of the same flat warm beers that came out of the draft, I couldn't quite identify it, but it wasn't Sam Adams. I realized that they had filled an empty bottle with Sam Adams. When I realized this bottle probably came out of the recycling I stood up an left. I'm still deciding if I'm going to call the Nashville Health Department on Monday. I understand mistakes happen, and so I was polite and patient with them. In return, I've never been more disrespected by any restaurant or bar. Any other place would have thanked me for pointing out the issue and taken care of it.

reviews.name: Robert S.
reviews.review: Stopped by tonight after the film festival cuz it was open late on Sundays.  I am glad because I felt at ease from the moment I walked in.  The wings were very tasty, the chili looked good enough for me to come back to try, and the beers were fairly cheap.  Add lots of TVs for NBA/NHL viewing, and it doesn't get much better.The only thing I could find to pick on was that smoking was allowed in the patio area, where we were sitting.  It wasn't all that bad because it wasn't full, but if there was a crowd, and the weather was nice, I'd have to go somewhere else if I wanted to sit outside.

reviews.name: Jay M.
reviews.review: I love Sam's. If you're a guy and you need a neat place to watch the game, Then this is a great place to hang out. the drinks are decent and the pizza is awesome. Lots of places to sit and watch the game or games that you're interested in. Its very spacious and the service is fast and courteous. The buzz of the people talking with the televisions going makes it a very cool guy hang out spot. My friend and I decided to hang out here on a Tuesday evening. I could hardly hear her speak and she was not soft spoken. Maybe it was game night... maybe I just happened on a bunch of strangers who were loud. But needless to say we left there as soon as we had the chicken pizza, which was delicious. But then we were hungry. So I would probably avoid this place if you're on a first or second date. Otherwise this is a great spot for hanging out.

reviews.name: Sarah B.
reviews.review: I have always enjoyed Sam's, particularly when craving a burger or chicken tenders while sitting on the terrific patio watching Hillsboro Village walk by.The only reason I haven't really visited more often until now has been that even while sitting on the patio, you could still smell the smoke wafting in from the bar.But no more... yelpers... Sam's Hillsboro Village is now smoke free!  Hooray!And if you haven't visited before and are thinking oh... another sports bar... whatever, I understand.  I'm not a sports fan, couldn't even tell you what season it is to be honest other than March.  How could you not know March Madness is going on?The folks at Sam's Sports Bar are incredibly nice and incredibly generous.  I work for Big Brothers Big Sisters in Nashville, and Sam's/Sperry's (common ownership, in case you didn't know) are some of the most generous of any of the area's eateries having helped out our agency time and time again.  I like to patronize local places that support local interests - and they definitely fit the bill.  Pick a warm afternoon and play hooky while hanging out on the patio, then you'll understand.

reviews.name: BethAnn S.
reviews.review: Oh Sams....you are a sports bar, and I'm a non-sporty girl so maybe our relationship was doomed from the start.  But I had my son and HE likes sports and frankly, I was in need of a drink (always good to brace yourself with liquor before a PTO meeting).  I thought with the Hillsboro location Sams would be better than your average sports stop, but I was wrong.  The floor is fly paper for humans and clients are 96% male (SPOILER: Nashville ladies, this is where they guys are! Just wear your haz mat suits).  From a sports stand point, they do have every thing you could possibly want to see and it wasn't blasting which meant you could have a conversation.  And apparently Tuesday is 2 for 1 beers making PTO all the better.  My son's chicken sandwich was on par with McDonald's and the waitresses tight ref uniforms were gross and unflattering.  They aren't as demeaning as Hooters, but its just way too cliche.  All in all, they clearly make a lot of money here, spend some on cleaning, getting a better menu and humanizing your staff Sam.  PS Those photos of the food are NOT like anything we had.

reviews.name: Alexandra D.
reviews.review: Excellent baby back ribs and veggie burger! Happy hour on Sunday is super affordable!!The only downside is that you only get one side with the ribs. Usually you get two sides.

reviews.name: Ruben M.
reviews.review: I guess this isn't my kinda place..It's fun in there but it's really dark and loud - its a bar, so it has to be. But food is good.

reviews.name: Ryan S.
reviews.review: I've heard Sam's is a sports bar, but I didn't have much of a sporting experience when I was there. Un. Im. Pressed.Came to watch a college basketball semi championship game (Gonzaga). While we got to "see" the game on one of their many flatscreens, they seemed adamant about playing music. So we sat there and watched the game while Miley Cyrus (and other "pop" artists) blared in the background. Doesn't quite seem to live up to the sports bar name.Going somewhere else for the rest of the college basketball season.

reviews.name: Barbara B.
reviews.review: Been to Sam's a few times now and its always a good experience.  Great place to sit on the patio and watch sports or catch up with friends (and non-smoking now!).I usually stick with pizza (i recommend the cajun one) and beer but the wraps are good too and everything else always looks great.  I was recently there on Friday evening during happy hour and they had awesome specials so keep that in mind if your looking to start your weekend out enjoying some beer!

reviews.name: Lyndi S.
reviews.review: If you're looking for a fun sports bar with good pub fare and a great list of draft beers, this is your jam.  The place is spacious, with pool tables and plenty of seating and room to stand if that's your thing.  I think they offer a pretty sweet trivia night, although I'm not sure when exactly.Their food is pretty tasty and supplies a really good variety for a sports bar.  They also offer weekly lunch specials, which basically means that you can leave there paying $12 after tax and tip for a beer and a delicious burger. Also - the staff is friendly and helpful, which is always appreciated.My only qualm about this place is that they allow smoking.  While I'm definitely not an advocate for second hand smoke, Sam's wasn't too bad, and I didn't leave completely reeking of smoke.Also - they have Sweetwater 420 and Fat Tire on tap.  That being said, I will definitely be a regular once football season starts up again!

reviews.name: Cameron V.
reviews.review: The food is typical American sports bar food.  Nothing more; nothing less. This used to my go-to place for watching sports.  However, Sam's recently recently made the inexplicable decision to switch from beer glasses to plastic cups for serving beer. In this writer's opinion, this was a HORRIBLE decision.  I will have to find a new sports bar that serves beer in glass.

reviews.name: LM P.
reviews.review: We stopped here recently after leaving Cabana because we weren't quite ready for the night to end, which has happened many times.  Sam's is a great bar to go to when your in the Hillsboro Village area and are looking to catch a game or even just a great place to hang out.  I love the locale.  It is walking distance to some great shops and eateries.  They have an abundance of televisions that are easily viewed from any spot.  The open seating, patio and beer selection are also top notch.  The service has always been friendly and attentive.I can't wait to go back some time and take advantage of the Two-for-Tuesdays drink specials and food.  I hear the chicken nachos are delish.

reviews.name: Elizabeth E.
reviews.review: How can you not be a fan of Sam's? And that's coming from someone who hates to go home smelling like smoke (and you most certainly will when you hang at Sam's). It's a local beer, bar and sports hangout wedged between Belmont and Vanderbilt Universities, so it gets a lot of traffic with a young crowd. It's almost always packed thanks to big sporting events, trivia nights or drink specials.Although I'm not a fan of the company that runs the trivia at Sam's (and almost every other place in town), trivia on Wednesdays is fun and pretty competitive. Two-for-drinks until 7:30.As far as the food goes, Sam's has good pizzas, their french fries are like crack, salads aren't bad, and the chicken fingers take you back to your childhood. Beer selection is great - prices are pretty similar to other places in town. Pitchers available.Saturdays in the fall at Sam's are always fun as it attracts fans from all over the SEC - and even a few ACCers as well. When the weather is nice, the garage windows are rolled up, making for a great atmosphere toward the front of the restaurant. And Overall, Sam's is a fun sports bar for those nights you just want to throw back a few beers with friends and watch a game.

reviews.name: Mike J.
reviews.review: We hit Sam's up for the Thursday night football game. On the upside, our server was friendly. On the downside, well most of everything else. The nachos were very ordinary - bag chips, velveeta cheese, fresh out of the microwave. Chicken strips were above average but not spectacular. Smoke was pretty heavy. No sound for the game. Our waitress gave us good service, but we heard other tables complaining about their service, and my girlfriend saw one waitress in the bathroom playing Angry Birds on her cellphone (maybe she was on break).  So, not a "foodie" destination, nor a good place to watch a game...nor a particularly good value (they charged extra for the honey mustard dip, and added a charge for my side order even though our server told us the chicken came with a side).

reviews.name: Avonel R.
reviews.review: I went to Sam's with a group from work for lunch. The special on this day was the chicken tenders so I decided to try them even though I figured it'd be mediocre bar food. When I received my plate of food I was thoroughly impressed. Chicken tenders are nothing inventive, but they were the best tenders I've ever had. I now know that it is possible to have good bar food, just don't expect it to be healthy by any means.

reviews.name: Marcia M.
reviews.review: I popped into Sam's for a brief moment to meet up with some friends and quickly remembered why I don't frequent good ol' Sam's. Don't get me wrong, I'm not dissing on your pal but just stating that it's not really my thing. The seating and layout seem a tad awkward but the crowd didn't seem to mind as the place was packed. March Madness can do that for a sports bar! Tons of televisions surround the room, buckets of beer are plentiful, and artery clogging appetizers and food are the anchor. Smoking is allowed so plan to do laundry when you get home too. Two-fer Tuesdays offer up compelling drinks specials so be prepared for a nice size crowd. I also appreciate the open-air dining on beautiful Nashville days too.I presume that if I suddenly woke up and wanted to wear a jersey and pound beers while watching a Titans game, this would be one of the first spots that I would head but until then...

reviews.name: Ryan A.
reviews.review: Sam's is a pretty good place to watch a game, but I've become less and less of a fan as of late.  Also, coming from Columbus, Ohio, Nashville is in dire need of better sportsbars.  Maybe people actually find this place enjoyable, but I believe its more of a problem of not having that many choices.  They have plenty of tv's, but something is off with the seating in this place....Let me also say I have had times where I have enjoyed Sam's.   But on the other hand, there are plenty of other time I find myself asking "Why did I come back here?"  The food is decent, I enjoy the cajun pepperoni pizza, the chicken tenders are good, and some of there subs are pretty tasty.  With that said, I just can't find the smoke in this place bearable.   I hate copmplaining about smoke in half of my reviews, but its really horrible here, especially when the garage doors are closed.  If you plan on spending a couple hours here, be ready for a heavy wash or drycleaning.  The beers are decently priced, but besides happy hour or two for Tuesday, there aren't really any other deals.  This is one of the few bars in Nashville where Buckeyes congregate, but it still doesn't change my opinion of it.  I can be swayed to go here by friends, but its not my first choice anymore to watch the big game.

reviews.name: David G.
reviews.review: When I was preparing to write this review and give Sam's a particular number of stars, I encountered a dilemma.  Should my star rating be based upon comparing Sam's to all Sports Bars in which I have ever been?  Or, should it be a comparison to Nashville Sports Bars?I chose the former:  compared to everywhere - because if you're from out of town that only seemed fair.  The sad news is that for a vibrant southeastern city where we have two professional sports teams, our sports bars kinda suck.Sam's is honestly one of two great sports bars in the city.  I really like Sam's and I really like the patio in Spring, Summer, and early Autumn.  But, when compared to so many sports bars across the country in other cities of comparable size with their own sports' teams... Sam's is just mediocre.  The service is always a toss up, and the ladies dressed in those referee outfits - could you not find some attractive Southern women to put on those booty shorts and v-cut referee shirts?  Some of the regular old-time employees who have been there since I was in undergrad - a decade ago - really should not be wearing tight clothes.  Wow.  That was just really mean.  I'm sorry.The food is on the better side of bar fare.  But their beer selection could want for some better beers and a wider variety of selection.  The mixed drinks tend to be a bit weak, in my opinion.But, hey, it's a bar.  It has lots of TVs and they play the game commentary over the speakers throughout the bar.  All and all, if you want to watch sports at a bar, then I would recommend Sam's.

reviews.name: Kaitlyn K.
reviews.review: I appreciate this place for many reasons, but mostly because they will show a good PAC-10 football game.  Being from LA, I need to watch my USC football!  I don't love that you can smoke in this bar, but it's a sports bar, I get it.  The food is normal bar food, but I always order the pizza.  They're delicious - especially with the jalapenos!

reviews.name: Zac S.
reviews.review: I have pretty specific criteria when it comes to evaluating a sports bar:1. It must show or be able to show my team's games.  (Full Disclosure: I am a Red Sox, Celtics, and Patriots fan).2. It must have enough TVs to put on your game, regardless of what else is going on in the sports world.  That Titans game may be in overtime, but I'm sure you could find some random TV in the corner for a Lions fan, right?3. It must show a wide variety of other games.  I enjoy sports in general, and I like to see other games.  I mean, I could go to Sox bar to high-five and bro-hug other patrons all night long, but it's more fun to have a diverse collection of fans.4. It must have at least one "go-to" food item.5. It must have a decent beer selection.Sam's fulfills all of these criteria, and then some.  They have all the sports packages, and will gladly put on your game if you ask nicely.  During the football season, the manager labels the TVs so you know what matchups you'll be able to see and when you'll be able to see them.   I've only been to a couple other bars that do this, and it's amazing.  You can position yourself optimally for a day of sports viewing/drinking without having to bother a waiter or waitress.  In addition, they have a good beer selection and decent bar food.  The chicken fingers are the gold standard.  I could seriously drink the honey mustard.  But the chorizo dip, southwest egg rolls, and pizza are all good for what they are.On top of all this, Sam's isn't some chain mega-bar.  The service doesn't wear flair or sing songs (although they do wear referee uniforms and are unnecessarily inattentive and gruff).  They have a nice "patio" area and do activities like trivia and karaoke.  There is also ample parking in an otherwise very crowded Hillsboro Village area.Sam's is a great sports bar - definitely the best I've found so far in Nashville.

reviews.name: Brianna N.
reviews.review: I needed something quick for lunch, so I decided to stop by Sam's for a to-go order. Bartender Jessie greeted me and I ended up staying to enjoy my salad (which was delicious by the way). I had originally planned to take the food home since I was alone, but here, I was able to relax for a few minutes and enjoy some nice conversation before continuing on with my day.I had the chicken tender salad with honey mustard, dressing recommended by Jessie. It was just what I needed!Once, when I visited Sam's with friends to watch the Cowboys game, we had a server who didn't pay much attention to us, but other than that I've had all good experiences here!

reviews.name: Ian R.
reviews.review: I have given Sam's a couple more chances and it is not all bad.  To use an overused phrase, it is what it is.  Sam's is a pretty good sports bars with a metric ton of flat screens a paint by numbers food menu and pitchers of beer.  It would not be my first choice to eat or drink, but I can't deny that there is something to be said for drinking, eating food that is bad for you and watching sports.  If that's what you are after you could do a whole hell of a lot worse.

reviews.name: Lauren S.
reviews.review: Overall: It's a typical sports bar with decent food & a open-air room up front.Food/Drinks: The pizza is surprisingly good. (I'll admit I wasn't expecting much.) The wraps get a thumbs up also, as do the burgers and fries... but the sandwiches are a little dicey. (not bad, just nothing special.) The pitchers are fairly priced though I can't comment on the liquor drinks (I haven't ever ordered one.)Service/Atmosphere: The service is always pretty quick and waiters/waitresses attentive, that's not something you always see at a sports bar so that's a plus for me. My only complaint (and I'll admit this is pretty petty) is the Metro Police officer (or look-a-like) checking IDs at the door. He's kind of an ass, but I suppose he probably deals with a lot of jerks so I'll let that lie.Cost: Pizza (obviously) depends on the size but you can get a good sized one for about $12 & burgers are about $7.Tip: Head over on a warm day when they open up the windows in the front room. It's a good place for Hillsboro Village people watching.

reviews.name: Megan M.
reviews.review: For the lunch crowd:  Service is fast as it's not usually too busy during lunch hours.  Although the food is technically "bar food", it's really great!  Last time I had the club sandwich (which was so big I took half to go) and a generous side salad, which they top with almonds and eggs among other tasty extras.  Pizzas are popular and the burgers and chicken sandwiches are very good.  For the sports and night crowd:  It gets packed here at night and during any big games.  Obviously being so close to several universities, this is expected.  It's not my personal comfort level to be crammed in to a loud smokey bar, fighting for the attention of a server to get food and drinks.  But it is what it is, and the students and many non-students seem to enjoy it a lot.  There aren't a ton of choices for sports bars in the area that will show all the games, and they show most here.  They also have great food and happy hour specials.

reviews.name: Alyson W.
reviews.review: Those 5 stars go to Tuesday night specials at Sam's.  I'm not a sport's fan, but I've watched my fair share of games on Tuesday nights here because for a long time, I was at Sam's every Tuesday night.  Things I like?Two for one draft beers.  I don't know what they put in the newcastle, but its really good.$9.99 two topping pizza.  And for the price, the pizza is really good!I few tips, Tuesdays they have 2-4-1 all day long.  Get there early before the Vandy crowd rolls in.  Get a booth.  I am partial to the Michael Jordan booth, just because.For not going on Tuesday nights though, I'm going to go out on a limb, put my reputation out on the line and say this...Sam's has the best bar food in Nashville.The prices are great.  The chicken tenders... oh the chicken tenders.  I think they somehow fry a little bit of heaven in them.  And one of the best burgers at a bar period.  They have a great lunch special, and I really enjoy hitting up this place for lunch every now and then.

reviews.name: Megan C.
reviews.review: Now non-smoking!  What a win!

reviews.name: Justin R.
reviews.review: Great sports bar. TV's everywhere and a really great selection of draft beers. They have Sweetwater 420 and Fat Tire, so I'm a fan! I think they serve food, but I didn't try it the other night. The bar is not as smoky as I thought it was going to be. They have trivia on Wednesday nights, which I am going to have to check out sometime! If you looking for a place to grab a great beer and watch some sports, this is your place!

reviews.name: Jf F.
reviews.review: had a really good Grilled Chicken Sandwich, Very tasty, very tender. Son had big wings! Two NCAA BB GAMES and the NBA all on nice big screens. Wait staff young and friendly. Near Vanderbilt University / Medical Center. Would come again. Big menu

reviews.name: Carlene E.
reviews.review: This is a good place to watch a game. I love a dive bar and I love to watch sports but i was disappointed by the food. Also, not enough bartenders during Sunday night football. That said, it does the job.

reviews.name: Mike A.
reviews.review: Sam's....I don't like Sam's.  And I have no rational reason why.  There's douches here, but who cares?  It's a sports bar, that's who goes to sports bars.  I myself am probably a complete asshole and don't even realize it.  It's crowded, but so what?  Crowds are good sometimes.Their food is alright from what I've had.  Their drinks are overpriced but so it goes for Hillsboro.I think the real reason I don't like it is because cheating is so rampant at trivia here and it's so packed that there's nothing they can do about it.  But again, that's kind of trivia everywhere.Or maybe it's something more sinister. Perhaps I was abused here and  repressed it.  But I doubt it.  Sometimes we just don't like places.

reviews.name: Benson C.
reviews.review: Probably one of the best places to eat in the Village.  Living nearby and their lunch specials were the greatest perks of Sam's, also the good food.  The pizza and fries have always tasted good, and what goes well with pizza and fries??  A beer!  I'm not sure of when their 2 for 1 specials are, but it's a good special and this definitely has a good sports bar feel.  If you're a college student in the area, you'll definitely enjoy this place.  If you're new to this place, and you don't see any parking on the street, there's a nice big parking lot behind the bar.

reviews.name: Courtney B.
reviews.review: Sam's has quickly become one of my favorite haunts for Monday nights during football season.  Ther crowd is great and there usually seems to be the perfect amount of people there, not too rowdy but lively enough to keep you excited.  There are PLENTY of TVs set up, so no matter where you're sitting you've got a great view of something.  They have local brews like Yazoo and Blackstone on tap as well which is a plus if you're like me.  But don't worry there's plenty of typical sports bar beverages to be found in case you're not.What is great about Sam's is that it's not just a sports bar.  It's happy hour and two for one specials make it a great place to hang out on non-football nights as well.  It's front patio makes it a lovely place to sit and relax with friends and a beer on nice days and its location in Hillsboro Village is convenient and lends to its ecclectic mixture of patrons.The menu features your typical bar food fare - pizza, wings, burgers and sandwiches, all of which are good but what you would expect.  My favorite is their chili which is amazing and their salads are surprisingly what I order the most.  Don't be scared to try one!  For around eight dollars you get a large super fresh salad topped with tomato, bacon, egg, almonts, red onions and my favorite -  chicken tenders (which are also delicious).  Parking can be an issue just like everything else in Hillsboro Village so be prepared to walk a little ways and spend a few minutes searching for a parking spot, especially during busy hours.

reviews.name: Trisha P.
reviews.review: Adequate bar food, smokey but congenial atmosphere, fair (but not cheap) drink prices. BUT. If you are looking to watch the World Cup -- go elsewhere. Though they advertise as being the place to see watch the games, they could not manage to get Italy vs. Paraguay on TV in English, and didn't seem especially interested in trying (they could have at least turned to the soccer channel on XM). That said, Arabic-speakers of Nashville, I may have found your World Cup viewing place.

reviews.name: CHRISTOPHER O.
reviews.review: Sam's is a great place on Gameday,  Not many sports bars acutally have enough tv's, Sam's does.It is a smoking bar so be prepared,but i also like not having to hang out with under 21 people so to me its a fair trade off.   If you dont smoke sit up front by the patio doors,The staff is cute and friendly.  Food was quality, and affordable.  I still love their Chicken n Herb pizza.Will definatley go back.Not to mention you seldom go to a restaurant when the owner is there.Sam is almost always there (usually white polo, and golf shorts) so things keep running smooth.

reviews.name: Renée M.
reviews.review: Sams is one of my favorite low key bars to go to around town.  The food is great, beer is cheap and the servers are on top of it!  You get away from the downtown hype, but can still enjoy karaoke on Friday nights, happy hour specials and good company.  It's definitely one of my favorite places around town.  And it's non-smoking now :)I highliy reccomend the chicken ceasar wrap, trivia outings on Wednesday night and two for one specials on Tuesdays!

reviews.name: Sarah M.
reviews.review: If you go to Sam's Sportsbar, you MUST and I repeat MUST order the cheese dip and the club sandwhich. It truly is sooooo good. They also have a location in Hendersonville that is really nice-I got to check it out when it first opened. For football games or March Maddness, it is really here or Corner Pub. The good thing about Sam's is that it does accomodate more seeting and there are more waitresses. They also have doors that open so when it gets smoky and the weather is nice, it airs out.

reviews.name: Ben G.
reviews.review: I went to Sam's before I even moved to Nashville, and got hooked. It is now a spot I gravitate to. I end up there twice a week at least. I once overheard Sam say "I am a food guy that opened up a sports bar not a sports guy that tries to serve food" and it shows. Several items on the menu are the best in town, or the best I have ever had. Only down side: Stay away on Wednesday nights if you are not playing trivia. Wings (Medium or Hot) - Best I have ever had Spinach and Artichoke Dip - Best or tied for best in town Burger - One of the best in town Cajun Pasta - One of the best Pastas in town ** Food aside the atmosphere keeps me coming back too. It is cozy and unique and fun. The staff are great and the fans are amazing. I think everyone should experience an NFL Sunday here. For any major sporting even plan on showing up 30 minutes to an hour early as it will be standing room only at game time. The atmosphere is always electric. I get disappointed and bored when I watch sports anywhere else (including at home). They have great happy hours with two-for-ones, including all day on Tuesday. Great spot. One of a Kind. Definitely in my top five places to hang out in Nashville.

reviews.name: Mica D.
reviews.review: The pizza is delicious and I want to try the baked potatoes sometime.  They look great! It is really good bar food!

reviews.name: Patrick R.
reviews.review: I've said it before and I'll say it again: sports bars just aren't my scene.  This one, however, certainly seems to meet all the requirements of a top notch jock bar.  Sam's has dozens of TVs (I counted 18 just from where I sat), and several of them are plasma screens.Sam's has lots of seating, and from the looks of it there isn't a bad seat in the house.  Anywhere you may dare to dine in the establishment, you'll find at least a half a dozen monstrous television screens staring at you while tuned in to hockey, football, basketball and even soccer games.  The walls are decked with local sports paraphernalia, and the place is perpetually crowded.  The food seemed decent and appropriate for this type of restaurant, though I made the mistake of getting the BLT (a bit greasy).  Most of the sandwiches seemed up to par, and the prices were fair.Though on my last visit our server was pretty nice, she was a bit slow and she even lost my friend's debit card at one point.  It was eventually retrieved, but not speedily or with a great deal of concern.  It's fair to say that Sam's is one of the better sports bars/restaurants in the city, but this is coming from a music man who likes dive bars and Mexican joints.  But if you're a sports nut, I don't think you'll be disappointed.

reviews.name: Steve M.
reviews.review: Amazing sports bar.  I play trivia every week here and the atmosphere is always great.  This is a great place to meet up with friends after work and have a good time.

reviews.name: Michael W.
reviews.review: I shouldn't be doing this.I can't count the number of times I've complained about the smokiness, the noise, the crowdedness. But God help me, I love this place.They play decent music, they serve good drinks, with weekday discounts. The food is tasty and reasonably priced. And they have trivia on Mondays and Wednesdays. Plus, I can stumble home after.

reviews.name: Nickie G.
reviews.review: Sam's is the go to location when I come home to Tennessee.  Why?  Because my brother practically lives there.  He knows all the waitresses by name and may have even pulled an Irish goodbye on one of them (btw he's really sorry bout that).  This is a fantastic sports bar.  Huge TVs behind the bar and other TVs strategically located all around.  We got there early enough to get happy hour...and boy was I happy to see a double rum and diet be placed in front of me without having to ask.  Two for one happy hour...can I say HELLS YEAH!  Also, good to know is that Tuesdays are two for one ALL FREAKING DAY LONG.  If I lived here, I would be drunk every freakin Tuesday.  Just sayin.  They also have a party room for you and 25 of your craziest drunkass friends...at one time in the past the waitresses were topless in said room, however that the no longer the case.  (Insert moment of silence here).  Rewa was our waitress...she knows my bro and friends, and she was probably the coolest waitress EVAH!  Love her!  Not only was she a fantastical waitress, she was also smoking hot so boys take note and sit in her section and tip her appropriately for her hotness.  The best thing tonight at Sam's was hanging out with my brother and his fraternity brothers from when we went to college.  I heard astonishing and downright befuddling drunk stories but the best line of the night was...."I'm a tornado of sexiness.  I was dipped in handsome sauce."  Who could freakin resist my brother after that shit was said.  NO ONE!

reviews.name: Jamie A.
reviews.review: I have to be honest. The reason for a four star as opposed to five is the ridiculous crowd on Two-for-Tuesdays. Can't help it, I'm getting up there in age and my tolerance for a bar packed with undergrads has diminished. It's the "Get off my lawn!" thing and I suffer from it. There, I admitted it. Okay, back to the shiny happy stuff! Sam's is a kick ass sports bar. Not only do they have a great selection of tap/beer bottles, the bartenders are very skilled with the cocktails (even delicious coffee based hot drinks in the winter). Even better than the booze is the food. CHICKEN TENDERS. I'm not kidding, these are the best in town. Perfectly crunchy, beer-battered pieces of heaven! I love getting the traditional wing sauce along w/ ranch or bleu cheese for dipping. You can get them tossed in the wing sauce, but that tends to kill the crunch. Another star are the wings. Even if you think "Extra Hot" might be too much, just try it. I'm usually a strict medium - weak hot when it comes to spicy foods, but they smelled so good I had to steal one from my boyfriends plate. They aren't on the menu, but they will gladly add some extra heat to the usual hot for you. Other standouts include the rib appetizer, beer battered onion rings, cheeseburger and (when they have it) the creamy chicken artichoke soup. So yeah, absolutely a terrible place for a dieter, though I have been known to bargain...oh, I'll have the chicken tenders but with celery instead of fries, etc. Yeah, not really a great solution but it is worth the extra time in the gym. So yeah 2 stars food, 1 star drinks, 1 star service and 0 stars because I'm an old mean bat. Oh, and one additional note regarding Tuesdays...while two-for-one is every Tuesday, somethings the pack is at Sportsman's instead. Our theory is that they send a mass memo/text/sky-writer out to let everyone know. One or the other is ALWAYS packed to capacity on Tuesday.

reviews.name: Dave S.
reviews.review: My friends and I went to Sam's to watch football on New Year's Day.  I was visiting from out of state for the holiday and while a fan of the Hillsboro Village area from a previous visit this was my first trip to Sam's.  Like any good sports bar, it is wall to wall televisions and offers a good variety of grub and beers.   Our bartender Jessie was a ray of sunshine who greeted us warmly.  The place was mostly empty when we arrived but quickly filled as the first round of bowl games began.   No matter how busy it got, Jessie was one of the most attentive bartenders I have been served by in awhile, and I say that having logged many hours behind the rail myself.  My friends each got the tortilla soup, while I ordered the wings on Jessie's recommendation.  They were very meaty with a unique sauce (I ordered medium).  Both my friends liked their soup.   Late in the afternoon we also sampled the spinach & artichoke dip which was tasty.   If I had any gripe about the place, which was actually a pleasant surprise, it would be that we had no idea there was a two for one drink special going on until about midway through the afternoon, not that this would have changed what we ordered or how often, and this was something I encountered at more than one bar in Nashville during my visit.Kudos to Jessie for her awesome service, and to Sam's for being a solid place to watch a game.   I would definitely go back the next time I am in Nashville.

reviews.name: Scot B.
reviews.review: The first time we went to Sam's the food would have warranted four stars. Our last trip there was a different story all together. Two stars may be on the generous side. My Cheesesteak was very bland, the wrap my wife ordered was soggy and dripping in hot sauce, and my youngest daughters chicken strips had a very strange flavor. I am assuming the oil used to fry them was well past it's prime. The only bright spot was the white pizza my oldest daughter ordered. It was pretty good. Keeping with the sports bar theme, if this were baseball, one out of four would get you removed from the roster. My roster of good places to eat in H'ville just lost a player.

reviews.name: John G.
reviews.review: If you have ever been to a sports bar, and left thinking that the food was just fantastic, as were the dozens of flat screen TVs, then I suggest that you keep going back to that place.  For the rest of us, I thinks Sam's will do until we find that other type of place I just mentioned.  Sam's has plenty of TV's, a good patio for people watching, and ok food.  It's kind of like bar food that tried too hard to be something that it is not. So, come here for the TV's, the people watching and the beverages, and you will not be disappointed.

reviews.name: Claire B.
reviews.review: I'm not usually a huge fan of sports bars either, but I'm always surprised by how much I like Sam's. I think it's because they have a huge closed in patio where you can get away from the sportiness of the main bar area. The drink specials are worth going for: I will be a fan of anywhere that has two for one Yazoos. It's really as simple as that. Maybe it doesn't take much to make me happy, but Sam's has more. The pizza is good, as good as many of the specialized pizza places in town. The medium will easily feed two.The burgers are top-notch sports bar worthy and the wings are hot enough to require a ton of blue cheese, and they will give you lots if you ask for it. The best kept secret on the menu is the ribs and fries basket, which is an appetizer, and cheap, but a great meal with really good tasting ribs. This is my default place to go before seeing movies at the Belcourt, and the service is always quick and friendly.

reviews.name: Dana H.
reviews.review: Hendersonville - Had a casual business lunch on 10/26.  Great service as usual, I ordered the Sante Fe chicken and received a large portion which was excellent but the steam veggies are my favorite! I'm not sure what they steam them in but they are definitely the best anywhere!

reviews.name: Doug B.
reviews.review: Pizza, beer, and chicken fingers are great!  Great hang!

reviews.name: Kyla A.
reviews.review: I'm not much into the sports bar thing, yet somehow circumstances have led me to spending many more nights at Sam's than I ever would have predicted.  Once they added it to the Vandy card, it became an obvious choice during my student days.  They do their 2 for 1 special on liquor as well as beer which I always appreciate so that has brought us in as well.  I also find myself running over to Sam's for a shot between games of darts at H Cue's since they are beer only.  The food at Sam's is your standard greasy bar fare, but it's not bad. The pizza (which, by the slice, is about it for the late night menu) tastes just like what you would get in your high-school cafeteria.  It's comforting and satisfying while still being a bit gross.If you are the sports bar type then you will definitely enjoy Sam's.  It gets pretty packed, but the crowd is usually attentive to the game that's on.  There are TV screens everywhere - enough that they can play two different football games, a poker tournament, and a strongman contest simultaneously so everyone has something to watch.

reviews.name: Robert K.
reviews.review: From what I have experienced, Sam's is more of a bar than a grill.  Sam's has tons of high definition TV's all over the place which makes it an excellent place to watch sports, especially football!  This is the type of place you come to drink all day and night long, my hunch is that the only reason they serve food is so that people can keep drinking.  During a game it can super rowdy in here, especially now that they have only high definition televisions.  There is a nice outside patio for people watching and smoking.  The food is decent: I like the burgers, chicken fingers, and pizza.Overall: during football season, this place blows up and don't go for the just the food, unless you start seeing double, then order a burger or pizza!

reviews.name: Brian R.
reviews.review: Solid beer specials, awesome buffalo chicken wrap and other food. They're always accommodating on sports TV requests, and the karaoke is a major plus. I don't always go to sports bars, but when I do, I go to Sam's.

reviews.name: Robin S.
reviews.review: My reasons for loving Sam's are threefold:1) Location.  Right in the heart of Hillsboro Village, it's convenient to pretty much everything.  Downtown isn't far off, and the Vanderbilt stadium is within walking distance.  This is good to know during football season!  2) They have a great patio.  It actually has those garage door things, so even in the dead of winter you can sit out there and it kind of seems like you are outside.  It's not one of those dreary nasty smoky sports bars--in fact, it's really the only one I like to go to if I'm watching some sporting event on TV.3) Great people-watching.  Especially if you are out on the patio--you can see prepster Vandy kids, the eclectic coffeehouse crowd, tourists with fanny packs, runners, walkers, and skateboarders, and of course the ever-present line in front of Pancake Pantry.  If you are going to eat there, I love the Cajun pepperoni pizza or the hot turkey and Swiss sandwich.  Both are scrumptious!  It's a bar food menu, but I feel like the food is a notch above what you would normally expect.  Drinks aren't half bad either!

reviews.name: Shiho F.
reviews.review: We stopped in for a quick lunch and I was craving Fetuccini Alfredo.  I ordered the closest thing to it on the menu and it was the Cajun Pasta.  It was actaully pretty good.  However, we foudn hair in our food.  Our group expereinced hairy food at every restaurant we stopped in.  No joke.  I don't think hair nets are necessary in TN.  They should be.  A very casualy bar/restaurant that you can get rowdy in if you want to.

reviews.name: John O.
reviews.review: Great place to go after work

reviews.name: Jason C.
reviews.review: Would get a lot more business if you made it non-smoking!

reviews.name: Katherine M.
reviews.review: Sam's is your go to spot to watch The Big Game. During football season it's so crowded on Saturday's you can barely move. Even for night games, folks show up hours early to get a good table. The porch is awesome in good weather, but since it's hot in Nashville through October, you'll be scorching if you grab a porch seat for the first game of the season. There are big screen TVs everywhere. They show all the SEC games, but WARNING - Tennessee games take precedence, so if you cheer for another school, be prepared to watch a small TV in the corner.Of course people go to Sam's for much more than to watch a football game. That's just been my experience and what the bar is most famous for. They have outstanding food. Granted, it's bar food, but hey - you don't go there for fine dining! They do have good, big, fresh salads. Burgers, hot sandwiches, quesadillas, wings, and the whole bit. They serve wonderful drinks and have every beer available on draft. So go and cheer on your favorite team!

reviews.name: David S.
reviews.review: A fine example of a sports bar. There are a ton of tvs. You can probably see any game you want to during the year. Definitely the place to go for SEC football or NCAA March Madness viewing. Hell, probably hockey, too, if you're in to that sort of thing.Here's what not to do, though. When I've had a few drinks I like to put some money in the jukebox. I just do. So I walk in to Sam's one night, the jukebox is right by the front door. I put some money in, pick out my songs. My songs come right on, so I'm psyched. Um, then some waitress with a microphone comes up and asks me what I'm doing. I think it's pretty obvious. Then she tells me it's trivia night, and I can't use the jukebox. Why is it on, I think? But then they have to turn my music off and everyone in the place is staring at me because I have ruined their precious little trivia contest. Nerds. And I lost, like, $5.00. So that's what not to do at Sam's. I also have a friend who tried to pick a guy up here once. It's a funny story I'll have to tell you sometime.What to do at Sam's: drink beer, watch tv, people watch. Food is nothing special, but it will do in a pinch.

reviews.name: Sydney G.
reviews.review: This place is great. Happy hour starts after 7pm (well at least on Sunday nights)  so you can actually make it. 2 for 1 beers for $4. I love it. I was amazed. I was astounded. How easily I have become accustomed to $5 or $6 beers and never making it in time for happy hour. I had 2 rounds that equals 4 beers. Bottom line: I was a happy girl.There is plenty of places to sit, and a million TVs and not the "we have 30 TVs, but 20 of them are from 1999 and only play the news" bullshit. They literally have 20+ flat screen TVs so every seat is a good seat. Drink beers, watch football, enjoy your life. I haven't tried their food, but I was advised not to order the nachos at 9:30pm by our server who said the "cheese sits out all day." We didn't, probably for the best. It was a fun way to watch the game and a cheap place to hangout. Giving this 4 instead of 5 stars, because the beer selection wasn't great and the food seems iffy. Oh and, every other time I have been here (except last night) I've run in to those people. You know the ones people from high school who want to know all that you are up too, but didn't care a single bit when you actually went to school together. No offense to these people, but you do your thing, I'll do mine. Cheers.

reviews.name: Erin D.
reviews.review: I just went here for lunch and was really impressed. I expected yucky bar food but it was actually really good. We got their queso, it was yellow cheese with jalepenos. So good. I chose their buffalo chicken wrap with fries for my entree, and loved it. I got the Hot (rather than original, and is really, really hot) buffalo sauce with ranch dressing. I really liked their fries, too. They are shoe string, but thick enough that you get some potato in each bite. They're also covered in black pepper and salt. It is 21 and up though. Oh, and allows smoking.

reviews.name: Lauren B.
reviews.review: Awesome sports bar--- and the food is great. This place gets overrun with the college crowd during the school year, but doesn't get as clubby/crowded as Sportsman's.

reviews.name: James E.
reviews.review: The best place in town to watch sports hands down no question.  College football Saturday is always a reunion of the finest weekend warriors.  NFL Sundays are a little less crazy but fun.  The atmosphere is dark dirty and shitty bar but do you really want anything different from a sports bar?My only qualm is the over priced liquor drinks and shots.  $7 jaeger bombs made with ripoff red bull and $6 well gin and tonics?  If you go to Sam's stick to beer.

reviews.name: Mariela C.
reviews.review: Sam's is probably one of the best sports bars in Nashville, that being said, don't expect a lot out of the food or service. It is what it is, that is to say, a place you come to watch games, get beer, and eat greasy food. College football on Saturday and NFL games on Sundays pretty much ensures that it's packed so good luck getting a table. The service can be slow, but I really can't think of anywhere better to yell at the screen and gulp down pitchers. They are pretty good about making sure that everyone is happy by putting all the good games and not so good games on any of the many flat screen TVs. Also they have the arcade game Buck Hunter, this might just fly over some people's head, but for others it's a dream come true. I usually go for beer (clearly) and either the chicken strip basket, burger, or pizza. The food isn't a party in mouth, but it goes great with beer. My one major gripe: It's disgustingly smoky, I personally cannot last more than 1 game.

reviews.name: Andy C.
reviews.review: Cool place, lots of TV's. The food was actually good, I thought.  I would recommend this place to anyone looking to catch a game.

reviews.name: Janette L.
reviews.review: Great fries.  Basic bar food at decent prices.  My friend swears that she had a bottle beer refilled and served back to her here.  Still, we usually come back whenever I visit for the fries and the people watching.

reviews.name: Carter G.
reviews.review: While the environment can suck at times, this place has reasonably priced food that is almost always excellent. They have the best chicken fingers in town (as far as I'm concerned), and the french fries are spectacular. If you can ignore the patrons from the nearby University sneering at non-students and yelling at the huge flat-screen televisions, it's an awesome eatery.

reviews.name: Nathan K.
reviews.review: Decent place to see the game.  Sunday night I think they have 2 for 1s after 4 or 5. (4.0 even)

reviews.name: Peter M.
reviews.review: This place has a good location in Hillsboro Village and lots of well-positioned tv screens (had a good time watching some world cup matches here).  However, the food is fairly bad.  Service is all right, sometimes slow.  Eh.

reviews.name: Sarah S.
reviews.review: I absolutely love this place.Nowhere else will the employees bend over backwards to make sure you have exactly the order you want.They take pride in their business and treat their customers SO well! Mark (Marcus?) always puts a smile on my face with his friendliness and positive attitude. He remembers names and faces like you wouldn't believe!The food is killer - get the chicken salad sandwich. I'll continue to give them my business (and keep bringing friends) for as long as I possibly can. :)

reviews.name: Angela O.
reviews.review: I have been to Bentons twice now with a groupon I had purchased.... both times have been a great experience! 1st time was for lunch their soup and sandwiches were delish and now I can say the same about their breakfast. I had a vanilla latte and a bacon biscuit this morning. Yum yum! And I forgot to mention how nice the guys are there!!! Greet you as soon as you walk up:) will defiantly be back!!

reviews.name: Alison C.
reviews.review: Great place for lunch! The sandwiches are so fresh and very delicious. The cafe is very clean and has a wide variety of options. I suggest trying the Houdini! The gentleman that works there is also super friendly and will switch up ingredients for you! A+

reviews.name: Liz H.
reviews.review: Friendly staff, lovely natural lighting, fresh herbs, and delicious salads and sandwiches made to order at reasonable prices. I'm a fan. Oh, they also have espresso drinks. Only con I could complain about is the menu is not posted online. I like that this little gem is rather undiscovered (first floor of an office bldg) because it is a nice, quiet place to eat and never has much of a line. :)

reviews.name: Matt L.
reviews.review: I don't usually add a review for a place I didn't get to try: only when it makes me angry, and this place has done it.I've tried going to this place three times, and all three times, I've found it closed outside of my expectations.The first time I showed up, it was in the evening, so it was closed.  Fine, it's evening.  People usually don't drink coffee at night.  I noted the hours and moved on.The second time it was closed, in spite of the hours I checked, because there was a sign that announced summer hours.  There are new places that have announced summer hours, and I think that's nonsense.  If you've been open four months, you haven't been around long enough to establish your normal hours.  Whatever.The third time I showed up, it was the Friday before memorial day, and there was a sign that said they closed early.  Now they're not even honoring the new hours they've set up for themselves.  I don't care it was memorial day weekend.The FOURTH time I showed up, it was in the morning, no holiday, and clearly within the set hours.  This time, they said they were closed for a private event: that does it.  There was no one besides a photographer in the place, it was quiet.I went and went and went, and I simply could not get served.  I get the feeling that they do their thing on their own time, and if it doesn't work out for the customer, teckwitcha!

reviews.name: Rachel M.
reviews.review: So my husband comes home one night raving about this bagel that was so good that it could have ended world hunger by itself or something. Said he was going to HAVE to take me to this place. That day finally came. I picked him up for work and we drove over to Demonbruen. This place is in the Roundabout Plaza (or the JP Morgan building, whatever you wanna call it). There is a parking garage that you can park in for free for 30 minutes; after that it is $2/hour. They do breakfast, lunch, and coffee. A lot of the sandwiches looked really good, but what I got was nothing special. I got the 'Pickle-me-perfect,' and it was just a turkey sandwich with pickles, jalapenos, banana peppers, and mustard. I could have made that. It was somewhere between $6 and $7, too! The people who work there are friendly enough, and the iced mocha my husband had was really good, but I don't see myself trekking to this place when I'm too lazy to make my own sandwich.

reviews.name: David P.
reviews.review: This place is amazing. To be honest, I wasn't really sure of what to expect when I walked in the door  as there were not many people at 11am on a Friday. However, I am so glad I found this little gem of a place. If you are in the mood for a sandwich, salad, soup, or baked good, you can't beat Benton's Cafe. They have a large selection of sandwich for both the carnivorous and veggie lovers. I was shocked to see they were growing their own herbs to use in their creations and this freshness was obvious with the first bite. You can tell Aaron, the man behind the counter, knows what he is doing when he creates new items. My sandwich, apple, and tea was the perfect amount of food for a quick lunch before heading back to the office. However the longer I sat there, the more I kept drooling. I simply had to have a brownie to take with me. I am glad I made this choice as these are not your typical Cisco product, but pure perfection made with love and talent. It was mentioned that chocolate chip cookies were being made, and I just might have to stop by this afternoon for a weekend treat. This has become my new lunch spot as I work my way through the menu. Keep up the great work and I will see you soon.

reviews.name: Michelle M.
reviews.review: I love Benton's!!! I usually order something from breakfast or lunch on a regular basis. They have a wide variety and it's good. My favorite part of going, is talking with Benton and his sidekick/employee (So sorry, I can't remeber his name). They are great guys and they are fast with dispersing orders.

reviews.name: Samma A.
