reviews.review: A guy named Benton (unrelated to Benton's Bacon)  opened this because he likes cafes and he likes Music Row. Benton's is in a tall building across from ASCAP in the roundabout with the dancing naked statues.  Anyway, Bentons has delicious wraps with good ingredients; try the Aunt Sally turkey wrap. Sandwiches, salads, yogurt parfaits and breakfast items are all handy to neighboring folk. Occasional acoustic music is also sometimes there.

reviews.name: Ginger G.
reviews.review: My mother & I had lunch today at Meridian Street Cafe.   The meatloaf & pork chops were great.   The servings are huge & the vegetables taste like home cooking.   The staff is very friendly & welcoming & the dining room very clean.  I highly recommend giving Meridian Street Cafe a try.  It's well worth the time & money.

reviews.name: Jasmine S.
reviews.review: Came here to grab to go food on a rainy Wednesday afternoon. I had the chicken & dressing, Mac & Cheese, and Turnip greens. Let me just start by saying that the chicken & dressing was probably the best I'd ever had! It has a little sweetness from the cornbread dressing & saltiness from the gravy that made my tastebuds explode. The Mac & cheese was great as well! The greens could have used a little more salt but over the whole meal was great! My boss ordered the fried chicken which was made to order (took about 13 mins to fry).  I will definitely be back!

reviews.name: Antoineka S.
reviews.review: My parents, daughter, and I went in around 11 am on a Saturday morning. We experienced great food and friendly servers. Unfortunately, some of the patrons felt the need to curse and discuss private things loudly like it was midnight and they were at a bar. My 6 Year old daughter was right beside me and I thought that it was extremely inappropriate for adults to carry on in that manner. I'll have to check the environment before dining with my family again.

reviews.name: Candace a.
reviews.review: This is one of the best meat and threes I've ever eaten at, and the prices are so reasonable (cheap). The portions are huge. The fried chicken is amazingly good - really tender and juicy. The batter is perfectly balanced, not too thick, not too thin. The pork chops are delicious as well. I had them grilled, and they were yummy. All the sides are really good, too. The green beans (which I normally don't like at these kinds of restaurants because they are cooked down so much) are delicious. They have this sweet, smoky flavor and are delightful. The mashed potatoes are real potatoes and are also great. Oh, yes, and the corn bread? They make it the right way - in a skillet. It is soooo good. Do yourself a favor and eat at this restaurant. You'll love it. They also have desserts which are very good. I love this restaurant for its really good down-home cooking!

reviews.name: Sue B.
reviews.review: Consistently delicious food! You can count on chipotle for fast, delicious, and healthy fare. The menu has barely changed in years, but the food is still scrumptious!Be prepared to wait in line if you come at peak times. But, line moves quickly.

reviews.name: Megan K.
reviews.review: Great Chipotle location--I frequent this locale pretty often. Lines are typically long, but service flows quickly. Food servers are prompt, attentive and pleasant. Food is always fresh and flavorful. Location is clean and updated.I love knowing that I can breeze into this joint, grab my food and be out in less than three minutes typically, no matter how long the line is.

reviews.name: Kimberly S.
reviews.review: Not all Chiptoles are created equally. This West End location is the most consistently good around town. Their portion sizes are good, and most all of the time the food is really tasty. Granted I've been here probably a hundred times over the years so there are some off days where the food is lukewarm or watery. My Chiptole nemesis also works here-- she never gives enough rice. Other than that, I'm a happy camper at this place!

reviews.name: Tyler B.
reviews.review: I come here often, but it's just because it's the most convenient location for me. They are often out of an ingredient. They'll usually post signs when they are out. One night, there was so sign posted and when I asked for corn salsa, the girl got snippy with me about it and yelled at her coworker that he should be telling people that so she didn't have to. No one in this location knows how to roll a burrito... They roll the sides in way too far. It ends up being very short and fat with a lot of leakage. Despite everything, the food always tastes great, so it keeps me coming back.

reviews.name: Frank O.
reviews.review: In my experience Chipotles are pretty universal but this particular location is a 2-star. I recently moved to the area and on my first trip here, they were out of bowls, lettuce, sour cream, carnitas, (maybe more, that's what I can remember). There seemed to be some arguing amongst the staff, maybe due to the shortages. Also, the trash was overflowing and needed to be taken out. I didn't hold any of this against them because stuff happens. On my second trip, similar story. They were out of carnitas again (won't hold it against them because I think it's a national thing) but also completely out of hot salsa, black beans, a couple of others, as I went through the line. It was a matter of asking the kitchen for more to replace an empty bin. At all the other Chipotles I've been to they're pretty seamless. Line staff notices they're nearly out of black beans, they shout to the back for some more, and pour the new batch into the existing bin. This location wasn't doing that at all. They were scrapping the bottom of the hot salsa bin, giving me half a serving and calling it good.Also, this location is pretty dirty. A lot of unbussed tables, low supply of Tabasco sauces out. Trash on the floor (napkins, straw sleeves, etc.). Just an overall grimy feel.

reviews.name: Rob L.
reviews.review: second time this week they messed up my to go order. get it together. people have choices!

reviews.name: Tim G.
reviews.review: I frequently eat at this Chipotle and it is wonderful, the food is always fresh and delicious, the service is excellent.The only drawback is sometimes parking is difficult if you are there at the busiest part of the lunch hour.I always get the chicken and have never been disappointed, you can even see them freshly grilling it!

reviews.name: Danny K.
reviews.review: Chiptole is delicious, quick, and healthy.  Not a game changer by any means, but I eat here 3-4 times a week for lunch. I love the carnitas burrito bowls. Location is convenient and staff is usually friendly.

reviews.name: Betsy L.
reviews.review: So I just landed a new job in a shiny building on West End. Yay for me and all that racket. I usually go home at lunch to save money and to take my pup on an afternoon walk around the block. But, today, I realized I have nothing to eat at home! So, I decided to head on over to the trusty GoogleMaps and see what's around me. Chipotle in walking distance? I've never eaten there before...and I love Mexican (well, ok, fast food Tex-Mex in this case). I got the lettuce bowl (salad bowl?) and it was, er, fine. It was really soggy on the bottom, and they piled SO MUCH guac on there, it ended up being a really heavy meal. Now, don't get me wrong. I love guac. Like, I loooooove it. It's with whom I cheat on salsa. But, too much of anything is bad (see: hangover). So, all in all, it was a great quick meal. But it's definitely something I could make at home really easily. Maybe I'll try a burrito or something next time. And I'll most likely be tacking on one of their margaritas, because...liquor in a plastic cup makes me feel classy. I'll update my review after the next meal.

reviews.name: Erick R.
reviews.review: They usually give us nice big scoops of chicken on the weekends. Boom! Love that chicken! (This advice applies to lunch time on the weekends. I don't know about week days)

reviews.name: Amanda B.
reviews.review: Okay so, I have been giving this location another chance lately and it is now my go-to. The other location near Vanderbillt kind of sucks now - chicken is extra fatty and the service is almost always pretty...well, just plain rude. This location is great though, now. I guess the cheese nazi left. Hooray!

reviews.name: Joey R.
reviews.review: Good chipotle. This location is pretty convenient. Never have trouble getting a parking spot and it's always fast. Workers are usually pleasant. Outdoor seating is nice. I only wish they were open later because this would be great for a late night eat.

reviews.name: Chris C.
reviews.review: Convenient location, generally friendly staff, lots of seating. But they frequently undercut scoop size here; more than a few of my burritos have felt underwhelming relative to price for the amount of meat include. Typically more common when ordering carnitas as they use tongs. It's also strange as guacamole is always piled on no matter what.Just something to keep in mind.

reviews.name: Donny D.
reviews.review: First I had to wait 15 minutes for chicken (I timed it) because they didn't have any cooked and the employee cooking the meat was visibly annoyed that he had to cook more. Then my friend (who suffers from crippling anxiety attacks) was rushed through the ingredient process. The woman (I didn't ask her name) passed down the bowl without even offering him fajitas, which he wanted. The next woman (I didn't ask her name) condescendingly asked what else he wanted and refused to listen to him when he specified the certain amount of cheese, and salsa he wanted. Finally she tried to verbally attack him, refusing to allow him to get extra lettuce, which he so desired. After he gained the confidence to fight back, commanding that he was the customer and should be rightfully treated like one, she turned to her supervisor (I didn't ask her name), who agreed to give him extra lettuce. I am happy that my experience wasn't so terrible but the things that happened to my friend were just inexcusable. Finally I wanted to thank the other two employees (I didn't ask their names), who were very kind. Probably will go to the chipotle on 21st next time, they always have better service.

reviews.name: Rich R.
reviews.review: Hip location full of hip people looking all hip (with a bit a burrito on their face)Don't hate me because I like Chipotle, I know it's not the "real thing" but it is some-thing. Something that is predictably good when passing through an area.This location has a friendly and efficient staff, was clean and tidy during my visit, and was playing some good music.Approved!

reviews.name: Nicole F.
reviews.review: I hate critiquing a restaurants procedures, but that's what yelp is for!I'm a vegetarian by choice and have been for 6+ years so I'm sensitive when it comes to co-mingling meat and veggies. I always order the salad (obv) and I immediately notice when they grab the lettuce with their hands, it was always someone who pushed the meat down on the previous diners plate (hey meat grease on my lettuce!). It's not like I can ask them to change their gloves when it comes to order a $7 salad. Other than that, it's quick, fresh and inexpensive. Sadly, I don't eat at Chipotle anymore because of this meat/lettuce deal. Had to inform the real vegetarians out there!

reviews.name: Jim V.
reviews.review: Not one of the best Chipotle restaurants I've been to. If you are wanting chipotle in the west end area I would suggest the Chipotle on 21st. The last couple times I've eaten at this chipotle I felt sick to my stomach. However the online or iPhone app ordering system is great. The staff is very welcoming and great at what they do. They are located on west end ave across the the piggly wiggly grocery store. Also, located in the same complex a honeybaked ham co, GNC, Ted's Montana Grille, and many others. Depending on what your looking for this could be a place for a one stop shop and eat outing.

reviews.name: Ted C.
reviews.review: I missed you, Chipotle and how surprisingly good your 'real' fast food was. Please come to Clarksville soon.With Love, Ted C

reviews.name: Jessica R.
reviews.review: Okay so I ordered from the west end location which I usually go to the 21st Ave location the food was horrible worst Chipotle experience ever. There was a piece of bone in my burrito bowl the chicken was dry and tasteless the rice was bland and overall the food was very dull and not like it usually tastes when I get it from the 21st Ave location will never go to west end Chipotle again.

reviews.name: Michael B.
reviews.review: I am surprisingly pretty new to Chipotle and my wife and I really like it. However, on our visit to this location, we went at 11:05 am for my lunch break. The sign on the door said Chipotle opens at 11am. When we walked in the door, the manager told us that we needed to wait outside until he was ready. Rather than standing outside, waiting for him to come get us, we just decided to go elsewhere.

reviews.name: Lisa R.
reviews.review: We are in town looking for place to live, so are eating out a lot. I ate at this chipotle twice while in town. The first time we walked there from the hotel, a bonus to not have to worry about parking! It's in a great spot with lots of other places to eat around it. I chose chipotle because it has ALWAYS  been good clean food that doesn't make you feel yucky after you eat it and my boyfriend has never been. The guy who checked us out was very friendly, smiled a lot and generally seemed to enjoy his job. Maybe he was manager? We both got the steak burrito bowls with black beans, med salsa, cheese, sour cream, and guacamole. The steak wasn't the same flavor I was used to and had grizzle. I picked 2 pieces of fat nasty grizzle out of my mouth, ( gross, right?!). The guacamole didn't have much flavor either, i make it at home and have had it at the other chipotle where I'm from, and this was not up to par. The 2nd visit I walked to get lunch, waited for them to open and got a steak burrito this time with the same combo as before. The staff seemed to be there just to collect a paycheck. No matter what you do, you should ALWAYS take pride in your work!  The burrito was not "wrapped/rolled" properly, which made the insides ooze out. I pulled more fat grizzle from my mouth again and swear if I go there again I will ask to speak to a manager ASAP! Eat at your own risk. I you have had excellent chipotle in the past, like me, you will understand why I would not recommend this location to anyone until they learn how to prepare the food chipotle is known for!!

reviews.name: Aleeson P.
reviews.review: I love the food! Burrito bowl and burritos!If you like guac, be sure to add it! It makes all the diference! The ingredients are always so super fresh. It's also very convenient! Although, this location could have a friendlier staff.

reviews.name: John S.
reviews.review: Awesome location and convenience, very speedy, clean place, good service, and of course good food. Not much to complain about for a fast casual burrito place. For a very decent price you can get a burrito bowl that you can pile on very high with salsa and corn and cheese and stuff. Also their guacamole is very good.

reviews.name: Matt C.
reviews.review: This was my first time at a Chipotle. At first glance I thought it was pretty bare bones, but that didn't matter as the carnitas in my burrito bowl were yum. The one major thing missing however, was the jalapenos. I was like "wha!?!" That's a key ingredient. But the hot sauce was actually "hot" and had good flavor, so that kind of made up for it...almost.

reviews.name: Heather H.
reviews.review: I almost swerved into traffic I was so happy to see a Chipotle in Nashville. It's a favorite back home on the West Coast-a frequent meet up for tacos and cheap beer with friends. I picked up lunch there this afternoon. Happiness, let me tell you, is fresh, crunchy, veggie tacos with everything on it from Chipotle. This location delivered for sure. (not all Chipotles are created equal. I'm looking at you West Lafayette, IN).By some miracle, there wasn't a line when I went in, so I got everything served up right away, and secured a booth to kick back with a Corona and chomp down of some kick ass tacos. Couldn't have been tastier.

reviews.name: Veronica D.
reviews.review: Even with a number of food allergies, i can still count on this place as my go-to spot! The carnitas is my fave and with either salad or rice bowl, it's always a filling meal. Also, the location on West End has beer for sale to enjoy with your eat-in order!

reviews.name: Aly G.
reviews.review: I can't say enough good things about Chipotle!My boyfriend introduced me to this place about 3 years ago and I've loved it ever since!Fresh ingredients, friendly service, and the price isn't too shabby either!YUM!!(Oh, and if you're not putting their sour cream on your burrito/bowl, you have NO idea what you're missing out on!)

reviews.name: Johnny W.
reviews.review: You know about Chipotle. They make burritos. So why review it?Because there are two things I want you to know:1. Yes, the guacamole is pricey, but it's free if you get a veggie burrito. They don't publicize this, and you have to ask for it at the end.2. On a per-calorie basis, this is one of the cheapest, most delicious "real food" restaurant lunches you can get. I am of course not counting traditional fast food in this equation. For around $7 for a burrito, you get roughly 1000 calories (more if you get cheese and sour cream). For some people, you can make two meals out of that. I can't, but it's still a good deal.The biggest problem with Chipotle is salt. Everything on the menu is oversalted, and their nutrition table is alarming: one burrito contains 150%, give or take a few percent, of your daily max salt intake. Foom!   The #2 problem, at least with this location, is that their music is too loud. I often like what they're playing, but I'm not there to hear it.

reviews.name: Brandon M.
reviews.review: I come here 3 times a week at least  and I love it. Chicken burrito bowl is my usual. Depending on who is working will determine the portion size of your burrito bowl. The petite girls who work there give me half of what the guys do. I walked out of there one time with barely enough food to feed a small rabbit.

reviews.name: Tim M.
reviews.review: This location has gotten worse the last 6 months. They used to have friendly staff who greeted and asked how things were going. They actually tried to make what you request - "extra lettuce, no sour cream", etc.My most recent online order - I got extra lettuce, extra cheese, and a side of sour cream.I will note that the bowl size is consistent at each visit. The LA locations I visited this summer could learn from this Nashville location.

reviews.name: Paul K.
reviews.review: Chipotle is good, but their veggie burritos are just that though, good. They are not great.  I really do appreciate them though, don't get me wrong.  For what they have and the amount they serve I am impressed by the place.I've been there 4 or 5 times now, I have a healthy appreciation of the place but if I have the choice I would hit Baja Burrito / Blue Coast over this place any time.  At Baja I am downed by 1 burrito, at Chipotle it takes two, odd thing is Chipotle is significantly larger so I have no idea why their veggie burrito is less filling.Pricewise, it's not that great of a deal. The drinks are a total ripoff for sodas and the guac prices pretty hefty.  The guac is good, but it's pretty hard to go wrong with a vegetable that's solid fat.For the area though, this place is it for quick burritos as far as I know, they are a pretty tasty burrito spot, and they don't seem to be doing anything wrong.I get the love, but my arteries belong to another burrito joint..Parking is generally not hard, but getting out of their parking lot can take some time.  Lines are either nothing or very long.  If they're really long, be aware they move pretty quickly.

reviews.name: Andrea R.
reviews.review: Having just come from Iowa, where there is one Chipotle in the entire state, I get a Chipotle burrito whenever I can. The ingredients are delicious and the Nashville locations were the first where I was offered brown rice! yum!!I always get a vegetarian burrito and am accommodated with however I choose to modify the ingredients. Easy. Fast. Delicious.

reviews.name: Rachel M.
reviews.review: Here's a little secret: I may heart Moe's to pieces, but I REALLY love Chipotle. The burritos are fantastic. I love the chili-lime rice something fierce. I love the red tomatillo salsa. I love their guacamole. The only thing that is a little disappointing is that the chips aren't free and the guac is a whopping $1.80 extra. However, I have such mad love for the burrito that it's ok to splurge.

reviews.name: Susan S.
reviews.review: I've had lots of uncooked chicken.  I like the fact that they have brown rice, but occasionally get undercooked rice.  This is definitely better than Taco Bell.  But the company's ads that are very anti-farmers made me say that I'll never go there again!  They have non-BST treated dairy products, but it isn't BST that is causing our kids to reach puberty earlier.  It's the obesity epidemic!  They don't guarantee that 100% of their products are anything.  They say they TRY to get food from local farmers but it's only when it's available.  Who cares if meat is from an animal that has been raised in gestation stalls or has been given antibiotics?  There are withdrawal times that protect our food.  We will not have residues in our meat.  The meat they sell isn't organic but this company acts like their sh*t doesn't stink.

reviews.name: Alex P.
reviews.review: Compared to the other burrito place (Qdoba) on the corner of 21st and West End (6 blocks away), I'd say its very different.  First off, the interior and exterior is a lot more stylish and upscale... It just attracts a different crowd.  On the other hand though, the Chipotle is open until 6am on the weekends!  There's nothing like a late night fix of a well done burrito. yum!

reviews.name: Peter K.
reviews.review: On the off chance that you've haven't been to Chipotle, it's a one of the better burrito spots.   They're giving away free burritos from 11-7 today, and the grand opening is this Friday the 13th.While I'm not a fan of chains, Chipotle is one of the few exceptions.  All the ingredients are fresh, tasty, and full of flavor.The Green Hills location will be opening in the new few weeks..

reviews.name: Jeff L.
reviews.review: I would give Chipotle 5 stars if their parking lot didn't make me want to murder someone every time I go there for lunch.Seriously Chipotle, worst...parking lot...ever.  Best burritos in town though.

reviews.name: Mike W.
reviews.review: Does it get any better???  I think not!!!!  Chipotle has set the bar for all things Burrito!!!  I frequent this restaurant anytime I am around!  You should too!   Try having them mix the hot salsa and sour cream half and half for a great dip!  The guac is great as well.

reviews.name: Benson C.
reviews.review: When I heard of Chipotle's arrival into Nashville, I was drooling at first thought.  Chipotle serves great burritos, quesadilla, and tacos and the like.  My favorite thing to get here is the Barbacoa Burrito, with rice, black beans, sour cream, pico de gallo, and corn.  Yum!  I thank God they even thought about an app for the iPhone, so I can order it whereever I am.  It's so easy, simple, and convenient.  I love it.   I think Chipotle fans might hate me for this, but Chipotle is comparable to Moes.  However, Chipotle is slightly better than Moe's!!

reviews.name: Jess Y.
reviews.review: I am so glad that since I've come back to Nashville, we now finally have a Chipotle. And not just one, but multiple Chipotles to feed my hunger for delicious burritos.If you have never tasted a Chipotle burrito before, for whatever crazy reason that has kept you from it--maybe the whole "chain restaurant" thing scared you off, you need to try one. All of the components of this delicious masterpiece are incredible, starting with the ever critical cilantro-lime rice. Yes, the most amazing and fragrant herb on the planet has been paired with the most delicious citrus accent to create the perfect base and marinade for the rice.  Then you can add either beans or peppers/onions (for a fajita burrito) and the meat. I always go for the chargrilled chicken--yum! Toss on that fresh pico de gallo and maybe some of the spicier salsas and some cheese and sour cream and lettuce and wrap it in a warm tortilla or spoon it up in a bowl for a lower-carb and lower-calorie option. I prefer the burrito bowl option because otherwise the burrito tends to just get quartered-off and since no one can ACTUALLY fit the whole burrito in their mouth, you only get half of the ingredients--it doesn't mix well. Usually they'll let you get the tortilla on the side if you want it still to eat it with your burrito bowl too.Also, their guacamole is fantastic. You know the ingredients are fresh and delicious.  Last time I went, they were offering free guacamole and chips to anyone that showed their Vanderbilt student ID. I don't know how long this deal lasts, but it's worth it. The guacamole made all the difference.The service was great too: my cashier was probably the most cheerful person I have ever met in my life and he definitely put a smile on my face.Bottom Line: Let's be serious, Chipotle beats Qdoba. Duh.

reviews.name: Ryan O.
reviews.review: I consider myself a burrito snob but I try to avoid chains whenever possible because I like to support local businesses. My love of all things burrito helps me overlook the fact that Chipotle is a chain.I won't attest anything here is the best in the area but there are a lot of items that are really good. For me the best thing on the menu are the pork carnitas. If you are counting calories, try a carnitas bowl with rice, black beans, 86 the cheese, and triple up on mild salsa. It is borderline too much to eat for $7 and the whole thing will clock in at under 600 calories. If you want to go the vegetarian route swap out the pork for guacamole and you net the same result.  This is my staple at least once a week for lunch.Unless you are pulling a man vs. food you might want to skip the chips. The burritos are truly massive mission style and I don't how a single person could eat both the chips and a burrito unless it was for fame or fortune.

reviews.name: Melanie J.
reviews.review: I absolutely love our Chipotle in Cool Springs Tennessee. Today I went with my family to try the one in Nashville and it was not that great. I got my food and it was already cold and my cousin found a hair in her food. The whole family had cold food. Kind of a disappointment compared to the Chipotle in Franklin.

reviews.name: Dante' T.
reviews.review: Wow! I think that I have fallen in love.... With a burrito bowl!  The ingredients were very fresh and so delicious, I may be eating at Chipotle every week...

reviews.name: Ruiqiu K.
reviews.review: For a chain, this is okay. I like Americanized Mexican food and am known for going to hardly authentic places where they glop on the sour cream and salsa. But the places I frequented more than made up for it with flavorful meat and sizzling salsa or even whole cilantro sprigs.Sadly, this place didn't hit the spot for me. I had the beef bowl (can't remember the name; it started with a B). The meat was just so-so. The rice was bland. The salsa cruda (or was it just tomatoes?) was nothing to write home about. And what's up with the chips? They have a slight acidic taste to them. On the other hand, the crew was extremely friendly.I intended to visit Hog Heaven, but I keep trying to get there when they're closed. So, I came here, instead. I can't wait until I get a car to be able to venture out to other places in the city.

reviews.name: Justin Y.
reviews.review: Nashville has always been behind the times.  So when I returned after having spent 4 glorious years in D.C. with Chipotles abundantly available, I knew I was going to miss my favorite burrito chain.  Not so!  Nashville has taken one step closer to true civilization and gotten itself 2 Chipotles!  How glorious!I think this chain beats all others due to it's more minimalistic cuisine.  My favorite is the Pork Barbacoa burrito with black beans, pico de gallo and tomatillo red sauce, guac (costs extra unless it's a vegetarian burrito), cheese, lettuce, and corn.  If you order the chips, be sure to squeeze some limes onto it before taking a bite.  And don't forget a Corona to wash it all down.I don't miss D.C. as much now that Chipotle is here to fill by belly.

reviews.name: Wayne H.
reviews.review: My first day in Nashville three years ago, I was on a bus with a gaggle of other students.  As we drove around, one student turned and yelled to everyone: "They have a TACO BELL here!"Oh boy.I am so glad we have a Chipotle now. yes its a franchise, yes it's not authentic Mexican food.  But whatever.  It's a filling, 6-in long, 3-inch wide Mission Burrito stuffed with meat products, beans or grilled vegetables and salsa for $5.50. While not the healthiest thing in the world, it is made to order and delicious.  The guacamole is especially noteworthy, both for the great flavor it adds to the burrito as well as its fairly pricy $1.20 for a dallop.  Chipotle is a solid, cheap fast-causal joint that adds delicious Southwest cuisine to the West End Area and sure beats the heck out of Taco Bell.

reviews.name: Mike R.
reviews.review: A really good value for the price. The food is fresh, and the combinations you can create are the hallmark of the chain.. plus the spicy salsa, lolI had a chicken salad, and even though it was near closing time the meat was fresh and so was the lettuce, etc. Decent ambiance, the place lives up to the Chipotle business model. Oh, good location in a small strip mall in a nice part of town.

reviews.name: Justin R.
reviews.review: Chipotle is a great quick Mexican joint. I just moved from New Orleans and there were none within 100 miles of the city. So, when I moved to Nashville I was very excited to see a Chipotle. The quality of the ingredients is always so fresh. I especially love their rice! The seating in the location can be really cramped when you walk in during the lunch rush. But, the line moves really fast. I cant wait to eat more delicious burritos!!!

reviews.name: Christopher M.
reviews.review: Chipotle is not a restaurant, it's an addiction. The best Guac in Nashville. The chips are fantastic ... oh and the burritos taste like heaven.My note to you: every.single.time. that I go to Chipotle and I order a burrito, I tell them to put half the amount of everything (except meat). If you don't specify this, your burrito will be the size of an infant. They almost know me now for this procedure. I don't want to be *that* full.Couldn't live without Chipotle.

reviews.name: Anita A.
reviews.review: Chipotle is a great place to get good food fast! One of my faves!!!

reviews.name: Steph H.
reviews.review: I won't lie: the only reason I set foot in Chipotle was because I received a "buy one, get one free" coupon and figured that was enough of an incentive to give the place a try. Don't get me wrong, I don't have anything against the place, but despite living within spitting distance of the place (yum?), I'd never frequented it simply because I don't really do fast food.I guess the obvious comparison to make is between this and Qdoba (where I admit that I have eaten MANY times in the past). I think that for the money, Chipotle is the better pick simply because the ingredients seem fresher, which is probably reflected in the relatively slimmer menu at Chipotle. Rather than overwhelming you with myriad options, you pretty much decide whether you want a burrito, a burrito bowl, tacos (soft or hard), salad, or tacos. The filling choices are the same for all of them (chicken, steak, barbacoa, carnitas, or veggies) and everything costs about $6.25. It seems like Chipotle has decided to focus on providing the best product possible, so while eating here every day would probably get boring, what you do get tastes pretty good. Also, the portions are HUGE. A single burrito will probably get you through the day because the amount they manage to cram into a flour tortilla (how do they do it?!?) is enough to feed a small family... or the average American, I suppose.The first time I came, I got the carnitas burrito, which was sufficiently good that my husband and I decided to come back. I think the barbacoa burrito is probably my favorite - the meat is juicy and nicely spiced. We both splurged and got guac on our burritos, and while $1.25 for this add in (the only one you have to pay for) may seem pricey, it was well worth it because this guacamole is muy delicioso. That said, if not for the coupon we had, two burritos and one drink would have cost us nearly $19... which seems kind of insanely expensive for fast food in my mind. Sure this is a healthier choice than a lot of other places, but for $20 there are a lot of other (non-fast food) places I'd hit up first before coming back here. It's a decent choice if you need to eat and run or really want a burrito, but in my mind, it's not a huge game changer.

reviews.name: Matt L.
reviews.review: Chipotle had been the place Nashville foodies knew about, but weren't about to trek to Atlanta or Indianapolis for.  Oh sure, if we ended up in the area, then sure we'd stop in, just like how yankees stop by Krystal or White Castle it they happen to wander down this way.But the hype has been immense, and the question has to be raised: does it match the hype.  I can only say that it does, and that's amazing.I knew it was a burrito place, but Nashville has Moe's and Qdoba both already sell big burritos wrapped in tin foil.  It turns out, there's no comparison.One nice feature of the fast casual oeuvre is the simple menu: Chipotle epitomizes this: pick your dish, pick your meat, pick your salsa, and that's it.  That everything is fresh only improves upon this.  Everything tasted perfect both separately and together.  Chipotle clearly has their formulas down because the burrito was simply outstanding.  It puts that other fast casual burrito places to shame.Nice sized portions, very reasonable prices, and very delicious food makes for a great combination.  My family and I will be returning to Chipotle.

reviews.name: Aj R.
reviews.review: Wow! I am not a fan of fast Mexican food but this is an awesome spot, The prices are very reasonable and the staff is friendly, quick, & knowledgeable about the food, I can always get in and out of here in 10 minutes max. The portion sizes are generous and the food is super fresh, all of their salsas, rices, and guacamole are made in house. The meat is also marinated in house and never frozen.  My personal favorite menu item is the the burrito bowl but I can never seem to finish it all it's so huge, If your on west end and in search of a quick bite of Mexican Skip Taco Bell and hit up Chipotle.

reviews.name: Merritt G.
reviews.review: I absolutely love Chipotle. I've been stopping by this location lately because I grab a burrito bol on my way to watch Vanderbilt baseball. In fact twice now I've just stuff the bol in purse and brought it into the stadium with me - since there are no gluten free options inside Hawkin's Field. Thank goodness for the light to help you get back onto West End, or this would be a nightmare to get out of!

reviews.name: Claire B.
reviews.review: I'm a convert. I originally went to Chipotle with pretty high expectations only to be greatly disappointed when they were out of nearly all the key ingredients to make a burrito or taco. They had very little meat left, no black beans, no cheese and they scraped the guacamole container with a spatula to fulfill our order. I aired my complaint here on Yelp and was contacted by a Chipotle representative who asked if I would give them another chance. I was impressed with the employee being concerned about my opinion and reaching out so I gave them another shot. My second visit was a success. All inventory was in stock and my burrito was delicious. My experience was in line with the other positive reviews I had read. I now look forward to my next visit!

reviews.name: Kenzi N.
reviews.review: I went there today for lunch... If you go, you had better be hungry- the burritos are the size of a small baby.  The tomatillo (sp?)  salsa is delish!  You can get burritos, tacos, salads, or a naked burrito (burrito in a bowl w/o the tortilla. Overall, a great lunch (and dinner w/ my leftovers).  Personally, I like it better than baja burrito, but that is my opinion =)

reviews.name: Mark M.
reviews.review: It's Chipolte. Probably the best chain burrito place but it is just that....A chain.

reviews.name: Liz D.
reviews.review: You could not even imagine how excited I was when this place opened. I had my first taste of Chipotle in Texas, then went almost every week in college in Seattle, and when I came to Nashville and found that they didn't have one in the whole state, I was disappointed. But when they started putting this one up, I counted the days. They gave free burritos on opening day, and also occasionally have free/discount days on Halloween, first day of summer, tax day and other times. Chipotle is reliably fresh and delicious. There have been times where the rice was too salty, the meat too spicy or the people making your burrito don't distribute the ingredients quite evenly. But in general, though, it is delicious and I am always coming back. Lines get long at this location, especially at lunch and dinner time. There are now several locations- Green Hills and Franklin are less busy, 21st is busy during lunch. But all delicious!

reviews.name: mumin k.
reviews.review: This is the place to go for a burrito. I really like the fajita burrito. The chips and guac is pretty good too.

reviews.name: John D.
reviews.review: GOBA mid-day strategy meeting, spicy! Brad said steak was chewy, chicken was fine. Rewards card needed but they do serve ZERO. #in

reviews.name: R F.
reviews.review: Very good fast food burrito chain.  The lines have been long since opening (for good reason), but online ordering is great.  Just tried it out and it worked as advertised. Highly recommended.

reviews.name: Shane M.
reviews.review: Really quant place and great food. Back home country feel. Nice place to sit down and have lunch. Meats are excellent. Try the smoked turkey with the sweet sauce. You can serve yourself your own sides as well which is nice!

reviews.name: Stephen C.
reviews.review: What a perfect place to eat for lunch. Monday and Tuesday they have the best food for 10 bucks. 2 trip buffet. Can't go wrong with a combo. You will be so full and the BBQ is outstanding. One of the best BBQ places in town.

reviews.name: Alex L.
reviews.review: GREAT place to grab lunch. I'm a big fan of the bar b q as well....especially with the "sweet heat" sauce. The sides, cornbread and cobbler are must haves too. The owner is a huge Auburn fan so it's fun to give him a hard time.

reviews.name: Crabby O.
reviews.review: Breakdown of things triedSausage - B+ : FlavorfulBrisket - C- : Flavorless and dryBologna - D+ : Borderline edible, seemed reheated (how do you screw up this?)Pork    - F  : Several days old, disgustingDev egg - D- : Odd flavorGreen beans - C- : Mushy, tasted like waterGreens - C- : Bitter and void of flavorMac & Cheese D+ : Looked good tasted almost like plain pasta, suspect food coloring Iced tea A- : A little waeker than I like but fineSlaw A+ : Delicious, was almost dumbstruck it was so much better than everything elseNot sure what this guy is smoking every day but it is not meat because he clearly is serving stuff that is not just a day old, in some cases it seems to be several days old. Here is a tip - if you must serve leftovers, freeze it. It taste like ass when refrigerated. I'll just say it was mostly edible

reviews.name: Mary B.
reviews.review: Great bbq. Love the mac n chhese, slaw, baked and hot beans. Cobblers and pie are great. Chicken wings on wednesday, ribs on thursday, buffet Monday and Tuesday heaven

reviews.name: Anne R.
reviews.review: Some of the best mac and cheese that I have ever had!!!!!

reviews.name: Jim S.
reviews.review: Some of the best BBQ in town!!! Great atmosphere and they treat you like family. I would recommend anyone to try this place and the price is right.

reviews.name: Cameron D.
reviews.review: Tex's is a little buffet-register-sit style BBQ joint with a charming Texas theme. It's not a good restaurant. Here's why.I ordered the Combo Plate (chopped beef brisket, pulled pork, turkey, bologna, sausage; $7.99 with two sides). Grab a tray, the meat is served to you with sauce poured over the top, and then you serve your own vegetables. The portion size was just fine (picture is uploaded). The sausage was by far the most flavorful meat on my plate, but like the previous commenter said, probably not made in-house. The turkey was a little dry and the beef and pork were average to bland.Sides (macaroni, green beans, texas toast) were a bummer. Some generous salt on the green beans helped, and the macaroni was fine (can't really screw up macaroni). The toast was room-temperature.However, here's the dealbreaker: the BBQ sauce was ... inexplicable. Watery and bland, without a hint of spiciness or seasoning. Maybe it's intended to be supplemented with hot sauce? Maybe the sauce was having an off-day? Maybe I was supposed to ask for "medium" or "hot"? I have no idea, but all I can go on is what was served to me.

reviews.name: Dennis C.
reviews.review: I only ate there once but was greatly surprised the staff, the food was very very good. The one thing I like was the building it look like a run down house needing a lots of work and the inside look the same but the charm and food really made you enjoy eatting there. The atmophere is the best I have seen in a long time and I will go back as soon as I can.

reviews.name: Greg T.
reviews.review: Tex's serves texas style BBQ in a comfortable and charming dining environment.  went with the brisket and sausage...brisket was decent but didn't blow me away (1 star) and the sausage was average (i don't think they make their own sausage).  nice selection of sides and desserts (1 star); I was unimpressed by the mac and cheese and collard greens...both needed more seasoning.  the cole slaw was average at best.the service was very attentive and friendly...nice crew running this show (1 star).  wish the food was as good as the service.

reviews.name: shaun p.
reviews.review: I had something to go.It was abit of a dirty place the beef brisket was ok the sides were sub par.But there sweet bread was pretty good

reviews.name: Pam X.
reviews.review: Of all the places to be a regular customer in college, I have become a regular at this particular Qdoba. I must've come here every weekend for an entire school since I live across the street. The staff is friendly for a chain restaurant--the lady who runs the place told me to skip the line once because she knows that I only get chips and queso during the week. Once, I got a free drink from one of the staff because I had to wait through a line of drunken partiers for chips and queso. I guess the gist of this review was that I like chips and queso, and Chipotle doesn't have queso, so I end up here a lot. And that's fine. The quesadillas are also good with rice on them (mmm carbs) so try that out sometime. But they're not great without cheese, which happened to me once, so make sure to get queso on your dilla.

reviews.name: Paul S.
reviews.review: Very frustrating experience. Really poor communication from the staff. Burrito artists behind counter would mumble and then act annoyed when you couldn't understand them. And if they are indeed burrito artists, mine must have studied under Jackson Pollock.

reviews.name: Rachel M.
reviews.review: I've noticed that this place gets very mixed reviews. I love it simply for the fact that it's open until 5 in the morning on Fridays and Saturdays..the hours listed on Yelp say 4, but I THINK they are now open until 5...whatever, they're open at 2:30 in the morning when my husband and I are a little, um, tipsy...yeah, that's the word. There are not too many things better than a huge, very terrible-for-you burrito after a fun night out. You'll meet the most interesting people at that time, too. Sure, the employees could be a little happier and the food could taste a little better, but you know what? I used to work fast food and have to deal with the drunk crowd. It gets to you sometimes. PLUS the guac is free. I love Chipotle, I do, but adding guacamole to a burrito is not $2 and some change worth of work.

reviews.name: Carly B.
reviews.review: Yay drunk food! This particular location stays open until 5am and is conveniently located near the midtown & downtown bar scene. At 4am your choices are pretty limited: Jack in the box, Wendy's, Paradise Park.... For taco lovers, this is your only option.So late last night after all the booze, my tummy demanded tacos. Chipotle & Moe's serve higher quality food so during normal business hours, I wouldn't visit Qdoba, but their crispy tacos hit the spot while intoxicated. Be prepared for a 25 minute line at 3:45am. As the bar scene wines down, you won't be the only one craving grease.

reviews.name: Alvin P.
reviews.review: Comfort Food Late at Night!This one is located inside the Vanderbilt campus (technically the university is intertwined into the city) and you can actually see the big Vandy sign out the window.  They have plenty of parking, although I've gone mostly at late night hours.  One thing for sure, this place is busy.  Even at like 1 in the morning, there is plenty of people on the line inside to make an order.  But they seem to have fast service.  I've always ordered online and just skipped the line.  The service seems friendly to me, but I also never really had to stand there and make orders.  I think one time, I ordered food, but they closed earlier than the time mentioned on the website, but they opened it up when I got there to give me the food.  I don't think the main website hours are completely accurate, so if it's late on a Thursday to Saturday night, might want to call before making the trek there.  I'm vegetarian for the most part, so obviously not talking about the meat options.The food is definitely a large portion.  A burrito is huge, and definitely weighs a good amount.  This is food baby type stuff, that may cause you to loosen up your belt by a few notches afterwards.  The burrito has some nice flavors, plenty of cheese, and the sauces definitely add flavors.  I also love the ability to make combinations with a variety of options as fillings instead of being pigeonholed into certain toppings, so that's always a plus.  Albeit, this is true for a lot of burrito bars.  I also like the quesadilla at this place, although I have to add in the special comments section for an option to add beans to the dish.  I think the beans add very good flavor to go with the cheese.  The chips and dip are pretty good, I'm just not sure if it's worth the money as the same as other options.  I like it, but it being the same price makes me go away from it, feel like I'm not getting that much value out of it.  It does taste good though.  The place has pretty good seating as well, so most of the time, it shouldn't be a problem getting a seat.  I think the main attraction here is the late hours that they are open especially towards the weekends.  I think the only downside is that it's located near a police trap zone on West End, so be very light on the accelerator no matter how hungry you are. I think I would recommend this place to most people for some late night food.

reviews.name: Dina D.
reviews.review: This is the largest Qdoba I have ever seen, located right by Vanderbilt University. It is open until the wee hours of the morning, serving breakfast after midnight. A solid choice for quick eats, especially late night. Not the cleanest place around, but hey, they're open.

reviews.name: Brad W.
reviews.review: Do you like undertrained cops grabbing all your current and future business? Do you love metro hard asking if you're guilty?!No? Then dial us

reviews.name: BethAnn S.
reviews.review: It is odd to be the 'Yelp Dutchess' or whatnot of Qdoba and still be giving it a single star. Maybe I need have higher standards for myself?My problems with Qdoba are not the food, which I really like as fast food goes - tasty, reasonably priced and yummy lime tortilla chips make me happy when I'm too busy for anything else.The problem is the staff. The very, very slow staff who frankly rank as some of the least happy service workers I've ever seen. No greeting, you know, ever. People who yell at you if you break out a Qdoba rewards card DON'T SWIPE IT NOW! (because apparently its hooked up to a nuclear detonator on set to 'swipe card before cashier is ready'). This weekend we opted to go online and order in advance in the hopes of avoiding the kind of human interaction that make the staff so dang grumpy. Order online, head down there to pick it up and.....nothing. Nadda. Food isn't ready and, wait for it....there is not a single customer in line. Go to register and ask and they are working on it (bear in mind, its a burrito and two tacos). They get three groups of 2 or 3 people. Wait on them. Still no food for us. Wait 20 minutes. When no one is in the store 'can we have the food now?' to the manager and we get a 'we're working on it!'. Yeah, so apparently they were working on screwing it up with the wrong meat in tacos, none of the veggies we asked for and a whole lot of attitude. Hard to believe they have worse personalities on the internet than in real life. Also, there's a Chipotle on 21st.....go there.

reviews.name: Sheena T.
reviews.review: OK... for late night food options, I admit it right now... I want some Taco Bell. When they created the verde salsa, my head exploded. But I digress, the BF went to Vanderbilt, and I swear there is some kind of Vandy bond that goes with Qdoba.... maybe it's nostalgia, but he swears by the late night Qdoba visit. Anywho, I lost the Taco Bell battle with him and we went to Qdoba on Sunday night. I had a small "naked" chicken burrito bowl and the tortilla soup. The burrito bowl was pretty tiny but tasted OK. I very much enjoyed the habanero salsa.. it had a very nice kick to it, and I appreciate that! The soup was tasty as well and I left not feeling too full which I guess is a good and bad thing. Food was fine, but I couldn't help but wonder what all I could have bought at Taco Bell for $7.00... Let the late night Mexican food battle continue!

reviews.name: Gabrielle H.
reviews.review: Terrible customer service. I walked in around 5 pm on a Tuesday. It took about 2 min for anyone behind the counter to even acknowledge me (I was the only customer at the time too). The person preparing my food rushed through the order and didn't really ask me what I wanted on my burrito. She put my food at the register and told me to wait for someone to check me out while she went to prepare other orders. It took a good 5 minutes I actually get checked out. In the meantime, another employee behind the counter was throwing chicken on a grill and then another came out talking on his cell phone. Cell phone guy takes one look at the customers and then walks back into the kitchen to finish his call before coming out several minutes later to ring up my order. The food was ok, but the service ruined the experience. Maybe another shift with different employees would be different.

reviews.name: Nathan K.
reviews.review: Four considerations:1) Seems like you get less meat than the alternatives (Moes and Chipolte).  Also Moes and Chipolte are relatively close.  One is about 3 minutes away and the other is about 7 minutes away (both on West End).2) Kinda messy at a non-peak hour.3) Not the nicest Qudoba I've been too (as in well run and quality food)4) Water leak in the corner.  Ewww....It will probably be a long, long time before I come back.

reviews.name: Allison B.
reviews.review: Let me start by saying that I LOVE qdoba. However, I will NEVER EVER again make the mistake of returning to this awful location! First of all, I noticed the parking lot is unusually dimly lit for a place that's open late. Second, an actual employee was about to engage in a physical altercation in the parking lot as I was entering the building. Next, employees were moving very slowly, and the food line was absolutely disgusting! None of it even looked appetizing! There was spillage everywhere, and the food did not look fresh. The employees, for lack of a better word, were very ghetto. Absolute trash. They were disorganized and inconsiderate. I'm very let down by the service, quality of food, and cleanliness of the restaurant. Whoever is running that establishment should be ashamed.

reviews.name: Danny N.
reviews.review: Weekend late-night 1,500 calorie awesomeness with a side of regret the next morning.  I don't normally rate chain restaurants, but this Qdoba caters to those who failed bringing home a lady friend from Tin Roof where you can settle for a close second of a queso breakfast burrito mixed with home fries, sausage, salsa rojo, pico, and more cheese.  They are open crazy late on the weekends.

reviews.name: Torrey C.
reviews.review: Not so Friendly staff and good burritos not expensive at all. The location has lots of parking although the exterior comes off as a little dirty the inside is always very clean and comfortable. Love the queso! The hours of being open all night long is great for late night cravings :)

reviews.name: Courtenay L.
reviews.review: I love the food here but I will never ever go back to this location. I was going through the line and one of the employees started slopping things on my plate in the most careless way- you could tell he either hated his sad life serving here or he was just having a bad day. Maybe his cat died? I'll try to give him the benefit of the doubt but when you are a customer service representative you need to be professional and leave that shit at home. Anyway- when we got to the salsas I asked him which one was mild (because I don't go to Qdoba every damn day I didn't know) and he said "You can have any of this", which was confusing because I was asking for a type of salsa so I replied that I wanted the mild one. I don't know if he was ignoring me or couldn't hear me but he repeated "you can have any of this". I stared at him blankly and I think he was getting stressed out that a line was forming behind me and he violently pointed to my options and raised his voice and said "this, this, this or this!" COMPLETELY missing my point- I was asking what each type of salsa was! He was so belligerent it was unbelievable! He hurt my feelings to the point where I almost started crying, he made me feel dumb. Which is the worst type of costumer service. He threw my food to the cashier and she was pissed too- she gave me and my boyfriend free drinks because of how rude he was being (you could tell she was embarrassed) but she couldn't really do much about it. WHERE WAS THE MANAGER!? My meal should have been free. I hope they fired him.

reviews.name: Kevin C.
reviews.review: It is a solid burrito place best frequented late at night after a night out on the town. But, I have had a few dinners here and the food is always consistent. I hate the pricing scheme, since it's like $7 for some damn queso and chips, but eh, it is on the card.The restaurant area is a little messy, in a way that is unsettling enough to comment on it here. Don't expect any kosher or health standards to be in mind here. But, at least the food is cheap. If it comes off the card, I wouldn't stop by here, but as long as they are on the Vandy card, students will always be at the Q.

reviews.name: Kat T.
reviews.review: This review is for Qdoba in general not for this particular one location.  But I do like this location's hours,  they are open until 2:00 am during weekday.If you like Chipotle like I do, you need to give Qdoba a try.  Big fan of their Gumbo, Tortilla Soup, and naked Burrito.  I also like their Craft 2, so you can pick 2 small items instead of one giant burrito.  Fresh ingredient, good flavor.

reviews.name: Betsy L.
reviews.review: I give this 4 stars because I only ever get one dish and it's always to-go. The veggie taco salad. I love it and, therefore, force myself to only get it once every couple months or so. It's so delicious. But service is always quick and on average with a casual restaurant like this.

reviews.name: Alex P.
reviews.review: Its on the corner of West End and 21st.  Very convenient to Vandy students and late night people alike.  I can't believe they're open up until 6am on weekends (Thursdays, Fridays, and Saturdays)!!!  And they make things easy for Vandy students since they take the commodore card.  They have plenty of seating and parking and the staff are usually friendly (if they're not too overwhelmed by the crowds).  The food is tasty as always. My only complaint is that the parking lot seems to attract illicit activity as well as Vandy and metro police.  The entry way guard is a bit intimidating too, but his presence makes me feel safe.  Also, why close at 9pm on Mondays, Tuesdays, and Wednesdays?  Can't they close later like 10 or 11?  I'm a student! I have no sense of time!  And I have burrito cravings late in the night.

reviews.name: Bobby B.
reviews.review: This was a terrible place to eat.  I have a similar experience a few times at a Qdoba... I'm a Chipotle fan all the way. The manager at Qdoba came out of the kitchen, saw there was a line and said the "F" word really loud.  He carried on with a terrible attitude and had no smile or care for what he was doing.  The table I was going to sit at had a dirty surface, and a used plastic glove from an employee.  My chips were stale and food was mediocre.  I'll never eat at a Q ever again.  Chipotle is the real deal.

reviews.name: Matt B.
reviews.review: This review is not about the food. I like the food. The girls up front today were very unprofessional. They argued with my wife about menu items (and were in the wrong on the facts as well as treating her badly). They went so far as to gossip about her in front of us as they continued to screw up our order. On top of that they really didn't pay attention to what they were doing as they gossiped loudly amongst themselves and handed over some food that looked horrible (dollops of guac in a pile in the corner, salsa overloaded and dripping over the edge of the bowl). It doesn't take much to make fast food a little better but they actually made it a little worse.I like Qdoba but won't return to that location when their manager lets this sort of rude, loud behavior go unchecked at the front of the store.

reviews.name: Madalyn H.
reviews.review: Qdoba is my fast-casual Mexican restaurant of choice. Mainly because I hate Chipotle's chicken, but this isn't about Chipotle, now, is it?I was first introduced to Qdoba earlier this year when a friend passed along a $5 Any Entree email to me that was good during the end of tax season. Only $5 for a delicious burrito bowl? COUNT. ME. IN. Seeing my friend get this sweet coupon prompted me to sign up for their texts/emails and have since been rewarded with other discounted meals.The meat is flavorful. While they do just have your standard ingredients to add, they are always fresh and don't look disgusting waiting to be thrown on your extra large burrito tortilla. The cheese sauce costs a bit more to be added, but DAMN does it make the meal.My favorite thing about this location is that it's open until 4am on Friday and Saturday. I guess this is a perk of living near Vandy, but it also saves me from eating drunken Taco Bell, and for that, I am in love.The only reason I am docking one star is because a cashier once told me she didn't know about their rewards program because "no one ever tells [her] anything, ever."

reviews.name: Matt M.
reviews.review: We hit this place about every two weeks for lunch, and it's consistently good each time. For the most part, I always get the Naked Ancho BBQ Burrito bowl with black beans and chicken, then topped with their amazingly good Ancho BBQ sauce. It's the perfect combination of smoky and sweet, but it's unlike any other BBQ sauce I know. Then, I get my bowl topped with pico, corn salsa and their fiery habanero salsa, along with a little bit of cheese...just because, you know, it's cheese! The combo of ingredients in this bowl is amazing, and when given the option, I would choose Qdoba over the similarly priced Chipotle and Moe's. On other visits, I've tried at least one of the following, and they're all as delicious as the last: nachos, chicken tortilla soup and tacos. Although I've never actually had the wrapped burrito, the person in line in front of me ordered one and it was about the size of a small child's head. You definitely won't be hungry after eating it!Qdoba isn't where you want to go for good, authentic Mexican food; however, if you're looking for something fast, quick and delicious, the folks at Qdoba have what you need.

reviews.name: Ruben M.
reviews.review: I came here when I first arrived at Nash.The workers aren't as nice as the workers at the places surrounding this one.  I guess you just wouldn't like to work here, I wouldn't. They didn't even ask me if I wanted rice in the burrito, which I never have! :(I can't say that I like this place more than I do Chipotle, but it has its perks...The food was pretty good!  I just wish the staff would have been a bit friendlier..

reviews.name: Marcia M.
reviews.review: Vegetarian bean burrito and a nice size bag of chips and salsa all for around $8.50 = not bad. Not bad at all.However, I just didn't enjoy the flavor and would rather have more vegetable topping options that are healthy and delish than a 'rito the size of my 5pound chihuahua. Sorry Chico, no offense meant buddy.There was nothing horrible about the taste but it was just uninspiring and lacked any noticeable flavor. I wasn't impressed with the habenero salsa either. Perhaps this is why I make it an effort to avoid chain restaurants whenever I can but I would rather pay a bit more and have a memorable and tasty meal.I however take full responsibility for popping in today due to convenience.Overall, you'll feel stuffed post meal but not satisfied!

reviews.name: Kristin Marie S.
reviews.review: For a fast food place, it's in the top.  I'll take Qdoba over T-Bell anyday.  It's packed during lunch but they have yet to mess up my order.  At night, well, one guy told me he doesn't speak Spanish when I ordered carnitas.  This has less to do with Qdoba and more to do with the angry, college student who was working the 2am shift.  Note:  Qdoba by no means is "Mexican."  After eating legit Mexican food in California for 10 years, I never once saw queso on the menu.  This people is Tex-Mex, or at least that's what I'm told.  Either way I'll be coming back for the quesadilla without the pico in the middle and I will dip it in their guac.  The nachos are interesting too.  It's like higher class movie nachos only because the melted queso is whitish and not velveeta yellow.  After I go to Chipotle, I'll let you know which one is better.

reviews.name: James H.
reviews.review: Homoginized and Americanized, and a side of Medicore. For a place like this you don't expect much and usually get what you expect. The  food wasn't terrible and as my friend said,  at least it was better then the Taco Bell or Jack in the Box across West End. But I think you are 10 times better off going to a sit down Mexican restaurant then going to this place. The food portions are not that great compared to the competition, making it a bit expensive for what you get. This is a fast food feeling kind of place and my total was around 8 bucks. I got a chicken burritto. Nothing was wrong with it, but nothing to write home about either.The service wasn't that great either. The counter people didn't seem to care if you are even there, just going through the motions. I've always thought that a good manager team could hire friendly workers and then train them to appear cheerful and to smile. Chick Filet comes to mind. I like the way they seem happy to give you a drink refill there and when you say thank you they always say "my pleasure". Most of them probably don't mean it, but it feels good anyway.Either, spend some extra money and go somewhere better than Qdoba, or make the drive to Baja Burrito or Chile Burrito. They are both much better, and in the same price range.

reviews.name: Lauren L.
reviews.review: What can I say? It's a chain, so I'm not expecting the food to be amazing, but the food here is very good and tastes fresh. The restaurant is clean, and the all of the staff I've interacted with have been pleasant. Sometimes it's really difficult for them to hear me with everything going on in the kitchen, though, and vice versa.

reviews.name: Thomas L.
reviews.review: Decent burritos at a decent price.    I've never met someone that prefers this place over its nearby competitor Chipotle, though.  The ingredients just aren't as tasty. The burrito ingredients are good but just not as good as its competitors.   There is also the greater commitment of hormone and antibiotic free meat use at Chipotle. So factor that in if that's of importance to you.   The daily made chips, lightly salted, meet the need along with the "pretty good" guacamole.   There is also the greater commitment of hormone and antibiotic free meat used at Chipotle. So factor that in if that's of importance to you.   In a nutshell, I only head here when I get a BOGO email in my inbox. I leave pretty happy with that discount factored in.

reviews.name: Ruiqiu K.
reviews.review: "Fresh Mex" and I do not mix.I get that they're promoting a unique menu that's not quite Mexican and not quite Americanized Mexican, either. But a cheese sauce that's kind of iffy, an odd citrus-y taste to the tortillas (I wonder if they get their chips from the same source as Chipotle -- they both have the same weird taste to them), and no discernible salsa (at least my order didn't come with any) -- and I start wondering why I even bother.The place does get busy, so perhaps I should have tried something more popular.

reviews.name: Dan C.
reviews.review: Not just for eat in. I did a lunch and learn presentation just down the street and we had them cater. Way better than the typical sandwich lunch catering food. Would recommend to any one who would need that kind of service. The staff was also very professional.

reviews.name: Steph H.
reviews.review: A long time ago, back when I was a first-year grad student, a friend and I used to partake in an event we called "Q it up Fridays", which was essentially fancy speak for what ultimately amounted to having an afternoon taco snack at Qdoba at around 3 pm every Friday. Perhaps because I was young(er) and naive(r) then, I thought Qdoba was the bee's knees and looked forward to our weekly pilgrimage with gusto.After our first two years, however, schedules and life made it so that Q it up Fridays were no longer a priority and my visits to Qdoba dropped off dramatically. These days, I maybe only visit Qdoba twice a year, and that's generally just because it's one of the closest weekday lunch options for me on the rare occasion I am too lazy to pack my own.Perhaps it is because I no longer see the world through the rose-tinted lenses of those halcyon early grad student days or maybe it's just that this Qdoba has gone WAY downhill. Whatever it is, my last few visits to Qdoba have been really underwhelming. I suspect the food tastes much the same as it always does, but the people behind the counter are no longer as friendly as they once were, and even worse, the attention to detail is minimal at best. The last two times I visited, my order was screwed up; once I ordered (and paid for!) a steak burrito, but was given chicken instead. The other time, my gumbo was missing the crispy tortilla strips, which are one of the highlights of that dish, in my opinion. I don't expect culinary genius when I go to Qdoba, but it would be nice if they could at least get my order consistently correct. At first I thought it was kind of redundant that a Chipotle is opening up a little ways down 21st avenue, but given the lackluster performance Qdoba has delivered on my last few visits, Chipotle will likely be a welcome alternative.

reviews.name: Ryan M.
reviews.review: Welcome to Jack in the Box mexican, served by gringos (except the tortilla lady).

reviews.name: Simply S.
reviews.review: I have to admit - I visit Qdoba at least twice a week. As bad as it sounds,  It's one of the only places you can get a healthy meal (yes you actually can) late at night. I love their webpage - you can build your own meal and it adds and subtracts nutrition info. What I get us under 350 calories! Staff is always very friendly, it's always very clean and as long as the line can be at times - they always move it pretty quickly. Couple of wishes. I wish they were open late EVERY night. Sunday - Wednesday they are only open till 11. Thurs - Saturday it's until 4am.  I sure wish they were open into the wee hours every night. In fact, I think they would do well if they were 24 hours on those busy weekend nights! HOWEVER be warned. If you do go on a Friday or Saturday night after midnight - especially between 2 and 4 am - be prepared to stand in a long and VERY ANNOYING line.  There are nothing but drunk (usually young vandy kids) in line. They are always obnoxious, rude, pushing, cussing, etc. You get the picture. They do have security in there on those nights. So just be warned and prepared to bite your tongue, ha!

reviews.name: Kelley K.
reviews.review: Can I do more then 5 stars? I have been going to this place for years. I could write a book on how much Q means to me. Its been a place for so many get togethers...from after work, after shows, meeting new people, meeting old people...etc I cant say enough for how much I love this restaurant. I do miss Katie Qdoba though she was really into customer service and if something went wrong with an order she would do whatever to fix it where as now they may or may not just depends

reviews.name: Ryan O.
reviews.review: Ramblings of a burrito snob here.Qdoba is a chain so off the bat that is a slight negative in my book. The burritos are mission style which means they are massive. They have all the standard meats, vegetarian options, and toppings that you find at most mission style shops so you can customize your burrito however you see fit. For the calorie conscious they offer naked burritos in a bowl which is always a plus for me.If burritos aren't you thing they have quite a few other options like Mexican gumbo, tortilla soup, tacos, quesadillas, and a host of other standard tex-mex type fare. Other noteworthy items - I like the fact that they have a rewards program via the Qdoba card and every 10th meal is free. I'm also a fan of the habanero salsa. It noticeably hotter than what you find at the other local chains. All in all this is a solid option for a quick burrito. Quality wise Baja and Chipotle get my vote for better options but the wide range of choices here make it worthy of a nice change-up from those two every now and again.

reviews.name: Christine C.
reviews.review: WORST SERVICE EVER! I've worked in service for many years so I try to be patient when it comes to dealing with people in that industry, but for the first time in my life I had to say something and not even an apology. There was one boy who was doing all the work and the girl at the cash register decided instead of helping with the line of customers that she needed to restock the cups, when there were plenty already there. It took about 20 minutes for me to get my one meal, when there was only two people ahead of me in line. Even the manager walked by seeing the line waiting for for their orders to be complete and did not say a word. I've been to this location in the past, for lunch they seem to be faster maybe they have capable workers and managers at that time, the dinner crew has always been extremely slow, this has been my worst experience and I don't believe I will ever go back. The food is okay, a step up from Taco Bell, but Chipotle is down the street and has much better service and better flavor.

reviews.name: Christina C.
reviews.review: Really good burrito!It's like Chipotle, but gourmet.We found Qdoba by exiting off the freeway, following signs to the University, and going *point* "Let's eat there". We didn't even know what to expect.I had the Poblano Pesto Signature Burrito. Seriously, how can you go wrong with a burrito that has chicken and pesto? I love pesto. It was really good. I like being able to watch my food get prepared, so I know what is and isn't going in it. Even though it was HOT and HUMID, it was still nice to sit outside and eat. We even managed to prop the table umbrella open, which the previous table inhabitants didn't do.+ Cheap+ Fast+ Fresh+ Filling- Corporate (subsidiary of JITB)

reviews.name: Matt L.
reviews.review: I was beginning to give up hope that almost any of the burrito places would have any flavor.  Blue Coast, Chili Burrito Co, Baja Burrito were as bland as chalk, and I had no reason to expect this place to be any better.The service was reasonable for the busy lunch line; the menu was bigger than most burrito places offer, but the staff was ho hum, and the prices weren't anything to sing about.But when I actually bit into the chicken burrito, it was actually pretty darn tasty.  The rice had some taste to it; the chicken had been marinated; the cheese had a little zip to it, and the salsa wasn't just spicy, it was rich.  Overall, it was an enjoyable burrito, and I was disappointed when I was finished.  Other than Chipotle, and Mr. Burrito Fresh, I had not experienced this is in a burrito for some time.Would I recommend this over Chipotle? No.  But it is nice to have several good choices for faux mexican cuisine in the West End area.  If Chipotle is too busy, or whatever, Qdoba makes a nice little alternative.

reviews.name: Peter C.
reviews.review: No cheese.  Apparently this is not a concept understood by the staff here.  More than once a handful of cheese was tossed into my food, only to be hand-picked out.  Do I get a fresh burrito untainted with cheese?  No.  I get the *salvaged* burrito with about 1/2 a cup of the gas-maker.  The staff simply don't listen.  They ask what you want, then space out while mechanically making you the burrito that was ordered 4 customers ago.  On top of all that?  Rude service, dirty counters.  Would I come back?  Only if I am desparate (or if Chipotle closes).

reviews.name: Michael W.
reviews.review: Terrible.Mariela does a great job of getting to the kernel of truth: "Qdoba is popular amongst people that don't know any better."I'm a burrito elitist, so I'm inclined to hate mega-franchises (it's owned by jack-in-the-box! en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Qd… ). But in the interest of fairness, I'll list the specific reasons why Qdoba sucks, rather than simply ranting about the philosophical reasons not to eat there.1) Their burritos are bland. This is because their meat is bland. They have no flavor profile, because their flavors come in packets from national HQ. Their salsas are also quite bland.2) I'm sorry Nashville, consumption of queso sauce is acceptable only on nachos at sporting events and on occasions of extreme drunkenness. In my burrito, never.3) Their employees need to learn to roll. They just slop the ingredients onto the tortilla in a big mound without even a not to rough linearity (is that a word?). Then, they carelessly schlump (that's right, schlump) it all into an amorphous softball-like blob that quickly seeps through its wrapper and makes you devolve into taking a spoon to its bland, mushy innards.4) Nine bucks for a burrito and a drink!? Is there some sort of prize involved? Is there a silver decoder ring buried in my beans? I seldom leave qdoba without feeling raped in the wallet and the stomach lining.The only reason this place stays in business is it's close to Vanderbilt's campus and it's open late.This city deserves a better class of made-to-order burrito joint. Oh wait, it has one. yelp.com/biz/baja-burrit…

reviews.name: Anthony C.
reviews.review: I have only tried a couple of things here because the Ancho BBQ Burrito Bowl is awesome and I can't stop myself from ordering it every time! It is a version of a burrito on the menu, but naked, or without a tortilla. They start by layering the bottom of the bowl with cilantro infused rice and then offer you your choice of black or pinto beans.  You can then choose from steak, pork, or chicken. I have only gone with the steak once, the pork once, and the chicken the rest of the time because I thought it was the best of the three. Next, they ladle on the absolute best part of the bowl, which is the ancho bbq sauce. It is the perfect combination of my personal favorite flavor profile-smoky, sweet, and spicy. After that, you can get as wild and crazy as you want and load it up or keep it simple. I usually add pico de gallo, roasted corn salsa, habanero salsa, and shredded cheese. To complement this delicious bowl, I always add a few lime wedges to my Coke Zero that really works well with the flavors. With the great customer service and consistently tasty, fresh food, I will continue to make my bi-weekly visit and probably eat the Ancho BBQ Burrito Bowl every single time.

reviews.name: Robert K.
reviews.review: This Qdoba location is highly visible from West End and is situated in facing both West End and 21st.  It is kind of a weird angle for a building to be built, but hey, I guess it helps to catch your eye!I consider myself to be a Mexican food aficionado, hence why I have reviewed so many Mexican places.  I would consider Qdoba to be more of a fast food style Mexican place, than an actual restaurant.  I have only had the burritos here and they are pretty tasty!  The salsa they use is super zesty, I think it compliments the burrito well.

reviews.name: Steven U.
reviews.review: this location is consistently the worst... Sloppy food and mediocre service. I actually had to flirt with the "lady" behind the counter to get her to make my food. What happened to this location. It used to be my favorite. Now the only reason to come here is breakfast burritos after midnight on a Saturday... even then I am not sure if its worth the hassle.

reviews.name: Peter K.
reviews.review: Quick serve chains rarely provider great service, this location is no different.  The employees are friendly, but the service is marginal.  This particular Qdoba is popular with the Vandy crowd; you'll always run into a group of wide eyed kids.  Burritos seem to be one of the new in things in Nashville along with cupcakes.  You'll find new burrito joints every where in the city...and soon a Chipotle will be opening right down the street.  Qdoba is great for a quick, cheap, and usually decent meal.  I'm bound to eat here again....they're now open 24 hours on Fridays & Saturdays.

reviews.name: Caleb D.
