But they cheated; they cut a hole on the bottom of the cake and filled it w/ chocolate sauce. hahaha, but still good regardless.)The breadsticks and dips they serve first are different and tasty. The wine selection is great. The service is great. Despite how large the restaurant is, they high quality of their dishes remain the same. I have never been this wowed by a steakhouse before. Everything I have tried has been completely satisfying. It's too bad that the closest Fleming's to me is in Fresno. I have yet to take my bf there.

reviews.name: Tara R.
reviews.review: Melt in your mouth steaks....excellent wine list and a cool bar.  Great people watching and great food.  Service is excellent.  Desserts are fantastic as well.

reviews.name: Joe C.
reviews.review: Been to this place a few times. My boss went there a lot. Every time I went, I saw him and his wife and a few board members. Their dark wood and leather upholstery made it a warmer dcor (definitely not fancier) than F. Scott's, but their foods and services are exceptional. They also have a large selection of wines.  Although I'm not much of a drinker, my dad loves it. I go there for their smoked salmon and steak. The place has one of the few best steak places in town. The smoked salmon is out of this world! Be prepared to spend some $$$ in this place. It's worth it!

reviews.name: Jasmine S.
reviews.review: It was great.  Amazing service and yummy food.  I had the Tuna and my friend had the lamb chops.  The corn is spicy and the baked potato was HEAVENLY.  Nothing better.

reviews.name: John H.
reviews.review: Steaks are superb.  Sides are alla carte,  so get out your wallets.  The wine selection is quite good.  Very pricey.  Hard to get out for less than $100 per person.

reviews.name: J Lester S.
reviews.review: Very good.  The roux is excellent, and don't be fooled by the absence of okra in the gumbo!  It's there, it's just not in whole pieces.  Never been a gumbo fan before, but this place changed my mind.

reviews.name: Dave C.
reviews.review: Just tried this place for the first time today and was very impressed. The guy who was working was very nice and offered to let me try several samples of their different dishes, which were all very flavorful in their own way.I ended up liking the voodoo chicken best, so I ordered that over rice. It was delicious and a little bit spicy (in a good way). The portions were good for the $6.99 lunch price too. Also, I eat gluten-free, so it was nice to see several items labeled as GF right on the menu.Also, just FYI, it's located in an urban food court of sorts along with Quiznos and Nuvo Burrito at the corner of 4th and Peabody. There is a small parking lot behind the building and some street parking nearby. I would definitely recommend this place for a good, fast Cajun/creole meal near downtown and I look forward to trying more of their menu items next time I'm in the neighborhood.

reviews.name: Ronda N.
reviews.review: The cuisine here is Creole/Cajun. The ingredients are pre-made and assembled to order. Whoa the gumbo is spicy and full of flavor. This is a tasty fast food alternative to burger & fries. The meals are fairly priced $$. There is a private parking lot located on the east side of the building. Parking downtown Nashville not easy or free.

reviews.name: Allie M.
reviews.review: Okay - so, I'm not a big fast food fan, but if I'm going to do fast food, this is where I'm gonna go.J Gumbo is a little hard to find, in an indoor food court-type building a stroll away from Broadway, but it's worth the hunt. I liken it to the southern version of Chipotle, with plenty of southern favorites like jambalaya, crawfish etoufee and voodoo chicken - ready to serve, but still fresh.I had the Creole Ratatouille and Voodoo Chicken, which both came served in one huge bowl. The flavors were great and the voodoo chicken was supremely spicy - just the way I like it. I had a cornbread muffin, which I probably wouldn't get again, but I just love combining that sweetness with the spiciness of Cajun food.If you're in a pinch for time or you're starving and can't wait for restaurant service, this is a great place to quell your hunger.

reviews.name: Bret D.
reviews.review: Food here is really good and flavorful.  I have tried the voodoo chicken and the drunken chicken, both served over rice.  They will add more spice on request.  Dishes range from $6.50 to $8.00 and the serving size will leave you satisfied. Highly recommended for lunch.  I can walk to the location inside the Peabody Market so I will be a regular.

reviews.name: Jeremy E.
reviews.review: Stopped by today for lunch and was really blown away. The voodoo chicken is outstanding. And it's easy to get in and out, unlike their other location in the arcade. Great job!

reviews.name: Dale N.
reviews.review: Wife had the Gumbo tonight at a benefit for Big Brothers and Big Sisters and could not shut up about how good it was. Closed down before I got there, making a special trip to try it...better be damn good and as advertised by the wife!!!! To be continued!

reviews.name: Sarah H.
reviews.review: Made opentable reservation. Always a positive for me! Bloody Mary was spicy.. Love! Large group and we were well taken care of. The kitchen is small so food came out in waves. My shrimp & grits was beyond great. The Brie appetizer was mouthwatering! Enchanting place... Cool ambience. The only downside was dessert. Whip cream , mascarpone, blueberries and crispy shortbread. Just wasn't good but not bad. The pastry chef (I think) came out and asked if we liked it & when we were nicely honest... Was a bit defensive with an explanation that was to long. Great place! Will go back.

reviews.name: Mia F.
reviews.review: The restaurant iis in a historic early 1900's home. Beautiful and quaint- however that makes for small quarters when dining. We were only one out of three couples  - but we were all put in the same  room together and it just seemed a little confined and not conducive to lively or personal conversations. You can hear everyone else- I know way more about strangers than I wanted. Our waiter was the only one working, so the service was a bit slow- he was waiter, bus boy and bartender in 1. My husband ordered a coffee martini, and though the waiter made it twice(not my our request- he just wanted to make a better one in his mind), it still fell short. BUT- it was really thoughtful of him to even make this because it's not even on the menu. He was sweet - but just didn't seem to fit the southern vibe of the restaurant. The food was good- we had the watermelon gazpacho and shrimp and grits. Although the S&G's were a little on the salty side. Great presentation as well. Would really give it a 3.5, but I hate to say it- it really isn't a place we would come back to or recommend.

reviews.name: Tracy B.
reviews.review: Warning: LONG REVIEWThis place is absolutely adorable! From the ambiance to the food, it's as good as it gets. It is just off the beaten path although very close to local bars. It's a great place to go with parents or somewhere for a nice date or a nicer "girls" brunch on a weekend.We came in starving and thirsty and we were so excited to have attentive waters and waitresses. And we were all pleasantly surprised by the "spa water." All of the water is infused with cucumbers which is a nice touch.  Things to get: The Bloody Mary is one of the best I've had. The bartender was so excited to make the drink that I couldn't turn it down and I'm so glad I didn't. We started with the charcuterie plate which was a generous portion of bread and meats/cheeses. My only gripe is that they would not bring out a basket of bread for us to start, but our server was more than accommodating when we needed more bread for the bread plate we had ordered. The butter was fantastic-- it is perhaps worth getting the bread just for this. We ordered the bleu potatoes appetizer and were not disappointed. It curbed our hunger a bit before the entrees came out. Although I did think this could have been a bit larger for the price.For the entrees, the bone-in Rib Eye was apparently the winner (although I did not try it). It came with broccoli and shoestring sweet potatoes and looked amazing. Because it took a few more minutes to come out, the water brought over a few wine samplings for the girl at our table who ordered it while she waited. Yet another nice touch by the restaurant.The rest of us ordered shrimp and grits or a salad with steak/chicken on it. The grits were cooked to perfection and the only complaint was that the shrimp were not larger. BUT the portion sizes were perfect.Yes, this place is pricey, maybe a few dishes are too pricey, but the food is great, the ambiance is better, and the service is the best I've ever had. And that is something I am willing to pay for.

reviews.name: Katie B.
reviews.review: Went to Sunday brunch with a small group of girls. This place was adorable! It reminded me of one of my favorite Charleston restaurants. The brunch food was delicious and reasonably priced. I had a fried green tomato BLT that was amazing! One of the girls had quiche that was a smaller serving than expected. But overall the service was great, it was a friendly, and I liked the ambiance. While we didn't order any alcoholic drinks after our long weekend in Nashville, the bar area in this house-turned-restaurant was gorgeous! Would definitely recommend for brunch!

reviews.name: Aaron H.
reviews.review: Incredibly overpriced and definitely underwhelming. Went for our anniversary to try and treat my wife to something special. Very disappointed. It felt like a bad startup. The starting salads were so plane Jane and slightly wilting. I had the shrimp and grits and there was absolutely nothing special about it and the portions were small.  Service was ok. The historic home environment was ok but the a/c couldn't keep up with the heat.  Really sad I spent that kind of money on my wife just for us to be disappointed.

reviews.name: Tess F.
reviews.review: Don't let the location/nearby destruction deter you! I've been here twice for brunch. The first time was right after they opened and it was pretty empty, but I was glad to see there were a lot more people this time around since the food and service are both so good. Tanya and Richard (I believe those are their names) are both great servers. They're super attentive and friendly, and Richard was happy to talk to us about everything on the menu. Their biscuits are incredible (and served with cranberry butter or house made peach preserves). The grits are a little thick but are good, and their pimento cheese is amazing. There's a lot of options for brunch, ranging from a monte cristo made with French toast, to banana pancakes, to your typical eggs and biscuit plate, to a bologna pimento sandwich - all of which are under $15 (which isn't cheap, but the local and homemade food make the options worth those prices). Lastly, their drinks are great. Tanya makes a *fabulous* Bloody Mary and the mimosas are super fruity. Both my brunch mates have been really pleased to come, and I'm planning on going back for dinner and desserts soon.

reviews.name: Marion S.
reviews.review: We had an amazing meal here on 7/15/15. We can't remember a better meal in Nashville in a while. It was so much fun. A real dining experience. We had the snapper and the chicken fried chicken. The dishes were superb and the waiter was such a character. We'll definitely be back. I can't wait to hang out in the cozy bar.

reviews.name: Steve M.
reviews.review: Presentation of all the food was excellent....service was great.We enjoyed the flank steak, shrimp and grits.....and the watermelon gazpacho.Finished off with home made cherry ice cream and great coffee.

reviews.name: Seth C.
reviews.review: There are times when you feel like food is overpriced, and then there are times when you feel ripped off. The brunch Hayes Street Benedict is an example of such a rip off. $15 for half of an English muffin, with one egg and a small portion of prosciutto. No side item, no garnish. This is equivalent to a $30 proper portion of Benedict, which no one would pay. If the dish were extraordinary, I could overlook the price. This dish was mediocre at best, and in 4 bites, it's gone.

reviews.name: Artsy 2.
reviews.review: Just had a wonderful lunch with my family in beautiful magnolia south....lovely setting, delicious food, and friendly staff.....we will definitely be back!! Lovely old home with lots of ambience...beautiful bar and dining rooms....just a great new addition to the nashville scene!

reviews.name: Michael H.
reviews.review: I originally posted this on Open Table as that's where I booked the dinner, but wanted to share with Yelpers as well the wonderful experience I had at this new restaurant.Magnolia South hasn't been open but a month or so and Hayes Street has been blocked on one end for all that time.  It's now open and people are going to start finding this place as the food is exceptional.  I'm glad we got there before the crowds to celebrate my birthday.  Our favorite restaurant is probably MidTown Cafe but the food we had was even better in my opinion and better than anything we've had at Watermark or Sambucco or any of the Gulch places.  I had Ed's pork chop and my wife had Red Snapper with Crawfish sauce.  I couldn't decide which was better, probably the fish as the sauce was exceptional and the portions were substantial enough we had to go boxes.  The chef formerly worked at Antoines in New Orleans and The Indigo Hotel in Nashville and he's picked up some interesting combinations.  Probably the only downside is the menu is not extensive, but there is something there for everyone.  I guess the motto is like Johnny Cash says, "Do what you do, do well."  The ambiance is good as its in an old house from 1890 that has been a private residence, a rooming house, a doctor's office and law office in the last 100+ years.  The service was excellent, we were at the early seating on the coldest night of the year, which is always my birthday, so they were able to spend time and visit with us and that was fun.  I can heartily recommend Magnolia South and will put this restaurant in rotation for our special occasions.  Valentines and our anniversary are in February!

reviews.name: L G.
reviews.review: Wish I could give this place more than five stars. I don't know why other people have it low reviews-- I would take them with a grain of salt.Everything here was impressive-- from the food to the service, Magnolia South pays special attention to give patrons a good experience. My date and I had the four course tasting menu with wine and it was a wonderful meal. When I made the reservation, I noted that I'm a vegetarian, and the restaurant had no trouble accommodating. I didn't feel like I was missing anything that meat-eaters get-- every course was delicious. We started with a charcuterie board that was phenomenal. In addition to three flavorful cheeses, the board featured several meats, grilled homemade bread, some pickled condiment, pickled vegetables, peach jam, and the most WONDERFUL homemade honey-cranberry butter. Wow-- I could've eaten thai butter on anything! The waitress said it's made daily and the chef is always trying new combinations.After, we had the fried green tomatoes, fresh pasta and marinara (all made in-house!), and finished off with a fresh fruit and vanilla tart and a rich, smooth chocolate buttermilk pudding. We each chose a glass of wine from the menu, and the waiter recommended a red that my date really enjoyed. The water served was a nice touch too-- it was infused with lemon and cucumber and felt like we were at the spa.More than anything, the environment was an enjoyable place to be. The restaurant is located on a quiet street in a beautiful, old building. There are two dining rooms with quaint settings. The restaurant pays attention to the details-- everything is expertly and carefully decorated. The restrooms were spacious and clean.The service was amazing too. Multiple waiters stopped by to explain every dish as it was presented and ensure we had all of our needs taken care of. The waiters were polite and professional-- they didn't hover awkwardly and never rushed us, but they did ensure everything progressed smoothly and in a time-sensitive manner. The chef stopped by mid-meal to explain the dishes further and ask if we needed anything else.Overall, a great experience--Magnolia South deserves every one of these five stars and more.

reviews.name: Zach D.
reviews.review: My favorite place for brunch in Nashville! Small menu, locally sourced, perfect presentation. Prices are not unreasonable, especially considering the quality of food and drink. Highly recommend for brunch or lunch!

reviews.name: Bob N.
reviews.review: I would not recommend this place if your party is larger than 4. That is all.

reviews.name: Chris S.
reviews.review: AC could not keep up. Incredibly hot throughout dinner. Service was poor. Ordered a mint julep, which was basically a cup of ice. Would never go back. Also, I don't write reviews really ever. The fact I am shows how bad this experience was.

reviews.name: Kay G.
reviews.review: Way over priced, small portions. Ambiance lacking ... Tacky retro pieces overcrowd mantels, for example. Waitress very friendly but waiter was arrogant in demeanor. Don't waste your time or money!

reviews.name: Sally M.
reviews.review: Went here for brunch last Sunday.  Overall the food was excellent.  Unfortunately the service and drinks were not.  My husband sent his bloody mary.back 3 times,  the mimosas were primarily juice and pricey.  The staff seemed unorganized and overwhelmed even though the restaurant wasn't busy.  Took forever to get our food and drink refills.   Seems like they have ALOT of kinks to work out to make this place a success.   With so many great restaurants in Nashville,  I don't think we'll be back.

reviews.name: Robby H.
reviews.review: Beautiful old building is a wonderful intimate setting for great fine dining. We ordered the shrimp & grits and pork chop. The chop had a great flavor but the shrimp and grits were amazing.  They were not what I expected however they surpassed my desire with the andouille sausage gravy. Absolutely excellent all around. David was our terrific  waiter. Ask for him.

reviews.name: Dave B.
reviews.review: Magnolia South just opened for lunch last week.  Site is formerly home of Mambo's Restaurant, located right behind The Hutton Hotel.  Wonderful lunch menu.  We all enjoyed salads, which were excellent.  Overall, a wonderful experience!!!

reviews.name: Forrest P.
reviews.review: Wife had Snapper and it was excellent. I had the brined pork chop $35, and it was marginal. Menu showed wine list with 3 prices, the lowest being $7.  I assumed this was for a glass, but when check arrived it was $11 a glass. My wife and I both felt the entrees were overpriced by $5 to $8 compared to other restaurants of similar or better quality.

reviews.name: Michael S.
reviews.review: A group of 5 of us went for Saturday Brunch and it was delightful. Normally wouldn't use that would but the service was so friendly, the atmosphere familial, and the chef came out to welcome and thank us for coming in. It's in an historic house and feels like you're eating in a Southern Grandma's dining room. The food was very good, especially the Shrimp & Grits. We ordered one for the table to start and they served each of us a nice portion with a shrimp, that's the kind of place it is.

reviews.name: Natalie K.
reviews.review: Entirely too expensive for just ok food! One of us got a steak and it was pretty average. It was expensive and came with no sides! The other got fried chicken which was good but the mashed potatoes had no flavor at all! The kicker was the drink- don't get Johnny Walker with a splash of water unless you want to pay $18 for one!!! Ridiculous

reviews.name: Camille W.
reviews.review: Excellent experience at Magnolia South. Our waiter, Brian, was super attentive and informative. He even took the time to tell us about the background and give us a tour of the historic house that the restaurant is located in. Not only is the service excellent, but the food is phenomenal. The grits from the shrimp and grits entree are exceptional and the we highly recommend you finish with the vanilla bean crime brûlée. We loved our experience here and will definitely return next time we are in Nashville.

reviews.name: Britney C.
reviews.review: Very disappointing!!  Very over priced, served cold, nothing fresh.  Took way to long to get a drink and management solution was a bowl of communal ice cream. I am a foodie and respect the hospitality  community and support it but this place will close soon and not recommended. We will not be back.

reviews.name: Susan W.
reviews.review: We decided to give this new restaurant a try tonight and were very disappointed. The menu was limited and poorly executed.  The salad was very average, the shrimp in the shrimp and grits were rubbery, and the service so overly solicitous that it was irritating. This poor to average food with one glass of wine for two people was $100 plus tip.  There are many great restaurants in Nashville.  This is not one of them.

reviews.name: Pamela H.
reviews.review: Had brunch here today with my daughter. We had mimosas, fried green tomatoes, shrimp and grits, and chicken fried chicken. The mimosas were great and so was the coffee and the service. The tomatoes were fried in a thick batter and were just okay. I prefer a  lighter cornmeal batter. The chicken fried chicken came with mashed potatoes and gravy which had a good but rather bland flavor. My daughter liked the shrimp and grits which I thought tasted rather ordinary. I really want this restaurant to succeed so we'll return for lunch or dinner to try the regular menu. I always give new restaurants at least two visits before passing judgment. The atmosphere is quaint and I like that they're utilizing an old home. It looks like a great place to gather.

reviews.name: Donna D.
reviews.review: Beautiful restaurant, wonderful service...We had the 4 course chef's tasting, and every dish was SO delicious!!  Classic atmosphere, friendly staff.  Highly recommend!!

reviews.name: Vanessa S.
reviews.review: The food was good however the portions were excruciatingly small and the prices high. The service was wonderful. We went for brunch at 12 and they had already ran out of two or three things. Personally I would not return

reviews.name: Shane C.
reviews.review: I don't even know where to start.  For someone who loves to try new restaurant and love the way Nashville is growing and restaurants are getting really really good, I have to say this restaurant doesn't stand a chance.  Just left this place with a group of 15 and no one was happy.  To start, side salad that consisted of handful of spinach, slice of tomato and 1/4 hard boiled egg they wanted to charge me and my wife $14 each.  Next I ordered the snapper which was clearly previously frozen, over salted and served with a side of risotto which was ok at best...wife ordered shrimp and scallop dish that was 3 shrimp and 1 and 1/2 scallops...cold.  Each dish was $40 dollars!!!  They also charged our group for bread they brought to the table.  I will say the wine was good but drinks were mediocre.  When we said something to the owner, the response was free dessert that consisted of "homemade" ice cream that was communal to the table.  One flavor was pretty good, other two flavors seemed to be overchurned and more of a butter texture.  Anyway, it was my first and last time at Magnolia South, very disappointed.

reviews.name: Thomas F.
reviews.review: Very disappointing.  Perhaps I was expecting too much because of the cool and quaint venue.  I stopped in after work one evening for a glass of wine and an appetizer.  The wine had been in the open bottle so long that it had "oxygenated" and turned - at least the bartender replaced this without question.  The mini fried green tomato blt's from the starter menu could have used ALOT less batter and more emphasis on the tomato...the heavy-handed batter killed the whole taste.  I may, in time, give Magnolia South another whirl for a full meal to see if the entrees fare any better but I will wait to see how other reviewers find the place.

reviews.name: Calonda G.
reviews.review: The food was really delicious and fast sufficient service. I was here on a business trip but plan on coming back with my family.

reviews.name: Bridget D.
reviews.review: I've eaten at this place twice now.  First time I got the Falafel, which was pretty good. (I've had way better, but what do you expect in Nashville?) This time I got a salad. List price for the most basic house salad:$6.95.  Kinda pricey for lettuce and tomatoes, but I chose to add a protein to it and that raised it $2.95 higher. (It said it came with Kalamata olives.  They piled it high with black olives instead. blah. The taste of the food, otherwise, was good.  That is the only reason I came back.The gentleman who worked the assembly line to make my salad was Mr. GrumpyPants.  He never once looked me in the eye, nor did he raise his voice above mumble-level.  When I didn't hear one of his under-the-breath questions he got snippy with me.  "Tabbouleh, YES.OR.NO..." still never above a mumble. The gentlewoman behind the register,  Mrs. I-Have-No-Craps-To-Give, also had the inability to look customers in the face and spoke in a disinterested monotone usually only reserved to DMV employees. Sad.When I go to a restaurant, I like to be made to feel like I am a valued customer. Thank you for choosing our restaurant, ma'am, we hope you'll come back.  This one has made me feel like I was preventing the staff from having their Union Nap.  I probably won't be back. P.S. Turn on the AC!

reviews.name: Tyler B.
reviews.review: I came here for a Spanish Language and Culture Meetup group. Pros:1. It was quiet and there was a large table so we could all speak together and hear each other well. 2. It was clean. 3. Prices are good.Cons:1. It was FREEZING. I was literally shivering it was so cold. 2. My salad was kinda blah. It didn't have much flavor. 2. The only dressings they have are balsamic vinaigrette, ranch and Taziki sauce. I got the balsamic and Taziki, and they were very bland. The Taziki sauce was nothing like Taziki sauce. It tasted more like watered down ranch. I'd come here again if the group meets here again, but I wouldn't drive out of my way to come here on my own.

reviews.name: Linda B.
reviews.review: The food is excellent and the staff have always been friendly.  Even when the line is long, they keep it moving quickly.  Brought my 18-month old here recently and she even enjoyed the gyro and hummus!

reviews.name: Robert B.
reviews.review: Anyone rating this place with less than 5 stars is eating the wrong thing, or needs to get their taste-buds checked out by a licensed Orthodontist!  This place hands down has the best Gyro's I've ever had...EVER.  I get a chicken gyro, with rice, tomato, onion, and lettuce, with some of that white ranch sauce.... CAN YOU SAY HEAVEN ON EARTH??? I've had Gyro sandwiches in many many states, and none can compare! I've been eating at this place well over 20 years... This place is a Nashville landmark. The fact that this place is able to stay in business for so many years in a DEAD location, next to an ABANDONED MALL shows that they have EXCELLENT FOOD that keeps people coming back!

reviews.name: Debbie R.
reviews.review: The food was good, the place seemed clean and the people were nice enough.I didn't like having to stand in line to pay with everyone else when I had called the order in. I also think I was overcharged. The menu board said $6.95, but she rang up $7.90. They were busy and I was in a hurry so I didn't hassle it. It's a nice change from the fast food around here, so I will go there again.

reviews.name: Courtney B.
reviews.review: Hands down the best Greek food in Nashville. Lots of healthly options, not just your typical rice, meat, bread, ranch dressing kinda place. I usually get the greek salad with chicken or the chicken platter. The food is very fresh.

reviews.name: Suzie R.
reviews.review: This is one of my go-to places in Nashville. I used to work around the corner and came here multiple times a week. Falafel is awesome, the tabbouleh is tastier than everywhere and that white sauce is ridiculous! I almost want to tell people not to come here because I don't want it overrun by tourists!

reviews.name: Bruno S.
reviews.review: There are a few Kebab Gyro's on here so hopefully this is the right location.  I'm not overall familiar with Nashville but we found this hole in the wall while driving in the downtown area. There is limited seating on not much of an atmosphere, and it looks like the locals were mostly sitting down for a quick lunch.Parking was hard to find so I ended up just pulling in and getting our food to-go. They had a good variety on their menu but yes it was mostly cafeteria style service. Definitely not a restaurant/dining in environment.  But I didn't mind it, actually was looking for somewhere quick.The FOOD: I ordered the gyro and it was delicious. Not your typical gyro. They cut the top of the pita bread and "stuff" the bread with meat and fillings of your choice. This was the best Gyro I've had in the South and beats a lot of them up North.This place is busy during lunch time and would not recommend eat-in. It is family owned and they were very friendly.I will definitely eat here again and do recommend it to anyone looking for a good Gyro.

reviews.name: Karen T.
reviews.review: Looks can be deceiving, I didn't think this place would be that great based on the location and the looks from the outside, but the marinated chicken platter I had over rice pilaf and house salad was good, and a good deal for the amount of food.Good sign that there was a pretty good line of people from surrounding businesses; you know if the locals like a place, it is usually a good sign. The people were friendly and patient and make sure your order is correct.

reviews.name: Nickie G.
reviews.review: So now that I work at MetroCenter it has come to my attention that there are a paucity of decent restaurants to try in the area.  In order to avoid fast food we went to Kebab Gyros.  It is located in a strip of places that includes Neely's BBQ - which smelled so freakin delicious I almost never made it into Kebab.So this place has no atmosphere whatsoever, so don't expect much in that respect.  Just a bunch of tables where people with limited time to eat can sit and grub down really quickly.  Also, the trashcans needed to be emptied and there were a ton of gnats flying around them.  Ew.  So don't expect it to be very clean either.  That being said...on to the food!So there will be a line at lunch time but it moves quickly so don't let that run you away (if the gnats haven't already ran you away, that is).  The menu includes gyro or chicken pitas, platters that include gyros, chicken, or combinations + rice and tabbouleh, or platters where you choose two specialty items (like hummus, greek orzo, tabbouleh, chickpea salad, etc).  They also have salad offerings.  I got the gyros platter.  The meat was plentiful and was pretty decent.  Liked the yogurt sauce to dip it in and the pita they served on the side was soft and fresh (might have been store bought, not sure, but was still good).  Price was $8ish for the platter plus a drink.  And drinks are serve yourself which is good because you can refill right before you leave to get some afternoon caffeine.  AND it is a Coke establishment so you don't have to drink crappy Pepsi instead.  Service is fast and efficient - no time for friendliness or banter here.Try Kebab Gyros if you are in the neighborhood and are looking for something different than the usual fast food!

reviews.name: Janet S.
reviews.review: Sit down place by the lake in Metro Center, outdoor patio, plenty of seating indoors, cafeteria style food.  Platters, sandwiches, wraps,  No better No worse than any of its type in Nashville, just simply getting away with it (sigh), beef/lamb mixed together, could not taste the difference, horrible tasteless rice, and the classic watered down ranch, chick pea salad was soggy.  Had no expectation and none were met.  $12 for lunch.  The possee I was with thought it was great.

reviews.name: C R.
reviews.review: Good spot for a quick lunch in an area without many sit down restaurants. Good, not great, Mediterranean fare. Fresh ingredients and friendly people. You can get out for less than $10.

reviews.name: Aubrey W.
reviews.review: Solidly good food, and they were able to seat ten people on a Saturday night on short notice. We were drinking cocktails at Patterson House and getting peckish. Used OpenTable and snagged a quick reservation for the group, walking to the Embassy Suites to eat. It is hard to find given it requires entering the hotel, but it is a really convenient midtown location.Service was good and fast. I had the Drake & Boar, a duck and pork burger that was really tasty. What a winning combo of meats!  The fries were good too. I don't know that I would seek this place out again as a destination, but if I am hungry in midtown and everything else is slammed, this seems like a good option. Not overly pricey either.

reviews.name: Chad R.
reviews.review: The atmosphere here was great. I think we just hit them on a bad day, as they seemed to have been understaffed. Located in the Embassy Suites downtown, I wasn't sure what I expected from this restaurant. The menu is very promising.I got a burger, I ordered it medium, but it seemed to have been overcooked in places. Someone else got the Chicken and Biscuits, and the biscuits were burned, and hard to eat. Aside from that the fries are ONE POINT. Some of the best fries I've had in Nashville. I'm undecided whether I'll make a trip back here or not. It wasn't terrible, but it was outstanding. I think it would be better if they'd been staffed better that day.

reviews.name: Wendy C.
reviews.review: I stayed at the hotel on business and ended up eating at this restaurant three times. I never had a problem with the service-we sat at the bar and the bartender was super sweet and helpful. I'm an adventurous eater, but their menu was just weird. I mean it's cool to have a few signature dishes that are oddball, but the whole dang thing was like Picasso's Palate and just not good enough for the price, in my opinion. Here's what I tried:I had some sort of steak salad for my first meal. Salad, green goddess dressing, golden beets, caramelized onions, and peppered steak. Looked great, but the steak was awful. Way too much pepper and a rubbery texture. The rest of the salad made for an interesting combination, but was decent. I stuck to sides on my next visits. The asparagus was good. The French fries were great, but skip the bacon ketchup.

reviews.name: I F.
reviews.review: Service was very friendly, the food was eatable not 'bad' but wouldn't go back there.  Expected so much more from the Embassy Suites since we have stayed there several times before.

reviews.name: Mary F.
reviews.review: My friends and I went last night before going out for girls night. Apparently it use to be a Steakhouse but you couldn't tell from the Chic decor. The bar had quite a few people sitting at it while the tables near by we're not so full. There was a large party in the back consuming the whole dinning room so we enjoyed a comfy booth. Our server Jeremy was pleasant and informative although his bow tie he was wearing was the talk of our table.. Too funny.. Anyways, we shared the fried green tomato salad to start. The salad part of it was delicious with the pimento cheese and peppers. I love the little board it comes on. Tomatoes were also good and crispy.entrees- interesting enough I had the cap'n crunch chicken. Yes I said captain crunch chicken. It came is the cool cast iron bowl with this spicy heavenly jam in the middle of a sweet gravy sauce...  Uuummm delicious!Drinks- The beer selection is amazing I'm not sure how many but it seemed endless and a lot of variety. Craft craft and more craft. Cocktails- I had the good life martini this menu was designed with intention to please. Ingredients seemed fresh and my drink was easy drinking. Prices are a little pricey but we'll worth it..  Had to be a server issue with the other reviews because we had a great time and great service. We will be back its a great starting point before hitting midtown bars. Not crowed. It's our hidden gem for now lol.    Need better signs out side it was hard to find....  Also wish there was a restroom inside as you have to walk across the hotel to go to the bathroom. At least parking is free valet which you know how hard parking in midtown can be ..

reviews.name: Kendall B.
reviews.review: We went on Valentine's Day at a 5:00 reservation after being told they couldn't fit our party of 4 any other time.  We left at 6:15 and only 1/3 of the restaurant was occupied. Our first hint that this might not be a great place was that during most of our meal, the entire restaurant was empty.Also, they were cranking the air conditioner despite it being an unseasonable 40 degrees outside. We asked for them to turn the heat up, but there was no change in temperature.The music was awful. Early 90s love ballads on satellite radio. If they were trying to increase their romantic atmosphere for the Valentine holiday, they failed.The food was only ok. I got beer cheese soup and the fork and knife Cesar salad. My two friends got steak, and my fourth friend got the Captain Crunch Chicken. Our food was fine, not excellent. Nothing worth talking about.The service was slow and terrible, especially for this place being nearly empty during our entire stay.  Our waiter was boring and lacked knowledge of the food.Bottom line, go somewhere else. This place was not worth it.

reviews.name: Matt G.
reviews.review: Brandon P. got it exactly right.  Food was mediocre at best although it looks much better on the menu.  Just no flavor.  Some folks liked theirs but most of us were not impressed.  The service was unbelievably slow.  Drinks took forever.  Food took forever.  The waitress was always gone.  She was even a bit ride to some folks at our table.  On top of it, they automatically added 20% to our bill for gratuity.  Now, I'm not a cheapskate but to me, 20% is for excellent service.  This, most assuredly, was NOT excellent service.  I feel like I got stolen from.The only real plus was a nice looking beer menu.  They did have some good brews but, again, it took 15 minutes every time you ordered one and that was after your last one had been empty for 20 minutes already.Anyways, with all the decent choices coming out here in Nashville lately, I would most assuredly NOT go back to this one.  Keep moving on down the street.  Frankly, you could get faster service and probably like your food just as much at any of the little dives in the midtown area.

reviews.name: Mya W.
reviews.review: The food was mediocre and not awe inspiring for it to be in the hotel.  I didn't like the service and the food was bland.  I could've gone to McDonald's and enjoy their burger instead of spending $40 for a meal.

reviews.name: Glen B.
reviews.review: I was a little apprehensive about going to this restaurant based on the previous reviewers. I have family in town and they are staying at the Embassy Suites (where Five Odd Fellows is located), and after peaking inside and looking at the menus we decided to give them a chance. I'm glad we did.This isn't what a person would think of when it comes to a hotel restaurant. They have obvously cultivated an image and personality with the logo and the look of the space itself. We were seated rather promptly in a cushy booth. My only complaint about the space was the fact that the seats in some of the high tops in the middle of the restaurant were at very different heights, so some of my group seemed like they were in high chairs, and others seemed like they should have been.Service was friendly, the beer list was apt and had a large selection of locals, and the women in the group enjoyed their cocktails. I found them a little sweet, but they seem more geared to the ladies.The food menu was very different from what you see on a lot of other menus in Midtown. It is a welcome change from all the pubs. Duckfat popcorn, duck burger, captain crunch cereal used as breading on chicken, coconut milk in their whipped cream - little things that made their food out of the ordinary in fun ways. Everything was fresh and well prepared, and we left very full (thanks to pie we didn't need, but got anyway - we had to try that whipped cream, and we were glad we did).I often disregard restaurants that are in hotels because, let's face it, they aren't usually the greatest. This place was a pleasant surprise, and I'm sure I'll be back. They just need to find a way to get an entrance on to the street. Walking through the lobby is a weird thing for people who aren't staying at the hotel.

reviews.name: Josh R.
reviews.review: Great food but hard to find.  Since its in a hotel it may fool you into thinking its hotel food!  It's not at all.  The food is local craft with some really good specialties (hot chicken and greens).   The local beers are well represented.  Staff was very friendly, engaging, and helpful.

reviews.name: Brandon P.
reviews.review: Wow. This place was so bad it forced my lazy butt to join yelp to warn others.  We were a table of 12 and were the only people there except for a couple of people at the bar. Which should have been a warning sign since it was 7:30 on a Saturday night.   The waitress was nice but nonexistent.   You would think that the wait staff would have been hovering around us since we were their only customers, instead we constantly sat around with empty glasses.  When my gumbo arrived it was lukewarm at best.  The waitress brought us our checks without asking if we were ready for them or if we wanted anything else (dessert, drinks).   We weren't a loud or rude group,  so that wouldn't explain the nonexistent service.  I don't think this place will be in business much longer if this is the norm.

reviews.name: Jenny H.
reviews.review: Oddfellows opened on August 27, 2014 at The Embassy Suites hotel in downtown Nashville.  I often stay at this particular location on business and was excited to see that a new restaurant was replacing the tired Omaha Steaks steak house.  Oddfellows did not disappoint.  Service was fantastic, and the food was very good.  I ordered the Double Buttered Biscuits and Beer Cheese Soup.  Both were well prepared and very tasty.  The real winners here is the beer menu.  Oddfellows specializes in locally brewed beers and the Brother Maynard Belgium is a real standout.  Perfection!  I will definitely seek out Oddfellows again, when visiting Nashville.

reviews.name: Stephen L.
reviews.review: Been frequenting (any location they open of) this place since I was a kid.  This location is every bit as good as it was 20 years ago.  Excellent catfish and chicken, with gator tail as my personal favorite treat!  You can't get better hushpuppies than this anywhere in the world.  If you want some good southern cooking, this is the place.  Everything is friend and greasy like I want it.Servers are extremely attentive and keep the drinks and fixins coming.  Never had anything less than a superb visit.It's seriously one of my top 5 restaurants in Nashville!  If you are from out of town, be SURE to check it out!

reviews.name: Bob B.
reviews.review: Been wanting to try this pkace for a year now, but every time I went the wait was too long for me. Not today. It was pretty darn good. Very nice service staff and very welcoming. Got seated immediately and then greeted by Keith who is the manager  (did not know that when filled out survey, sorry Keith) he was super nice and funny. They bring out 3 huge hush puppies with white beans which were the BEST BEANS I'VE HAD IN MY LIFE. pickle spear and slaw. I ordered the catfish, chicken combo  it was real good , but think the chicken could use a little more seasoning. Just my opinion.  I would definitely encourage you to go give it a try. Uncle's is super busy at dinner time, so plan to wait 20-30 mins. If you go early you'll get right in.  That is alls i's got for you.  Now carry on with your day. Lol

reviews.name: Karen C.
reviews.review: Here visiting from Indiana.  This place is bright, with excellent service and food.  If you get the opportunity to eat here you shouldn't pass it up.

reviews.name: Robert P.
reviews.review: Have to say I'd given up on Uncle Buds because every time I would go it would never live up to the way I remembered from years ago.  When I heard a radio ad recently stating "Under Old Management" I thought it give them another try. I'll have to say that the service was great along with all the "fixins" and have tried the fish, fried chicken and chicken livers and enjoyed them all! Glad to see they appear to be back to their old selves again. Keep it up!

reviews.name: Demetrice R.
reviews.review: Experience was great. Great food and wonderful service, will definitely be there again.

reviews.name: Tammie E.
reviews.review: Great food! Great service! You are greeted at your table with white beans, cole slaw and the most delicious hush puppies! We had the catfish & country fried steak... Both were great! Drinks are served in quart jars, saves time waiting on refills. They give you a survey immediately to rate their food & service. A manager greets your table. So affordable too! A definite must visit! Minutes away from the Opryland area.

reviews.name: Roger M.
reviews.review: This is how food should be.  Large portions, friendly service, casual atmosphere, reasonably priced.  What more could you ask for?

reviews.name: Paul R.
reviews.review: Back under old management & it is great again. We only had the chicken. The catfish looked good too!  Everyone did a great job taking care of us. If you haven't been there for a while, you should give them a try.

reviews.name: Leah V.
reviews.review: When you've listened to some Lynard Skynard and placed your trucker hat on your head, mosey over to Uncle Bud's Catfish shack. Served Family style, the  fried chicken and catfish is crispy and delicious. I was disappointed in the family style sides however. I was anticipating mash potatoes, mac and cheese, you know, hearty southern scrumptiousness. But our sides where thinner for lack of better words. Cole slaw, baked beans, fries, etc. Tasty yes but come on, I feel like they slacked on the sides to save cost honestly. To further that honesty, lets be truthful with our selves... when you go to lets say KFC and they ask you what two sides, what are you most inclined to? Yes my southern friends, mac and cheese, mash potatoes and gravy or buttery corn, not cole slaw and fries. Sweet tea was lip smacking good served in their iconic mason jar however.  The hubs and I will be back but i'm hopeful for side item changes.

reviews.name: Richard H.
reviews.review: Great place good food try to eat there often The waitresses were very friendly and service was prompt

reviews.name: Khaun M.
reviews.review: Waiting staff aims to please and they do with greetings, smiles and response time. Bring you out white beans, slaw and hush puppies to snack on. Had the All-Can Eat catfish and total of ?? pieces eaten not one muddy, cold or over cooked piece in the lot. Not much on slaw but did have more than one helping.

reviews.name: Jessie C.
reviews.review: I love eating here!!! The food is fabulous and the service is great! You get all you can eat fixins with your meal that includes slaw, white beans, hush puppies, pickles, and onions. And its yummy!!! I also recommend the chicken tenders.  Its a mom and pop place I always love that check it out and enjoy a good dinner!!!

reviews.name: David C.
reviews.review: New York native here. Moved to Nashville in 2012. I LOVE this place. Great food. staff is charming and friendly and really make you feel special. I have nothing negative to say. I waited tables for 5 years and I wish I worked in a place like this.  Great job guys! See you soon!

reviews.name: Erik M.
reviews.review: I went here with my grandma to take her out to something different. We wanted to try something new for a change, and thought... "why not?".We chose to go here due to it being close to her house. Needless to say we wont be going back - ever.This is your typical "hole-in-the-wall" restaurant... high prices and mediocre food you can get from the grocery store.I ordered the basic... simple... chicken tenders. Yes, "only childs get chicken tenders" but their menu made it sound really good. When the food came out, the chicken was barely warm and the fries were soggy and old.The food came with a biscuit and the biscuit looked like plastic because it wasn't fresh at all.My grandmother's potato looked like they took it from the bag and put a knife cut through it. That's it. Nothing special.Wont be going back at all, I wouldn't care if they went out of business either.

reviews.name: Mel M.
reviews.review: If you are ever in the area it is a great stop for good food. The helpings are generous, hot, and very filling. I echo the positive postings that have been made. With your entree you get all the white beans, coleslaw, and hushpuppies you can eat! Everything is seasoned well. The service was also great. On my visit we had a large family and the waitress was very accommodating. Great place for a southern meal!!

reviews.name: Scott L.
reviews.review: Well, what can I say. Why is it so hard to get a good meal in Donelson.  We were disappointed in this place after taking a truck load of younger people to lights at the campground.  Some of the college kids couldn't eat their chicken.  The star of the restaurant,  catfish was soggy. Too bad.

reviews.name: Jamie D.
reviews.review: Not gonna lie, didn't really want to go to a place called "Uncle Bud's Catfish"... But my wife loves catfish and after looking at their online menu, I gave it a shot. We walked in to a clean restaurant with massive picture windows bringing in tons of natural light. I like it already :) then, super nice server points us in the right direction for our lunch fare, gives us a metal number for our table, and tells us we can sit wherever we'd like. Our food was cooked to order and tasted fantastic. I ordered the calabash shrimp which is lightly breaded, not overdone, and then fried. My wife got the catfish and both of us got a side of incredible white beans, full of flavor. The hush puppies were nothing to write home about but the rest of the meal was awesome. We got a 50% off coupon from Scoutmob so our entire meal with tip was only $12. Can't beat that!!

reviews.name: Misty M.
reviews.review: Just say no.Probably the worst catfish and fries I've ever had. My husband's Louisiana shrimp was so bad he couldn't eat it and it was cold. When I tried his, I spit it out. He ended up eating half of my catfish plate.Nothing we ate was decent. What's interesting to note is that the manager was walking around greeting all the tables but never came to ours and she did make multiple eye contact with me. I've never felt so uncomfortable. As someone said in a previous review, the fish was super fishy tasting and super bland. The hush puppies tasted like pure salt nothing else. Just stay away!

reviews.name: Sal P.
reviews.review: This place is a must visit for local flavor. The catfish is fried perfectly and the oysters were awesome. The service was great.

reviews.name: Eddy W.
reviews.review: We just happen to stop by here to eat since the hot chicken place we wanted to go to was closed??? We have eaten here before and it was good. Large servings, chicken fried just right but not this time. Either they over cooked the chicken or the grease was way to hot. After you got past the batter that looked like it had been in a tanning booth way to long the meat was moist and tasty. The sides were good. Next time I will get the catfish since that is what their name is

reviews.name: David C.
reviews.review: We started going to Uncle Bud's in their original house location back in the 80's(?) but had dropped off over the past 10 years due to a drop in perceived quality however my in-laws convinced us to try it again a couple of months ago.  As that experience was good  I settled on this location for a group of 20 people who were staying near the airport, kicking off a 2 day conference and about to go to the Grand Ole Opry for the first time in their lives.  Most folks had never been to Nashville...thus the option to embrace our southern culture head-on and treat them to some good food.The staff did a fabulous job.  We walked in at 5pm and had all eaten and even sat around talking (as this was a first meeting for many) by 6pm when we exited for the Opry.  Had baskets of hush puppies and gator bites on the table to share while we waited for the dinner orders to come out...they went over very well.  Nobody ventured to the chicken livers but I believe most everything else was ordered with a heavy emphasis on catfish.  Not one order messed up and rave reviews from everyone.I give 5 stars because the experience was perfect for the type of restaurant...could not have had a better dinner for what we wanted that night.

reviews.name: Yotie E.
reviews.review: RUN!!!! I thought my fish was bad until my pal said mine was better than his.. THIS PLACE RANKED IN MY TOP FIVE WORST PLACES EVER.. UH, SECOND PLACE EVEN. I should have known when my shoes stuck to the floor.. again, I thought maybe it was just me until i saw some woman walk across the room and almost lose a sandal.  The 400 pound woman making grizzly bear noises in the bathroom stall should have also been a clue. This place is great if you want an overpriced plate of swamp fish, greasy salt fries, sad hush puppy frauds,  cold beans and weirdly tangy coleslaw. The beer was good. Bud in a can.. classy. For a mere $30.00, you too can get two dinners and be a dumb ass for stepping foot in this place because you were officially warned.

reviews.name: Jason R.
reviews.review: I really miss the full service restaurant when it was over off Stewarts Ferry. Really went down hill with the counter ordering and the price did not go down with it. It's a shame because the other location was top of the line. Food is decent but the atmosphere really put the experience off.

reviews.name: Jennifer P.
reviews.review: Since I took my last vacation to Daytona Beach, my mouth has been dying to find a place here in Nashville that serves alligator. Now I know what you are thinking... weird, right? Hardly. Think shrimp meets chicken. It's delicious.I was ecstatic to learn that Uncle Bud's Catfish Shack had it on their menu. I loaded up my boy and my pooch on Monday and we set sail on our culinary adventure. When we arrived, the decor was exactly what I had imagined for a place with "Catfish Shack" in the title. Very country picnic meets Applebee's. Not that cute, but it makes sense I suppose. We decided to order the shrimp po' boy, hushpuppies and the alligator meal which totaled to be $32. WAYYYY more than I was expecting and way more than it needs to cost. Needless to say, strike one.We opened up our boxes to see generous portions of food and just as I'm getting over the initial shock of the meal cost, I bite into some fries only to discover all of mine are cold and SUPER soggy. Strike two.All in all, the food was good (minus the french fries) but it wasn't good enough for me to pay a sit down restaurant price again. I'd rather just do Captain D's.

reviews.name: Emilian G.
reviews.review: We don't eat red meat or pork, so when we travel in the South we often end up at fish & seafood types of places. Uncle Bud's catfish and shrimp were among the best we've ever had. The breading was just right on both of them and the sides -- especially the hushpuppies -- were excellent.They also sell $2 cans of beer (16 oz) which was a nice surprise.We liked everything so much that we plan to swing by on our return trip as well.

reviews.name: Jim C.
reviews.review: I have lived in the Hermitage area since 2008.  This is my first time eating at any Uncle Bud's location.I finally stopped in today to try this place out.  I had been wanting to for a while now but something else has always seemed to win out in the past.I ordered the 2 piece Dinner.  This comes with fries, or you can upgrade to a baked potatoe, coleslaw, white beans, and 2 hush puppies.  I was thinking, for $11 they better hook that catfish up big time! WRONG!The fish was 2 small pieces, and on top of that, was the thinnest piece of catfish I have ever seen.  Now the fish itself was pretty good, I liked the cornmeal "batter" on it.  But those 2 small pieces were a rip off for $11.The coleslaw looked homemade and was a basic slaw, decent but nothing amazing.  The white beans were good and I could taste a little ham in them.  The hush puppies were decent size and had a slight onion flavor to them, not bad.  The fries were ok, but seemed little past their freshness prime.Overall, way too much money for a catfish plate, even with the sides. I wont be going back here again.  SORRY.

reviews.name: Danny B.
reviews.review: There's nothing like eating a whole catfish plate with some good old southern folks, I love this place :-)

reviews.name: Ryan B.
reviews.review: If you are not put off by fried foods, you will be a fan.The fried chicken was worth mentioning in this review, and I just did.

reviews.name: Matt E.
reviews.review: If you're in the mood for some fried fish and other fried goodies and need it casual and quick, Uncle Bud's is the a good choice.  The catfish is good, not great, but good.  The shrimp I thought though was excellent and I would definitely go back for a shrimp dinner.  The meal plates come with a heap of food to include fries, cole slaw, hush puppies, and white beans.  The beans and fries are average but I felt the slaw and puppies were above average.The service is a bit different with upfront ordering then you find a seat and they bring the food to you fresh out of the frier.  The place is clean, quiet, and casual.

reviews.name: Erica C.
reviews.review: This is my go to neighborhood spot when it comes to fried fish dredged in cornmeal. No beer batter here! Their hush puppies are out of sight. I don't like anything else. Steer clear of their fries.

reviews.name: jerry a.
reviews.review: Excellent catfish, po boys and chicken.  You can choose a basket or a plate and don't forget they have shrimp also.  The white beans are homestyle with bacon and other spices and I could literally eat only the hush puppies.  Don't forget to top it off with a glass of sweet tea!  i just recently ordered  out and the food was ready in 10  mins and outstanding.  We got the "gone fishin" platter and got 16 filet's, 16 hush puppies, white beans, coal slaw and pickles and onions.  I'll be honest, there could be a few more onions for me but to each his own.  The fish was expertly cooked, hot and fresh.  everything else was hot and delicious.   I will go back here again and again!

reviews.name: Frank K.
reviews.review: Terrible strong fishy taste and so overcooked was hard to cut thru. Fact that they don't give you a knife to cut the fish doesn't help. Also very displeased by fact that food was served on paper plates and styrofoam bowls.

reviews.name: Lee G.
reviews.review: This was my first visit to Uncle Bud's. McNamarra's was my original destination but being St. Patrick's Day and pack like sardines and a $10 cover I went in search of new tastes. Uncle Bud's was just up the street so I gave it a try.While the ordering process was a bit odd, sort of fast food ordering at a counter then they bring the food to your table, it was relatively painless and the staff was extremely friendly.I had not been seated long before my catfish filets arrived piping hot along with beans, slaw, fries and hushpuppies. The catfish was some of the best I have found in Nashville, the beans could use a bit more seasoning but were good, the slaw was ok but the hushpuppies were fantastic. The portions were more than I needed but I ate it all anyway. 4 filets, beans, slaw, hushpuppies and most of the fries.I will be back to try other offerings on the menu but I have to save up my Cholesterol credits first.

reviews.name: Jessica G.
reviews.review: First time visiting Nashville and my honey and I decided to have dinner here Saturday night and oh boy it was absolutely delicious. The portions were huge and the staff was so friendly. Price was reasonable. Omg I wish I could go back!

name: So Gong Dong Tofu House Restaurant

reviews.name: Lihua S.
reviews.review: 4 stars just because I'm so happy that they exist in Nashville. This is where you go when you're looking for the classics with no frills. (Medium spice is actually mild.)

reviews.name: Will C.
reviews.review: If you are looking for a "hole in the wall" gem, here it is. This place has great everything. Great portions, flavors, service, atmosphere. Nothing extravagant but everything you want. I've had the dumplings which were not the normal frozen in a bag from krogers. They were crispy and delicious. I've had the spicy beef bulgogi which was pretty good. The presentation of it was lacking a bit but tasted extremely good. I've also had the spicy tofu kim chi soup which was one of the best soups I've had in a while. Excellent flavor and textures. They give you a raw egg to boil in the soup right there. Very tastey. Don't think about it, just try it!

reviews.name: Queen B.
reviews.review: I'm in the "this place is the best" group.Whether it's the good service, the fresh food, the good sized portions, or the convenience of being right off Harding Place..  this place is top notch.  *And they serve sake - both hot and cold.   Win. Win.Party of seven adults.  We ordered the seafood pancake for all of us. They cut it pizza style so everyone can have a piece.One order of ribs, 3 orders of kimchi soup or seafood soup, 2 orders of spicy beef bulgogi.  No one replenished our little side bowls, I suppose we could have asked.We did have to ask for our water glasses to be filled, repeatedly.  They don't refill unless asked.You have to ask for more napkins or utensils. Food: freshly prepared, per order.  portions are large such that each dish could really be shared.  Seafood Pancake can feed 3 easily..The place is clean, the bathrooms are clean, waitstaff is attentive, flavors are good, authenticity is prominent.  I looked around at the other diners and noticed most everyone was having a soup. They must be very popular for their soups.I would highly recommend this place to anyone jonesing for Korean.

reviews.name: Shushu C.
reviews.review: This place rivals some of the Korean places in NYC ktown. I am serious when I say that their food is consistently very very good. I can't find any other Korean place in Nashville that serves anything remotely delicious. Definitely order the combos or actually anything else on the menu. Soon doo boo +ribs is my fav. They also have squid and other options as well. This place doesn't disappoint.The only thing is the location is pretty inconvenient for a lot of people but when in Nashville, you have to make do.

reviews.name: gloria c.
reviews.review: we went here only b/c my favorite korean restaurant (hai woon dai) is closed on mondays. the food at so gong dong was actually ok, but the service was horrible! they sat us at a dirty table, and no one even came over to clear it for at least 20 min. no one brought us menus. eventually, i went over to the desk to grab some myself. and then it took another 20min for someone to come take our order. we were there around 8pm on a week day, so it's not like it was even peak dining out hours. next time i'm craving korean food on a monday, i'll just hold out until tuesday and go to hai woon dai.

reviews.name: Kenneth D.
reviews.review: Tofu soups are their specialties.  First time trying kimchee soup and it was surprisingly flavorful.  Especially enjoyed the one with the oysters.  Seafood pancakes were full of chunky seafood!  Spicy chicken and pork were overly sweet.  Bulgogi and galbi were delicious but didn't get the lettuce to wrap them in.  Service was extremely slow.  Late comers to our party were not asked for drinks until we called for them.  No refills on our water.  Asked to refill our hot teas and they only refilled half of the table.  Again had to waved them over.  We did not get the banchas until our food arrived and they were never refilled.  When the waitress left the other table in front of us, she puts her head down and rushes off.  I guess poor service is typical of family owned Asian restaurants.

reviews.name: Lynn C.
reviews.review: We ordered the tofu soup and bulgogi combo as well as seafood pancake. Will be back again.

reviews.name: Steve S.
reviews.review: I am always looking for good, authentic places in Nashville. A lot of trendy places downtown but what about those "mom and pops" places? I grew up eating Kimchi and it's hard to find the real deal until I looked on Yelp and found one near my neighborhood. The area, I wouldn't have noticed it driving around. You'd have to look for the signs. It's hidden from its shades due to the sun beating down on it during the day but its very clean inside even though from the outside you can't tell.When you first look at the menu all of it looks good. Don't let the prices scare you. You get a lot of food for what you order. I ordered combo plate Shrimp, scallops with Kimchi soup with rice. It came along with complimentary side dishes like kimchi, sprouts, tofu, cucumber, etc. (don't know the rest of the names) but you get six side items along with the main meal. (also free refills of the sides if you like more)I was very pleased and all the food was fresh. With the soup you drop a raw egg in the soup. Soup is so hot it cooks the egg. So remember to drop it in and dunk the egg so it cooks. Use the rice bowl to dish out the soup so you can eat it without burning your mouth.For the entire meal with 2 cokes plus tip I paid $30. Def. a meal you can split with someone! Otherwise a growing boy like me, I ate it all! And felt good cause it was healthy and not greasy!

reviews.name: Mary V.
reviews.review: Authentic Korean, not-so-good service.We came here for dinner on a Sunday night and it was pretty busy.  There is no hostess when you walk in, and no sign telling you to either sit down or wait.  The two servers were running around to attend to their tables, even looked at us, but still we waited for at least a couple of minutes to even be seated.  Unacceptable.  I finally made eye contact with one of them and gestured my hand as if to say "What the hell?" and we were seated.We again waited at an empty table - no place settings, no menu, no nothin.  I understand busy - I've waited tables too - but at least give me a menu to look at.  Took a while but we finally ordered.First you get the small plates, or banchan, which included traditional Korean sides.  Unless you are extra sensitive to spicy, don't let the redness fool you - it's not that bad.  Our entrees arrived shortly after.  I ordered the Seafood Tofu Soup and added mushrooms which cost an extra dollar.  He ordered the full entree of Spicy Short Ribs, or Galbi.  Both were served with a small bowl of white jasmine rice.  The food was good although my soup was a bit bland and barely had any seafood.  I think I ate one oyster and one prawn.  Good thing I added the mushrooms.  Crack the egg they give you into your boiling soup - makes such a difference.  Galbi was good and savory.Don't expect 5-star service here.  They're all business.  Rarely checked on tables.  The older lady serving seemed to be the nicer of the two.  The younger one did not look like she enjoyed life.  Overall the food was pretty good but there are other Korean places we can try with I'm sure better service.Location: Fair.Parking: Good.Service: poor/Fair.Food: Good.Pricing: Fair.

reviews.name: Vy N.
reviews.review: The tofu soup here is excellent! I like that it is boiling hot when it comes out and that you can crack an egg (that's supplied) in it if you want to. You can also choose your level of spiciness for the broth. My husband and I really enjoyed it along with their delicious side dishes. We also had the seafood pancake there which I liked. I can see and taste the different kind of seafood in it. I gave them 4 stars instead of 5 because their bulgogi is not wow to us. We have had better. The service at first was rushed and not friendly but later on our waitress did check on us and bring us extra rice and side dishes.

reviews.name: Taylor H.
reviews.review: If you're from an area where you are familiar with sunduboo. Don't come here, super basic the food is nothing special and they put their location right by a laundromat? Which in my opinion is a bad idea.

reviews.name: Jerry Y.
reviews.review: This tofu house is pretty good. I have had better in Atlanta at almost 30% less the price. For it to be the only tofu house in Nashville, I can't complain too much. As in any family-owned Asian restaurant, the service will be inconsistent.

reviews.name: Tammy T.
reviews.review: The search for a legit korean restaurant is finally over! After moving from the Bay Area, i've been craving some good soondobu and I have finally found it!!! HALLELUJAH! Its different from other korean restaurants around Nashville, in that they give you a large portion of food and everything is really fresh and delicious! You can also have the option of getting both soondobu and kalbi for $25, which isn't bad at all. The kalbi is really tender and flavorful. The best part about tofu house is the constant refill of side dishes!

reviews.name: Joori P.
reviews.review: Not the best Korean restaurant out there. I had to succumb and went to this place because the one that I go to down the road is closed on Mondays. The soup tasted like the base and seasoning was used from the ramyun noodle packets. I had the fish cakes as a banchan and the flavor to that was so indescribable that I had to spit it out. The menu was limited and over-priced. I had the cold version of the octopus bibimbap. My sister wanted her bibimbap in a dolsot pot, but we both don't eat beef. She had asked if she can get chicken instead and the older lady told us, "No chicken only beef!" We were prepared to pay extra for chicken but didn't want to make a scene so she went with the beef. I had gotten my bibimbap and what do I see mixed in with my octopus? Beef! My sister doesn't eat seafood and since they had told us that it was "beef" bibimbap. She had octopus mixed in with hers! My guess is that since they were making 2 versions of the bibimbap they thought it would be OK to add one to the other. The bibimbap wasn't good for both of us. We ended up just sipping on tofu jjigae. My sister had ordered a large version of her tofu jjigae to-go, but instead it was served at the table when we confirmed to the waitress 4 times it was to-go! We didn't eat it, but ended up packing it up.I've lived in Korea and this food is not authentic as Hai Woon Dai's food. This is a more lazy way form of cooking. This isn't what Korean food is all about!

reviews.name: Leigh M.
reviews.review: SGD is consistently decent. While it deserves 5 stars in comparison to other Korean places in Nashville, I'd give it 3 in comparison to other Korean places elsewhere in the country. So it seems fair to split the difference and give it 4.Like I said, it's very consistent. I eat here about once every week since it's just down the road from my office. The service is always good and the lunch specials are reasonably priced. The banchan are tasty and quite useful for pulling people a bit out of their comfort zone if they've never tried such things. It's actually a pretty good place to bring people who have never tried much in the way of Korean food, as nothing there is overly intimidating.Where this place really seems to shine is with its soups. They have soft tofu soups of every description, served to you fresh and boiling hot. The bibimbap is also quite good, and much like the soup, is served searing hot in a bowl designed to keep it that way for a while. If you aren't the sort of person who loves their food at a high temperature (or aren't familiar with how these sorts of foods are commonly served), this might not be the best place for a quick meal as you'll have to wait quite a while for it to cool off. While this isn't the greatest I've ever had, it's still pretty darn tasty, it's the best I've had in this area, and is a cuisine that is sadly underrepresented in Nashville. That's why I keep coming here to get my fix.

reviews.name: april w.
reviews.review: This place is really authentic and delicious! Awesome Korean food! And their tofu soups are amazing!! They have spicy and non-spicy options, which is nice. Pan Chans are really yummy as well! They also give u a raw egg. I thought it was boiled, but it wasn't haha. Guess ure supposed to put it in ur soup when it first comes out and is super hot so it would cook it. The kalbi I got was really good too!! And it's not too far from the airport. Would def visit here again if I'm ever in Nashville.

reviews.name: Dylan M.
reviews.review: God I love this place.  Dolsot bibimbap is the bomb!  Health score is like 81 but idgaf

reviews.name: Ong L.
reviews.review: I was craving for bimbimbap.  I decided to check it out here.  Ordered the dolsot bimbimbap, which came with six sides of banchan and a small bowl of tofu kimchee soup.  The banchan included:- boiled potato cuts in a savory sauce (my favorite)- some kind of sliced bean in rice vinegar (plain)- raw broccoli dressed in spicy sauce (spicy)- bean sprouts in rice vinegar (plain)- cucumber slices dressed in spicy sauce (sour & spicy)- kimchee (spicy)I'm not a big fan of banchan.  Potatoes are probably the only thing I'll eat.  Other than that, everything tastes like it needs salt.  This is not exclusive to this location, but to every Korean restaurant I've been to.   The tofu kimchee soup was vegetarian and it was the best tasting thing I ate.  I hate tofu, but this tofu was not firm and dense like the ones I grew up avoiding.  It was silky and smooth in texture.  Very delicious and spicy.The dolsot bimbimbap didn't look like what I had hoped.  I expected julienned veggies all sectioned off, so I could do the mixing myself.  But nope.  The veggies were diced and mixed already with the red bean paste and put on top of the rice.  It didn't taste that good either.  The veggies tasted weird and the bowl was begging for some salt.  It was very one dimensional for me.  Other than that, it was piping hot and I probably waited a good 5-10 minutes for it to cool down.I also ordered Japanese green tea, only to find out it was from a can of "Japanese green tea" manufactured from Singapore and you're supposed to drink it cold or with ice.  I was expecting warm tea.  All in all, the amount came to about $17 (ordering bimbimbap + green tea from menu).  With tips, my meal was $20.

reviews.name: Linjuan S.
reviews.review: Nice environment, the sides are sooooo good!My best tofu soup, yummy! Everytime I went Nashiville for this， worth a one hour drive.

reviews.name: Micheal P.
reviews.review: We had some traditional dishes at So Gong Dong and I thought they lived up to others available in Nashville. Bibimbap was good, but then again, how can you screw up bibimbap? So Gong Dong specializes in soft tofu soups, so I ordered the Kimchi Sundubu. The broth had some pretty good depth - not the best I've had, but sufficiently good. To it's credit, So Gong Dong is the only Korean restaurant in Nashville that brings me a raw egg to crack into my stew. Of course, the yolk of the egg really enhanced the broth, so by the end of my bowl, I was pretty pleased. The Kimchi Jeon was perfectly cooked - fluffy with crispy outsides. We were extremely pleased.Banchan at So Gong Dong were acceptably good - all the standards - kimchi, spicy zucchini, bean sprouts, sweet soy potatoes, etc. Nothing blew my mind, but nothing was prepared poorly.I was surprised to see Makgeoli on the menu. I didn't order it because I'm pregnant, but if they do actually carry it, it's worth an entire star.In general, I suspect the high marks for this place come from people that don't eat korean food regularly at different locations. The food is certainly good, but it's not superior to what several other korean restaurants, like seoul garden, are serving. The main thing working against So Gong Dong is their far out location. They are, however, open on Mondays, and their kimchi jiggae is ten million times better than the mess you'll get at Korea House. So, if it's a monday, make the trek to antioch and eat at So Gong Dong. Order some makgeoli and let me know if they really have it.

reviews.name: Ryan R.
reviews.review: This restaurant is a place I visit as often as I'm in Antioch. The soups are fantastic, and I can't not order them.

reviews.name: Tran T.
reviews.review: Since this place is so close to my house, I always come here for dinner. My to-go choice is the combination of Galbi and Mushroom Tofu Soup. I suggest you order the food the combination list if you want to try their grilled meat (beef, chicken, pork, and fish) and tofu soup (kimchi, seafood, beef, mushroom). The banchan are also good. They are usually kimchi, pickled cucumber, sweet potato, pickled bean sprout, etc. These come with the meal and you can ask them for refill.Parking was never a problem for me. Service was good. They changed management the last time I was there so they do open on Sunday now.2013/#13

reviews.name: Chris P.
reviews.review: The food is ok but if you have never had Korean food and try this place you probably will never want or crave Korean food again, which is a huge problem because Korean food can be so good. The chicken bulgogi was a bit dry and my memory is a bit fuzzy because I haven't been back since the first time. This restaurant doesn't compare with the Hae Woon Dai Restaurant. See my review and pictures for that Korean place.

reviews.name: Andrew G.
reviews.review: My wife and I are very happy with our choice today. Food was excellent. The service was better this time. We will be back.

reviews.name: Carissa O.
reviews.review: Kimchi soup and bulgogi and you're welcome. Crack an egg into the boiling soup and it will be poached before the soup is cool enough to eat. The appetizers are one of my favorite parts of the meal. The potatoes especially. This place looks like a dive but it's great.

reviews.name: Sahak D.
reviews.review: This is the best Korean Tofu House near Nashville!  The service is super friendly, nothing but smiles :)  The things I've tried are:- Kimchi Pancake- ANY Tofu soup (Mushroom is my fav)- Spicy Beef AND Spicy Pork BulgogiEverything tastes amazing here!  A warm cozy hidden gem that I look forward to going to anytime I'm near Nashville!

reviews.name: Christine L.
reviews.review: Honestly, having lived in major cities for most of my adult life, I am incredibly spoiled by the authentic and cheap Korean food offered in NYC, Boston, and the Bay Area. HOWEVER, having also grown up in dinky town, Tennessee, I have also tried to seek out the most authentic oriental food as well, seeing as I am oriental.
