But it's kind of loud in the restaurant anyway, and it was OK. They had an AWESOME band that blended so well with one another and they all took turns singing. We were so impressed. One couple near us even got up to dance- so sweet.We had the fried pickles- the basket has 10 spears in it which was perfect for the four of us. They were delicious! This seems like a menu item we are starting to see in Illinois but these were much better than any I've had elsewhere. I ordered a steak. It came with a house salad and that was surprisingly good- probably because they sprinkled bacon on top- that gets me every time. :) The honey mustard dressing was spicier than honey mustard dressing usually is but it was very good. I didn't particularly care for my steak- it had a lot of fat. The coleslaw, however, was delicious! It is a generous portion and was so good. The baked potato was also very good. My husband had the catfish sandwich and thought it was great. We should have tried the fruit cobbler but were just too full. We had a fun time- awesome band and casual experience with good food!

reviews.name: Casey R.
reviews.review: Yep I agree with other reviewers.... Catfish was good. Old country tunes live. Same side sitters. Would go back.

reviews.name: Holly C.
reviews.review: Music was ok food was ok ... We wouldn't go out of our way to go back but it was a good time ... But I'm skeptical now bc of the review 2 down from me

reviews.name: Deanna P.
reviews.review: Food was great! The crowd is a little bit older but we still enjoyed the live music and food.

reviews.name: Jesse O.
reviews.review: Visiting Nashville for a couple of weeks and staying nearby. A local place across yhe street was packed, not 1 seat, so we decided to try this place.  Let me just say not 1 person sitting at the bar on a Friday night at 6 pm, should have known then.  Percooked frozen food.

reviews.name: Sarah R.
reviews.review: Went here on vacation it was near my hotel. Went here for some apps. I got the fried pickles yummm they were good and they give you a lot. My mom and dad got the twice baked potato they said it was alright that they had much better. My dad took a bite and then did not even eat the rest so thats a clue of the taste. They have bands that play old country music if you like that type of music or are more into the newer stuff. Tend to attract older people was not aware of this. Jim Ed Brown was there he sang some, saw him at the Grand Ole Opry earlier that day.

reviews.name: Chris H.
reviews.review: Behind the Radisson across the street from the Gaylord...this place is a dive. We went for two reasons 1) it was close 2) it wasn't in the Gaylord. Anything is better than the food served at the Gaylord. I saw a food menu but John A's doesn't feel like a restaurant. It's a bar that happens to serve more than a bag of chips. We had a large group for Super Bowl and we were all from out of town, it was close and they graciously accommodated our large group. There is plenty of space and TVs to watch a game. Our server (name escapes me) was on it all night. I doubt she would skip a beat serving a hundred by herself. We were all impressed. Great owner and staff, even better service.

reviews.name: Frank S.
reviews.review: Best fried catfish I've ever had.  Great live music nightly.

reviews.name: Lori J.
reviews.review: Music good but we've been here almost an hour and 45 minutes and still no food.  Waitress comment:  I told you it was going to take a long time.  Seriously??  She did give us some chips/salsa to tide us over until the food finally arrived.  Afraid it was mediocre at best.  Unless it was just an off night, I would not recommend this place.

reviews.name: AM S.
reviews.review: This was our first stop for food in Nashville. Our server was amazing, she was very interesting and was able to tell us all about the history of John As. The atmosphere was eclectic of pictures signed for John A. There was live music and it was a fun place to be. Food: We ordered fried pickles to start, they were average for fried pickles, granted I am not the biggest fan of them. For our meals I had the Ruben and my husband had the club. Both were very good and we practically devoured them. The club was very good they use hamburger instead of the usual turkey. I loved this place, its a MUST to eat at!!

reviews.name: Gary P.
reviews.review: Very very, nice and attentive wait staff. They made us feel like regulars right from the start. We went for beers in the afternoon and went back for dinner later on. The fried catfish nuggets were good but not the best I've had. Coleslaw was very good and the chicken and sausage gumbo was very tasty. The entertainment was live and very good.  Even some of walk-ons were impressive. We'll go back just because we felt welcomed.

reviews.name: Mike M.
reviews.review: Service great. Catfish sandwich was very good. Had a bite of club sandwich and was a different but good version which had prime rib in it. I'd come back here again. Bathrooms were clean but smelled like stronger than usual urine odor.

reviews.name: Dee M.
reviews.review: We had a blast here! Our hotel was across the street so we decided to walk on over and Glad we did! We enjoyed the Music and Locals were lots of fun.We also enjoyed sitting at the bar conversing with others that were just traveling thru like us! I'm a huge fan of country music and they did their best to play our All of our request! The funniest  thing is that when we walked in this place they started singing "All my Exes live in Texas" and I knew we were staying.. We just got married a week ago and moving from Texas to Va.. My Hubby and I Just laughed, and made our selves at home. PS the food was great too!

reviews.name: David G.
reviews.review: Went to John A's based off a recomendation front a front desk staff memeber from a hotel around the corner. Initially passed on the restuarant, however due to downtown holiday parade circled back and decided to give it a go. Not much of a wait for a Friday night, which was nice change of pace. However upon seating we were sat down with complete strangers as we were a party of two, and this continued with other couples throught the night. We ordered with them and everything, definetely different. So hopefully you get set with a good group. They push the catfish and Pabst Blue Ribbon is their main beer. Also, it seemed to draw a much older crowd, 60 and up. Live band, but again an older band. Food was ok, wouldnt go for the catfish even though it was pushed as their #1 dish.

reviews.name: Kristy K.
reviews.review: My family and I went here for my mother's birthday. We had heard great things about the restaurant and wanted to try it out!!! The band that was playing was great!! They played a lot of oldies,which was great!! Our service was probably about the worst. It took 10 min for the waiter to greet us, 15 min to take our order, and forever on our food. He never even came to check on us after we got our food. Also, my mom and I ordered a pitcher of margaritas to split, we got 3/4 of the way done and realized we were not feeling it at all. At the beginning we tried so hard to taste a hint of tequila. But there was nothing. We waved down the waiter and he said they put 6 shots in it, there's no way, my mom and I are light weights and definitely would have felt it. So we paid 22 dollars for a slushy with no alcohol and a ton of calories. The food was okay.

reviews.name: Katie W.
reviews.review: John-naaaays! This is what I feel like chirping when I think about good ol' John As, much like the "Timmay!" from South Park, ahh memories... My sister and I had just run from a sticky, awkward as ass situation - literally, we RAN. And we were 2 Girls on the tail end of a vacation of eating. It was effort, y'all. As we were running, we noticed the Cracker Barrel yellowed sign and took it as a symbol of salvation. Me thinking of apple crisp, Emily of fried chic chic chickeeen!! But, as we were running from our "situation" behind, I saw a sign for John's and we headed 'cross the street. As we panted up the ramp I noticed, hm. There are pictures of all Senor Citizens. Everywhere. Life-size. Outside. Why are there pictures? Outside? Why are they all - ALL Over 60's? Why are we walking up a RAMP?? We stepped in - perhaps out of the burst of unwelcome exercise and I wanted to burst back out. All the people in the pictures were, in fact, inside. And there were more. Did we walk into a Geriatric Trap of sorts? Were we unwelcome pre-menopausal Girls? Mere whippersnappers trying to hoard in on the fried goods? Unsure to the max, we were approached by a waitress who asked us "2?" and I said "uuuhhh. well...I...uh-uuuuuhh" and then stammered, "sure...could we see the menu?" Right away, I saw hush-puppies AND sweet potato fries, so since it seemed we were welcome, we walked through the early 70's decor to our platform seating area and awaited our fate. We ordered the puppies, as one simply must do when in Rome, battered prawns, sweet potato fries and of course the chicken salad, since we are ALL about the health... We received. We ate. We didn't stop. We ordered more. Our waitress divulged a dessert secret, they had an Elvis Special - to which I said; don't even tell me what it is, we'll take 2! Each served a little ramekin of pudding-like substance that was gooey, sticky, messy & sweet. A concoction of oreos, peanut butter and banana pudding, we were told - some of The King's favorite things. Julie Andrews, your raindrops on flippin' roses were just upstaged. Not only was the food real, authentic Southern style good - there was live music too, which they have every night. Our waitress kept asking us to stay so that we could hear her sing. We ordered more hush-puppies and sat in a fried corn stupor as she sang her country hits and then dedicated a song to "Her California Girls." The whole town's in on this place and we were happy to be included too. Southern Food, True Southern Hospitality.

reviews.name: Bret s.
reviews.review: Of the few days I stayed in Nashville I came to find that many of the places are very similar, John A's is no exception. The only thing that sets it apart is that it is not downtown with the rest of them like Robert's, Tootsie and a few others that all have the small place, live band, so so food, old posters and records on the wall from the Music city heyday. I do however like that atmosphere so I would recommend it.  They do have a pretty good reuben and catfish sandwich that are worth a try. I am only giving three stars though because it just did not have anything that stood out among the others.

reviews.name: Kenny H.
reviews.review: If there was such a thing as guilty pleasure restaurants, much like guilty pleasure TV, movies or music, John A's would fit into that category. The food is not great, it's mostly good, but the overall kitchyness (is that a word?) of the place puts a smile on my face. The reason is because it is unashamedly tacky. It knows what it is, and it is fine with it. It is also kind of stuck in 1970s, early 1980s country music scene. I have been in there a few times, and they are playing the same tape of a bunch of country music stars sitting around singing songs and talking. It's even got a skinny Vince Gill in it. It just kind of reminds me of an era of Nashville that doesn't really exist much anymore, for better or worse. And part of the reason is it doesn't try to hard to capture that. It just is. Since it is a throwback to an older era of country music, it is frequented by older folks. Even the live bands that play there generally older people. But if you don't mind all that, head down there.

reviews.name: Ann D.
reviews.review: John A's Little Palace does an okay job, but it wasn't spectacular.  My family met me in Nashville for a long weekend, and we ate dinner the first night at John A's.  I'd never been there before, so we didn't know what to expect.  We went around 5pm on a Thursday evening for dinner, and there was no crowd at all.  Since we were literally four out of 10 customers, I couldn't understand why once we ordered our food it took almost 30 minutes to get it.  Then when we got it, my hamburger steak was overcooked, the tomato casserole was cold, and the parsley potatoes were lukewarm.  Although overdone, the hamburger steak did have a good flavor.  I will say, the blue cheese dressing I got with my salad was the highlight of my meal.  There were large, tasty chunks of blue cheese in the dressing which is always a plus in my book.My Uncle must have been living right though... he had the beef and potato soup to start, it smelled fabulous and tasted great.  He also ordered the 12 ounce prime rib cooked medium and it arrived perfectly cooked and was so tender it could be cut with a butter knife.  My aunt ordered a cheeseburger and fries and said her meal was good.  My mom ordered the same thing as me, and she liked it well enough, but then she likes her meat cooked well done and charred on the outside.Ladies, if you use the restroom, beware the beefcake poster offered as temptation on the wall above the paper towel dispenser.  You're in for public embarrassment if you give in to temptation.  That's all I'll say about that.I doubt I'll go back to John A's the next time I'm in town.  There are too many good places to eat in Nashville to use one of my meals here.

reviews.name: Tom K.
reviews.review: This was right across my hotel so I went there with a group for dinner on a Saturday night after the Opry show. There was music playing as soon as we walked in and didn't stop when we left. There was a woman singing and she was pretty good; she did lots of cover songs and was very entertaining. I had the fettuccine alfredo which was nice and firm.

reviews.name: diane m.
reviews.review: I loved John A's, not just for the fantastic music, but the Fried Pickles were out of this world! Amazing how something so unusual could be so fantastic but they were so perfectly done we ordered some fried catfish too that was excellent.  The banana pudding was as good as any my grandmother used to make.  It had been a loooong time since I had that and will definitely order it again.  The service was fast, friendly and the prices reasonable.  Absolutely a great place to go with friends or a casual date, even the family.

reviews.name: Randi T.
reviews.review: best word to describe everything we ate: richstarted with the Poutine.  it was amazing.  the cheese curds were a bit salty, but still we finished every bite.  I had the butchers cut and my husband had the chorizo.  both were amazing, strong flavors.  ordered some sweet potato tots with the marshmallow and yes, very sweet but very good!the nutella shake was a chocolate lovers dream.  the only thing NOT rich was the summer salad (watermelon and tomatoes), it was a perfect balance to everything else.we definitely would go back, I deducted one star just bc it was so rich and they were the very best burgers we ever had, but still good enough to return.

reviews.name: Christine V.
reviews.review: We were in Nashville for 4 days and Flip was the only blight on our food journey. I read the reviews and the overall star rating was questionable, but I went ahead, hoping they had improved as some reviews mentioned they had only been open a few months. I wanted to love this place, but instead I was happy to leave and never return.You walk into the restaurant and there is desk where presumably a hostess might be, but isn't. We stood there for about 7 minutes with another group ahead of us. Finally a waitress came by to seat us. Ok, not a great first impression. I don't know why they don't have a dedicated hostess during lunch rush, but alright I could get over that. We ordered the poutine with the gravy on the side because we know chorizo in Arizona, but don't how they prepare it in Nashville, in gravy. It took quite awhile for it to come out, but I get it, they were busy. The gravy was surprisingly good. Sadly, that is where the journey of delight ended. The fries were SOOO salty. I love salt. I have several types and generally over-salt my food. So when I say they were too salty, they were way too salty. We had very little breakfast and were hungry so we kept trying to eat them. The egg was beyond poorly prepared...the whites weren't cooked but the underside of the egg was nearly burnt, with those unappetizing plastic curled edges. The cheese curds never got to the melted gooey stage because the fries were not hot and we had the gravy on the side. Poor execution is an understatement. Another reviewer had mentioned that the fries were overly salted and I am ashamed to say, I assumed they had corrected the dish. Save your money, time and tastebuds and don't order their fries.The sweet potato tots and marshmallow cream were tasty. Easily the best thing we ate. The tots had those almost over-done edges that offset the sweet and provided a great bite with the marshmallow cream. As other reviewers mention, this side is more sweet than savory.So, this is a burger place. Specifically a burger "boutique". Hubby and I decided to split a burger so we could have room to try the appetizer and a couple sides. We ordered a classic bacon cheeseburger. To say it was disappointing would be mild. Who looks at this stuff before it comes out? Two strips of bacon sat limply across the burger...I'm talking almost opaque fat here. This was no strip of bacon, this was a bacon noodle that couldn't stick to a wall if it tried. Booooo. If I want to eat congealed fat on my burger, I will order it. I want crispy fat! I asked if I could get bacon that was cooked, the waitress apologized and got it replaced. The new strips were much better, but in the range of applewood smoked bacon it's still mediocre bacon. There wasn't the deep luscious smoked bacon flavor you get from quality bacon purveyors. Onto the burger: It's virtually flavorless. No delicious juices pouring out of this burger as you bit into it. No fantastic grilled beef flavor dancing on your taste buds. The burger itself is super mediocre. We didn't get a shake. It was our original plan, hence the split burger, but we just didn't want to pay for anymore disappointment. We had such a great experience with Jeni's ice cream we decided to revisit them later instead.There are other burger places on yelp with much better reviews. I would pass on this place. If you've never had a delicious burger, you won't notice if, if you have, save yourself the heartache and skip Flip.

reviews.name: Alex F.
reviews.review: In short, the food here was really, really good. Docked one star for service. Showed up on a slow night, and ended up waiting quite a while to be greeted. The fries were awesome, but wasn't a huge fan of the sweet potato tots. They seemed a little too sweet to me, and are served with a marshmallow dipping sauce. I'd imagine someone with more of a sweet tooth would really dig it. Just not for me.

reviews.name: Salman S.
reviews.review: The restaurant is quite nicely made from the inside, the bar from far looks pretty interesting but once seated feels ok.Ordered the southern burger which is beef deep fried like chicken with batter.. looks wise 5 star taste wise truly 3 stars. The meat is just too bland no flavor cooked right but no flavor at all. The beef fries are decent a different taste as they are cooked in the beef fat.What really rocks about this restaurant is the milk shakes, tried nutella as everyone suggested it AMAZING.Hopefully they read the renaming reviews which have all mentioned that the beef is flavorless8/21  -- got contacted by the manager to give it another shot which i definitely will in a weeks time..

reviews.name: Kina L.
reviews.review: I have been to Flip Burger now three times. I went the first week they opened, and I am glad to say service has improved drastically since then. You can typically go here on a weeknight at prime hours (630-8pm) and immediately get seated. There is complimentary valet outside which is always a plus. So far I have tried:1) The Oxaca- An angus beef burger with avocado and cilantro-lime mayo. Its good but not life changing and not particularly unique in the ingredient combo either.2) Lamburger- lamb with marinated veggies and feta cheese. Now this... I dig.3) The Stack- AKA a miniature, more classy big mac. Thumbs up! 4) ALL the fries. I think they are over fried and nothing special. And Im still annoyed when burgers don't come with fries. SERIOUSLY? Thats like pie without ice-cream. #outraged

reviews.name: Mary F.
reviews.review: Oh.  My. Goodness. The high energy here matches the juicy, creative delicious burgers. Matches the unholy milkshakes. Matches the swift efficient service. Matches the smart, friendly, with-it bar keeps. We had the Stack, the Lamb burger, the Oxaca. Those Nashvillians hankering for an in-n-out styled French fry.....Look no further and high yourselves here. I am utterly besotted. The great fresh energy. The fit out. Modern. Almost shagadelic, baby. But just this side of Dr Evil. The burgers can be swaddled in a gluten free bun or a giant crispy sheath of tasty lettuce. Or, if you don't suffer from demon gluten or carb arse (or if you don't give a rat's), a puffy cloud of white bun. The burger renditions are grown up and yet playful. The sweet potato tots and burnt marshmallow dipping cream. Wrong. Yet oh, so right. Not cloyingly sweet. A charred compliment to sweet potato. Moonshine shakes. I recommend this only be done in conjunction with an Uber transpo plan because that sh*t sneaks up on you. My boys had the Nutella and the Krispy Kreme shakes. Shook me to my foundations. The ice cream was full. Fatty. Stiff and creamy. And fully flavorful. I think we might take over the shop front right across the street l from here.  And we will use all means necessary. Am I high from this experience?  Yes. I'm taking this corner very hot. Not more than 10 mins away. Damn. Damn. Dreaming about the Flip burger and when we can get back here.

reviews.name: Allyson G.
reviews.review: Ok let's talk about this new hipster burger joint for a sec...... It's AWESOME! I love that I can find other options and dietary substitutions that fit my taste. It's a win win for my boyfriend and I - especially for two people that have opposite taste buds. I can get my hippie food and he can dive on in to a manly hearty burger.I'm telling you, you gotta check this place out. Not to shabby price either.

reviews.name: Angelina M.
reviews.review: Great simple, sleek design! I would give a 3.5 if possible. I ordered the turkey burger with avocado. The roll was warm, toasted, and tasty. The burger was a bit too salty but the toppings were good. I thought $8 was a little overpriced just for a burger.I tried someone's beef fat fries and those were pretty tasty! The service was good and the restaurant not too busy. I did notice the volume on the music kept going up and down--very annoying. Overall, it was a fairly good meal but didn't blow me away.

reviews.name: Maria K.
reviews.review: I frequently drive down Charlotte and noticed Flip a couple weeks ago. The outside of it looked so welcoming and different so I decided to give it a try....and let me tell you it is a must stop for anyone looking for an ambient environment and great food for a great price.The decor itself gives you a natural "hipster" feel. It is casual, but still has the feel of a nice sit down restaurant. They have a large patio for outdoor seating which is perfect for any gathering.The waiter was absolutely wonderful. Since I had never been there before, he went through the whole menu with me. They have a "Nashville" themed appetizer of the day that changes daily. But each appetizer included the infamous Nashville hot chicken spices and sauce.The menu is very unique and diverse. There are quite a few options other than the traditional burger. They have a falafal burger for vegetarians as well as seafood, lamb and chicken options. I stuck with the traditional burger. I just had a cheeseburger which was delicious, but what really made this trip stand out was their fabulous fries. This place has the best fries I have ever had. They had a wonderful herb seasoning on them and they were divine.Overall my experience was wonderful there and I recommend it to anyone wanting a burger!

reviews.name: James A.
reviews.review: We had watched the Chef on tv before, and were excited to try his place.  150 reviews at 3.5 stars is about right.  The menu and food make an effort, but miss the mark.  This place is new, and as it is with anything new, it needs some work.Cocktails...I had the Mojito Coco.  Refreshing and beachy.  They love their liquid nitrogen.  It does bring a wow factor and makes for a great icebreaker or conversation piece before you start your meal.For starters, my friend ordered the Poutine and I got the Chartichoke.  Poutine wasn't bad.  It has cheese curds, french fries, and is topped with a fried egg.  It's kind of like a modern take on Chili Cheese Fries.  Chartichoke was as expected.For entree...everything is a la carte...I had their signature PBR burger...I just noticed the menu has already changed from when we ate a few days ago and I'm not seeing some of the dishes we had.  I guess the burger is now called the Classic.  Bun was nicely toasted, burger was cooked perfectly, but has a unique, salty flavor to the meat.  Almost like Dale's seasoning.  Burger was 3.5 stars overall.  I would've expected a 5 with burger in the name.  For a side I chose the "duck fat fries."  That wasn't the exact name but I don't see it on the online menu.  This was bland.  I had never tried anything with duck fat, and I guess I expected some flavor.  The potatoes were just large and tasteless.  The onions on top served no purpose.  That was a 1.5.  It wasn't "bad", but just had no flavor.Desserts...the shakes look a lot better online.  I got the Nutella and Kahlua chocolate shake with toasted marshmallows on top.  Again, 3 stars.  Nothing exciting.Price...overpriced.  Cocktail, 1 app, burger, side, dessert, 20% tip = $60.I think they'll improve as time goes on.  It looks like they've already made some menu changes from just a few days ago...or the menu online isn't current.  Either way...they need to up the stars on the food or lower their prices.I wish Flipburger and the chef the best moving forward and have no doubt they'll improve.  If they don't, they'll just be a $60 Steak & Shake.

reviews.name: Jessica S.
reviews.review: Came here for the first time tonight and really enjoyed it! My fiance and I ordered the turkey burger, onion rings, cap'n crunch milkshake, sweet potato salad, and the double burger. All ingredients were super fresh - we LOVED the cap'n crunch milkshake, it reminded me of childhood. Also really liked that the onion rings were thin and not the huge/heavily friend onion rings that you typically see at restaurants. Burgers were so so good. Service was quick but I'm sure this place gets busy when lunch/dinnertime rolls around. My only complaint is that it's kind of pricey - meh! I'll still stop by every once and a while :)

reviews.name: Angella F.
reviews.review: Great burgers! I had local lamb burger, the PRB BURGER one of my friends got, and the other two also had unique burgers that I can't recall the names of. Everyone loved their food. Our waitress was nice, and the atmosphere was great! We'd just finished climbing at ClimbNash and got there at 9pm, ate outside in the pleasant summer weather (patio was so beautiful), and are just now leaving at 10pm.Really a nice place with quality burgers, there are options for around $8-9, so not a bad deal.

reviews.name: Karri B.
reviews.review: Beef fat fried French fries? Sweet potato tots? Unique dipping sauces? Expensive but if you want a unique burger and sides, save your pennies and come here! My guilty pleasure was The Southern. Chicken fried beef patty, pimento cheese and homemade pickles. Well worth the calories for the amazing crunchy/soft texture and flavors. The space is slightly futuristic/modern with a good amount of outdoor seating. Good beer selection and if you are into "adult" milkshakes, they can make it happen! Be warned they don't have the appetizer sampler like ATL does, but a friend and I easily split the fries and each had a burger and we left feeling satiated but not gluttonous.

reviews.name: Jamee C.
reviews.review: I love burgers, I will say it again, I love burgers. But I am picky about my burgers, for example, I dislike M.L. Rose burgers a LOT.I ordered the shrimp burger and when the server told me about the tempura fried lemon, it made me turn my head a little. But oh my Gosh, oh my Gosh, oh my oh my my my my. My date and I were pretty into each other yet we were silent for about a minute because the food was so good. The marshmallow foam that came out with the sweet potato tots were so on point and I secretly hated on my date a little bit for finishing the foam before we ran out of tots. Then we had the spiked Nutella milkshake with the burnt marshmallows on top and I swear the marshmallows gave me an orgasm.Okay now for the more serious part of the review, I love the interior. It feels hip yet subdued but sophisticated enough to bring business related acquaintances for a casual meal. It's not in my favorite part of town but I am willing to venture out that way for this.

reviews.name: Aubrey W.
reviews.review: My girlfriends and I were up for trying this hip new burger "boutique" that recently opened.  There's even valet; that's fancy, right?  We were told it would be about 25 minutes wait for our table at FLIP Burger Boutique, but in reality it took nearly an hour's wait on a Wednesday night.  That's what we get for going to the popular, new place!  It may have taken longer because we needed an wheelchair accessible table, but I wish they had an established waiting area vs. a ton of people standing huddled around the hostess stand in front of a drafty door.  I kept almost bumping into this group's table/chairs as more people entered.  One of the reason FLIP is so popular is its creative director, chef Richard Blais, winner of Bravo's season 8 'Top Chef All-Stars.'  I don't watch the show, but I knew that the restaurant's ties to reality TV were no doubt responsible for the packed crowd on a weeknight.  The place had modern decor with a throwback retro feel like a diner; it kind of reminded me of the decor in a themed Disney restaurant or something.Because we're super cool chicks, we decided to order milkshakes to start and dig our spoons in.  There was likely double-dipping, but we're blogger buddies so WHY NOT?  We got a Krispy Kreme shake and a Turtle shake, both delicious.  There were doughnut bits in the Krispy Kreme shake, but it wish it had tasted more doughnut-y.  Maybe some cake mix would have helped a little?  Sprinkles?  Still, like I said, both delicious.  Well worth the Lactaids that Lauren and I popped beforehand.Jenna ordered some Braised Brisket Empanadas for the table to split, and they were delicious.  They had this cilantro lime mayo that was a really great complement. I didn't get a photo of these, because we ate them so quickly!As a big-time burger fan, I was anxious to try the main event.  I deviated a bit and did not go for a "classic" choice, instead going for their Chorizo burger: chorizo-spiced pork, hashbrowns, fried egg, manchego, Spanish paprika, almond romesco.  (I skipped the smoked mayo, as I'm not a mayo fan.)  Overall, the portion size was generous; I could not finish the whole burger after indulging in the earlier bites!  The burger had great flavor too, though I think the "hashbrowns" were actually fries added to the burger.  I added fries to my order (they don't come with the burger) and wish those were a bit more crispy.  They did not exactly win me over on the fries, though again the portions were generous and there were enough to share.I really appreciate that FLIP really thinks about its ingredient sourcing.  That means local pork, organic beef, sustainably sourced fish, and sauces made fresh daily.Would I come back to FLIP?  I might, if a friend wants to go.  It's not bad, though I hope the wait times start to die down.  Burger Republic is still my favorite burger in Nashville, and I also prefer Burger Up and The Pharmacy over FLIP.  But like I said, I would come back if someone else really wanted to, to mix it up and try some of the more creative burgers.

reviews.name: Renee S.
reviews.review: This location is only going to get better. The burger and appetizer were great. Check out there menu. Lots of awesome choices to choose. I can't wait to go back and try something else.

reviews.name: Avery F.
reviews.review: Pretty underwhelming. Burger was very much just OK. Fries were solid. Beet salad was meh. They charge for soda water. Not at all a contender in Nashville's burger scene.

reviews.name: Queen B.
reviews.review: Went the first week it opened and had a good experience.They have been open a good six months now and I had my second visit.Some good changes, music is low enough to have conversation..  that's a plus.Service was lacking..  Our waiter was in no hurry to please us, this last visit.Had to ask twice for water refill.Had to wave him down for ordering.Order the oaxaca burger and was not especially crazy about it.  I think the cold pico de gallo ruined the burger.  Bun looked toasted, but wasn't warm.  Toasted in the morning?Wasn't too pleased with lunch, today.  Doubt I'll be returning this year.So many other great burger joints for a lot less money.

reviews.name: Linnaya S.
reviews.review: I had my first lunch here today and wow! I had the turkey burger with goat cheese (which was recommended by our fantastic server, Justin) and the Mac and cheese as a side. The burger has hints of sweetness and saltiness and tanginess all rolled together in the perfect package. The Mac and cheese was creamy and subtle. I also got the turtle shake which came out doused in nitrogen and steaming. The service was incredible the whole time. Not a single thing I can complain about!!!

reviews.name: Tara W.
reviews.review: Delicious! I ordered a burger and sweet potato tots, when the plate arrived it was almost too pretty to eat! Everything we had was excellent. A little pricey but you get what you pay for. Service was great, beer was cold. We sat on the patio as the atmosphere inside is a little loud, but the patio was very pleasant. Small parking lot but they have valet. Will def be eating here again!

reviews.name: Correy S.
reviews.review: Couldn't tell you how the food was because we never got to eat. Was told a 30 mom wait, and at the hour mark we gave up.. After watching several smaller groups be seated at tables that could've been pushed together to accommodate our party. Terrible customer service:+ The wait staff had no problem trying to talk to the "celebrity" face in our group.+ only offered to give us free fries after we started leaving the restaurant

reviews.name: Caterina H.
reviews.review: Not bad! Like many people I heard about this place because of its famous founder, so I thought I'd give it a go. After reading others' reviews, I was worried that it might be too expensive for the portion size. I'm not crazy about the idea of selling the side separately from the entree, but I needed to experience the place for myself. That particular day, I wasn't feeling like having anything too heavy, so I ordered a turkey burger. My friend and I decided to split a side of sweet potato tots, and if we needed another side, we'd order more. I actually loved the turkey burger, and I'm glad I split a side instead of ordering a separate one for myself because there would have been no way I could have finished it all. I paid $10 for the turkey burger and half a side of tots, and I was okay with that. The turkey burger was excellent; the sprouts and pomegranate sauce were very complementary. I liked the marshmallow sauce the sweet potato tots came with, but didn't finding myself dipping it with every bite. Perhaps it's a tad too sweet for me, but it's a big hit with mostly everyone else. Service was kind and quick. Maybe next time I'll try their famous milkshakes too!

reviews.name: Crystal J.
reviews.review: FlipBurger-One of the most modernized chic places I've been to eat on Charlotte. There is valet parking, if you choose. There is a hostess to greet you when you walk in- there is music that plays so you can get closer to your food companions. The first time I was here, I ordered the Oaxaca burger. I ate it so quickly and enjoyed every last bite. Today- I'm branching out and getting the flip burger "chorizo". I am anticipating the heartburn of eating the spicy sausage but that's okay. I've got a few tums in my purse to (hopefully) ease the pain if it comes to that. One of my coworkers stated that he felt like he was in East Nashville. While you have to wait awhile to receive your burger (at least that's the trend in the two times I've been)- it's great to have a different burger joint to go to to with different  choices. I will update my review once I get to taste the chorizo burger!

reviews.name: Larina L.
reviews.review: Super trendy burger place! You can spot it from a half a mile away it's really hard to miss. The food was amazing! I was blown away by the menu and all of the things they thought up. First off, let's talk about the sweet potato tots- My mouth is still watering- they pair it up with a marshmallow sauce of heavenly goodness that, I swear, the baby Jesus (or whatever you believe in) created himself. There's a full bar and the bartenders are very easy on the eyes. They have some pretty creative drinks too. All in all I'm impressed and every time I visit Nashville I'll be stopping in.

reviews.name: Shannen S.
reviews.review: We came here for my father in laws birthday and they wouldn't let us bring in cupcakes. They said they would charge us $10 to bring them in. We just went to Maggianos the weekend before for my sisters birthday and they didn't care if we brought cupcakes and that is an upscale pasta place and this is a just a laid back burger joint trying to charge us. Not impressed with this place at all. Probably because that was our first impression walking. We had a table of 6, it's not like we were being cheap. I ordered a turkey burger with lettuce wrap instead of bun and they gave me a lettuce bowl. It was ridiculous and I doubt anyone could eat that. Not the end of the world, just didn't make sense.

reviews.name: Maggie M.
reviews.review: Tried this place when it first opened and now tried again.  Not much has changed, service is terribly lacking.  Our waitress was in no hurry to wait on us, we had to ask twice for water refills and had to flag her down to take our order.  They have some very serious issues to iron out if they plan on making it.  Food is nothing to write home about and cocktails pricey, who cares about the liquid nitrogen. Doubt I'll be returning here, so many other great burger joints for a lot less money and frankly better quality of food.

reviews.name: Chris W.
reviews.review: Eh, very trendy place. Not somewhere I would come to on a regular basis. The salad was supposed to have a "light" citrus vinaigrette dressing. There was nothing light about it. Not something I would order again. The tuna was ok. I know, I'm at a trendy burger joint ordering a seared tuna salad. But, I'm not a big burger fan anymore. Came with friends because I was just hungry. $12 for the tiny salad is a little much in my opinion.

reviews.name: Damon D.
reviews.review: Based on one visit, though I've been to Flip in Atlanta a couple of times. I was anxious to check out Chef Blais' latest Nashville venture. I questioned the location when I heard about the announcement a while ago. It's in an "older" part of town in Nashville-but I suppose in time, it'll come back. I give this place 3 stars mainly because of the food-value ratio. I'm not sure if the area, or city for that matter, is ready for a $14 burger. In all fairness, I had the trio, which are three sliders, but other items range from $9 and up. I chose the rbq, fried chicken and stack. It tasted good...not great. The rbq was the best. Side of fries is another $3.75.  Then my beer (Einstock Porter) was $6.  All told $25. Add tax and tip, and it was $30 for lunch. Again, not quite sure this area/city is ready for that.  However, I must tip the hat to Blais for his unique/creative selections.I would not recommend this place as a regular "go-to place." The area doesn't offer much...The food; while good, is not worth the price (value). There are plenty of other great burger options in Nashville. With all that said, since it is new, and he did choose up-and-coming Nashville, give it a try, at least.

reviews.name: Sarah B.
reviews.review: There are times when I am fully aware that I'm not cool enough to be somewhere.  To prove my dorkiness, I checked in on facebook at Flip and said "Feelin' hip and Flip..." Yea, I'm that girl.My office is nearby on Charlotte, and I'm so psyched to see new options popping up in our 'hood for lunch.  A girl can only eat so much Sonic...Flip has a parking problem.  When we visited at 11:30 AM on a Friday, the single valet was way overwhelmed with like six cars backed up, so we ventured up the hill and parked like a block and a half away.  Not horrible, but I hope the neighbors enjoy burgers, or there's likely to be some unhappy homeowners soon.  (And seriously, I think the valet was limping...)We got like the last table (score!) and were seated a booth right in the middle.  This is a very contemporary, modern white interior with splashes of color kind of place.  Like I said, cool, even though I'm not.I was intrigued on the menu listing milkshakes made with liquid nitrogen (who wouldn't be?) so we started splitting a Cap'n Crunch shake.  The server very nicely split the shake for us into two separate little glasses, thoughtful.  It wasn't expensive at $5, but it's also not very large.  We didn't want large, but if you are picturing the tall soda fountain-esque shakes of Steak & Shake or something, these are at least 1/3 smaller.I had visions of the shakes coming out all smoking or something having been made with liquid nitrogen, (a la Mad Scientist) but no, none of that.  Just a regular shake that slightly exceeded the small glass where it was divided, and dripping down the sides.  It was good, but not anything to write home about.  Nutella or Krispy Kreme might be more exciting, we went with the server's suggestion.My burger was the Southern ($8) because I love all things pimento cheese.  I had asked the server if instead of the menu description of deep fried (yikes) it could be a normal grilled, and she replied at how awesome it was, and meant to be served that way, why not indulge... You know how sometimes you get the vibe that the chef makes a certain thing a certain way, and they really don't want you to change it?  In the most polite way possible, that's the vibe I got, so I ventured.  And I shouldn't have.  The deep fried was too greasy, too much batter, and seriously the outer rim bits of burger were all breading so I just skipped those.At weekday lunch you can combo your burger with a side and soft drink for like $3.50, but of course they give that a fancy name.The sweet potato tater tots were quite good, and they are served with this sweet melty marshmallow-inspired sauce on the side.  It was good, but you can't eat that much sweet.  I like honey mustard with sweet potato tots or fries, but when I asked the server, they don't have honey mustard.  (Remember the polite as can be, this is the why the chef does it comment earlier?  Yea...)Hubby's burger was on point, and his regular fries when dipped in the ranch dressing they did have in house was on point.It was overall a little heavy, would've enjoyed some lettuce or tomato on the burger rather than burger, small almost dry spot of pimento cheese, and three pickles.Lunch for the above with tip was just over $40.  And then we walked that block and a half back up the hill, now super full and wishing we'd have skipped... well, more than we did.Good burger?  Yes.  A little too hip right now, so parking and waits and overall service a little challenged?  Yes.  Best I ever had, so putting up with chef's inspirations and whims, although very politely... no, thanks.

reviews.name: Kevin K.
reviews.review: Good burgers. Not a huge fan of the Chorizo burger. But the egg on it save the day for me, however it was different. Next time I will opt for a regular burger though. Not a huge fan of the Krispy Kreme doughnut shake. Kind of overpriced for something fairly simple, basically you're paying for the novelty of the shake. Overall a good place to stop in a grab a specialty burger if you want something different from fast food and chain restaurants. The sweet potato tots were AMAZING! Go ahead and give it a try you won't be disappointed, just don't get the chorizo burger if you have weak stomach :)

reviews.name: Annabelle A.
reviews.review: Went there during the week for lunch & was very satisfied with my meal.Atmosphere: Simple, clean, modern. Nice and bright too.Parking: Free valet, but there were spots right by the restaurant as well.Service: Quick and knowledgeable.Prices & Portions: Quite reasonable. For lunch, you could make a combo with fries & a soda for around $13. (1 portion of fries is enough for at least 2 people.) The burgers are also pretty big.Food: Delicious! I got the shrimp burger (not as heavy as a traditional burger), which was fresh & tasty. The beef fat fries are excellent & the onion rings are good.  I wasn't crazy about the sweet potato tots (the tots are good, but the marshmallow dipping foam...not for me).  Also got the Krispy Kreme milkshake - tasty!Overall: I'd definitely go back to try some other things. :)Tips: For the best deals and fewer crowds, go for lunch during the week. The earlier, the better too (11:30 had no wait for our party of 6)!

reviews.name: Christy L.
reviews.review: This lunch experience was a waste of time and money.  We waited over an hour for our food; there were only three other customers in the place.  The sliders were awful-overcooked and came to the table cold-ugh!  The waiter was uninterested in serving us- don't know what that was about.  Do not waste your time.

reviews.name: Nickie G.
reviews.review: Burgers are my favorite "bad" meal - the kind of thing I crave when hungover or when I haven't eaten all day and want to get all my calories at one sitting. I have been to FLIP in Birmingham so I was eagerly anticipating the opening of this place here. Plus, I am a total Top Chef junkie and cannot resist a restaurant by someone I have seen on the show.So I was invited to the friends and family soft opening and agreed immediately. We got there and were seated immediately. Ambiance is casual but modern and slick and new. Big bar in the middle of the room and tables all around.If you were wondering about the menu, well, they have all types of burgers. Yes, as the name says, it is all about burgers so if you don't like that you probably shouldn't go. They do have a turkey burger option, some standard burgers, lamb burger, "chorizo" burger, etc and so forth. And they have sides such as fries cooked in beef fat (um...YESSSS), onion rings, etc. Oh and they also have booze, which is my favorite.Drinks were good cocktail creations and there were choices for whatever liquor you prefer. They also have beer and such. And probably Coke and water too but...boring.Given my first trip to FLIP in Birmingham I steered away from the chorizo burger. Not that it isn't good, but that it isn't CHORIZO. To me, that implies a burger either mixed with or totally made out of CHORIZO which is SAUSAGE. This is PORK with CHORIZO SPICES. There's a big difference. Just FYI. So this time I went with the lamb burger because I can totally get into any Mediterranean flavors. The burger was big and well spiced and flavorful. The fries were good as only fries cooked in beef fat can be...if they were just a smidgen skinnier I'd be putting these on my best French Fries list.Service was friendly and excited if a bit disjointed but it was a soft opening so overall was impressed. Our waitress was so pumped about everything on the menu and seemed excited to be working there so it was really fun and refreshing.Definitely give this place a try when you are craving a burger. I know I will since it is not too far from my house and there are so many other burgers to try on the menu!

reviews.name: Jenny P.
reviews.review: I am always searching for a great hamburger in franklin/nashville area. When I heard flip burger was coming to nashville I anxiously awaited while it was built, checking with my friends in Atlanta who worked at flip there about the status, etc.. Total freak about it. When it opened I couldn't wait to try it. I had heard such great things from my friends in Atlanta and the pictures looked awesome. My husband and I finally went and I got the southern burger with fries and a captain crunch milkshake. 1. The burger was so unique and delicious. (Not 'delish' but delicious) It was deep fried, topped with pimento cheese and bread and butter pickles. O.M.G. The deep fried crispies around the patty, aka breading, was very tasty. 2. Fries are NOT included which is stupid but after I finished by burger I didn't even want them.. Which was also a waste of 3 bucks. Boooooo. 3. The milkshake was a disappointment. There was zero nitrogen in it, no foggy awesomeness I had seen in pictures and mine was spilling over the glass when the waitress brought it to my table that she had to go get napkins to clean the glass. It was VERY thin. Not milkshake like at all. And it was a lot smaller than I had anticipated. Just so-so. I was super pumped about the nitrogen shakes too. Sucks. :-( All in all, I had a good first experience. The staff was super friendly and my burger was awesome. If I can convince my husband to go again, we won't get shakes and fries. Our burger dinner was 50 bucks. Ouch.

reviews.name: Mike J.
reviews.review: Sliders and Kale YES, Bison Burger and Tater Tots NOWe came on a Sunday afternoon at 2:30. The restaurant was full, but no wait and plenty of seating at the bar. Some reviewers noted loud music - that was not an issue for us on Sunday. I ordered the bison burger and the kale slaw. The kale slaw was excellent - cold, crunchy, and not overly doused in mayonnaise, and the portion size was generous. The bison burger was not good. As another reviewer noted, it was more akin to an inexpertly made sloppy joe. The chili completely overpowered the burger, and it made the entire ensemble mushy, a la sloppy joe. A $14 sloppy joe. I'm not a big fan of chili, so my bad for not noticing that chili was an ingredient. That being said, my lady (who likes chili) thought my burger was too chilified as well. Speaking of my lady, she had the sliders, opting for turkey, stack, and fried chicken. She was kind enough to let me sample each. All three were very good. Surprisingly, the fried chicken was our favorite of the bunch. The stack was excellent as well - if I come again, that's what I will order. The turkey was nice too, the alfalfa sprouts made it. She ordered the sweet potato tots. Not good - soggy, no flavor.The bartender (who waited on us) was great. Service was fast. We parked about a block away, no problem.So, between the two of us we had one Very good entree (sliders) and one very good side (kale slaw). But, for $40 (including tip), we think that we should expect better than a .500 batting average.

reviews.name: Timika S.
reviews.review: First time dining experience!  I thoroughly enjoyed my meal today.  I had the Summer Salad topped with Crab Cakes, the Trio (Classic, Fried Chicken, and Turkey) with Sweet Potato Tots, and a White Sangria.  I went after 3pm and was seated immediately.  My waitor, Dustin, was very nice and helpful.  He recommended to salad and I'm glad he did. The salad was delicious and refreshing.  The trio plate was very tasty.  Overall, I will go back for another dose of goodness.

reviews.name: Corey N.
reviews.review: First time here. I'm surprised at how chill this place is on a warm Friday evening. The decor is nice, modern with clean lines. Service was prompt. My wife and I did not have to wait for a table and it didn't take long for our food to arrive. I had the Oaxaca: burger with cilantro-lime mayo, avocado, pico and queso fresco. This was a good burger. The flavors meshed well together and I liked the texture. I loved that the patty fit the bun: I had plenty of meat left when I took my last bite. I also had the beer-fat fries, which I didn't care for. They were steak fries and I thought they were over cooked. I had a sip of my wife's Nutella milkshake and it was delish. Overall this place is not too bad. I'm always leery about places that take classic fare and add seemingly ridiculous ingredients. But flip does it well. I would definitely come back.

reviews.name: John W.
reviews.review: We went during the Family & Friends soft opening. The lamb burger and chorizo burger were both juicy and cooked to perfection. The pickled vegetables on the lamb burger were a great addition to lighten up the burger. The runny yolk of the fried egg on the chorizo burger is the perfect addition. I highly recommend the onions rings. I would suggest getting a side of the smoked mayo as a dip for the onion rings. The Krispy Kreme doughnut milkshake was simply delightful. A great way to end the meal. As far as ambiance, the modern red, black and white theme is playful. The only negative I would say is that the staff does not reflect the vibe and edginess of the restaurant.

reviews.name: Tracy Z.
reviews.review: FLIP is really fun and a great place to spend time with friends and family.  It's a burger joint, and yeah, the burgers are really good - but the drinks were AWESOME!

reviews.name: Richard G.
reviews.review: The food is is inexplicable. Seriously, I don't like  telling people about this place. Masterful food.Fries are unbelievable. I am glad I live 30 min away. I would live I this restaurant.  It is superb. There are no other words needed.

reviews.name: Ryan P.
reviews.review: We started off with Milkshakes, I got the Krispy Kreme a Milkshake, it was delicious but definitely small. The burger was definitely the best part of the meal. I ordered the Classic and loved the Flip Sauce and fresh pickles. The fries were exactly what I expected out of hand cut fries  and went well with the Smoky Mayo. Overall it was a pretty good restaurant.

reviews.name: David E.
reviews.review: Menu seemed more expansive than I remember at Atlanta locations.  Food was great.  We had a double and a classic.  Both were spot on. Sweet potato tots and onion rings were both great too. Nutella milkshake with burned marshmallows is always excellent.  Biggest complaint is wait time and kitchen speed.  2 hours for a 2:30p meal is stretching it.  Hopefully both will improve as newness wears off.

reviews.name: Anthony S.
reviews.review: I went with co-workers at lunch and was pleasantly surprised. We got amazing service for a burger joint at lunch. The menu has a burger for everyone...if everyone wants a burger. I got the Lamb Burger and it was really good. Not mind-blowing, but good. The sides were varied and tasty. Salads were impressive. My co-workers got desert including shakes that they raved about. While we were there it filled up and then got quiet again. It's reputation is one of popularity and I could imagine it being too busy for my taste on a weekend. There's a fad for burger places to be pushing the boundaries and Nashville now has several. Flip is great for what it is. I'd recommend it.

reviews.name: Robby H.
reviews.review: Poutine is here. Get them while they are hot. A Canadian favourite and a great appetizer with chorizo gravy and french fries straddled by a fried egg. The burgers here are great the combinations of ingredients selections are wonderful. always go for the blue cheese burger with arugula and onion rings. A sure-fire winner but the pimento cheese hamburger is most excellent as well. The sweet potato tots are great sides.

reviews.name: Amber H.
reviews.review: Can't recommend this place enough.  Came here with a group of friends and everything we had was mouth-watering!  The service was timely, everyone was friendly, and I quickly realized it was one of those places where I was going to have a hard time deciding what to get because just when I thought I'd decided, I'd read the next offering.We started with beef brisket empanadas, fried pickles, and sweet potato tots.  You can't go wrong with either choice, though you only get 2 empanadas.  The meat was so juicy and yet it had the perfect crisp to the outside.  And of course, that blow-your-mind sauce that they only drizzle a bit of so you can't quite figure out what the heck makes it so stinkin good.  I got the chorizo burger.  I've heard of chorizo atop a burger, but this was literally a chorizo burger patty.  I liked that it was less greasy than traditional chorizo, and the manchego was a plesant bonus since I have a dairy allergy.  The egg was cooked perfectly; I loved every bite.  The best part was arguably the SMOKED MAYO.  No, this is not chipotle may, to which I am also a huge fan.  It looks like regular, white mayo so I was all the more surprised to find that it really took on the smoky flavor.  They should bottle that up and sell it.  Someone else at the table got the rBQ burger and beef fat fries - again, the brisket was very juicy and the fries were delish with smoked mayo.Everything about this place is trendy, from the decor to the plates to the dry ice on your neon-colored beverage.  The menu is the perfect size - basic food done better.  If only I could have taken it home with me.  Lucky Tennesseans.

reviews.name: Brian F.
reviews.review: We enjoyed a great dinner here. Our service and meals were great. The sweet potato tater tots with melted marshmallows. We'd definitely recommend a visit here.

reviews.name: Kim A.
reviews.review: Had the best Burger, best Service and By dar The very  best martini I have ever had at Flip.

reviews.name: Bob G.
reviews.review: I come to the idea of a frou-frou burger with some suspicion, so it needs to deliver.  And it does.Hot Nashville is a rotating appetizer.  This time it was fried oysters, served on a slice of white bread, dashed with a bit of some kind of hot sauce - probably the kind that makes "hot chicken" which is a local fav.  The oysters were very lightly breaded and delicious.  Not many people can fry an oyster with good results, so this is a strong opening.Also, fries and tots - sweet potato tots, mind you - as a shared app:  genius.The burgers are simply delicious, obviously made of high quality meat.  Normally I go for all the cheese and classic toppings you can load, but in this case I went with the "classic" which had no cheese and a few basic toppings.  Fantastic.  We also had an Oaxaca and other variants at the table...  Good, but you run some risk of diluting the greatness of the baseline product.Downsides:  Four of us feeding up ate a C-note, before tip.  I'd like a Yuengling on draft.  I got over it.

reviews.name: Johnathan J.
reviews.review: The hostess staff needs some work. Not friendly and lie about the wait. There since of urgency is nonexistent.  The restaurant vibe is extremely loud. If you are trying to have intimate conversation, this is not your place.We arrived at 8:20 and received hot food at 9:15.I asked for no tomato on my stack and received one. Our waitress Ashley was great! Come around 9 if you don't want to wait.Food 3 out of 5.

reviews.name: Courtney R.
reviews.review: Basically, everything was mediocre. Our waitress was very blah. She misunderstood a beer order that we put in. She basically rolled her eyes when she brought out a couple cocktails and we told her of the mistake. The burgers were mediocre. If I were you, I'd walk across the street to ML Rose where the service is better, the beer is colder, and the burgers are tastier. I'll give the hostess an A plus. The vibe is cool and modern...but I don't think it matches a burger joint. Not worth all the hype.

reviews.name: Cait C.
reviews.review: came back to this place for a second try since it's close to our hotel.again, left somewhat disappointed. everyone made better choices with their burgers this time and we did enjoy the egg on top of the bison burger and the lamb burger.I had a salad this time and it was so light on the dressing that it really didn't have any citrus vinaigrette that I could taste.

reviews.name: Jen W.
reviews.review: We've been three times and each visit was a mixed review. 1. Loved the chorizo burger, disappointed by the beef tartare (served ground meat style, massively over caper-ed). 2. Loved the hot rabbit, not the beet salad.3. Loved the drinks and kale slaw, not the limp fries and 1 hour wait. I can't make up my mind about this place; that said all the servers and staff were very nice and friendly.

reviews.name: Bill F.
reviews.review: Always on the lookout for great burgers in Nashville so my wife and I decided to swing out to Flip after running a 5k in downtown Nashville and it did not disappoint. We are fans of The Pharmacy and Gabby's, but I think after today's lunch I will need to move FB to the top of the list. I had the rbq burger which is a burger topped with a slice of brisket, coke slaw, and BBQ sauce. The flavored from the slaw and sauce were just perfect coupled with a well executed cook to medium. Getting the term perspire right is one of my pet peeves and something The Pharmacy often doesn't get right as they tend to over cook. My wife got the Oaxaca because her favorite burger in town was the Mexican Burger from The Pharmacy which is great, but the Oaxaca has moved to the top of her list. The pico, blue cheese, and peppers were an awesome combination of taste bud stimulation. So, the burgers were amazing as you already know, but I don't want to forget about the perfectly cooked onion rings and fries. We did not try the shakes as the calories from the burgers were enough, but will definitely indulge on the next visit which will be very soon. We live in Brentwood so it is a good hike to get out to West Charlotte Pike for us, but we be making the trip often for sure. Flip Burger is definitely our new favorite spot for burgers in Nashville, but we still love The Pharmacy, Gabby's, ML Rose, and Burger Shack.

reviews.name: Ashley M.
reviews.review: So amazing! The burgers are fun and interesting with a variety of flavor profiles to choose from. I got the lamb burger that was done in Greek/Mediterranean style and it was delicious. My friend got the shrimp burger, and she loved it. I would definitely go again!

reviews.name: Allison L.
reviews.review: We had a ladies lunch here.  The manager kindly worked with us and the chef tweaking their beef tartare as it was waaaaaaay over dijoned.  Great atmosphere, but a slow service... Could use help in that department.  As well as fixing their bathroom situation.  Mixed gender single stall bathrooms ALWAYS suck for ladies.I had to wipe urine off the seat to put the lid down... If you want to do a single stall restroom you need to have toilet covers and constant cleaning.  It was borderline bathroom level gas station.  Eew

reviews.name: C H.
reviews.review: This is definitely not the best burger I've had...  I will give them credit for their creating a different burger.It is very expensive for a burger and the patties are very small, leaving you desiring another place next time.Hmmmm... A burger with avocado and alfalfa sprouts on it, sweet potato tots, and a draft beer... Twenty bucks!I'll let you decide :)

reviews.name: Chelsea W.
reviews.review: I'd rather give a 3.5 star but I would visit again so I went with a 4 star.  The outdoor seating is very large so its great on a nice beautiful day.  I went with 2 other friends and we all ordered different cocktails of which were very different and very different quality.  I ordered a glass of sangria which was good...nothing special really but it was refreshing enough, one friend ordered a southern mule type drink which was delicious and although its not something I would normally get, I would consider ordering it in the future.  My other friend ordered one of the special drink offerings...i think called the "Kale Yeah" which was a gin based drink with kale and some other things which the fact it included kale alone sounded gross but I love gin so I was a little intrigued on what it would taste like.  In the end it was a small cocktail bursting with green colors and EXTREMELY strong and more of a sipping drink than anything else so overall on the list of things I would skip.I ordered the lamb burger which was delicious and I would absolutely order it again.  One friend got a shrimp burger which was literally just shrimp meat in patty shape and she really enjoyed it and my other friend ordered the Chorizo burger which looked good if you know you like that type of burger.  My main complaint was the sides.  The burgers themselves don't come with sides which considering the price of the burger I thought was kind of cheap from the restaurant but it is an artsy type place so whatever...but when we ordered the sides they were described as something that wouldn't be big enough to share for three people.  Maybe my group didn't constitute as big eaters but we were definitely not even close to being able to finish three sides that we all shared.  The sweet potato tots were good but the marshmallow fluff dipping sauce left a lot to be desired.  The onion rings were mostly friend nothingness- I don't recommend them at all.  I can't even remember what the third side item was so obviously not something that made much of a statement.  3.5 stars because the burgers are overpriced for not including sides and the sides themselves were overpriced

reviews.name: Rob B.
reviews.review: Food was good. But it took 30 mins to get a water. Another 30 to get a drink. Drinks were not good. Slow and poor service, but restaurant was not full and many staff were just standing around chit chatting.

reviews.name: Charlie S.
reviews.review: Delish! Great service and atmosphere! Fabulous cocktails! New favorite Nashville spot. Best burger out there!

reviews.name: Stacey O.
reviews.review: I can't speak to all of the burgers on the menu, but the lamb burger was honestly one of the best I've ever had. I was so impressed by how many different kinds of meat and toppings they offered- I also want to try the blackened shrimp burger and the chorizo burger. Their sweet potato tots are EASILY the best I've ever had- they put burger republic's to shame. My boyfriend got the May special burger, which was a massive bison patty with cheese, caramelized onions, bacon, and a fried egg. He loved it, though it wasn't quite as flavorful as mine. His onion rings were amazing though! Also, we came on a Sunday for lunch and didn't have to wait, so maybe try to go for lunch/brunch instead of dinner?? Don't miss this place!!!

reviews.name: Matthew C.
reviews.review: Eaten here three times and they haven't been able to get it right.  Most recently I got the PRB burger medium and it came out well done or even extra well done.  Expensive for what you get and it isn't really that good.  Service is always fine.

reviews.name: Peggy O.
reviews.review: New yummo hip place. Milk shake Delish.really very impressive. Order the onion rings ! Burger quite good! Fun bar scene. Looking forward to coming again to sit outside with the dog without the threat of rain.

reviews.name: Brandon W.
reviews.review: Really good burgers, fries and onion rings. Milkshakes are the best things on the menu, we get the Nutella one every visit. Good atmosphere, always busy but never seems crowded

reviews.name: Eric P.
reviews.review: First visit. Had dinner with my daughter. Excellent experience from the very courteous Valet to the Hostess, GM, Waitress, Food Server & Support Staff. Location is on an easy to find corner. Great decor, very comfortable atmosphere, seating just far enough apart that you don't feel disturbed by the people next to you. There is also a very large outdoor seating area for pretty days & evenings.We shared the Beet & Goat Cheese Salad by having it served with our burgers and put it in the middle of the table. At only $8 it easily served the two of us and we took a full serving home. The beef-oil french fries are an excellent side with plenty served standing up in a very cool cup. Ketchup and smoke flavored mayo sides are provided for dipping with extra quickly provided to us that made it easier for two people to share.Now for the Burger choices we dined upon. I selected the Fauxlafel made from Chickpea and my daughter selected the Stack with Angus patties and cheese. We were very, very pleased. The buns are the perfect size and so soft which made it very easy to cut the burgers in half without any of the meat or toppings sliding out. You will not be disappointed with the taste or the way the cook staff has prepared your food here.For drinks I tried the Cucumber Martini which was delicious and great with my burger. For the final touch my daughter tried the Nutella Milkshake and it was also great.This will be a frequent place for our family to dine and I also look forward to trying it out for some business lunches.

reviews.name: Steven R.
reviews.review: Been there twice in one week. Lamb burger if cooked medium to med rare is so good. Went for the new menu roll out got the turkey burger very good got duck pouched hash browns not a big fan need a little more seasoning also got the crispy pork belly that is to die for it is so good melts in your mouth with red eye gravy and grits with it you can't go wrong. Good job

reviews.name: Rebecca H.
reviews.review: We LOVE Flip Burger!  We first discovered them in Atlanta and were thrilled that they came to Nashville.  Our food and service are always great, and the price is reasonable for the quality you get.  My favorite combo is the Nutella milkshake with burnt marshmallow topping, sweet potato tots, and the trio of burgers so I can mix and match.  The salads look really delicious too, but I just can't ever talk myself out of the burger.  LOL.

reviews.name: Laine N.
reviews.review: I've previously loved the food at Flip and have dined there several times. However, I stopped in last night for a to-go burger and fries on my way home from a long day at the hospital. Boy was that one of the worst burgers of my life? I ordered the new prb burger medium well, because typically I like my burgers a little more on the done side. This thing was like saw dust. It was unpalatable, dry, and made its way into the trash. I was horribly disappointed and still hungry. My advice, order your burger undercooked?! If I'm going to pay $20 for a burger and fries, I really do expect that it'll be good. Perhaps my mistake was coming in on a quiet Saturday night right before they were looking like closing early. Either way, I probably won't be ordering again.

reviews.name: Howard L.
reviews.review: We arrived at 11:30 AM on a Friday. The parking lot was packed so we figured the restaurant would be packed as well. It was less than a quarter full, so I guess people who come to Flip are averse to car pooling. Hostess greeted us and seated us promptly. We ordered a few appetizers and asked for a little more time to look over the menu. I ended up ordering the lunch special (burger + side + drink for Burger price + 3.75), ordering a Stack, Ceaser Salad and Sweet Tea. The appetizers we ordered arrived promptly: beef tartare, onion rings and fried pickles. The onion rings were a disappointment - slightly undercooked, lacking flavor and mealy. The fried pickles were excellent, although the ones near the bottom were absolutely swimming in grease. The beef tartare was just OK - it tasted mostly of capers and looked really pre-made. Like, put in a ring mold last night and plopped out for our pleasure the next day. A lot of the beef was gray, contrasting sharply with the bits of beef that looked nice and pink. It's just color but visuals matter when you're eating raw meat. There was also something stringy on top, like a sauce that had dried out to the consistency of plastic that was unpleasant. Would not recommend the tartare in the future. Our burgers arrived fairly fast. The Stack was delicious, with the only downside being it was almost too buttery. It tasted a bit like a breakfast sandwich in that respect, but the pickles and b+b sauce were worth the price of entry alone. Burger was actually a bit small - an average male could probably inhale two of these. The Ceaser Salad was ATROCIOUS. I suspected the tartare had been set the night before, but I absolutely believe this Ceasar had been sitting around for at least a couple of hours, if not more. Once you dress a salad, you should eat it right away. The longer it sits, the slimier and nastier it gets. It's inedible after a night in the fridge. This is the salad that was served to me. Nasty, slimy and old. Croutons were the size of crumbs and too few. The whole salad was COVERED in shredded parm, like they were trying to hide the lettuce underneath. I ate a few bites and pushed it to the side. It was a stark contrast to the rest of the meal. I tried some fries too. They were good but cold. Smokey mayo was good. Waitress was OK but she added an extra burger to our tab. So watch your checks. Prices overall weren't terrible but this place is more expensive than say Five Guys. And I really didn't see anything that blew me away besides in the in-house pickles. It was all pretty standard fare. All in all, I would eat here again, but I don't want to fight with people over parking and the lunch rush was overwhelming the restaurant as we were leaving.There were probably 5 or 6 parties waiting for a table.  I also think it's silly that I need to valet my car in this part of town. And I'm tired of seeing Richard Blaise on TV. Do we need another food nerd on TV?

reviews.name: T N.
reviews.review: This place is Target meets burger place.You know the smell that exist in once you enter Target? Well that's the smell here. Kind of sad though since its a burger place and I would have thought should smell like burgers.Anyway I'm a big fan of M.L Rose across the street. This place has done an excellent job to distinguish itself from them. It caters to a certain demographic. Just perhaps not one I would fit into.So the burgers. Are they good? I got the Trio sampler and I would say the best they have hands down is the RBQ Burger. Super good made with BBQ brisket.I want to like this place but the ambiance is just too much like Target. Like it's literally Target had a burger place called Flip.

reviews.name: Katherine H.
reviews.review: I'm really, REALLY surprised by the less than stellar reviews I've read. My mom and I tried FLIP today for lunch and were blown away by the food and service. Our server, though I can't remember his name, was fantastic and very personable. We started with the Bloody Mary and the Nutella Shake with Burnt Marshmallows. Both were out of this world and the presentation was really awesome. To start, we got the Fried Pickles. They were yummy, but I would have loved a liiiiittle more crisp to them. My mom got the Butcher's Cut Burger and I got the RBQ Burger with fries. Everything was so so so good! Definitely one of the best burgers I've had in a while. The vibe was hip and for a packed restaurant, it wasn't noisy at all. Our wait time was what should be expected of a full restaurant, but we honestly didn't even notice. Give this place a try! I promise you won't be disappointed! PS: While you wait for a table, try to make the older hostess smile. She looks like she needs a good laugh. ;)

reviews.name: Lauren K.
reviews.review: I really want to like this place but after giving it 2 chances for dinner I'm just not impressed. The sweet potato tots are gross, the fries are nothing special, and the burger has been mediocre at best both times. They did split a milkshake into two glasses (without us needing to ask) which was nice but the milkshake wasn't any good either. There are just too many other good places to get a burger in Nashville than to make it worth going here.

reviews.name: Katie L.
reviews.review: It's tough to open a burger place in Nashville, even if you're Richard Blais. With options like The Pharmacy and Burger Republic, outstanding food needs to call me all the way out to Charlotte.As a "Top Chef" and Blais fan, I wanted it to be outstanding. I really tried. But with the loud music, absent waiting area and fair food, I won't be returning.Specifically, here's what didn't work for me:1. Since it's a rainy day, the outdoor seating area was closed. My guess is this space is used for overflow for folks waiting for tables. Without that area, the tiny space in front of the host's stand (which inexplicably faces the bar instead of waiting guests) was crowded.2. Other reviewers have noted the loud music, and I'll second/third/fourth their complaint. It's nearly as bad as Adele's sound quality, with the music video-playing TV's volume on blast in the dining area.2. There were nine beers on draught, and they only had three of them. They didn't say if they were out or if those supplies haven't yet arrived -- the restaurant's only been open a week -- and those beers they did have weren't all that appealing or local.3. I ordered the fauxlafel (chickpea, arugula, cucumber, pickled beets, red onion, tzatziki yogurt spread) on a lettuce wrap instead of a bun, which is an option I was glad to see. I expected to be able to pick it up and eat it with my hands; you know, like a lettuce wrap. Instead, the burger was placed atop a wedge of lettuce, so I had to eat it with a knife and a fork. This isn't a minus -- yet the burger was so dry that it crumbled eat time I tried to stab it with the fork. The flavors were nice, and I liked the crisp lettuce against the yogurt spread.4. My husband's bison burger tasted like an elementary school's sloppy joe. It was messy, fell apart and not special. I'm surprised this came from Blais's genius mind; maybe I don't understand it yet? Maybe there are hidden chemical compounds that will burst with flavor in our mouths overnight? Doubtful.Here's what I thought was grand:1. The beef fat french fries come with smoked mayo and ketchup as dipping sauces, and the smoked mayo is excellent. Why have we been dipping into ketchup for so long while this existed in the world? I'm someone who orders truffle fries and regrets it -- They're greasy and not worth the extra couple dollars. Here, the beef fat was light, and the flavor's worth it.2. The milkshakes are delicious. They leave no coating on the roof of your mouth, and are hit-the-spot cold. I had the foie gras milkshake -- yep, that's right; only Blais -- and the server (who had a great personality/disposition) said I'm the first to order it from her. They melt the foie gras down before blending it, and there are small, delicious pebbles of it mixed through the shake. Small bits of doughnut rested in my husband's Krispy Kreme milkshake.There was more "eh" than "yum!" in our visit this afternoon (around 2:30 on a rainy Sunday with a 25-minute wait), so we're unlikely to return.

reviews.name: Anne B.
reviews.review: This is the best burger restaurant I have ever been to. Everything was absolutely fantastic!The decor was beautifully thought out.
