It was very mod with a  lot of metal and glass complimented with splashes of crimson, black, grey, and white. There were also geometric prints in the same colors. I especially liked the unique lighting fixtures. They were white domed hanging lamps with textured artwork of fruit and flowers on the inside. Very reminiscent of cathedral friezes.The staff was great. I mistook the manager for our waitress and rather than correct me, she very nicely took our order. Our actual waitress was also awesome. She was quick with suggestions for dessert though we did decide against it.Finally, the food was spectacular! We started with a steak tartar appetizer. It was so yummy! The steak was well prepared with a little bit of spice and the quail egg topping and house made cheese cracker were perfect compliments. For my entree, I had a tuna tartar burger. Huge chunks of sashimi tuna mixed with pine nuts, greens and a touch of wasabi mayonaisse. All I can say is YUM! My husband had the Stack. It was a fairly basic double burger, but the addition of bread and butter pickles as well as very fresh toppings really elevated it to another level.We are defintely making plans to hit this restaurant again on our next time through Nashville!

reviews.name: Anne B.
reviews.review: I have been to Flip Burger Boutique two times.  The first time was a Friday night.  A long wait.  Over an hour.  The second time we went during the week.  No wait.  I ordered the Classic burger.  It is one of my favorite burgers ever.  The fries are very good.  The wait staff is quick and efficient. This restaurant is a little pricey for a hamburger place but I will go back.  It is very crowded since it is a small space and it gets quite loud.

reviews.name: Dez S.
reviews.review: Great juicy burgers - great selection of creative appetizers - clean architecture - everything on menu is a la carte (pricey) - nitrogen shakes are fun but wish flavors were different

reviews.name: Jay F.
reviews.review: I looked at the online menu, was fairly confusing....um, how do I order a BURGER without pickled onions or some fufu sauce? Do fries come with it, or separate? I called, to order for pickup, what a confusing experience. Either the person who answered the phone couldn't hear because of the background noise there or they were just wanting to get off the phone. I get there, nowhere to park, and I wasn't dealing with valets. If they hadn't blocked off that street I could have found a place....I parked on 42nd and walked through the alley to get to the restaurant. $30.00 for 2 burgers and 2 fries, no drinks, and the phone person was awful, part of the order was wrong so I waited. Bartender was friendly. The food was good, NOT worth the price at all. Riverside grill shack and the Pharmacy I think are better, and no Beverly Hills attitude, and out that way M.L. Rose is just as good if not better. Pretentious burger joint seems to be an oxymoron and doesn't translate with me. No reason to go back unless I'm with a group of friends who want to go there, other than that I can't see it.

reviews.name: Jennifer L.
reviews.review: I'd been wanting to ck this place out since they opened but wasn't sure about kid friendliness (still not.) BUT, Im already excited to come back soon for a date nite. I'm giving five stars due to the awesome service I got from Penny the bartender on a drizzly hump day. I had a cold & was grumpy but she turned my frown upside down with friendly thoughtful service to a girl dressed in sweats. I thought their hip factor might not allow such things but I was in luck! I had a KY bourbon barrel ale at a great price ($5) & a turkey burger with kale slaw. I don't even  like slaw but their version was healthy AND delicious!  The turkey burger w mozzarella, pomegranate ketchup & sprouts was one of the most flavorful I've ever had. "I'll be back"

reviews.name: Bob S.
reviews.review: Been waiting for them to open!! It another one of my favorites from Atlanta who could always cook my burger the right temperature.Can not wait to see!!Started with the beef brisket empanadas!! Which were very good.I had my staple butchers cut burger!! Blue cheese and caramelized onions with wine jam. Perfect amount of blue cheese and well balanced flavored. But more important it was cooked right!! Our second burger was the stack burger which was thin patties with American cheese and was very juicy!! We also had the onion rings which were very good!!Congrats for good service on the first night and cooking the burger correctly!! Good drinks and nice atmosphere!! Welcome to Nashville!!

reviews.name: Michael B.
reviews.review: Amazing!Nearly all the sauces are house made and you can taste of a variety of flavors in every bit! I love the bison and lamb burgers! and the staff and GM are super nice too!

reviews.name: Andi B.
reviews.review: Very good. Service was quick and friendly. Food was good and the drinks were just right. Not crazy about the tartare appetizer but my husband had the southern and I had the Stack. Portions are just right for the price and the Krispy Kreme milkshake was worth the calories!

reviews.name: Jessica M.
reviews.review: I live in Sylvan Park and am so excited this place is here finally!  I went here two nights ago with a girlfriend.  We walked right in at 7:30 (but again it was a Monday).  The service and atmosphere was nice (though nothing stunning).  The food was a mixed bag.  I got the burger trio and beef fat fries. The fries were excellent.  Crispy (but not too crispy) and salty.   My trio of burgers was good but not great.  The burgers themselves were pretty tasty, but the buns were STALE!  Like, really stale.  Hard to the touch stale.  I'm not sure if they'd been left in a toaster too long or something, but it really detracted from the taste.  And if you are a burger place you gotta get the bun right.  The good news is, it's an easy problem to fix.  I'll be back to sample the goods again.  And I'm happy they're in the neighborhood!

reviews.name: Howard B.
reviews.review: Wonderful food and a nice place to eat. Service was a little slow but it was also raining. The turkey burger was great and the Berger with the pamonto cheese that my friend had looked good. He said the same thing as me. I think the atmosphere and the food were wonderful. I will go back. Also I don't know who the founder is.

reviews.name: Justin B.
reviews.review: I really looked forward to trying FLIP Burger after hearing such great things about it's Atlanta counterpart, however I had a rather underwhelming experience.My party was asked to wait for 25 minutes, however our wait ended up being closer to 45 minutes.  This is forgivable, however its worth noting that 25 minutes into our wait, the hostess told us that our table was ready and began ushering us to our seat before informing us that she actually made a mistake and was looking for another party under the same name.  We were then made to wait an additional 20 minutes before being seated.I ordered the Lamburger (Medium Rare) and fries - The Lamburger arrived well done without any pink, and the fires were cold.  I requested new fries, though the replacement fries still didn't seam fresh, and were still not hot.  All-in-all, while the food wasn't terrible, I can name at least ten burgers in town that are better (And a better price too).I hope that my experience are early growing pains (They have been only open a week or so after all), though I will be unlikely to visit again anytime soon.

reviews.name: Susan A.
reviews.review: Wonderful food, service and ambience. We had a great time! Definitely will be going back soon!

reviews.name: Tulané H.
reviews.review: The good: My falafel burger wrapped in lettuce was REALLY good. I don't even really like burgers, it was damn good. Everyone at our table of 8 enjoyed what they had. They can cook good food. The bad: The place was overly crowded and very loud. Our server was obviously overwhelmed. The worst part was they started packing up our things and  seemed visibly annoyed that we hung around for a few minutes after.

reviews.name: Ruthie W.
reviews.review: I like the fresh approach in menu ideas and atmosphere, plus the burger is better than average so I'm giving Flip 4 stars. I'm intrigued by restaurants that offer a twist on the expected normal. For ex: coca-cola ketchup.They lost their 5th star because of the slow and neglectful service. An awkward 5 minutes passed from the time we sat down to when the hostess noticed our waiter had not greeted us, so she took our drink and app orders on his behalf. Finally, our waiter came and he tried to take our drink orders too. Later on, it was clear that the two of them hadn't communicated if the order made it to the kitchen, then it took a long time for the app and meal to arrive. He visited us once after the food arrived and then waited a good while to bring the check. I know restaurants can operate more quickly and efficiently because I've seen it happen as a regular standard in Nashville. I expect Flip will catch on quickly as they settle in to their groove. Great service goes a long way! Good luck, Flip. I'll try you again.

reviews.name: Carissa O.
reviews.review: Solid effort. The burgers are good but in some ways they try too hard. Fries were good. Service was fantastic. Drinks were also fantastic.

reviews.name: Malcolm R.
reviews.review: My first time at FLIP burger boutique. I ordered the double and fries. The burger and fries was great and well seasoned. Nice friendly people and waitress. If I was off work I would've tried the beer and took a nap because I was stuffed. Maybe next time. I will be back.

reviews.name: David H.
reviews.review: It's ok. Didn't live up to the hype for me though.Cons:Took an hour from the time we arrived until we had our food. Menu online isn't the same menu as the Nashville location uses.Limited vegetarian options. -- I get that this is a burger place, but it's also 2015.Parking sucks.VERY noisy.Pros:Nice outdoor area.Food is good.If you've got kids, skip it. If you're on a date and/or want some level of intimacy, skip it. If you're in a rush, skip it. If you don't eat meat, skip it.Overall, an average experience. If you're in the area and not in a rush, may be worth a shot though.

reviews.name: Beth G.
reviews.review: Saw it heard about it so tried it. Really not a fair review because we make the best burgers so going somewhere is ironic. Soooo. To start we called ahead to see wait. Beautiful spring day and people were sitting outside on a Saturday. We chose to sit inside after the valet took our car up the street. Not much parking but free valet. Tip your driver hostess was nice and we were seated quickly at 1245 pm on a Saturday. The lunch special is very good but only weekdays.  I had the Oaxaca and friend had classic and we shared fries. I like yellow mustard nothing fancy and was pleased they did not say we only have our condiments like some other burger places. Also they cook to order and rare another plus. Fries are cooked in beef fat and were good. Drinks seemed about right price but did not get a shake they talk about. It was a burger with a porch. Cheaper than the big city places but more expensive than Nashville sees. Would go for lunch definitely but not otherwise. Great service too.

reviews.name: Portia K.
reviews.review: I'm so surprised by the negative reviews. Flip is SO DAMN GOOD. Oh my gosh. I had the best burgers I've tried maybe in my whole life, I love the atmosphere, the milkshakes were delicious, and I loved how they can serve your drink with liquid nitrogen so it smokes coming out to you. Is it kind of pricey? Yeah. But well worth it in my opinion. It's a burger "boutique", so the whole point is to provide a more upscale and unique burger experience than a burger shack. If you want that go to Gabby's or Fat Mo's. Complaining that the burgers are too froo froo is silly, come on. They are freaking delicious and I don't want to hear it. McDonalds is only a couple blocks away if you'd like something more all American. I'll be sitting here with my smoking whiskey and lamb burger.

reviews.name: Christina H.
reviews.review: Limited menu. Apparently the menu changes daily... I assume it depended on the random meat they had available. Slightly overrated. Over cooked fries.I would like to come back for the milkshakes. Atmosphere was loud as expected, but service was average.

reviews.name: Geordie D.
reviews.review: Why's this place so expensive? Also, just in my opinion, nobody likes to order a meal that doesn't come with any sort of side whatsoever. Which none of their meals do. So ten you get to buy a side in addition, which they scrimp you on but make it look all nice. My belly ain't here for the looks.They need to flip their style

reviews.name: Rebekah S.
reviews.review: Comfortable, great service and excellent food. I had the falafel burger. DELICIOUS. Party of 7 at lunch - we were seated very quickly. The music was not so loud that it was difficult to hear. The atmosphere was great. Our server was attentive and easy going. On a side note, the mayo was delicious. It had a nice smokey flavor. I will definitely go back to try the Krispy Kreme milkshake. I would definitely recommend this restaurant to everyone!

reviews.name: Allie C.
reviews.review: I think this place will be great. I'm just basing my 3 stars off of my experience last night. I'm really hoping they'll get the kinks worked out by springtime and I'll be back again when it's warmer to try. Having said all that...My husband and I sat at the bar and ordered a couple of drinks. I got a beer and he got some kind of spicy cocktail. I'm not huge into cocktails, but this was delicious.We ordered cheese curds, oaxaca burger, chorizo burger and fries. It's hard to really go wrong with fried cheese, but I think if they put paper in the bottom of the bowl, it would really help with the grease. I'm not shying away from grease, but this had a lot, even considering it's cheese. Flavor was good and I liked the tempura batter. But, could you give more sauce? Why so skimpy with the sauces? Ketchup, too. It wasn't enough sauce for the amount of food. Maybe try a 4 oz ramekin? Burgers were okay. Chorizo was a little dry and would've benefitted from a properly cooked egg. Mine still had raw egg whites and the yolk was mostly over-cooked. I liked the idea of the burgers and I am looking forward to my next visit. Just wanted to drop my opinion. Don't be so hard on the new place! They'll be great soon

reviews.name: Ben R.
reviews.review: The service was condesending and more involved in themselves. The onion rings were just aight and burgers ok. The bbq on my burger was dry and didnt add much flavor.  Ultimatly was overpriced and not as welcoming of staff.

reviews.name: Thomas J.
reviews.review: Went during opening weekend and service was quite lacking. The food was delicious despite a few ordering mishaps. Management fixed the issues promptly for us though. I would like to go back know that they have  been open for a while now.

reviews.name: Kimberly M.
reviews.review: Very good.  Not great but very good burgers.   Great vibe.   Great milkshakes.  Great cheese curds.  Great onion rings.   Looking forward to the seasonal menu change because I miss the mushroom burger.  I'm a fan.   If you've tried it and didn't have a good experience I recommend trying it again.    Wait staff was wonderful.   The hostess actually walked us to our car in the rain with an umbrella because we didn't have one.   You don't see that everywhere.Keep that Danny Meyer customer service vibe and it will come together.

reviews.name: Josh W.
reviews.review: I know that i will be the scourge or W. Nashville by writing this review, but I was not one bit impressed by Flip Burger, despite its touted founder and his presence on some cooking show.  I am all about supporting new restaurants in the area, but not this one.My buddy and I ordered basic burgers.....his was ordered medium well, mine "as well done as possible....I won't send it back."   Both came out bright pink.  At first blush, it looked like a nice, big burger, but that was because it was loaded with lettuce, tomato, etc.  Taste was nothing special......i almost sent it back, but was on a time constraint and didn't bother, so I cannot comment on service except to say that otherwise it was pretty ok.   Noise level is terrible.....and btw who designed this spaceship of a space??  There is no intimacy, no ambiance.   I WILL say that the fries were pretty decent, but I've had better in the area.  Frankly, i can think of 6 burger places that are better and cheaper than this one, and I think I'll try them once again instead of returning here.

reviews.name: Carter B.
reviews.review: Had I gone by myself I'd have given it three stars, but the company of a lovely lady added a star to the evening. I had put off going as I'd heard it was so crowded, but late Sunday afternoon proved to be a good time; there were enough people there to make you know you were in a place that has plenty of business, but few enough that we got a booth which we wanted.The waiter was attentive, but not overly so, and the drinks from the bar were good. The liquid nitrogen is a gimmick, I'm sure. After all, using it to avoid "bruising the bourbon" seems a tad affectatious to me. Hey, it's only bourbon, but what do I know?We had a lamb burger and a beef burger. Both were good with interesting "fixin's" on top. The fries were excellent and we liked the smoked mayonnaise that came with them. We were too full for dessert, but weren't rushed as we lingered a bit finishing up our drinks.I would go back, though probably not alone; to me, it's more of a group or date place.

reviews.name: Lindsay J.
reviews.review: The food here is delicious, and it's definitely a burger place that's a sit-down meal, in terms of both time (slowish) and price (highish).  Modern vibes, cool decor.  Service was friendly and attentive.The empanadas, any of their angus burgers, their beef fat fries and sweet potato tots are all standouts.

reviews.name: Kerri J.
reviews.review: I have to admit that Flip Burger was my 2nd choice because our usual spot was too crowded. However, after tasting the delicious food and creative cocktails, I have a new favorite go-to restaurant. The decor is modern with tall booths and a central bar. We tried a few different cocktails and loved them all. I had the oaxaca burger. It was perfectly cooked and flavored. My friend had the Turkey Burger. He thoroughly enjoyed it. The service was awesome and food came out on time. I will return!

reviews.name: Emily Myles H.
reviews.review: Really liked the presentation and appropriate portion sizes.  Falafel burger was unique and full of flavor.  Definitely tasted healthy and the beets were a nice touch. Will definitely be back.

reviews.name: Bryce T.
reviews.review: Overall, the food here is pretty good, but I have been twice now and both times received some of the most terrible service I have ever had. My inclination is that I was not the staff's fault, but, instead, they were just wildly understaffed, but all the same, it was atrocious. My girlfriend and I went to get a burger and a couple beers recently, and our dinner took about an hour and 45 minutes from the time we sat down to the time we left; not because we were having a great conversation, but because everything took forever. Also, I decided to spring for the burger made with meat from Porter Road Butcher, and even though I ordered it medium rare so that I could taste the delicious local meat, it came out burned to a crisp.Maybe if they were better staffed none of this would be a problem, but I will not likely ever go back to find out when there are so many other great options around town for the same type of food.

reviews.name: Stephanie M.
reviews.review: Everything was delicious!!! I had the braised brisket empanadas and would get them again and again! My husband had the Butcher's Cut burger and said it was very good. The red wine jam is a perfect addition to the burger as is the cilantro lime mayo on the empanadas! Our server was very attentive and made special accommodations for our kids. No complaints except I wish I'd gone with a bigger appetite!

reviews.name: Shane T.
reviews.review: I really liked FLIP.  Went there with my wife and a buddy/co-worker. I had the trio (rbq,chicken, stack) and I really liked all 3.  We shared a couple of sides - onion rings were phenomenal, sweet potato tots where just fine... but the marshmallow side was a cool touch. I am ashamed to say that I ordered a Krispy Kreme milkshake... and I am even more ashamed to say that I loved it!  Much pricier than a typical burger joint, with a longer wait and slower service (basically, everything I expected because of the "Boutique" in the name!)... but I will go back again. Very interesting flavor combinations... things you aren't going to see or taste anywhere else.

reviews.name: Anissa P.
reviews.review: Not very family friendly, even though there were high chairs and a sling for the car seat. Unisex bathrooms, yuck!!! Thought this was a restaurant not a trendy bar. I guess that's why there was no baby changing station. This was the biggie for me. My son was to young to eat but spoke with another mom about the absent kids menu. So if you have children I would dine somewhere else because it's obvious they don't cater to families. Burgers ok at best. Shakes good but nothing special, mine had burnt marshmallows. Wanted to give this place a shot but I'll stick to my fave, Burger Republic.

reviews.name: David A.
reviews.review: Wed night quickly seated for a Birthday dinner. Waiter was friendly. Offered the burger special, but I had the Southern. I stressed that I didn't want any pink. The manager delivered my burger himself to allow me to check that it was cooked the way I wanted. I noticed that he was very busy chatting up each table making sure customers were happy. He impressed me. The burger and tots were very satisfying.My second visit has deserved an additional star!

reviews.name: Sara B.
reviews.review: The burgers here are good. I'm not sure why it gets the low reviews. It isn't the best burger I have ever encountered, but it was good. One of the people at our table had a lot of dietary restrictions and the server was very accommodating. I had the Fauxlafel burger and it was delicious. A nice change from the typical black bean burger that most places have. The fries and onion rings were good too. I got the kale slaw, but there was very little kale and it was mostly cabbage. So, I probably won't get that next time. Good wine list for a burger joint. Will return.

reviews.name: Sue W.
reviews.review: Other than the food poisoning that both my mother and I got, it was delicious. Maybe the salmonella burger is better for someone with a stronger stomach.

reviews.name: Brian N.
reviews.review: I live around the corner from here, so although I didn't initially love it, I went fairly often just because of the convenience.    And now I love it.  The food is fantastic, the servers are great, the manger -- Jason -- is helpful and friendly, and the prices are low for what you get.   A few good things have happened now that they've been opened for a little while. The food is much more consistent, and you don't have to wait for a table.   So..if you'e in the mood for a great burger and a milkshake, check it out.

reviews.name: Tammy T.
reviews.review: I decided to take a break from restaurant week and check out FLIP on their grand opening day! YAY! Needless to say, I was not disappointed. FLIP lived up to its expectations! To start off, I ordered the krispy kreme milkshake, which was muy delicioso. HOT DAMN were the milkshakes good! The milkshake had a very thick and creamy texture along with tiny bits of krispy kreme glazed doughnuts. After satisfying my sugar cravings, it was time for the more savory dishes. Even after studying the menu both in store and online countless of times, I will still lost as to what I should order. I know it's lame, but I decided to stick with the classic and added bacon to spice things up. The burger was juicy and had all the components you would want in a burger!!! I was kinda disappointed that this FLIP burger location didn't offer the fry side sampler... As a result, I was forced to give up the onion rings and got the fries and sweet potato tots. sacrifices had to be made... :( The fries were flavorful and not too oily. The tots were AMAZING. (that is saying a lot since i'm not a huge fan of sweet potato) They were seasoned with some sort of spice mix that gave them a little kick. There was also a marshmallow sauce that you could dip the tots in and for me this sauce was what made this side so delicious. It provided the perfect balance to the spice mix. Overall, I was very pleased with my meal and can't wait to go back and try more of the burgers!

reviews.name: Shawn G.
reviews.review: Solid burger place.  We indulged a little and started with the the steak tartare which was a little under seasoned but otherwise fantastic.  Then we moved on to the hit rabbit.   I have to say growing up I'm the rural south this rabbit rivaled that off my aunt Ona.  Not overpowering hot just great flavor and super moist.  Between the of us we had the chorizo burger, Oaxaca burger, and the lamb burger. All three were awesome.  My personal favorite was the chorizo as it had hash browns and fried egg on top plus tons of cheese.  We missed out on the fries and tots done everything is pretty much a la carte.  Rather pricey but you definitely get what you pay for.

reviews.name: Kim U.
reviews.review: I visited the first Flip Burger in Atlanta not too long after it opened and it was a great experience. I was a meat eater at the time and the burgers were great, but the shakes were even better. Since then, time has passed, I'm a vegetarian, and now there's a Flip Burger in Nashville. After checking their online menu to be sure there was at least one vegetarian burger option, my husband and I decided to check it out for lunch. It was okay. Pros:*Great flavored shakes*Delicious fauxlafel burger *Friendly serviceCons:*Really bizarre physical layout *Few places to wait (inside)*Fried foods are all swimming in a pool of oil*Straws were too narrow in the shakes, or they weren't blended enough*Expensive for what it is*Slow serviceGood for kids? I don't feel like this is a place where I would take my almost 5yo. Not because of the food or the atmosphere, but mostly for the slow service. Maybe in a few months when the hype has worn off, the wait times for a table have decreased, and the hiccups in service have been worked out. At the same time, it's not really a date night kind of place to me. Good for vegetarians? Well, they definitely had some vegetarian-friendly options. The fauxlafel burger was probably the best version of a falafel burger that I've ever had - lots of places offer this, but almost no one in Nashville does it well. It wasn't the best vegetarian burger I've had in Nashville though - that would be a tie between Fido and J Alexander's. The beet and goat cheese salad was really large and very tasty. It's a bummer not to be able to enjoy the fries here, since they're fried in beef tallow (but at least they're up front about it). They also have a veggies and hummus platter, if that's your thing. Overall impressions:We arrived a little bit before noon on a Wednesday and had to wait about 20 minutes for a table. No big deal and not a surprise for a recently opened restaurant. However, this left us with some time to ponder the really bizarre layout. If it's cold out, the only place for customers to wait is the fairly small open area right by the check in desk. I suppose people could wait at the bar if they wanted, but all of the bar seats were taken while we were there by people eating lunch. This won't be a problem in warm weather (lots of space to wait outside), but it really made me wonder if Flip failed to do their homework re: the local climate, and didn't understand that it does get colder in Nashville.      That brings me to weird layout thing #2. They didn't have double doors, so basically, every time someone came into or left the restaurant, there were major drafts throughout the entire front half of the restaurant. And this was on a fairly warm day! And that leads naturally into weird layout thing #3: between the awkward non-waiting waiting area and the drafts, the weirdly positioned tables on either side of the front door seemed really unpleasant to sit at - which is of course where we ended up getting seated.      The food itself was decent. The beet salad was tasty, although verging on over-dressed. It would be nice if they offered a fauxlafel burger patty as an add on for salads, instead of just meat. The fauxlafel burger was fab, as I said above. Both the onion rings and the fried cheese curds were served in a kind of odd way. I'm used to fried foods having some kind of paper to absorb grease at the bottom of the serving dish. In this case, there was no paper, so there was basically a lake of oil at the bottom of each. The top layer of fried food was great, but everything towards the bottom was just greasy and nasty. The onion rings were also served at a fairly tepid temperature. The shakes were as tasty as I remembered them being from the last time we visited the original Atlanta location, but either they were under-blended or they're using some straws that are just too small for the chunks of stuff in the shake.  Our bill for one vegetarian burger, one salad, an order of fried cheese curds, a side of onion rings, and two shakes was $38, pre-tip. Big safety concern: Their valet parking lot is across Charlotte from the restaurant. This means their valets have to dash on foot across the incredibly busy traffic on Charlotte and then navigate your car to the restaurant parking lot. This is, in one word, TERRIBLE. Not only is it a safety issue for their valets, it's a huge safety issue for anyone driving on Charlotte. So, if you're driving past Flip, please be aware that this is going on. I have no idea who approved this idea, but they were nuts. It was scary to watch on a sunny, bright day; I shudder to think what it's like at night.

reviews.name: Norra T.
reviews.review: One of my favorites from Atlanta. My fiance and I noticed the steak tartare was not served as a burger but as an appetizer. It did not disappoint. All of the flavors came together. Chorizo is one of my favorites. Had the trio this time. The rbq was delicious. I was surprised I really liked it. Sweet potato tots and fries did not disappoint. Loved my Nutella milkshake w/ kahlua. Met the GM tonight, he was so kind! wishing u nothing  but the best with ur first weekend opening Flip Burger in Nashville!

reviews.name: Mike A.
reviews.review: They make burgers and fries. You can doll it up all you want, but it's cow and potato folks. Pretty expensive as you're paying for the "sit down restaurant" deal as opposed to just a good ole burger. And I'm understanding of that. I assume they are banking on the maturation of the Charlotte Ave. area in coming years. The burger was good but I literally had to squeeze it to let the excess fat run off. I needed a wet nap after eating it.  It's a cool joint, but just another place for Americans to get fat, let's be honest.

reviews.name: Matt H.
reviews.review: Delicious burgers. Onion ring and fries were enough for 4! Will be back. Servess was awesome!

reviews.name: Mitchell P.
reviews.review: Loved it here. Great burgers and great shakes. Was very crowed-- even on a wednesday night. It's a little hype over substance but, that said, the food was very enjoyable-- except for the sweet potato puffs. Just so dissapointing and soggy. Sound so good, but, alas, no good.

reviews.name: Jennifer M.
reviews.review: I visited Flip Burger for the first time last night. I found the food to be quite good, and I enjoyed upscale diner feel of the place. What I didn't enjoy is the fact that it takes way too long to get your food. The staff was friendly, especially the bartender.  However, the snail's pace got on my nerves.  The burgers here are good and are of a slightly small size--not large like you would expect in a typical restaurant setting.  The beef fat fries are great, and I really enjoyed the drink selection.  I also found the price to be right.  If Flip Burger would just pick up the pace, I would be totally sold.

reviews.name: Taylor C.
reviews.review: Loved this place! Nutella milkshake was so good, a little bit small for $5 but definitely worth it. The burgers were so great! You have to pay $1.00 extra for cheese on them and also only get a side of fries (can share with another person). Definitely a cool vibe and a great place. I came for lunch and it wasn't crowded. I would come at an off time if you want to get a prime seat. Overall, good service and great food.

reviews.name: Lindsay C.
reviews.review: First time in, i got the turkey burger and fries. The fries are amazing the burger was juicy and delicious..recommend for sure!!

reviews.name: Ed K.
reviews.review: All I need is the Stack & a Turtle shake!!  Slow?  Bring an ipad...enjoy it.

reviews.name: Chris C.
reviews.review: Very underwelmed by my Ahi Tuna Burger.  More bun than anything for an expensive sandwich.  I'll go for substance over style next time somewhere else.

reviews.name: Carline S.
reviews.review: Great.  Having a girlfriends weekend vacation and found this on Yelp. The orders: Bison Burger, The Stack, The RPG and the Chorizo. I had the Chorizo burger  #whole30 style: no bun-sub lettuce wrap, pickled red onion, Avocado and a fried egg. DELISH! Wish we had one in DC.

reviews.name: S C.
reviews.review: Heinous food and no atmosphere.  The service was great and the location is fantastic as well, but wow that was some bad food...that made both my boyfriend and I sick instantly.Fried pickles- came out immediately, luke warm and literally sitting in about an inch of grease (we dumped it out on the plate).  Butcher burger- horrible flavor combo- blue cheese, frisée and over sweet red wine jam plus soy vinaigrette?  Swimming in liquid and worse- I ordered the burger medium, it came out rare and again, room temp- an obvious serve safe issue and potentially the source of our sickness.  The double burger, ordered MR was torched.  Neither of us finished our burger.  Then the Nutella milkshake- tasted more like Hershey's, bad texture and topped with stale mini marshmallows from Sysco.  Disappointing all around.

reviews.name: Natalie F.
reviews.review: Absolutely loved this place! Small & quaint with delish food. The cheese curds are to die for. I had a classic with bacon, so good. But, I have to say, the fries were my fave! Stuuuuupid good! Will def be back to try the Oaxaca and the sexy milkshakes!

reviews.name: Joshua R.
reviews.review: Plays smells like I'm eating inside of a paint bucket. Everything looks like it's bought from ikea. I'm not sure why it has boutique in its name.

reviews.name: Jonathan S.
reviews.review: Only been there once got the southern burger and fries and it was fantastic. I will be back!

reviews.name: Alex G.
reviews.review: I should have stopped by McDonalds on the way to hold me over until I was actually seated. After being told the wait would be an hour we were informed that it would be another 45 minutes at least. There are multiple tables open and we haven't been seated. The wait itself and the complete lack of ability to judge wait time is enough for me to never come back. They also have no seating for people waiting. #Starving #FeetHurt

reviews.name: Maggie W.
reviews.review: it was yummy. but....2 burgers+ 1 side+ 2 drinks each + tip= $100. too rich for my blood. i don't mind paying for a great dinner, but this doesn't have the value. 1-time-stop.

reviews.name: Ashley V.
reviews.review: Delicious! The menu here is full of fun choices, & you can't make a bad decision. The cocktails come with a liquid nitrogen topping that makes for a great presentation. Get the sweet potato tots, & make sure to dip them in the marshmallows. The butcher block burger was great if you need a blue cheese burger, but the chorizo burger with egg was also amazing! And leave room for shakes. The Nutella Shake blew my mind! So far this is my favorite burger spot in Nashville.

reviews.name: Joan W.
reviews.review: I had high hopes.  This place was NOT worth those high hopes.Nashville has much better burgers -- if you're on this side of town, head over to McCabe.  You're better off going there, to Rotiers, to the Sportsman, to the Pharmacy, to Burger Republic, to BurgerUp ... Our burgers were VERY pink.  I'm not super squeamish about those things, but these were really really pink.  They weren't juicy, they weren't thick, and overall they weren't worth $10.Plus, if I'm paying $10, I'm expecting fries.  To pay $3.50 more for fries seems a little crazy to me.The booths weren't comfortable, there were no condiments or salt and pepper on the table, and over all the place just seemed pretentious and snooty. I'm glad I went because now I won't wonder as I walk into Beer Pale, "Should I try FLIP?"  Because the answer is no.   I'd rather not donate plasma to be able to eat at some place that makes me feel like I'm in NY. Or Atlanta. Over all... meh.

reviews.name: Tanya B.
reviews.review: The experience @ Flip Burger was GREAT!!  The burgers were fantastic (the flavor of the beef was wonderful), and the fresh pickles and inspired condiments were great as well.  The onion rings were so light and crisp--not greasy AT all!  As for the fries...such a wonderful crisp on the outside with a warm, melt in your mouth center.  We will definately be returning!!  The ONLY downside...not enough room for one of those yummy-looking shakes!  Definately will return when warmer to sit outside!!  Oh, one more thing...one side is plenty for 2 to share...very generous portions on the side items!

reviews.name: Jenny H.
reviews.review: I wish I could say I had a wonderful experience at Flip Burger but unfortunately that was not the case. 1st rant- I understand that this is the "hip new place" but hip doesn't always mean mind numbingly loud music, a hour and a half wait, bright colors, or what looks to be a room left over from the set of 2001: A Space Odyssey. We put our names in at 6:30 and were given an hour wait quote...we were finally seated at 8, finally were asked to order drinks at 8:20, and didn't get our food until 9:10. At one point our server actually mentioned how bored he was.  2nd rant- The layout of this place is ridiculous. Walking in the front door, you're immediately greeted by the hostess' back as the hostess station faces the opposite direction from the door. The restaurant is a giant "U" shape and the kitchen is at the back. We had the misfortune of being seated right next to the kitchen, in what turned out to be the back corner of the whole place.  The restrooms were on the other side of the servers station in our line of sight, but whenever we got up to use the restroom, we were redirected all the way around the dining room. I understand that it may be a liability to have customers walking through the service station but based on how service was going, our little personal bathroom escort should've been busy assisting his co workers and getting some tables turned. 3rd rant -The food was average at best. Out of the 6 people at our table, not one person's burger was cooked as specified...medium rare was well done, medium was well done, well done was rare. I got the Trio with the classic, butcher block, and turkey with beef fat fries. All 3 were over cooked and dryer than dry. The toppings were basic and underwhelming. Overall I was not super stoked on this place but I'm hoping it's just the inevitable hiccups that happen with a new restaurant opening. I will go back in a few months to see if there is any improvement because the concept is great, but for now I'll be sticking to Burger Republic and The Pharmacy.

reviews.name: Lakeisha H.
reviews.review: Nice different kind of way of doing burgers. My boyfriend saw them on tv and was impressed from beginning to the end. I thought it was a very net idea, good menu choice burger was good not great not the best. Still burger republic top oft list. They have the best milkshakes in town by far. The place is small so waiting is to be expected. Parking is tight so also be prepared for that.

reviews.name: l k.
reviews.review: I think Richard Blais would be mortified to know that his Nashville kitchen staff can't make a burger "to order"...twice now we've been here and ordered "medium" and both times the burgers have come out "well done" with absolutely no pink inside. We're pretty easy to please/not the kind to make a fuss or send something back to the kitchen but after this last experience I may reconsider if it should happen again. It's a high-end burger restaurant...it's not like we're at Steak & Shake...and with the prices we're paying here the burger should be cooked perfectly. And it doesn't seem like an isolated incident...a friend told me he experienced the same thing just recently...the burger was actually black. Not sure if the kitchen staff doesn't realize a bison or local PRB burger is going to cook far differently than the regular beef burger? Anyway, I hope they can figure it out. The fries and tots are great...and the milkshakes are pretty amazing.

reviews.name: Reeju D.
reviews.review: Good food. Service not great and different menu than the ATL location. Asked for a chocolate shake instead of Nutella and they couldn't do it for me . Food tasted good. My son loved the rabbit.

reviews.name: Valerie B.
reviews.review: Omg the best of the best it's so totally packed for each meal time and it's because the customer service the food the shakes the cocktails are phenom!!!!!! The shrimp and salmon as well as the beef burgers ARE ALL GOOOOOOD!!!!! Get here you'll be overjoyed you did. S/O Blaine you rock

reviews.name: Ben R.
reviews.review: Very good burger. Cooked to temp, as requested. Great fries (not a 5 cause fries didn't come with meal). I always judge a restaurant on whether I would come back based on my meal. Will definitely frequent once they have sorted out their beer stock.

reviews.name: Andy W.
reviews.review: Sorry...I can forgive the wait and ambience, but a Burger Boutique better be all about the burger, and this place is not. The shakes were novel and nice, fries were good but not great, and the apps were good. All four of the burgers in our party were overcooked/very well done - the waitress did ask how we wanted them cooked (2 medium, 2 med-rare), but what came out was dry and overcooked/grey. I can get that at McDonalds. Shame.It's a crowded and competitive field for gourmet burger joints these days, and Flip Burger is close to the bottom.

reviews.name: Corian B.
reviews.review: If you have big hands well lol the burgers will feel very small lol, the prices are ok but you if you order a burger that's all you get, you have to pay extra for the fries, and the drink, there are no coke products and I have to emphasize again the burgers are too small (they are nicely decorated but that's the only good thing about it) I left there hungry still. Atmosphere is nice but I think I will stick to pharmacy burger in east Nashville at least you will leave with no appetite

reviews.name: Rebecca P.
reviews.review: First time visitor tonight. We got seated very quickly and enjoyed the bar while waiting. Drinks and food were very innovative and it was delicious. Service was great. Price point was good for the area!

reviews.name: Josh M.
reviews.review: Everything ran pretty smoothly for having just opened. Based on what we have seen of the Blais from TV, we expected a little more. It felt like there were able to charge 20% more for everything because they called it a boutique. The place felt modern and dated at the same time. Service was on point. The hand cut fries and the Nutella milkshake did not disappoint. Non alcoholic drinks were pretty lacking. Loud techno music was a little distracting. The menu online didn't quite match up to the actual menu, so we ended up with a falafal burger and a trio. Both were quite tasty, the highlight of the trio was funny enough the fried chicken. Fun take on burgers and it was good, but there are a plethora of great burger places.

reviews.name: Leah S.
reviews.review: Everything was delicious. Had the Butchers Cut and it was phenomenal. Onion rings and fries were tasty. Drinks were fab! Will return very soon.

reviews.name: Natalie H.
reviews.review: No way.WAY too noisy.Servers are sleep walking.Too much grease.Did I mention the noise level.  The music is so loud I might as well have gone to a club and had fun instead.Never again.

reviews.name: Sara S.
reviews.review: I have eaten at all of the FLIP locations throughout the south and this one by far is the absolute best!!! I love Richard Blais's concept and execution. Staff was well prepared and informed. I loved the atmosphere and seating available on a Saturday. I seriously cannot rave about this place enough and I recommend it. The burger is high quality and up to the burger standards of Nashville.

reviews.name: Christian P.
reviews.review: I really wanted to love FLIP, but I'd give my experience tonight a 4 out of 10. Pros: We arrived at 5:30 on a Monday and got a booth. They were on a wait when we left. Excellent onion rings, fries were also very good Glad to have another restaurant option in this part of Sylvan Park/CharlotteCons:This location doesn't offer the "Vedge" that is on the online menu, but no biggie (I'm not a vegetarian, it just sounded good)Ordered my burger well done but it was cooked to the point of being almost inedible--the first bite reminded me of a cheap burger you'd get at a company cookout, swimming pool grill, etc. Boyfriend's chicken fried burger (I think called the Southern) was very bloody and greasy...hard to eatWaitress was nice but a little awkwardAnother server kept coughing into his hands when walking past us (near the kitchen)...I hope he was washing them often to avoid spreading germs I will definitely give it another chance but was sadly underwhelmed tonight!

reviews.name: Jeni M.
reviews.review: City Eats on the West Side. This boutique has a very modern, metropolitan atmosphere. Service was great. I had the fauxlafel burger and a friend tried the Oaxaca burger. Both burgers were pilled high with toppings. I especially enjoyed the shredded, pickled beats on the fauxlafel.  This place will bring a lot more traffic to the west side. Looking forward to trying their famous milkshakes next visit.

reviews.name: Brooke W.
reviews.review: I had a great experience here today! I got here about 15 minutes after they opened and saw a half-full dining area already. Since I was dining alone I opted to sit at the bar. By the time I got my food, less than 10 minutes later, the restaurant was full and on a wait. I couldn't believe how fast they filled up. The bar staff was very friendly and helpful and the food was great!

reviews.name: Karri S.
reviews.review: overrated and I hated the modern ambiance for a burger joint! when I want a good burger I don't want to feel I'm in a stuffy restaurant that is jamming techno to loud, luckily for this place the burger wasn't anything to brag about. my turkey burger was heavily salted and the fries were mediocre. the service was not great- when I said I needed another minute to look at the menu, I was literally given 30 seconds and they tried to take out plates before we finished eating. if I have to go back I am definitely going to wait for the outside seating because it was the more relaxed vibe I expect with my burger.

reviews.name: Ric W.
reviews.review: Stopped into Flip Burger while visiting Nashville for a baseball tournament. It was recommended by a friend. Fabulous food. We tried two fabulous appetizers- sweet potato tots and fried cheese curds. They were as delicious as they sound. We had 3 different burger selections and shared. All were fabulous. Our server Michael was delightful and guided us skillfully through the menu. Bravo!

reviews.name: Juanita J.
reviews.review: Great environment. Good burger. Greasy fries. Pricey!

reviews.name: Kevin And LaRae C.
reviews.review: Started with the Caesar salad which was huge and delish.  I had the Oaxaca burger & he had the Butcher's cut.  Both were very good with buttery buns, although they could've been hotter.  Not the best burger I've ever had but we enjoyed the meal.  We got seated right away because the other parties waiting had more than 2--we lucked out.  But everyone seemed to get seated right away.  It was a little hard to hear each other, but no loud music--just the crowd.  The partial carpet helps the acoustics.  Service was fast, and helpful.  Our waiter suggested one order of fries was enough for the two of us, and he was right!!  Fries were wonderful! Must be the beef fat they're cooked in.  Parking is tight, and it's a new popular place, so we expected to wait, but our timing was perfect and we were eating soon after arriving.

reviews.name: Brandi W.
reviews.review: Empanadas are amazing! Sweet potato tots with a light whipped marshmallow sauce better than Vortex burger (if you've even been). Lots of fancy burgers. The classic burgers are good. Double is better than the classic. Flip mule is really awesome. And the shakes are phenomenal.

reviews.name: Arielle P.
reviews.review: Was visiting Nashville for a graduation and someone suggested Flip Burger. It wasn't what we expected, but turned out being good. Our main issue was that our to go order took an hour. But You have to try the sweet potato tots, AMAZING!!

reviews.name: Wendy N.
reviews.review: I had an okay burger. It wasn't that memorable because I already forgot what it was. I also got the Krispy Kreme milkshake that I hurt my lip on because the dry ice thing? It was good but not great. There are plenty of other burger places to go without the wait.

reviews.name: Mina K.
reviews.review: I must admit to being a little apprehensive to try Flip Burger with so many new burger places in Nashville and not all living up to their hype.  My husband and I ordered burgers to go and while this was going to be my "cheat" night I found it very easy to eat healthy (turkey burger, kale salad).  Both were great.  Turkey burgers normally come very dry and not only was it NOT dry it was full of flavor and moist.  It also doesn't hurt its topped with avocado:)  My husband got the classic burger with fried cheese curds (ummmm husband doesn't eat as healthy:)).  He said all was fantastic.  After the last few visits to Burger Up being disappointing its nice to see stellar food being served right in my own neighborhood!

reviews.name: Allan B.
reviews.review: If you want a better burger head to Burger King and get a Whopper and save yourself a fortune. The service will be better too.

reviews.name: Greg W.
reviews.review: We stopped in at Flip the other day and were pleasantly surprised at how good the service and food was at this restaurant.   The one aspect that really impressed me was how clean everything was.  Silverware and glassware were spotless as was the entire restaurant.  We ordered the single patty burgers with fries and sweet potato tater tots.  The burgers were delicious and cooked exactly how we requested.  The French fries seems to be home made and were equally delicious.  The tater tots seems to be a tad on the salty side but had a nice taste, I only wished they had a little less salt.   Overall we were very happy with our meal and service and definitely will return for future burgers.  I have already recommended to friends.

reviews.name: Seth W.
reviews.review: I've eaten here a million times already as we live close. The food is amazing and the milkshakes are awesome. Great drinks too! Only drawbacks are the price ( but well worth every penny) and the wait is often lengthy.

reviews.name: Jeff W.
reviews.review: I've never been as frustrated at a restaurant as I was Friday night at Flip Burger. From the minute we walked in the door, we were ignored and disrespect. We were told that our wait time would be around an hour, so we headed to the bar. After about 15 minutes, our drink order was taken. We got carded everytime we placed an order, though we had drinks in hand(not a big deal, but annoying). After almost 2 hours of standing at the bar and being shoved around by the waiting staff, I asked when we might be seated. The host, clearly too incompetent to stage a Friday night dinner crowd, responded in an extremely condescending manner. I'm not sure if this was solely a product of his frustration or if the was trying to impress the co-hostess. My blood pressure spiked and I asked the group to leave. After overhearing our conversation, the staff seated us pretty swiftly. All-in-all, the food was pretty good and the beer was cold, though the Dave Thomas - esque burger patties left more to be desired.

reviews.name: Jacob G.
reviews.review: Hot rabbit was good, the beer selection was also good.  Had the burger with blue cheese (I forget the name) and thought it was good, unfortunately not great.  I would go here again if in the area but probably won't drive across town for the burgers specifically.

reviews.name: Wayne M.
reviews.review: People were very nice and the food was above average. Seems like they might need a little more practice moving people through because the weights are still long and the food took an extremely long time to come from the kitchen. French fries and onion rings were tasty but a bit greasy

reviews.name: Nan F.
reviews.review: If you like overpriced, corn fed, flat burgers then this is the place for you. Nothing local or organic in terms of beef or beer. I expected more from a Top Chef winner coming into Nashville. It's really no better than Five Guys. I won't be back.

reviews.name: Ms T J.
reviews.review: Heard about this place while visiting GA, then Nashville guru. We went Friday after work. We ordered onion rings it came with about 5 rings and a whiskey based dipping sauce. They were very good and light. We ordered the butchers cut burger oh gosh! This came with blue cheese(crumbled) carmelized onions, soy truffle vinaigrette,frisée, pickled shallots and a red wine jam. Oh my it was so good! I recommend trying this burger. It came with fries with ketchup and a smokey mayo, they were seasoned well and good. My bf ordered a turtle anarchy. I only do girly drinks, so I ordered a jazzy bell cocktail. I think they use liquid nitrogen in most of their drinks which makes them look cool. The drink was very good also. The bill for the 2 of us all together was $45.00. Our waitor was cool and very helpful. Everyone was nice from the hostess to the other employees just walking around. I will definitely return!!

reviews.name: Kat M.
reviews.review: I'm not a big "review" person, but this place deserves it because it definitely caught my attention and "WOW'd" me so to speak. I love a great burger as much as the next person, and everything about this place was great! We started off with the Fried Pickles & Fried Cheese Curds.  I prefer Dill pickles, and these were B+B, but the breading was incredible and just the right amount without overkilling the frying.  If you're a B+B pickle fan, this should be an automatic go-to.   The Fried Cheese Curds could not have been more perfect, and I am not exaggerating when I say they are the best I've had. Ever. The cheese curds are served with a sauce that tasted a little like tartar sauce to me, and I think that could be swapped out with a spicy ranch of some sort to give it a nice power kick, but once again personal preference...Moving on to the burger, I got the Butcher's Cut, medium, and it was cooked to perfection. Pink + juicy center, while not moo-ing.  Just the right amount of blue cheese as well, so it was not overpowering. And whatever is in that red wine jam, I want it on everything. I got a side of fries and OH MY GOSH! These were the perfect combo of crunchy on the outside, yet mushy on the inside. I almost went with the sweet tater tots (and definitely will try at some point!), but so happy I went with the fries. A "side" is enough for (2) people in my opinion as well. Next time I'll definitely have to try a Nutella Milkshake..... Highly recommended, and worth the wait! You can always go next door to The Beer Pale and grab a beer. Their sweet host(esses) will gladly come find you when your table is ready :)

reviews.name: Amelia K.
reviews.review: Best burger place so far.  I had the turkey burger and it was great.  Sangria was good also.  Great service and great food.

reviews.name: Ashley L.
reviews.review: The blue cheese butcher burger was amazing!!! Service was great but I did not like the fries, at all.

reviews.name: Truc L.
reviews.review: In a landscape that's pretty saturated with gourmet burger places, we were curious to see how FLIP Burger was going to stand apart. I was skeptical at naming it a "boutique", but after dining there, I actually think the name is quite appropriate. FLIP's focus isn't on making the "best burger" per se, but rather on providing unique twists and flavor combinations using a burger as base. It's a subtle distinction, but comes down to what the focus point of the meal is. We tried the Butcher's Cut, and while the patty itself was nothing extraordinary, the melding of the other ingredients/toppings made for a very tasty dinner in the end. The wife had the Chorizo burger, which was also quite good. The egg was too runny for our taste, making for a very messy meal, but the overall flavor was quite nice. The biggest food disappointment for us was the burnt marshmallow foam with the sweet potato tots. The tots were excellent, but the heat from the tots melted the marshmallow foam into a gooey mess. As others have stated, the kitchen speed was slow, but hopefully this will pick up as they work kinks out over time.

reviews.name: Rod G.
reviews.review: This is it.  If you are a Cali or a Zonie then look no further.  Yeah, La Hacienda is rockin just down the street but there are times it is way too crowded and busy.  Dare I say inconsistant as well.  San Jose is a sleepy little joint where you may be the only gringo or customer.  It is a trip to East LA or Oakland right here in the 615.  The menu sparse but enough standards and traditional's to keep you fed.  The food is not dressed up or slammed out like the chain names.  You will find no "Speedy Gonzalez".Tacos, torta's, burritos, enchilada's, tamales, etc. in about every kind of street meat.  Soups, salads and some variations.  They make their own sauces which are very good.  They offer Mexican sodas, drinks and beers as well as American.  The fare here is simple home or street style.  Cooked fresh.  There is never a wait and the TV's are always on.  Do not let the outside scare you away.  Yes, it is a tire shop/boxing ring/pool hall/taco shop.  Pulling into the few parking spaces directly out front you might never venture into this gem unless you have been to Mexico.  This is as real and good as it gets in Nashville and I have chased tacos around the world.  As a former San Diegan this is where I eat and take friends to see them flip out and gorge.  Well worth it.

reviews.name: Tom J.
reviews.review: For 12 years, this was, by FAR, the best Mexican restaurant in Nashville. They did NOT serve ground beef, and everything was great. Unfortunately, they closed and some guy opened up a restaurant of the same name on Linbar near Harding & I-24. The Linbar restaurant is sub-mediocre, typical of Mexican restaurants in middle TN.

reviews.name: Crystal S.
reviews.review: Blow away by the awesome service!!! On a whim, we decided to give Hard Rock a try. Having our 3 yr old is always tricky, and since we were surrounded by bars, we figured we better play it safe.. So glad we did!!! We were able to get a table right away. Our server, Morgan was right there to greet us and take out order. The atmosphere was fun.. Music was great!! It had our 3 yr old dancing. Will definitely go back on our next trip to Nashville!!!

reviews.name: Laura C.
reviews.review: Great experience here. Staff was responsive and helpful, and the stuff they offer kids to do is way more than just a few crayons and a piece of paper.We used our hard rock coloring book at many restaurants after this trip!Food was good, drinks were amazing. A really nice place to stop in Nashville especially if you're with kids and don't want to bring them to the local honky tonks.

reviews.name: Lori W.
reviews.review: My review is based on the gift shop in front of the Hard Rock Cafe...the building is very small but stocked full of Hard Rock collectibles and shirts and all kinds of other souviners. There is a section on the floor where it used to be the silver dollar saloon. There are several silver dollars in the floor. It really is cool to see it.The staff is fun, friendly and helpful.Highly recommended..

reviews.name: Dave B.
reviews.review: Spent the evening with an awesome bartender named cass she is excellent check her out!

reviews.name: Ricardo R.
reviews.review: After finding out the Acme rooftop was closed we decided to go to this rooftop bar. Big Mistake! I asked the hostess if I could go to the rooftop, she said it was full. I asked if there was a wait, "Nah people just sit there forever." Dumbfounded I asked if we could just go up and see if we could order a drink; "Sure." Upstairs we meet the second host and he says the bar is full but there is a table. I was super excited... that is until I sat down. There seemed to be some tasty mason jar drinks on special that included the mason jar. We asked about them and our server answered "Well, I can get you the drink but not the mason jar. I'm sorry they've just been so popular." Ok, perfect, I didn't want the glass so I asked what was in one of drinks and the server said they were an old promotion so he forgot so he was going to ask the bartender. I asked what the new promotions were, he also didn't know. He came back with the recipe of the mason jar drink but still didn't know the new promotions. I had had it so I ordered a simple Tito's with soda, lime and a splash of cran. He came back saying they were out of Tito's, I ordered Ketel One and got no splash of cran. I drank, paid, tipped, left.

reviews.name: C R.
reviews.review: WATCH YOUR DATE!!! Uncomfortable Gropeville. We ate dinner here last night after Last Comic Standing and our bearded waiter spent the entire uncomfortable evening hitting on my Fiancé. At one point he invited her this weekend to a burlesque bar at another location... The he did the unforgivable, he grabbed her forearm with his hand. To avoid my hitting him we left the Hard Rock quickly never ever to return. I'm sure they will pull down this post... But warning people before they do.

reviews.name: Beth G.
reviews.review: It is a Hard Rock Cafe in another city. Good for Tourists looking for Nashville stuff in the gift shop. Nothing stands out that I have to say because I live in Nashville. The Hard Rock Cafe in Vegas a different story. I can get collectibles at Walmart in Nashville..so really the tourist location loses it luster here on me. Prices are a bit pricey for average chain food grub. If not a local, maybe stay away. Why pay for parking when you can get average food down the street for free parking. NOW this is NOT to say this is not a place to visit when you visiting Nashville. It has COOL stuff only Nashville will have. If I had someone come to visit and ask specifically about the Hard Rock, of course I would take them. Otherwise, not so much. Not against this place, just not for it as a local.

reviews.name: Adam K.
reviews.review: Place was half-empty when we walked in, and we were told there'd be a 20 minute wait.  Saw at least 2 managers or expediters just standing around, as well as 2 waiters who didn't seem too busy.  Maybe one of them could have waited on tables and cut down on that wait time...Cobb salad was only okay and half the cheese on the nachos wasn't melted.  Go to the Memphis location to eat and stop by here just to pick up your pins.

reviews.name: Sarah E.
reviews.review: The restaurant is extremely loud. Not family friendly at all, or even friendly at all if you want to have a conversation with the person you are dining with. The food is below average, nothing about our experience was enjoyable or memorable.

reviews.name: Emily H.
reviews.review: This was good, not great. The food and service was decent, but really expensive. Steak was prepared as ordered, but was too heavily seasoned.

reviews.name: Diana O.
reviews.review: 3 stars cause I enjoyed the rooftop outside patio view and live band. Outside patio gets a different menu verses dining inside you get a bit more option. Basic american food. It was okay. Our server was new and she didn't know anything about the menu or if it was even on the menu. Our food took forever to come out. And we just ordered wings. They do have valet parking if your not wanting to look for parking.

reviews.name: Ruby R.
reviews.review: Don't Do It!I have been to Hard Rock Cafe's around the US in most major cities. This one is the worse.  There was a large party with at least 10 kids in it. Instead of seating them all together, the parents were seated in an elevated section near the door and their pre-teen daughters were seated next to the kitchen..and our table.Not only were they running around and overall barely supervised but the manager just walked back and forth as though it was no big deal.  I love kids, but on a Sunday afternoon on Labor Day weekend, we just wanted a simple meal with a normal level of activity for a family resturant.Lastly, our waiter put an asterisk on the bottom of the recipe...next too the 18% gratuity recommendation.That gave us a good belly laugh!As for the food..nothing special.

reviews.name: Nina P.
reviews.review: Food and service is excellent, Rooftop seating was closed for dining which is the only spot really worth eating at as the layout is very odd.Store staff was super helpful and friendly, it's still a one visit stop for me.... 4 stars

reviews.name: Amanda M.
reviews.review: We made one last stop a Hard Rock Cafe before heading to the airport back to ny. Drinks, food, service was excellent ! Even better was the bartender Logan!!! We had such a fun time. Good send off!

reviews.name: Tommy H.
reviews.review: "The Reverb Room" at the Hard Rock Cafe Nashville is one of the better rooms for music in the downtown area. "The Ledge" (the rooftop patio) is a great place for cocktails or muchies. You might have to ask the hostess how to get up there, but Check it out!

reviews.name: Nicole M.
reviews.review: This is the type of place to grab a drink, not eat dinner. I came here with a large group, so I understand that there will be time delays with wait staff. But our waitress took over 30 min to take our order. Not sure if they were short staffed but then it also took a long time for drinks to come out and food to get there. And when the appetizer came out, we got the spinach and artichoke dip which I sent back because it was cold. Even the second time around it was still cold. I just gave up. On another note, I went on a Wednesday which are live karaoke nights. That part is a blast, and since it's Nashville majority of the performers can actually sing pretty well.

reviews.name: Kevin B.
reviews.review: Typical.  If you want the typical Hard Rock chain and to get away from Nashville, stop in here.  You won't even remember you are in the Music Capital.

reviews.name: John P.
reviews.review: Service was the slowest I have seen. We ordered and it took and hour to get the food on a Thursday night when it wasn't busy at all. My wings were ice cold and I sent them back. Not worth eating. The menu is limited and not worth it. With So many places to go don't waste your time at Hard Rock. .

reviews.name: Alec S.
reviews.review: I ordered my food and it came back in a reasonable amount of time but, that was the last I saw my waitress and the food was tasteless and under cooked. Will not be going back for sure.

reviews.name: Rachel R.
reviews.review: Eh. Our server was good. The food was mediocre. Which we probably should have expected. I ordered the twisted Mac and cheese with chicken and red peppers. It was okay, nothing to write home about. My girlfriend ordered a $30 steak that she could only eat half of. She asked for medium rare, thinking that places tend to overcook steaks a little anyway. (She eats steak a lot, probably once a week. She is not new to proper steak ordering). However this steak was RARE and cooked unevenly. We looked it up to make sure and compared. She basically just ate the edges because the center was cold. It was not medium rare. In truth, she did not say anything to the server because by the time she realized it was not cooked the way she asked, she had already eaten like a third of it (the more cooked side). She also felt bad and the server was so nice so we just didn't say anything. Can't say that I'll be hurrying back to a Hard Rock Cafe anytime soon.

reviews.name: Madison S.
reviews.review: Let me just start by saying our waiter Allen was AMAZING! He was very nice and was always there when we needed him. And he had only been there for 4 days! We've never been to hard rock and let me tell you it was great and we will be returning!

reviews.name: Amanda W.
reviews.review: Was super excited to see Nashville's Fourth of July fireworks at their rooftop party. But it was not a full viewing of them.  The building obstructed nearly half of the show. Very disappointing.

reviews.name: Ccl M.
reviews.review: Bartenders are AWESOME! Jacki is the best! Food is fantastic! Music was great. The restaurant is just amazing

reviews.name: Melody C.
reviews.review: The service is excellent!I had veggie sandwich and it was amazing. I would come back again before I leave.

reviews.name: Alex G.
reviews.review: The food was okay nothing that was so great but it is what you expect when it come to a Hard Rock Cafe,   The service is what I am commenting on here,  it was excellent!   Our server was very responsive and out going.  The restaurant was clean and cold and that is what matters the most after you have been baking in the sun at CMA Festival.  The only negative is that the prices seemed to be exceptionally high for this category of restaurant.

reviews.name: Bradd G.
reviews.review: Had the hickory barbecue bacon burger and it was very good. Fries were seasoned nicely. Wife had a combo appetizer and her wings were great. Service was average or I would give it 5 stars.

reviews.name: Jigna S.
reviews.review: We ordered the nachos appetizers and the half roast bbq chicken....huge portions! And delicious! The bbq chicken was alright, but the nachos were excellent. I haven't been to many Hard Rock cafes but I enjoyed the experience at the Hard Rock Nashville. There were photographs of famous country singers adorned on the walls and great, live music...really made you feel like you were in music country!

reviews.name: Matt S.
reviews.review: Extremely slow service and overpriced food. Never asked if we wanted refills and saw server only twice entire meal.

reviews.name: Jessica S.
reviews.review: I live in Orlando, so we have fairly large Hard Rock's here and I was expecting the same while I was here. This wasn't so. It was fairly small, there was no area for a live band (that I could see), which I thought was strange considering we were in the music capital of the world. However, the staff was friendly, especially the valet who was more than happy to help direct us to our next venture. The server was kind of pushy when I didn't order a drink, but I think she was just trying to be friendly, but I was a little put off by it, because it made me feel a little guilty for not getting one, even though I was the designated driver. But the hamburger I ordered was fantastic and it was quiet besides the music playing. But it wasn't obnoxiously loud. As these places tend to be. I wish their store was a little bigger and had more merchandise. They didn't even have the special shot glass for their store! But otherwise, it was pretty much the same as all the others. I kind of feel like, if you've been to one, you've been to them all, but still a great place to eat.

reviews.name: Queen B.
reviews.review: I went to see a famous musician here, during the Songwriter's festival and I have to say, it was not the best place to enjoy music.Whether it was the line outside, the way they take the tickets, the way they herd you in and everyone fights for a seat.....Nah........  I didn't like this venue, in fact, I left early.I wouldn't go back. I would avoid this place for watching performers.

reviews.name: S S.
reviews.review: Our server was SO nice! The food was amazing and the drinks were even better!! I would eat here every chance I got if I lived close!! This is my go to restaurant for a trip to Nashville!! :)

reviews.name: Robert O.
reviews.review: I have frequented many a Hard Rock Cafe throughout the world and I can say that this experience was not one of the better ones.  My colleagues and I were in town for a conference and we decided to explore Downtown Nashville for dinner.  We originally wanted to experience Demos or BB Kings, but the line for both were very long and we were hungry.  We ended up at the Hard Rock Cafe and were seated immediately.I will say that the service was very good and friendly (never really had a problem with service during our stay in Nashville) but the quality of the food left a lot to be desired.  I was in the mood for some nachos and ordered the Nachopalooza.  My colleague ordered the spinach dip and my other colleague the potato skins.  Each of us expressed disappointment when we received our dishes as there was nothing special about any of them.  I asked for a side of salsa for my nachos and was informed that they do not have salsa - very strange.  I ordered a draft beer which was not as chilled as I would have liked, which added to the negative experience.I suppose there was a reason why the Hard Rock Cafe had immediate seating while other places in town were packed to the max.  I would not recommend this place to anyone visiting Nashville - plenty of other locations to experience the local fare.

reviews.name: Judy R.
reviews.review: Best drinks in town!  Our bar tender/ waitress Faith was fantastic...friendly, mixes the best drinks in Nashville and a great waitress too.  We each had a Jack Daniels Low Rider... Totally wonderful !! The banana-strawberry Coloda was tasty too!We had veggie burgers with salad. The burger had a huge, fresh portobello mushroom on it. The burgers were quite large and cooked  just right.  The salad was full of dried cranberries and bacon. Everyone was in costume for Halloween!!this is a 'must go' place when we are in Nashville,TN !

reviews.name: Kristina A.
reviews.review: Good visit. Food was good, drinks were good & service was good. Will be going back there!

reviews.name: Melissa K.
reviews.review: Great music, fun servers. There was about an hour wait, which we expected on a Saturday night. When you first walk in, it's really hectic and the staff seemed to be really scattered and flustered- They even forgot to give us a buzzer at first! We waited at the bar and probably should have just ordered our food to eat there, because it was a little longer than an hour wait.Once we were seated, our server was fun and gave us really good input about the menu. our ONLY complaint about the menu was that the brisket was sold out. (it was only about 7:45) They then ran out of glasses- just as I had ordered another drink. I was almost done with my meal by the time I got my new drink. You would think that a large restaurant like this would be prepared for a huge rush. Other than that, the atmosphere was fun and it was a good place to start our night.

reviews.name: Kathie L.
reviews.review: The food was really good when we got the food. It took a long time to receive the food. The waiter was very absent-minded. They did not know what they were doing as far as waiting tables. I'll food was cooked to specifications. The waiter seem to think that comedy was the way to wait tables. Apparently he was mistaken. This was an extreme disappointment.

reviews.name: Jonathon R.
reviews.review: Hair in food and waiter seemed to be in a perpetual state of highness.  I wish i had 4 hands So i could give this place 4 thumbs down!

reviews.name: Jennifer A.
reviews.review: The food was mediocre at best.  The wait was only 30 minutes for 9pm on a Saturday night and now I know why.  To add to it, the waiter had the worst B.O.  He didn't write down our order and he didn't get it right. My daughter ordered a virgin pina colada, and it took almost 15 minutes just to get that.  My mother got a caesar salad without chicken and it was about 1 1/2 cups of greens for $12.  I don't recommend this place unless you are just wanting to say you've been to Hard Rock in Nashville.

reviews.name: Lily B.
reviews.review: Pretty good meal. Nothing spectacular but nothing bad either.

reviews.name: Je'Taime C.
reviews.review: Food was awesome! The chicken mac and cheese was VERY good! Service was very good also. Good music, good food, good service..can't go wrong!

reviews.name: Monica D.
reviews.review: Not the place I would choose to stop at in the heart of Downtown Nashville but it wasn't my call and I must say, this is one of the better Hard Rock's I visited. Great setup, really nice lighting and music was great (and a bit on the loud side, which I love)I had the Hurricane, it was pretty good but too weak for my taste. I was looking for a light app and did NOT find it in the bruschetta!! Holy momma!! They give you 5 LARGE toasted bread rounds with mounds of fresh, sweet tomatoes and basil. Some of the best I've ever had...here..at a HARD ROCK! My friend had the bacon cheeseburger which was also massive and delicious.

reviews.name: Paul G.
reviews.review: Steady ship in a storm. Downpour out side and Southern Rock inside. Always have a good time, great food and awesome drinks. Haven't been in a Hard Rock in any city that disappointed us.

reviews.name: Ross M.
reviews.review: I've lived in nashville for a long time. I have always avoided the hard rock because of how other hard rocks have been.  Huge mistake.  The nashville hard rock is a great location with good food and service.  Of you want to get away from the all the country music on lower broad for a bit and have some great food.  This is the joint.

reviews.name: Charli T.
reviews.review: This place was ok. The servers and host were funny and right on us. We went here for lunch and they didn't have a lunch menu. $20 for Mac and cheese with chicken is insane, but I suppose that's what you get for eating at a chain kitschy restaurant.

reviews.name: Jeff A.
reviews.review: Got the brisket which was very good but the fries were cold and not good. When the check came lots of extra charges were added. Even after review, when the check came back again there was still extra drink charges. Waiter did not want to fix the bill. I wonder if he gets extra money by adjusting checks after customers pay. Looking back I regret leaving him a very good tip and wish I would have contacted the manager in case he had a thief working for him.

reviews.name: Jessica S.
