reviews.review: I was here for CMA fest over the past week and spend quite a few hours in here a few different days. We had Jackie as our server and let me tell you she was OUTSTANDING!! The food was decent but the service was incredible. :)

reviews.name: Emi H.
reviews.review: Situated at the edge of downtown Nashville, right next to the river lies the Hard Rock Cafe. I drove down from my hotel one evening to watch a songwriter showcase and it was packed! The restaurant is located downstairs and the stage is located on the second floor. Upstairs there's a bar on your left and a ramp which goes down to a seating area in front of the stage. It's an odd set-up that's small but I'm sure this is really great when you have an intimate gathering.As each songwriter took their turn in the round it was so much fun to people watch and see people mouth the words out loud. The Hard Rock staff did their best to service everyone and were constantly weaving their way in and out with drinks. I had a decent time here but it's tough to give it anything more than three stars. Oh and it was $10 for valet parking. Ouch.Yelp 365 Challenge: #216/365 (The Rock & A Hard Place)

reviews.name: Paul K.
reviews.review: I'm never here for the Hard Rock, so I feel that no matter what i do the review is going to be a tad skewed. I'm always here for events at the Hard Rock, so that's what I have to review. 2nd floor. VIP.The space is pretty darn nice, from an outdoor patio overlooking (well, not much honestly, but it's neat) with heat lamps (which cannot fight 25 degree weather). The staff are pretty well on it... sometimes a bit too much so.Last event I was at they were working overtime and grabbed a drink they should not have (long story, short is I was dressed overwarm and had to head outside to cool down), I told the bartender, bam, drink was restored. I do appreciate that much in a bar. They had no particular reason to believe me, but they did. I was not a big spender, I didn't look like I was going to be one either honestly.So yeah, their second floor and staff are great, which is something i think you'll only see if they've rented the place out for you, but I do not know.I generally don't go to the Hard Rock 1st floor as I am carrying nuclear weapons, and I respect their right to not serve people carrying The Bomb.

reviews.name: Ann E.
reviews.review: We've been to other Hard Rock Cafes and found them to be okay. Since we were in Music City, we thought we would give this one a try. Went for lunch. We had salads (Haystack Chicken Salad and the Smokehouse Chop Salad), both were very good. The service was excellent. We were surprised at how sparse the memorabilia on the walls was, usually the walls were packed! Certainly, should not stop you from going.

reviews.name: Huyen T.
reviews.review: It was my first time ever going to a Hard rock cafe even though there was one in Memphis but never bothered to go. This hard rock cafe is located downtown and it's very lively. Going in the restaurant, music of original Nashville roots are played and its quiet unforgettable. I ordered a grilled salmon from the menu and our food took a while to come out but I have to say...that that was the best salmon I've ever eaten and to this day, I still want to make another trip just for the salmon.

reviews.name: Marcia M.
reviews.review: My review is base on utilizing the space as an event venue as I have never actually had a meal here... although, I have heard from a few others that the veggie burger is quite tasty.The 2nd floor venue space is very versatile and spacious. It is well appointed with slick and modern furniture but balances nicely with rock and roll memorabilia. In addition to a great stage and acoustics layout, there is a beautiful outdoor deck  that overlooks Broadway, and large bar area. The staff has always been on point here and the space can be utilized for shows, receptions, parties, and much more. I have both hosted and attended events in this space and seen it utilized for a small professional lunch event to a full blown launch party with live entertainment. The Hard Rock Cafe nailed it both times...

reviews.name: Terri H.
reviews.review: Good food but too loud for conversation.Our niece was in town for her birthday and wanted to go to Hard Rock Cafe.  The musician guitars and other music memorabilia made the place pretty rockin cool.  We went on a Saturday night and the music seemed especially loud so it wasn't great for conversation and visiting.  My craving for a big ole burger and fries was definitely satisfied.  The burger was huge.  At least a lot bigger than I'm used to putting away because I couldn't finish it.  It was a pretty good dining experience except for our clueless waiter.  We had to explain everything we ordered including my glass of wine more than once.  Pinot Noir and Pinot Grigio are the same thing right?  He kept trying until he got everything correct.  Maybe he is new so we didn't let it deter us any.

reviews.name: Pagan Team Of Real Estate Pros P.
reviews.review: Awesome food awesome service.  We a very nice waitress.  I will come back and recommend this to anyone anytime.

reviews.name: Vee E.
reviews.review: Hard Rock Cafe Nashville has the best veggie burger in town. Add grilled onions and pepper jack and it's on!

reviews.name: Carie S.
reviews.review: This is a review for the 4th of July VIP and Parking area that is held as an event. The charge for VIP roof view was $65 per person and the parking area was $10 per person. I paid $50 for 4 adults and 2 children. Needless to say, both tickets were a hit and the area was packed. HOWEVER, NO one was able to see the fireworks. Many people like myself waited hours to enjoy the fireworks and were not made aware of the blocked view. When I asked for my money back, I was told that I signed a "contract" saying I understood the view would be blocked. I never signed anything of that sort and simply walked in and bought my tickets and that was the end of it. There was NO mention of the very limited view. I have pics of the "view" or lack thereof, and plan to post them on tripadvisor. I encourage you to go there and see it. Hundreds were ripped off on July 4th. I am very upset all my out of town guests were so excited to experience the 4th of July in Nashville, but were left with a bad taste in their mouth for the treatment at the Hard Rock Cafe. I wasn't the only irrate person that night. A couple dozen VIPs walked out very upset!

reviews.name: Brian C.
reviews.review: I've only experienced this Hard Rock location through the eyes of a corporate event.  I have been a guest a several events in their private room upstairs and I have to admit, it's the best private event experience in the Broadway/stereotypical-Nashville area.The space has exposed brick, a private stage and an amazing outdoor deck overlooking Titans Stadium, Broadway and SoBro.  The food for catering is really strong and filling.  I love the spicy shrimp and Thai beef skewers.  If you're a party/corporate planner, make this location your top choice for your company outing!

reviews.name: E M.
reviews.review: Above average service, exceptional memorabilia, very clean, and flavorful food with valuable portion sizes.  Biggest down falls is very little country music and no items priced under $11.  Two levels with adequate space.  Definite place to go for a drink and big meal.

reviews.name: Chris H.
reviews.review: Vegan?  They were able to confirm that the veggie burger is vegan, however they had no idea if their buns / bread options were vegan.  I had to order the burger without a bun because they were not able or willing to verify this for me.  Very disappointing.

reviews.name: Michelle F.
reviews.review: We came here twice in a four-day trip to Nashville.  The first time was just for drinks and so my friend could get her commemorative cup, and the second time was for dinner.The service the first time was really fast.  Granted, we just had drinks, but the server was attentive, friendly, and let us take pictures of his buttons for a challenge!The second time, the service was really quite slow.  The drink speed was fine (someone else brought them out to us most of the time) but it took about 45 minutes for the food to get to our table.  And the waitress took a long time to actually get the order, too.  The actual food looked good, however.  Typical Hard Rock menu!Overall, I would go back again--strong drinks, great ambiance, and my friend got her glasses.  It does have a lot less memorabilia than the other Hard Rocks I've been to, though!

reviews.name: Jackie M.
reviews.review: We had fajitas and burgers that were very good we had a great server Braz. He actually got on stage and sang with the musician that was playing.

reviews.name: Nikolai C.
reviews.review: It's the typical Hard Rock but for some reason it didn't focus upon the country music scene of Nashville. They were playing a ton of 80's songs and videos which made for a rocking night.Out waitress was fantastic. Full of personality and was more than happy to split our checks (all 12 of us) as it was a business related dinner. The drinks were made the right way but no way am I into those fruity cocktails. Make it a Jack on the rocks, a double.Food is the standard American fare but I chose the chicken lettuce wraps since I don't eat grains. Pretty good but definitely not enough lettuce to make my wraps.Overall, it's a good place for the standard food that you want. Overall, Nashville is pretty much a tourist trap city and was disappointing as a whole.

reviews.name: Lulu C.
reviews.review: Food is good.  Overpriced.  We went here because it was downtown Nashville and we are vegetarians and there were a few options for us.  Veggie burger was good.  Veggie springrolls were good.  Salad was good.  My husband enjoyed his mushroom burger.  Lots of transients nearby.  We saw one bothering guests that were eating outside.  He looked like he was selling a newspaper or something.  The guest gave him money.  We didn't sit outside for that reason.  My husband came back from the bathroom and told me there was a bum in there washing his hair.  He told the manager and the manager immediately removed him.  Three stars because it's overpriced and the bums.  I guess you are paying for the name.  The waitress was super nice.  She got a good tip from us.

reviews.name: Martin M.
reviews.review: When you think of Hard Rock, you don't necessarily think of family, but the 4 of us were traveling and it had been a while so we decided to go for it.  The staff was friendly, the food was delicious, the Mojito I had was one of the best ever, and I think because we were there early for dinner around 6pm, the place wasn't too crowded or too loud for us to enjoy a nice family dinner.

reviews.name: Nigel H.
reviews.review: Just went here to be a tourist and grab a beer, but it was awesome! The bartender was very engaging, and the atmosphere was amazing! I was by myself, and had never just gone to a bar for a beer by myself, but I felt very comfortable. Good beer, friendly bartender, how could anything go wrong?

reviews.name: Maggie C.
reviews.review: Came here after leaving another restaurant with terrible service a couple blocks away. It was late on a Saturday night and we were seated immediately. Our waitress was awesome and the food was great!

reviews.name: Terry W.
reviews.review: Not at attentive as the other Hard Rock's I have been in. The memoribella is always fun to look at. I love Guitars and they have them all over the walls.

reviews.name: Robert W.
reviews.review: Super food, super wait staff.  Noise level is high, but enjoy the experience, that is part of it.

reviews.name: Sebastien S.
reviews.review: Rockin place !

reviews.name: Megan T.
reviews.review: I thought that for a chain, this was a pretty good place to take out of towners for lunch. I LOVE the fact that the kitchen is open and you can actually see how CLEAN the kitchen is and God forbid if they drop your sammie on the floor. That is actually the first time I've ever seen that layout and surprisingly it wasn't a loud kitchen so it didn't bother the conversation at the table.I got the veggie burger and it was pretty good, just very large and I couldn't eat it all.Over all this was a good experience, and I can't think of anything bad to say!

reviews.name: Ryan S.
reviews.review: I had the red, white, and bleu burger. It was decent, but just tasted like a burger you'd grille at home. The atmosphere is unbeatable, just recommend something other than a burger! Ha

reviews.name: S B.
reviews.review: I normally wouldn't give any Hard Rock four stars.  Their food is usually bland.  This Hard Rock cooked a really good burger.  The server was very friendly.  As others have commented, this location is sort of sparse on the decorations that Hard Rocks are known for.

reviews.name: Robert R.
reviews.review: Hard rocks can be hit or miss, some are pretty good while other are very cheesy. This one ROCKS! The bartenders were great, the decor is modern, and the memorabilia was very cool. Very hard to say anything bad about this Hard Rock.

reviews.name: Justin R.
reviews.review: I would not really consider this Hard Rock to be a music venue. Sure, they have some awesome Beatles memorabilia, but that's about all it has going for it. The music venue is upstairs and is very small. I am use to the Hard Rock in Orlando, that is massive. I did really like the outdoor rooftop seating, but it might have been a little nicer on a cooler night. Our waitress was really nice, but the beer selection here is next to nothing. If your looking for a light beer then you are in luck. I just stuck to vodka for the night. Parking is a pain in the ass, but they offer valet for $10, which is not bad compared to the prices at some of the near by lots. Would I go back? Yes, if a band I really wanted to see was playing, I wouldn't think twice. But, would I stop back in just to have a drink, doubtful.

reviews.name: Aaron P.
reviews.review: Ate here after a Titans game. Arrived 5 mins before close and the staff was happy to seat us. Food was really good for a chain restaurant.

reviews.name: Rachel S.
reviews.review: So I've never been to a Hard Rock but I get the gist of what it is trying to accomplish. Touristy edgy rock feel that has some cool memorabilia on the walls. Just a warning I do not like touristy stuff to begin with so my attitude is skewed. I sat upstairs for the Music City Mayhem promotion so if you are looking at this review to get an idea of the downstairs restaurant look to another one. Upstairs is cool, wide open on the patio that has a descent view. Beer selection is mediocre, if you like run of the mill beers they have every standard one but nothing special. The food is good but highly overpriced. My friend and I shared a burger and appetizer with 2 beers which ran us a bill of nearly $50 with tip. I could see how this is a nice family restaurant with kids of all ages to be entertained by. Also the Music City Mayhem bands were terrible, they made me want to drink and not in a good way.

reviews.name: Stuart W.
reviews.review: I found this location to be the epitome of Meh-ness. This was the second stop on our friend's birthday cruise and after partying in the limo and good food and great drinks at Rumba, we were all ready to ramp the party up. Instead we came to the Hard Rock.Now don't get me wrong - its not bad. Its just not good. The drinks were were weak (perhaps they were actually a full shot, but they were so full of ice that my mojito tasted more like lime-aid than anything. The music was turned down to muzac level - in the freakin' Hard Rock? And besides the Microsoft Surface tables - which are wicked fun to play with - the ambiance of the place left all of us border and looking for the door within 15 minutes.With all the choices on lower Broadway/2nd, I'd think twice before coming in ere again.

reviews.name: Ann K.
reviews.review: I had the potato skins without the bacon. (vegetarian).. They were ok, but a little pricey. Right at the end of the main drag on Broadway.. Not much to report.. Clean restrooms.. Attentive staff..

reviews.name: Laura M.
reviews.review: Good food fun staff, a bit loud

reviews.name: Kelly W.
reviews.review: I am a fan of HRC Nashville.  The Reverb Room (music venue) upstairs has taken this establishment to another level. Being a music fan, it is always fun to visit HRCs despite their overpriced hamburgers, drinks, etc. because of the great memorabilia and vibe you get from being around it.  I was slightly appalled several years ago when I discovered this particular HRC didn't offer live music... (hello, Music City?!?!) However, since the remodel and the implementation of the Reverb Room and their second  story balcony, it has become a great way to experience 2nd & Broadway in Downtown Nashville. As far as the staff... always a blast, and great under the pressure of tourism.HRC Nashville is also involved in the community. During the remodel, the staff volunteered for Nashville's Live on the Green concert series, for Musicians on Call, and more. If you see a show is happenin' there, don't be frightened of downtown parking. Park in the Pinnicle Building deck in between 2nd & 3rd, and be sure to have HRC validate your parking at the retail area inside to receive a deeply discounted parking fee. Valet parking is also available.

reviews.name: Lorraine N.
reviews.review: Horrible horrible food----yuck---overpriced and barely edible.  I was with a group of 6 people and i tasted the twisted mac-(so not worth it and blah!) i had the goat cheese chicken sand--it was cold diced up chicken on a hard ass baggett with big chunky leaves on it ---the chicken was gross---the other gal got some type of chopped salad it appeared to be swimming in dressing---the only sensible person at the table got a burger which I would probably rather have mcdonalds for 1/8 of the price...our food all came out at different times which is really weird for a place to condone or practice.....on top of all that they forced a 18% gratuity on your bill because we had more than four people.....yeah it is safe to say hell would have to freeze over before you see me eating at a hard rock again....the best deal of the nighti WAS the valet parking for 10.00----it was the only thing that made me happy about this place-----

reviews.name: Jerry W.
reviews.review: With wife on vacation.  We decided to stop and eat at the Hard Rock because it seemed every other place along the strip was filled with smokers.  Our waiter suggested an appetizer for lunch since all their food was such large portions.  It was a wining choice.  The Jumbo sampler filled us up and we saved money.  The vibe was cool and the staff was very friendly and laid back, but they stayed professional.

reviews.name: sherry c.
reviews.review: I noticed the clientele is aging along with the hard rock--so no young people there on this particulary Sunday. But then again, I'm in my 40's, so I guess I fit in. But I got a regular cheeseburger and fries and I have to say it was one GREAT burger. It was juicy and tasty and the bun was very soft. Definitely recommend their burgers. Will go again.

reviews.name: Stephen F.
reviews.review: Kind of a let down compared to the Hard Rock in Atlanta, NYC and Baltimore.  I went at lunch which may have contributed to the "not so unique" experience you would expect from eating at a Hard Rock.  Given the fact they were flooded several months that may contribute as well.The servers were AWESOME though and I definitely got the southern hospitality you would look for in Nashville, TN!I was surprised at the weak beer selection.

reviews.name: Alden C.
reviews.review: This cafe is in a decent location downtown but by no means what I would call where the action is at. All the same it fine. Same merchandise you find at any of their other locations except the merchandise will say Nashville on them.

reviews.name: Michael T.
reviews.review: Waitress was awesome, Donna like her hair. I liked her boobs. Go figure.

reviews.name: D L.
reviews.review: We had been to the HR last weekend and our server sold us on the HR's NYE private party. We decided to go with the least expensive ticket at $75 per person since we had to buy 3. We were told we would be outside, but it would be covered, heated and have a table/seating. It would also include access to the HR Café itself and the bathrooms. Luckily we had eaten prior to arriving at the HR for NYE. We were supposed to be let in at 8pm. After waiting in line the HR security finally let us in at 8:15pm. There was a very small covered area with 2 heaters. The area where the tables/seating was not covered nor were there any heaters. There was one bar and absolutely zero wait staff. We were given 2 drink tickets, but after we used those tickets we were only allowed to order from the limited bar outside. The HR had security at every door and would not allow us into the café, the bar inside or the store. We could only go to the bathroom and then had to leave. About 15 mins before midnight I went to the bathroom again and saw they were giving out champagne to the people inside. There was none provided outside nor were we given the option to purchase a glass. This was the only time in the night there was not security at the door guarding the café, so I walked into the bar and asked the bartender if I could get a couple of glasses of champagne. He looked at me in disgust and said "yeah, if you paid for it" and walked away. My badge clearly said "club level" so he knew I was not part of the $125 ticket for inside. I was completely offended. After I had just spent $100 eating there with my family on Sunday night, then another $300 for NYE. I was treated so poorly. I wasn't asking for it for free, I would have happily purchased it. I live in Nashville and am appalled that someone in our city would treat paying customers so poorly. There were 2, yes 2 heaters outside for about 100 people. It was ridiculous. Yes, we had a great view of the main stage, and yes we didn't have to fight for a bathroom, but after spending $400 at the HR in one week I would have expected to have been treated better. I was also told that the people with the $200 tickets were unhappy because they ran out of propane for the heaters upstairs on the balcony and they said the food was nothing special. Overall we had a good time, but the "private party" was a bit disappointing.

reviews.name: Leenie S.
reviews.review: I went here on a date, it was nice, the food wasn't bad! :)

reviews.name: Patricia G.
reviews.review: I can not imagine worse service.  shames southern hospitality, is overpriced and has nothing unique to offer. KEEP ON WALKING

reviews.name: Rich F.
reviews.review: Don't waste your time here. I've been to dozens of HRC aroud the country and this is by far the worst service I've experienced. Music is way too loud.  The manager and staff have no concern for customer comfort. Our appetizers came 5 minutes AFTER our meals.  I guess the food was edible.  I know the HRC has a music theme and that the music is often loud.  But if you cant have a conversation with someone without screaming in their ear, then the music needs to be turned down a bit.  I literally had to scream in the waiter's ear to order.

reviews.name: Faithe D.
reviews.review: We came on halloween and everyone was dressed up really cute. We've also come on a Thursday and had a great waiter... Nixon! Food came out pretty fast, the kitchen didn't cook my fajita thoroughly enough tho and the veggie burger had a weird aftertaste. But our waiter made it a great experience. We'll come again!

reviews.name: carrie s.
reviews.review: Just barely ok. Food was bland and not very good.Service although good was not organized and orders were not right, other peoples dirty dished were left on our table.I wouldn't rush back there

reviews.name: Erin D.
reviews.review: In terms of Hard Rock Cafe's this is a pretty small one. They don't have a lot of room for dining and their bar is kind of squished to one side. In the middle of the restaurant they do have a stage, where I've seen several concerts. What I don't like about it is that you can probably only squeeze 75 people in front of it, comfortably. Then everyone has to move to side, which with it's set up, makes viewing difficult. The food is typical Hard Rock food, average. There have been numerous shows I've wanted to see here that I actually considered going to, but I usually don't make it because of parking and the fact that you have to wait in line forever to get a good seat. If you're just in town to see Nashville, I'd pass on this one.

reviews.name: Matthew B.
reviews.review: The location is great - the corner of an active nightlife.  I ordered an app - lettuce with onions and chicken - you like make your own sandwich.  Problem was, the chicken tasted pretty nasty, and was certainly not the best cuts.  I'm pretty sure the valet left my car running for most of my meal.  It was on track 8 when I gave it to him and when we left the restaurant, my car was running, and was on track 7...  Other than that, the interior is cool, any music fan would love it.  Lots to see.

reviews.name: Nancy M.
reviews.review: This is my second time to this location. What can I say? It's Hard Rock Cafe! Food was good. Drinks good. We spent a bunch of money but it was worth it! It's more than an restaurant, it's a destination. Just go!

reviews.name: Ben M.
reviews.review: There's nothing terribly special about the Hard Rock in Nashville. That's not to say that the experience was terrible; I just didn't see what the big deal was. Sure, there was an area where merchandise was sold, but they weren't ramming it down your throats like other campy chains do. It wasn't one of those annoying TGI Friday's experiences where servers wore annoying outfits with "flair." In fact, our server was pleasant, even when he forgot to get drinks for us (despite the lack of customers the night and time we went). My burger and beer were good, and there were no incidents that night to speak of.

reviews.name: Amanda K.
reviews.review: Not a lot to brag about here. The food was overpriced and tasted average. The coolest thing was the touch screens on the wall at the tables where you could look at memorabilia and vote on the next song choice.

reviews.name: MyBabyLove R.
reviews.review: There are so many other places to go in Nashville other than the Hard Rock Cafe. Don't go here unless you are on some sort of Hard Rock Cafe quest. I don't recommend it for anyone looking for authentic BBQ or anything more than burgers and fries. The ribs were awful. The service was mediocre at best, and the food was not that good. The interior is like all the other Hard Rock Cafes except for the added prominence of guitar greats like Merle Travis and other country pickin' fools. You will find that parking around this part of Nashville is difficult without having to pay for lot parking.

reviews.name: Adam H.
reviews.review: A friend from Buffalo told me about Wing Basket and it's been my go-to spot for wings ever since! LOVE the Cajun Country and Sweet Heat sauces and the fries don't even make it home any more! I've had wings all over Nashville and none come close to Wing Basket!

reviews.name: Cody M.
reviews.review: I'm beginning to think people who gave 5 stars clearly know nothing about hot wings or hot chicken. Ordered both last night and the only thing I have to say is... TERRIBLE!!!!  How can you get away with calling those meatless small pathetic all bone pieces of crap wings!?  Don't even get me started on the hot chicken. Order Xtra hot didn't even burn me.  Barley any drizzles on the bread or the chicken.  Meat didn't even taste good.  Go to Hattie bees, princes,  or pepper fire for people who are not posing and know what they are doing.

reviews.name: Stefanie M.
reviews.review: On a whim, hub's and I decided to get some hot chicken and fries.  Well, that was back in January (New Years Day, I believe....hangover cure!) and we have been many times since.  The only thing we've ever ordered is the hot chicken (both breast and dark) and French fries and both are incredible.  Everything is always fresh, including fresh cut fries!  Once we try about 4 or 5 more hot chicken places I might bump them up to a 5-star....just want to make sure I'm holding out for my "Best"!

reviews.name: Gaby J.
reviews.review: I love Wing Basket I always get the classic hot and plain for my son he also enjoys the wings & fries

reviews.name: Leslie R.
reviews.review: I'll start by saying my friends like this place. I do not care for it. They put sugar on the fries, eww. The chicken tenders are a no go. If you like wings,  give them a try, but don't say I didn't warn you about the fries.

reviews.name: Even P.
reviews.review: Best hot chicken in Nashville.  Real down to earth staff too. Good experience all around.

reviews.name: Rachel L.
reviews.review: First time being here, everyone was so friendly and even came over and talked to me a few minutes while I was eating. Very personable! I had ordered to go, but they smelled so good I wanted to try them before I left, and I ended up eating them all right there! Made just the way I asked and were fantastic! My go to is lemon pepper, but this time I got that and then tried the sweet heat, which is now my fave there! Will def be going back!

reviews.name: Courtney A.
reviews.review: Best wings in Nashville! The quality of chicken is so much better than Buffalo Wild Wings or Pizza Hut!(traditional or tenders!) their sauces are awesome. Sweet heat is similar to Asian zing, but so much better!If I'm not in the mood for something spicy the lemon pepper is amazing! I always get their ranch as well- definitely made fresh.  Sweet tea is A+. Love their fries with a sweet seasoning on top. Their coleslaw is surprisingly REALLY good and made fresh daily.Staff is always nice. So happy to have found this place! The food is made to order and so worth the freshness. May not be the nicest place inside to eat in, but the good is worth it to get it to go.

reviews.name: Heather B.
reviews.review: Very simple decor, which lets everyone focus on the real prize around this joint - the chicken. The fingers are humongous. The sauces offer something for everyone without being too numerous to choose from. And the seasoning on the fries is savory with just the right amount of sweet. Easy in, easy out, tasty eats. I come here almost every time I'm in the area.

reviews.name: Victoria S.
reviews.review: Just had to make a review... thinking about hot wings! Lol!Anyways I've been here numerous times and it's always good here! I always get wings covered in hot and sweet heat. Yum! Perfect combination, along with what I like to call their "sugar fries" soooo addicting! There are various sauces you can choose from depending on your tastes. Ranch is great and creamy at an additional cost! Daily specials from Monday-Thursday! With Monday night as traditional wing night and Wednesdays, boneless wings... my bf's personal favorite! I have seen their chicken tenders and man they are huge! Staff here are quite obnoxious in ways due to a well known team goofing around and  working the evening shifts of all the times I've been here but nonetheless that does not seem to bother me, they are humans! I just come here for the wings and fries! Their drink area could use a little more cleaning, it's always sticky when I come here and their tables too. All you do is just leave your trash of food behind and the employees come pick and clean it up afterwards. Overall, great wings and fries, my favorite!

reviews.name: David O.
reviews.review: I wanted to like Wing Basket a lot more than I did.  The guy behind the counter was very nice and answered all of our questions, so bonus there.  Maybe it was because we had been going around and having lots of other wings at lots of other places though, these just turned out to be.. well.. bland.  It does seem like they do a great lunch business, and we didn't have to wait too long for our order.  There is also ample parking, and a good deal of room inside to sit down but overall I just didn't taste much in the way of Oomph from these wings. (I had the Honey Mustard & Jack Daniel sauces)One other thing on the plus side, they apparently bus the tables for you. We looked (rather awkwardly) for a trash can on the "Customer" side of things and the only one we could find was outside.So overall I give this place an A-OK because the service was good, but for the wings, unless I just got the WRONG sauces just didn't seem to have much in the way of taste.

reviews.name: Allison B.
reviews.review: I really like Wingbasket. It's close to my apartment, it's cheap, consistent and delicious. Everything is made to order so if you are in a hurry I would call in your order ahead of time. I have tried the wings and the chicken fingers. You should know that the chicken fingers are huge. I usually get 3 and take the other 1.5 as lunch the next day. And bonus they are $1.25 on Tuesdays. The wings are perfectly cooked to a delicious crisp and still juicy on the inside. I have tried several of their sauces and I like the sweet heat the best. Its just awesome. One huge bonus is the french fries. They are fresh and have a seasoning that has sugar in it. We call them sugar fries and they are just wrong. Its the combo of sweet and salty that dreams are made of. Get the sugar fries. The staff is super friendly and always willing to answer any questions and give suggestions on what to try.

reviews.name: Lyle P.
reviews.review: When I lived in Texas my friends took me to Wing Stop. I loved it.Since moving to Nashville, I've been looking for a good wing place and Wingbasket is solid. The food is prepared the same as Wing Stop.I work right around the corner so it's an easy go-to for lunch.I've been there more times than I've checked in and each time the wings have been consistent.You're going to wait at least 10 minutes to get your food. It takes at least that long to cook up wings. The fries do have sugar on them, but they grew on me and I now really enjoy them.Ranch is an extra 69 cents, but it's enough for 10 wings.All in all, this place is great. I would give it 4.5 stars. Try the Garlic Parmesan!

reviews.name: Carey James B.
reviews.review: Simply THE BEST wings in Nashville . Period. Damn good!

reviews.name: Daniel B.
reviews.review: Food: meh.Ambience: meh.Service. meh.In a pinch for some wings on a Monday? Grab some of these forty-nine cent special wings! The chicken fingers were not good in terms of texture and the "nuggets" were just cut up pieces.The Mild and Medium sauces are just okay.The fries have sugar on them and I didn't care for that at all!

reviews.name: L Dante G.
reviews.review: I love Wingbasket much more than Wing Stop. I've seen some pretty discouraging reviews and I'm really not sure why. It's a chicken wing joint. The fries are dope (yes they're sugared, but I dug it immediately), and the available sauces are wonderfully savory. The ace in the hole here is the fact that they have hot chicken. Quite honestly, I think it's their best kept secret as it is mad hot, rivaling Prince's.  That makes the southside's second hot chicken joint. If you're into hot chicken, definitely give this joint a shot.

reviews.name: Bob B.
reviews.review: The Staff was really really nice. Keep up the great work. First time there, ordered the hot, and they were perfectly hot, just the right bite in spice. I like things hot, but not too hot. If you eat 3-4 in row, you'll get that nice burn. They actually made a mistake and dropped a few more wings in my order and told me it was my lucky day, and it sure was, I could not stop eating them. I will be back. Hope the wings are consistent.  And those who did not like, they are wings, not steak. They are good.

reviews.name: Bryan B.
reviews.review: I like their wings. I think that this place is as good as BWW's and cheaper. I got a 20 piece boneless. The Kentucky Bourbon flavor is good if u like sweet. Unless you just really really like ultra spicy do not try the son of tnt or tnt. I would go with classic hot.

reviews.name: Simon K.
reviews.review: Honestly, has anybody found a wing place so unique that it blows everything else out of the water?  (If so, message me please)You got Buffalo Wild Wings and every other local wing place.  They all pretty much have the same fried wings and 20 or so flavors.  So when it comes to wing places, it's NOT about how unique they are (b/c they're not); it's about how well they can execute their food.  The wings are cooked to order, so they're not fast.  Unless you're at Chili's or Applebee's, where they have your wings pre-cooked and frozen, you should expect to wait a little bit for your wings to come to you.They also offer a Hot Chicken that's comparable to Prince's or Bolton's.  One thing I've learned about Hot Chicken in Nashville is that they're always in sketchy locations.  Wing Basket is the least sketchy of all Hot Chicken joints.  The service is pleasant and worth the trip.

reviews.name: Michelle P.
reviews.review: I do love their wings. I am usually just get two flavors. The Lemon Pepper & the Garlic Parmesan. I always get great service from whomever is working in the restaurant. I did not give five stars because sometimes the chicken is too greasy and doesnt have any flavor. This is not every time I go but just happened on a few occasions.

reviews.name: Danny E.
reviews.review: There was a night a week or two ago that I had the most annoying craving for wings... ever. I say this because when I used to live in NoVa, there was a Buffalo Wild Wings within a short drive from my house; the nearest here is definitely a trek.Since this place was literally two miles from my house, I thought it was worth a try. Emphasis on the word "thought."I'd gotten 10 boneless wings to go; 5 wet/5 dry. I can't necessarily remember the flavors I'd picked, but the point was less about the flavors and more about how it was prepared: the oil. There was TOO MUCH oil in the sauce. It wasn't even sauce in my opinion. Which is a shame because if the ratios were better, it could've been pretty kickass.Their "sugared" fries were also semi-decent. That's one of their trademarks - I assume - but didn't really deliver for me. I was disappointed overall with the quality of everything; one problem can be overlooked, but several needs to be noted.I'll just have to reserve my wing cravings for the 30 minute drives to BWW instead.

reviews.name: CeeCee R.
reviews.review: I went to Wingbasket for the first time yesterday, and although the decor of this "strip mall" store front is nothing to shout about, their wings are scrumptious!  Lemon Pepper Wingbasket wings have that wonderful citrus-ly zing and that spice that gives your mouth that kick you crave.  Plus they are crunchy on the outside and juicy on the inside.  I can't stand a soggy wing or and hard overcooked wing.  These were perfection in a box!  I ordered 10, but really... I could have eaten 30 of those bad boys in one sitting.  BUT it isn't all about the wings!  I've been searching for a place that can pair good wings with a basket of crispy, perfectly seasoned fries since I moved to Nashville.  I have had order after order of the most disappointing fries in this area, and unfortunately, I did not enjoy the fries from Wingbasket.  I didn't even finish eating them.  The reviews of their sweet and salty fries did intrigue me, so I did know ahead of time.  But my fries were soggy, greasy, and way too sweet.  My husband's fingers were slick and shiny after diving into his fries.  Seems he couldn't find a napkin fast enough.  We also tried their hot chicken, and it was so dry on the inside that I couldn't finish that either.  Lastly- the infamous chicken tenders.  THEY WERE HUGE!  And so juicy and delicious!  WOW!  If only their hot chicken had that moistness!  ANYWAY!  The staff was friendly and were all smiles.  (I kinda thought the cook in the back was cute, but didn't say so... lol)  And they were pretty busy, so that shows how popular they are in the area.  In conclusion- Essay- I am giving Wingbasket 3 stars because their wings and their chicken tenders were off the charts delicious!  I will definitely be going back!  But I couldn't stomach their fries or dry hot chicken.

reviews.name: Howard L.
reviews.review: Simon K....your reviews are so wrong. Like every time. This place totally blows. Super small wings with revolting sauces. They put sugar on their fries. Disgusting.

reviews.name: Sherie B.
reviews.review: We have been to the Wing Basket on Nolensville several times now and have been very satisfied with the food and the service every time. Everything is cooked and prepared to order so you do wait a little bit but it is worth it. When I want them for carry out, I call ahead and they are ready when I get there. We have only eaten the wings (several flavors - lemon pepper is the best!!) and celery/carrots and dressing. The people who work in the kitchen and behind the counter are super friendly! We took a large group in last night and everyone enjoyed the food and kept commenting on how nice the employees were.As mentioned in another review, the chicken "fingers" are actually "planks!" Wow! They are huge! We took a lot of leftovers home with us! I did taste a couple of the french fries from someone's order at my table and do not care for the sugar that is part of the seasoning but I don't like sugar so you can't really judge by that. It is a salty/sweet seasoning. Interesting!Try for yourself!! You won't be disappointed if you like non-breaded wings!!

reviews.name: pauline s.
reviews.review: each visit seems to get worse.their wings are "OK"  nothing special.just another wing place, i thinkthe last visit was on a friday, after lunch.i know there are NO specials on friday.but i thought i'd stop in to the MADISON location while in the McHenry Shopping Center.  the owners insist on working themselves.  the woman at the counter told me 10 minutes.  a group of 3 in front of me.ok.  i took my wares to my car and came back inside.  sat on the bench.while waiting, there must have been 15-20 people come in for late lunch.she told them all 10 minutes.  the old man in the back and another lady were cooking.  NO SENSE OF URGENCY while the orders stacked up.moved slower than a freight train while you're waiting.Finally, 25 minutes later, my SIMPLE order of ONLY 10 wings, mild, were ready.REALLY ?!!!  cooking each order one at a time.............if you go for lunch, plan on spending half your lunch hour waiting on your food.BWW is run like a corporate restaurant.  and for lunch, that is a plus.it will be awhile before i give my hard earned $$ back to WingBasket.

reviews.name: L D.
reviews.review: Great wings; large portions and great service!My only drawback is there isn't a location anywhere near west or central Nashville (hence the 4 star rating).  Other than that... They're the best we've had since living in Nashville (1.3 years)!

reviews.name: Jason E.
reviews.review: I don't care at all about wings, but I love this place's tenders. On Tuesdays they're only 99 cents each. I come here every Tuesday from work, and if I didn't work nearby I would probably drive. The tenders are huge, delicious, and come with a variety of tantalizing sauces. The Kentucky Bourbon is pretty good, but I prefer the Sweet BBQ.

reviews.name: Katie S.
reviews.review: Perfect place to have a late lunch. Three of us stopped in around 1:00 on a weekday for a lunch between appointments. I was very happy how fast the service was without feeling like it was rushed. Our waitress was outstanding; she was helpful in answering questions & offering suggestions, she was courteous and attentive. The food was excellent. House salads came out quickly followed (with perfect timing) by our entrées: Ginger chicken & broccoli, almond & cashew chicken, and The Buddha's Feast (for the vegetarian). All of us were happy with our meal choices. The lunch portions were large but the prices were not, so that was great. The restaurant was clean & comfortable. The one & only drawback is the parking which can be hellacious no matter what time of day you visit, but that's anywhere on West End so it's to be expected. All in all, we had a great time & we'll be back soon.

reviews.name: Lisa V.
reviews.review: P.F Changs was at one point, my favorite restaurant as far as chains go.  About 3 years ago, I started noticing changes but still kept going hoping it was a one-time thing but after today, I won't be going back.  Honestly, Panda Express has better food, cheaper prices and they get my to-go orders right.As I said, several years ago, I noticed the food was just not as good as it used to be. Our favorite dish was changed and there were no veggies in it anymore.  Today was the 2nd time in a row that I've ordered a to-go order and they got it wrong.  I had to drive all the way back to get my order right and no one offered to comp at least one of the entrees for my trouble.  When I called to let them know the order was wrong, I got excuses instead of just an "I'm sorry".  Once we got home and started to eat our dinner, it was just bad.  The meat was so tough and sinewy that we just chewed and chewed and chewed.  It was so overcooked.  The sauce was so salty....it felt like I was eating warmed up beef jerky.  This was a $57 order...I could've gone to Stoney River or Maggiano's and had a really great meal for that price.If I'm craving Chinese-American, I'll eat at Panda Express.  I've eaten there a half-dozen times and it is always good, fresh and the meats are tender.  Good-bye, P.F. Changs...my 12 year affair with you is over....$57 for a really bad meal is ridiculous in this day and time...Nashville is full of wonderful restaurants with really good foodat your same prices.  I feel like you are resting on your laurels and letting quality take a back seat.

reviews.name: Sheena T.
reviews.review: I used to like P.F. Chang's....but maybe that was before my palate developed and/or Nashville was bombarded with such other amazing restaurants. Whatever the case, when I stopped in for a family lunch on Sunday I was so underwhelmed. We started with the lettuce wraps, one chicken, one veggie. An appetizer I remember liking in the past. This time around, it was more water chestnuts than chicken! Do not like. I split the cucumber side dish and chicken paid thai with my mom. The chicken pad thai was not good. No fish sauce, the noodles were all wrong. Then we asked for it very spicy and it wasn't spicy at all. Complete let down. The cucumbers were in a soy sauce and tasted strangely. Huh??My dad got the Mao Pau (sp?) tofu.... the tofu had sauce on it and was fried, but there was hardly any flavor. The broccoli had zero seasoning. It was just steamed and bland. I really didn't enjoy anything that I ate here. Plus they no longer mix the three sauces at your table like they once did. The only redeeming part of the meal was our server who was attentive and did a good job with us.

reviews.name: Jay R.
reviews.review: We came for a birthday lunch and had Great experience, great food and great service!  I had pork dim sum and stir fry eggplant.  The dim sum was good but the eggplant was terrific.  Crispy outside and soft inside with a sweet and lightly spicy sauce, it was delicious.  They are so consistent it's hard to have a bad experience and this one did not disappoint!

reviews.name: Simon T.
reviews.review: I'm not gonna lie.It might feel like Applebees,but this stuff is good.

reviews.name: Kim P.
reviews.review: I have been to many P.F. Changs before, and am pretty savvy in picking healthy choices.  This is a pit difficult in chain restaurants and especially "Americanized Chinese".   We were attending a Vanderbilt basketball game at 5, so I made a reservation for 7:30 ( a must on a weekend? As the wait for a walk-in was over an hour - and I refuse to wait that long for food) .  We arrived a few minutes early and were seated within 5 min.  We knew ahead of time we wanted the lettuce wraps and were thrilled that they offered a "steamed" version ( versus wok fried) of several dishes.   We choose the ginger chicken and broccoli and splurged on a vegetarian fried rice.  We loved that the ginger chicken came with the sauce on the side, as it was very sweet and we just dribbled it on to get the taste.... Chicken and broccoli, was just steamed, no seasoning, so it needed a bit of sauce.  We ordered a bottle of 14 Hands Merlot ( reasonable at $28, but probably $11 bottle at any store)".   Overall a nice and convent way to end a fun evening,,. Nothing over the top, but better than fast food.  We don't typically go to chain restaurants in Nashville... Just too many other great places to go, but this was close by and we had a gift card!

reviews.name: Tyler B.
reviews.review: I love everything on PF Chang's menu. My favorites are the chicken lettuce wraps (of course), Chang's spicy chicken, hot fish, and lo mein.The service is always decent, and they have a pretty good wine list. I only take away a star because they have wine on tap, but the tap is always mysteriously broken or malfunctioning every time I go to this location. I know wine on tap sounds cheap and gross, but it's actually really good, and it is a couple dollars less than their average glass of wine. I'm not sure if the tap is genuinely always not working or if the server is just trying to increase their check average. Either way, it's annoying.

reviews.name: Tim S.
reviews.review: Beef Sichuan was tougher and drier than some beef jerky I've had.  They no longer start you with sauces at the table, you have to request them.  Sauces may or may not arrive while your food is still hot.

reviews.name: Chris D.
reviews.review: Service was nice, the food was good ,atmosphere was fantastic, I gladly recommend this place anytime I'm in Nashville again

reviews.name: Donghua S.
reviews.review: Really? Does anyone really think this is Asian food?  You are kidding.  Do not, under any circumstances, order the Mapo Tofu.  I have lived in Chinese cultures all over Asia for many, many years.  I can certify that NO ONE on the planet except P.F. Chang's makes mapo tofu this way.  The P.F. Chang's version brought to mind the early days in the interior of China when Chinese cooks used to think Italian spaghetti was noodles with ketchup on them.  I will never return to this place.

reviews.name: Krista M.
reviews.review: I go for the gluten free options, but quality is not always at the top. Pei Wei is better, but doesn't have as many gluten free options. Staff is average at best... For the prices I expect more overall.

reviews.name: Kara R.
reviews.review: Really confused about the hype for this place. Ordered the two dinners with soup, appetizer, entrée, and dessert for $40 and it was good, but not incredible and I wouldn't say any better than your favorite (and cheaper) Chinese buffet. The water didn't taste very fresh, but the Long Island Ice tea was tasty.

reviews.name: Alexandra F.
reviews.review: Consistently delicious Chinese. I always order the kung pao chicken or shrimp. Always the same. Always tasty and spicy. This location was very big and nice. Our server was crackin a lot of jokes so that was pretty entertaining.

reviews.name: Beth G.
reviews.review: Another chain review. I really don't like to do this, so will specify, just this location bc different owners, different experience. This one has been around since 2000 or possibly 1 year earlier, not exactly sure. We used to eat at the bar because always crowded. These days can get a table relatively, but bar is still fun. We always have the lettuce wraps...well because they are the best ever. And really, the original. I don't recommend Lunch portions. Small and more rice. Get the dinner and take some home. I was disappointed when we bought lunch and thought...man for a few dollars more, we could almost have 2 times the portion and that is dinner and next day lunch. Yes you heard me right. I love love love their chicken noodle like soup. Their noodles are a white noodle and they look like bamboo shoots. These are not bamboo shoots so they are carbs. But whatever... it is great chicken soup for 8 or 9 dollars. If soup is not your go to, their eggplant dish is sooo good for vegetarians. Their Black pepper shrimp is wonderful and the the Kung Pow is also our go to.  They have Dan Dan noodles too. All favorites. We also have had their Tuna Sashimi. Save that for  your Japanese rest. visit, unless you really need some. Also the dumplings. You can get those at the grocery and they are good, but spend your money where you can't get it somewhere else. They used to have a corking thing where if you  bought some wine and did not finish it, you could take it home. I don't know if they do that anymore. That was about 7 years ago when we heard about it. Most servers are extremely knowledgeable. If you don't like one. ask for another .The managers are very good. Bathrooms were clean. Parking...hmmm...either circle, park on the street or go to the garage. The parking lot is NOT easy, but have faith, someone is always pulling out. They have a great kids menu too! My son usually orders 3 of them and it still is a deal.

reviews.name: Ian R.
reviews.review: It has been a while since we tried P.F Chang's and being downtown decided to go for lunch, we arrived early just after 11 and seated immediately. I think we fell victim to the early lunch team as sadly our lunch fell very short of expectations. Lobster Tacos on the pairing menu come out as penny sized deep fried pieces of "something" that only tasted like deep fried pieces of "something" no dressing and very poorly assembled and not worth the $10.00 tag. Chicken Satay very tasty but served minus the skewers (they had ran out) and peanut sauce very thin. Soda and water only plus an appetizer of fried green beans all for $32.00 plus tip just not value for money. Management - hopefully dinner service is better but lunch service did not serve you well.

reviews.name: Brian M.
reviews.review: Picked up lunch - ordered online Great spicy chicken and Kung pao chickenAnd egg rolls order 10 sauces and got a qt container wow - I'm taking the chili sauce home mmmmm

reviews.name: Alex P.
reviews.review: This was actually my first PF Chang's experience and I've gotta say... its a little overrated.  Its not exactly what I thought it would be.  For one thing, the inside was a really cool hangout and it kind of looked upscale?  I wasn't actually expecting that.  But on the downside, the food wasn't cheap (about $10/ dish and if you're a pig like me, you'll get 2 or 3 dishes so its not the stereotypical Chinese food restaurant that you might think of).  Also, the food was really salty and obviously mainstream/ Americanized stuff.  Either way, I enjoyed it.  I got the eggplant in black bean sauce and ginger and the beef lo mein.  I walked out pretty happy.

reviews.name: Lacey F.
reviews.review: I'm probably the only Nashvillian who hadn't eaten at P.F. Chang's up until two weeks ago, but you'll have to forgive me because I was too poor to eat there before I moved to Canada (to whom I must give thanks for paying me a living wage). I listened to acquaintances goo and gush over the menu, wondering what the hell was so special about a place with pan-Asian cuisine. On a personal level, I wonder no longer, yet I'm still no closer to understanding what all the to-do was about. A friend and I arrived at about 7 p.m. on a Wednesday night. The restaurant was busy, but not full, and we were seated almost immediately. I knew something was weird when servers kept stopping by the neighboring table. It didn't take long for them to start sitting down and chumming with the table's occupants, who I'm pretty sure were fellow servers off the clock. If you've ever worked in a restaurant, you should have some idea that it's not kosher to sit down at a friend's table when you're on the floor, and that it's totally inappropriate to help yourself to bites of their food and sips of their drinks. And the incessant up-down, down-up was supremely annoying. Our own server wasn't fraternizing with them, thankfully, and he mitigated the behavior of his annoying co-workers. He kept our glasses full and our meals straight (without an order pad). I had a forgettable drink (a margarita?--you'd think I'd be able to remember something like that, seeing as I only had one), then some passable spring rolls, which, based on the menu's description, I expected to be fresh and raw rather than fried. I had the seared ahi tuna salad, which was tasty, but again, nothing mind-blowing, and tried my friend's cucumbers (also tasty). I hadn't eaten anything extraordinarily bad (save the spring rolls), but I was left with a lethargic food hangover, which makes me think there was fat and sugar hiding in everything else I ate.In sum, far from the worst dining experience I've ever had, but also far from the best. At $70 for two appetizers, a salad, a side, and three drinks, I think I'll pass in the future (or let someone else pay).

reviews.name: Eric D.
reviews.review: I love P.F. Changs.  However,  there was an experience here that may have forever ruined my love for this place. I came in with my girlfriend in the afternoon for lunch.   It took a little while for our server,  Niccole, to come over.   We just got the calamari and the lettuce wraps.Our table was situated so that we had a direct view to the kitchen. We waited for almost 15 minutes for the food.   While we were waiting,  we watched Niccole brush food off the one table with her hand into her other hand.   Then she immediately went back and grabbed the lettuce for our wraps WITH HER HANDS.  Obviously,  this ruined our appetite.   She brought the food over and must have seen the look on our face because she asked if everything was ok.   We didn't know what to say. She immediately went back and got more lettuce,  this time she used the tongs!  Why didn't she use those for ours? ?  She then brought that lettuce to our table,  saying just in case we needed some extra.   Yes,  we could use some "extra. "Needless to say we only ate the second batch of lettuce. Overall,  not a good experience.

reviews.name: Anna J.
reviews.review: Mediocre Americanized Chinese food... the quality of the dishes has gone down from say 5 years ago.portion sizes are a lot smaller, and the food is always cooked in a ton of oil and grease! Yes, I'm a snob and a bit more harsh on Chinese restaurants, bc I am always comparing it to my mommy's cooking! At least the atmosphere is good.  But I would come here unless I have to (when its other people's choice for an event).

reviews.name: Lauren L.
reviews.review: I really do like this place. I've never had a bad experience- my waiter/waitress has always been very friendly, and the food has always been delicious. It is definitely not authentic Chinese food! However, it tastes great and isn't overly greasy, which I love. There are only a couple of negative things I can really say:1) Ladies (or gentlemen) that are working as a host/hostess in the front, get off your friggin' phone while you are at work! It's really rude and immature!2) The portion sizes are very small for what you pay. I really think that for a $14 entree you should get more food than they do give you. However, I guess you're paying for ambiance or some such nonsense...  I wouldn't make this my go-to for Chinese, but sometimes it's nice to change it up with some of the unique items on P.F. Chang's menu. My bf (who is, by the way, Chinese) and I quite like this restaurant.

reviews.name: Gail D.
reviews.review: Never again!  I visited on 4/6/15 for dinner.  This is a neighborhood restaurant for me and I have been here on many occasions.  At this dinner I had water to drink.  I ordered a bowl of hot and sour soup so I would have leftovers to take home.  The soup was delicious.  My entree was spicy scallops and shrimp.  The entree was a small serving.  My rice was brought to the table when the other people at the table were receiving their appetizers.  My entree tasted of nothing but salt.  My bill was $36.  There were 5 in our party.  The service was haphazard.  Items were served in no sequence whatsoever.  And I won't be back.  There are too many Chinese restaurants in Nashville that have better food for a much better price.

reviews.name: Tulané H.
reviews.review: It took us 30 minutes to receive our appetizer. We watched as literally every table around us received their appetizers, drinks, and entrees and we just waited. Our food finally arrived 45 minutes later. Poor service, poor quality of food, and overpriced. Never. Again.

reviews.name: Nickie G.
reviews.review: I have never been to PF Chang's before this past week.  I am not sure why, it just never comes up.  But my coworker wanted to do her birthday lunch there so off we went.So obviously it is a chain and I am sure all the food is delish but HOLY MOTHER OF GOD have you looked up the nutritional info on the food at this place?  Look it up.  Think you are being healthy with that dish that is basically chicken, broccoli, and rice?  Nope you are eating 800 calories.  If you get a vegetarian dish, try 1000 calories.  I'm just saying WHAT THE FUCK ARE THEY PUTTING IN THIS FOOD?  I couldn't get over that and it clouded my entire opinion of this place.  Granted it is for the entire dish so if you take half home then it isn't as bad....but a lot of people eat more than half (or all of it) so they are getting screwed if they think they are being healthy.So I got some duck spring rolls that were on the summer menu and some hot and sour soup which together came out to a reasonable 420 calories.  I just didn't want to blow the diet on this stuff that didn't sound as appetizing to me as a hole in the wall joint.  I really liked the hot and sour soup.  Duck rolls were ok.  I just can't really get into spring rolls overall.  Not their fault, just preference.I know, I'm being way harsh, but damn.  Some good things included the really nice waiters, super helpful, kinda young and flirty, we loved the guy.  The restaurant itself is really sleek and nice inside.  Patio seating available.  For my money, and definitely for these calories, I'm going to get some fried chicken or a burger or some non-chain Asian food.

reviews.name: Haley V.
reviews.review: When you're stuck in your old home cookin' ways, don't you dare forget this place exists! Eating here is always the right decision; Always excellent service, great food and calming atmosphere. Don't even get me started on leftovers- OMG. They are just as good as the day ordered it (prepared right of course!)

reviews.name: Sophia S.
reviews.review: After being seated it took a little while-as in 10 minutes-until the waiter came around for our drink order. Luckily we had plenty of time to figure out what we wanted to eat because drinks didn't come for another 5-10 minutes. When our food finally arrived we noticed all the silverware on our table was dirty. I ordered the pad Thai, which came more spicy than asked and very oily. Pad Thai isn't oily. It would have been easier to eat if my water was refilled, but I only received one refill on my greatly needed water. All in all I feel generous giving 2 stars.

reviews.name: Rachel M.
reviews.review: I've dined here once before and was very pleased - even on a "bad" date! Zeph was my server and all was well-attended. Tonight, I read the Yelpers before coming just for kicks and giggles - everyone is entitled to their opinion and especially on Yelp. But we all know there are lots of disgruntled douchebags out there.. This evening I sat at the bar and was very well-attended by Lynn and Haven. I ordered Ahi Tuna Tartare, Edamame, and a cup of Hot & Sour Soup - all of which was good but I won't be revisiting the soup. Apparently it's loaded with sodium which I hear is bad for you but so are douchebags. I should add that I've been in hospitality for 20 years and have reasonable but high standards and I'm a pleased customer! Cheers y'all

reviews.name: Sally L.
reviews.review: Iike the menu and the dishes they offer . BUT,  their dishes are on the salty side and it over takes flavors .  ( sodium)   Offering chop sticks is a plus as soon as you sit down . Friendly staff .  Must try if you haven't .

reviews.name: Diana S.
reviews.review: I could be wrong, but I doubt General Tso served his chicken in a bistro.P.F. Chang's is Americanized chain food. As long as you know this going into your meal and are ok with that, then you can have a decent experience, although I feel the prices reflect the upscale interior decor more than the actual food and I have to wonder why you would choose to pay more for mediocre, dumbed-down food when there are so many good, inexpensive ethnic restaurants in town offering the real deal.I believe the actual "chain-ness" of the place is the answer to my question. The menu caters to all needs and desires: there are items that are gluten-free, vegetarian, spicy, not spicy, kid-friendly and, as I said, the food is Americanized so there will be no crazy surprises. All that, and a choice of several chocolate desserts and Key Lime pie? What more could you ask for?So, what it boils down to is that P.F. Chang's is the place to go when you have group of people you might not know very well, who have differing tastes, e.g. a work get-together. Oh, and BTW - the parking sucks.

reviews.name: Jesse Q.
reviews.review: Well the service was off tonight I had to pour my own Bottle Water and the Deserts are Frozen.  When I inquired about it (deserts) no answer from the waiter I ask to find out if they were frozen or not.he came back to advise they will chilled. .meaning frozen I asked the quest again at the check in I was told because Frozen is Good..I laughed and advised them Frozen is never good..

reviews.name: Andy S.
reviews.review: PF America ???? There was no Chinese people anywhere nowhere to be seen in a Chinese restaurant lol now that's funny, and they still want you to eat with chop sticks

reviews.name: Matthew J.
reviews.review: The drinks were very much worth the money and the food was tasty as always.  I had the Spicy Ahi Tuna Roll and A bowl of hot and sour soup ( to share of course!) I love the atmosphere and the friendly staff I do want to point out that the guy behind the counter up front remembered me from last time I came which was months ago.  Parking is a nightmare so make sure you have reservations if you do valet let them know you have reservations so they'll treat you good.  It bothered me a bit that the valet service treated me like a child until I let them know I had reservations. This is the only reason I didn't give the 5th star.

reviews.name: Samuel E.
reviews.review: This is exactly what you would expect from large scale chain dining. Friendly service, very generic menu. Very mediocre/average taste.Just very ordinary.

reviews.name: Dan W.
reviews.review: The food seems a little overpriced for the amount and quality you get.I'm getting a little tired of finding cartilage (or something else that's hard and gross) in my chicken.This location has a pretty nice dining environment, a bar and outside seating.My service has been good overall, when they've made mistakes they've compensated appropriately.

reviews.name: Jenn C.
reviews.review: I'm a bit prejudiced when it comes to big chain restaurants - I had been to PF Chang's in the past, years ago, and wasn't impressed with the quality of the food.  It was, in my mind, on par with Cheesecake Factory for mediocrity.When looking for lunch - and vegan protein seems to be a rather elusive concept in Nashville, I figured PF Chang would at least be able to serve me some danged tofu, right?  That's all I asked at the front - "Do you have tofu?"  -- the host who seated me at the bar recommended the spicy Mapo Tofu -- and I was very impressed,  Great flavors in the sauce and way more broccoli than I could eat with about 12-14 oz of cubed silken tofu. I also ordered the spicy green beans which were just as good as any I might get at a decent Northern Chinese restaurant in the Bay Area.  Service was fantastic -- the atmosphere was very cordial and laid back - there were several regulars there, and it was a pretty good lunch for about $20.  Not bad at all!

reviews.name: Anthony T.
reviews.review: WOW! For a Friday night we got great service even with our bartender dry attitude.  Maybe he was tired or not friendly but his service was really good.The food was really, really good. We just happened to be in the area with to me friends for a birthday outing and stopped by fir dinner. We normally visit the other location in the area because it's closer to home. I would highly recommend!

reviews.name: George K.
reviews.review: Disappointing. Chengdu Lamb not on menu anymore. No unflavored black tea. WHAT!? Noisy, drafty, unwelcoming. Hot sour soup tasted burnt, with no other flavor. I'll stop before main course arrives,  I'm bringing myself down with this review.  Truth be told, I seldom eat at chain restaurants. PF Chang used to be one exception. Not any more. Zai jian Chang xian sheng!

reviews.name: Marshall C.
reviews.review: NO AIR-CONDITIONING,,,you gotta be kidding me.   Parking here is bad enough but I'm sitting here now trying in vain to enjoy my dinner and it probably 80 plus degrees here

reviews.name: FoodCritic 6.
reviews.review: Good service! Good food! Love the chicken lettuce wrap. The dessert has a big variety of different choices love it. Especially the Great Wall of chocolate!

reviews.name: Joe M.
reviews.review: Gluten Free friendly. I love to eat hear. I am gluten free and this is one of the best places to grab a meal. The place was very busy so it took a little bit to get our food, but it was good when we received it. i am a major fan of P.F Chang's Food is always good.

reviews.name: Matt R.
reviews.review: Holy cow.  Talk about game on - Not!  Love, love, love PF Changs for over 15 years.  This kitchen is messing up by switching products and not realizing it until enough customers complain (fried shrimp dumplings with the wrong dumpling wrapper - apologetic management realized that).  S&P prawns comes out without the second main ingredient.  So, our two favorite items were less than 50% satisfactory.  But to really make it hurt was the cockiness of our waitress always asking "foods good! right?" While briskly walking past our table.  Never bussed.  This was not a nice evening. Huge disappointment because we love PF Changs, and chose a family celebration over a local restaurant

reviews.name: Melanie C.
reviews.review: Love this place! Great food, excellent service, great atmosphere.Tried the pad thai (exquisite!) and the Ma Po Tofu (very good), but I haven't ventured out more through their menu. The pad thai is too good to not order it every time!

reviews.name: jacki R.
reviews.review: This place a great place to go with a date or friends . But make your reservations ahead of time . I love their Kung pow chicken and the get a bowl of the hot and sour soup to share . The prices are reasonable also

reviews.name: Sunny R.
reviews.review: Free valet!  Which was great because it was 100 degrees and super crowded.  This is located in a cute little strip mall anchored with a Marriott at one end and one of the few remaining Barnes and Noble Bookstores at the other end.  This was one of the friendliest locations I've ever been too.  And they must do a great business because they were packed.I sat at the bar and began with the crispy green bean appetizers.  Two women seated next to me asked about them and I ended up sharing with them.  They became big fans of this appetizer too.  The long green beans lightly battered in tempura are as addictive as potato chips.  The dipping sauce served with them is spicy and makes this a flavorful appetizer.  And the portion is large so it's nice to share.  And, the bartender also let me know that leftovers can be warmed on a cookie sheet in the oven and they crisp right up ;)I couldn't decide between the Coconut Curry Vegetables and the Kung Pao Scallops.  So I got both!  And both were delicious.  The Coconut Curry Vegetables were delicious.  Green beans, red bell pepper, onion, carrots, mushrooms and tofu in a delicious coconut curry sauce.  The Kung Pao Scallops come in a lunch portion that is the perfect portion.  These scallops were spicy and flavorful and all coated in the Kung Pao sauce.  Beware the red peppers in this dish - HOT!  They no longer have the Blackberry Green Tea on the menu.  They now have a Mango Green Tea that was quite refreshing.  The service was fantastic.  The bartender gave me enough space for me to enjoy the book I was reading but was also attentive.  And something new at this location was that he already had a pre-mixed sauce ready for patrons.  (They usually concoct a little mix using soy sauce, mustard and hot sauce when you get your order.)  Great way to think ahead!

reviews.name: Kaleena 'Kala' H.
reviews.review: My fiance and I went to PF Changs last night to celebrate our 3-year anniversary, and it was a great experience! Even though there was a bit of a wait, we still got in on time for our reservation, and were able to enjoy our food. Our server was excellent, always checking up on us, refilling our waters, and even bringing us dessert on the house in honor of our anniversary. I ordered the Chicken Fried Rice and some pork dumplings...which all were delicious. I even shared some calimari with my fiance and it was so tasty! If I had one thing to complain about, it's only the fact that you can no longer get 10% off of your meal with your Warrior card. But I still plan on returning! :)

reviews.name: Natalie W.
reviews.review: I've been to many PF Chang's all over the country. This one was sub par. Food was served differently. For example sauce on top of dumplings, not on side? Chicken lettuce wraps tasted fine, but pieces were very large and not finely chopped as they should be. Service was friendly, but waitress got our order wrong and we had to order again. She never brought rice to go with our food and we were not given knives in our napkin roll. It was not very busy when we were there. No wait. Table was not wiped down and receipt from last person was still on the table when we were seated.

reviews.name: Marie G.
reviews.review: Pad Thai was pretty bland, not a fan.We were also disappointed to sit next to a manager while he explained to a busser why he wasn't ready for customer service positions. Perhaps do that behind closed doors?The usual chain restaurant...not delightful enough for us to return.

reviews.name: Tal C.
reviews.review: Host with an attitude spoiled our visit from the start.  Made a noon reservation and when we showed up we were forced to wait for 10 minutes even though 75% of the  tables were open.  Do they think waiting is part of the experience?

reviews.name: John J.
reviews.review: Just went in to grab a quick lunch. 3:00 pm on a Saturday. Was told it would be a 30 minute wait. While waiting I counted 12 completely empty tables and 8 tables that just needed to be cleaned. They seemed very unorganized.

reviews.name: Howard C.
reviews.review: I seriously don't know how PF Changs stays in business. My wife and I waited 45 mins for a table for 2 while watching couples get seated that came in after us. The staff seemed more concerned about hanging out with each other rather than customer service. The place is a joke. Not worth the wait.

reviews.name: A N.
reviews.review: We arrived at 11:30, so nobody had obviously been seated at our table since the night before. There were cough drops in our booth, dried food on the seats, and the plates they gave us were visibly dirty. The new plates they brought were also dirty. If it's been brought to your attention, shouldn't you check before you lay more plates down?The food was ok at best. We ordered crab wontons and lettuce wraps for appetizers. We were not impressed with either. The wraps were extremely oily, they did not provide close to enough lettuce, and the wontons had zero flavor. For our meals, we ordered changs Kung pow chicken and sesame chicken. They were both average.However, the speed of the service was fantastic. However, we will not be returning.

reviews.name: Brian C.
reviews.review: For a national Chinese restaurant chain, this location is exactly what you'd expect from them.  The food is consistent.  The atmosphere is in line with the national brand.  Love the orange chicken as well as the spicy chicken with their brown rice.  The pan friend pork dumplings are always a safe, excellent, consistent bet.  The service is hit-or-miss here.  Several of the staff are top notch, but it seems more have a difficult time keeping up with the deliverables.  The hostess staff typically have a ton of attitude, but I've grown used to it until the other night when walked in on a hostess who DID NOT want to seat us as her shift was ending.  Note, we were out before closing time, still.

reviews.name: Jackie W.
reviews.review: Great Food This is a Good place for Businessdinner or Date.

reviews.name: Eric E.
reviews.review: Food was good, and they are good with their vegetarian food as well, as most of my party were vegetarians. Got the kung pao with scallops, but its pretty pricey. That alone cost 21 bucks because I upgraded to fried rice... but still! Probably will come back if I feel like celebrating something, but not for casual dining.

reviews.name: Travis R.
reviews.review: Bad service. Too expensive for what ya get. And don't even think about a Togo order. All the hospital around, hungry staff, ya think they would do better

reviews.name: Paul K.
reviews.review: I'm not exactly a fan on the Chang's, but I wouldn't turn it down.  I think most people will love it.The vegetarian silken tofu they almost have right... from 3 experiences with it it's been a little over the place, but never bad.  Sometimes juicy (not supposed to be juicy) sometimes crisp on the outside and uncooked on the inside - it's hard to cook tofu right.The coconut/peanut curry dish they make is great, it's possibly the best veggie thing they have on the menu.  It's the second best rendition of that curry I've had, and the best is about a block away in a little Thai dive restaurant and a few dollars cheaper.  It is, however, remarkable.They have Yazoo on draft, and the beer is good but I have not really found a foodstuff it complements yet.  But I have not tried too much variety there.This is a nice business-class Chinese bistro, nothing wrong with it other than parking.  It's safe, tasty, and not horribly priced.  I dig it.

reviews.name: Oliver K.
reviews.review: We went here when everywhere else was closed one night and we really needed some food in us. The hosts were very professional and the food was actually quite nice. It's a little in the pricey side but definitely still in budget for most people and they were very knowledgeable regarding the gluten in the meals. They have a specific Gluten Free sub-menu which was very helpful. My veggie GF enjoyed it and so did I. It's not the best place in town to get food, but it was the best chinese that we went to and is definitely worth going to.

reviews.name: Danxia Y.
reviews.review: Thank you CJ for inviting me for lunch to cheer me up. It is the first time for us to this restaurant although it is just downstairs.
