As Chinese, I could just say PF Chang offers good American style Chinese foods. If it is in China, only low-to-middle level. Anyway, we had a very happy lunch time and I would like to recommend it to other friends.

reviews.name: J G.
reviews.review: This location is always great in my opinion. The lettuce wraps, moo goo gai pan, and lo mein are always great. Servers are always very attentive!

reviews.name: Sarah N.
reviews.review: This is my second time going to PF Changs, and it wasn't my pick to go.  We were meeting a group in town. We showed up about 10 minutes early to make sure we had a table for everyone since it was Friday night. Well for 15 minutes we ended up sitting without a single person coming and talking to us. I finally went back to the host stand and requested a new table. In that time another server took our drink order then pawned us off to another server.  The Manager lady came over and didn't seem to care at all that we just sat there for 15 minutes being ignored, her time at the table was very short and simple. The food was decent, nothing extravagant, def over priced. The atmosphere was busy but the restaurant wasn't even full.

reviews.name: Ann C.
reviews.review: The service was amazing! Charles was great! The lettuce wraps are my favorite. Not so impressed with the pad thai but that's okay, the crispy honey shrimp was so good!!

reviews.name: Faith J.
reviews.review: It's PF Changs of course it's great!! There is nothing there that has been bad so far that I have tried. My kids even love it

reviews.name: Kristen Z.
reviews.review: We recently went to PF Chang's for my birthday.  You definitely want to call ahead and make a rez or do call ahead seating.   We had a group of 6 adults and they tried to put us into one of the semi circle booths... i think it would fit 4 comfortably, but not 6 adults.  SO we requested a different table.  They allowed us to wait in the booth, and gave us the next available table.  They didn't make us feel like they were put out in the slightest and were so nice about the switch.  Needless to say, the service was great!  I appreciate when a server keeps the glasses full, with out asking a million times... this guy was on top of it!  Our food came fairly quick and everything was exactly correct!It took me several trips to find a couple dishes that were just my taste, but I love the chicken fried rice and the duck!  Dessert was SO DELICIOUS!!  Love the chocolate cake!Parking- there is a valet, but you can also park in the hotel garage and PF Chang's will validate the parking slip, so you don't have to pay!

reviews.name: Kyla R.
reviews.review: We went on a Wednesday night and were surprised at how packed the restaurant was.  We were seated fairly quickly but it took FOREVER to get our food.  30 minutes before appetizers arrived and 1 hr. And 5 minutes before entrees arrived.  When we finally got our food it was lukewarm.   It had obviously been sitting under the warming light for some time rather than being brought to our table.  Our waiter was a wise a-- and didn't even offer apologies but a few negative comments instead.  Don't think I'll be back at P F Changs.

reviews.name: Piyush S.
reviews.review: This is the worst food I have eaten in my life. I would be better off eating a quarter pounder in mc donalds.PF changs is over priced, sub standard chinese food served in a snobbish setting. I hate this place. There is nothing good about this place.I don't care if the food is not authentic but it has to taste good. Food in PF changs is no different from the 5 dollar chinese buffet restaurants. Actually, it might be worse.So it just does'nt add up. PF CHANGS SUCKS BIG TIME. They are a disgrace on chinese cuisine.

reviews.name: Misty M.
reviews.review: I'm all about authentic food. The food isn't horrible, but it's just not my style. I'd prefer going to a locally owned over a restaurant chain any day. Their food is just too generic. Meh.

reviews.name: Dee B.
reviews.review: 5 stars for excellent customer service. I walked in and placed to to-go order from the bar. I received Fast, quick service. Then as I sat and waited, the person at the entrance who seats their customers offered me something to drink as I waited. However, they get No stars on my meal. I ordered brown rice with my meal and it was not edible, it was hard and very distasteful, I basically threw it away. And my meal wasn't correct, I got no soup that comes with the lunch specials. Needless to say, I was disappointed when I sat down  for dinner at work that evening. So, I definately won't be returning no time soon.

reviews.name: Branden B.
reviews.review: My first trip to a of changes and I was very impressed!   Everything was delicious.   I had wonton soup, lettuce wraps and changes spicy chicken.  Definitely my new favorite Chinese place.

reviews.name: Benjamin S.
reviews.review: Went here with my fiance for our 3 year anniversary. Thank goodness we made a reservation as the place was packed and the wait was, from what I was hearing, an hour or more for those just walking in. We only had to wait about 20 minutes as we had a reservation.Again, save yourself the wait, especially if you are going for a special occasion (birthday, anniversary, etc...) and put in a reservation online in advance. Usually 48 to 72 hours before hand is good enough to get the time you want, except on really busy days, like Valentine's for example.Also, while PF Chang's is definitely not authentic it is still very good, and a wide variety at that. Honestly, at least as far as I am aware, finding a good vegetarian chinese restaurant is not easy, that being said I like meat, but still not all my friends do.Anyway, I digress. As to our experience, our waitress was really nice and took great care of us. The service was fast and the food was excellent as per usual. And when I asked for a big dish of lemons for my water, the waitress brought me a cup size bowl of full of lemons. The salt n pepper calamari was perfect and the dumplings were absolutely delicious. Originally I wanted to try something new, but once again I caved to getting my favorite, the Singapore Street Noodles and once again, I was not disappointed, they were so good I cleaned my plate. Best of all, since it was our anniversary, we got dessert for free.My only complaint is that, like my fiance said, the Warrior card is now a points card and not a discount card. Oh well, at least we can still do something with it.

reviews.name: Grant R.
reviews.review: Ice-burg lettuce on the lettuce wraps, really?

reviews.name: Tara B.
reviews.review: First of all, I am a bit of a foodie (and, yes, I know that proclaiming such, I am reviewing a chain restaurant, which is a bit contradictory in and of itself) so I realize that I have high expectations.  That said, I can't remember ever sending food back at a restaurant.  Ever.  Maybe I did one day, way back when...but I honestly can't remember ever doing so...I have definitely complained/reviewed many a meal to various dining companions over the years, but I have never sent food back.Until tonight.  My husband and I had a gift card to PF Chang's and were very excited about a free (or at least inexpensive) night out.  Before I begin the tale, I will preface by saying that our server was very good.  I was a bit mortified throughout our meal (keep reading), but she was awesome.  I just wish I remembered her name!Okay...the meal.  First of all, we both ordered soup.  The only way that I can explain it is that it tasted right out of a can.  You know that really viscous, canned soup consistency? My egg drop soup tasted like Progesso chicken noodle...with some egg dropped in.  And it was just above room temperature...kind of like bath water...for a baby.  I ordered a mojito...and it tasted like a watered down limeaid from Sonic.  Both went back.  Then the entrees came out.  Both of our entrees, including the rice, were  lukewarm, at best.  Those went back too!  See what I mean about being mortified?!  But we just couldn't handle it...even with our gift card in tow!  We finally asked for the manager, who came out ohh...15-20 minutes later.  And when he did, he basically stared at us and said "we dropped the ball."  In the end, he did take some off of our tab.  But to be honest, even if he would have offered us our meal for free, leaving us with our $50 gift card, I wouldn't haven't returned.  And that is saying a lot, as I love a free meal.We won't return...we'll head to Ken's Sushi or Smiling Elephant for our Asian fix from now on.

reviews.name: Simon K.
reviews.review: The way to measure success is to compare the outcome to the original objective.  All that means here is, know what you want before walking into a restaurant.Are you looking for an unique experience, great deal, great food, great service, or great atmosphere?  All the above?The truth is that you'll rarely find a restaurant that does it all well (write about it if you do find that place tho, i wanna know).The food is of a good quality, but just know that this place is more about the asthetics.  If that's what you're looking for, then you'll probably give this place an easy 4 stars.I'm more about good food at a good price.  And thus, "to me," PF Chang's is not a success

reviews.name: nicole d.
reviews.review: This review is for the bar area and the fantastic Gluten Free menu that even includes dessert!! I love the food here and its great if with just 2 people and you can sit at the bar. The bartenders are great, specifically Dave and Haven, they fun, informative and very attentive.

reviews.name: Mark M.
reviews.review: It's PF Changs.

reviews.name: Gabriela L.
reviews.review: What can I say? IOur food was incredibly sal generally love this place. It is open very late for those late nights or late night munchies, but the last two times that I've gone here my food has been too salty. You must try one of their signature cocktails, they change every so often, and of course, their mini desserts.

reviews.name: Lashona M.
reviews.review: Best place to get drinks made just the way you like them! I had a fuzzy navel martini and an asian pear mojito! Loved it!!! Also, try the chicken flatbread with it! Excellent!!!

reviews.name: Spencer H.
reviews.review: Solid chain. I come here at least once a week - such nice workers and pretty quick/efficient.

reviews.name: Crystal M.
reviews.review: Love love love this place esp for date night!! Lettuce wraps and Kung pao is a fave!

reviews.name: Jude C.
reviews.review: I had a good experience here...our waiter was very knowledgeable and nice and the food was excellent.  The restaurant was very clean and the manager on duty gave me a $10 gift card since it was my first time at the restaurant.  I'll definitely be coming back when I visit Nashville in the future and highly recommend this establishment.

reviews.name: Kiran G.
reviews.review: I like the food and service here. It can get bit crowded on the weekend. Parking is an issue but it is not that bad. Waiting time is more on weekends. I like chicken fried rice and appetizers.

reviews.name: Andrea R.
reviews.review: Ordered the vegetarian lettuce wraps to go for lunch and was disappointed. They were not the flavor I have experienced in the past and had so much lime juice that every bit was tart and uncomfortable. Probably won't revisit although the service was fast, friendly, and helpful.

reviews.name: Steven T.
reviews.review: Service pretty reasonable and attentive without being bothersome.Food is okay, certainly not outstanding.  Lamb as good though pretty fatty.  The wok fried beef was terrible and the heavily promoted Pad Thai lacked the depth of favors to make it stand out.   Overall a very middling average

reviews.name: Olivia W.
reviews.review: The only complaint I have is the parking, and that is specific to this one only. Everything is phenomenal all the time every time. You can go online and sign up to be a member, for free of course, and get 10% off! Their garlic noodles are the bomb.com Mmmmmmmm! :-) lemon grass prawns with garlic noodles is my choice 80%of the time. On the more expensive side but hey it's well worth it. They also have tons of sauces you can ask for- plum, sweet and sour, ones they give you on the table, soy sauce. Whatever! You can really get creative here. Their menu has enough on it that you will never get bored with the choices like I do at some places. This is probably my favorite restaurant. It is for Chinese food. I would drive the extra 50 miles to eat here any day!!

reviews.name: Nicci M.
reviews.review: I really enjoyed the great food and service. They definitely give quality food and quantity. My Kung Pao (Pow) Chicken, Spring Rolls, and Dumplings were excellent.

reviews.name: Robert K.
reviews.review: I was really excited to go to PF Chang's for dinner, because It has such a great location next to the Vanderbilt University campus and the building looks really cool on the outside.......However, the food is pretty expensive for the portion size and quality and it gave me a belly ache after!   The double pan-fried noodles with chicken was okay, but very greasy and expensive for the portion I received!!Always packed and almost no parking in at the shopping center where it is located!To give PF Chang's some credit, you feel very cool and hip inside, the ambiance is great.  Also, at the table next to mine several "older" folks were ordering from special menus with larger text for customers with sub-par vision.  Good idea!

reviews.name: George M.
reviews.review: Not a huge fan of Chang's but I took some customers recently who like it.  I have to say that it wasn't terrible.  Their chicken soup is very good.  Of course it's not authentic, but you know that going in.  Our server was awesome.  Very attentive and took time to talk about options and how certain dishes were prepared.  Overall, not a bad choice for a customer lunch.

reviews.name: Jerry R.
reviews.review: Over two years ago I would have written a different review than what I'm writing today.  Things have definitely changed for the better.  The prices are more reasonable and the quantity of food for the price has improved.  Taste and seasonings are excellent as is the service.  I had the Broccoli ko po dish and my wife had the Budda Feast. Egg rolls are of a generous portion size.  Parking out front has a lot to be desired but my recommendation is to use the 2525 garage around towards the back side and let P F Chang validate your parking ticket.  Over all, this is a place you go to for a special treat once in a while but a bit pricy for a routine hangout.

reviews.name: Caitlin D.
reviews.review: This is Chinese food for people who don't know what Chinese food is supposed to taste like. If you have ever travelled somewhere where actual people from China made the dishes, you'll know instantly that this is a corporate knock-off that misses the mark by a longshot. That said, it's not nasty to the taste; it's just not real Chinese food. Don't even get me started on how overpriced it is, either. They want HOW much for Chow Mein? That's supposed to be a cheap staple! And by the way, most of this is pre-made and frozen. However, I have yet to find any truly good Chinese food in the area so I can't direct you anywhere much better...

reviews.name: Patrice S.
reviews.review: Tammy the bartender makes the best scotch old fashion I have had in years. Great service, fresh terrific food. Valet parking.

reviews.name: Ben M.
reviews.review: My colleagues and I got a recommendation for PF Chang's from a friend who lives in Nashville and was joining us for dinner. Austin has a location of its own and of which I was acquainted, so I knew what I was in for.This location shares a parking lot with the Borders, a Starbucks, and a Fleming's Steakhouse, among other businesses, so parking is going to be an issue. We opted to use the valet service, which technically doesn't charge you, but works for tips. Still, it's worth it if you have already spent five minutes trying to snipe for a parking spot.We started off with appetizers: lettuce wraps and Sichuan flatbread, which were great. The lettuce wraps do require some assembly and therefore can get a little messy, but it's worth it. My entree of Chengdu Spiced Lamb could have been better, but because it's only one of two lamb dishes on their menu, it doesn't appear to be a specialty, as far as I know.The service was pleasant and prompt; I don't remember my beer glass to be empty for too long.The impressive part of the night came when we had to split the tab (ah, the joys of business travel and separate checks). There were six of us paying for our individual entrees, but five of us splitting the appetizers because we weren't letting my friend pay. Their POS (point-of-sale) system printed out checks that read "1/5 appetizer" on them, as well as what one-fifth of each appetizer came out to be.Fine, it's nerdy. I don't care. It was still impressive.

reviews.name: Kathryn E.
reviews.review: I love consistency. PF Chang's is consistent throughout the good ol' US of A! A manager once recommended I order the shrimp and scallops "extra crispy." AWESOME!! My favorite dish is Kung Pao shrimp and scallops...extra crispy! They used to charge a few dollars extra for the shrimp/scallops combo, but I'm not sure if that is still the policy. Hot and sour soup is the best I've ever tasted and lest we forget the chicken lettuce wraps! I never tire of this place.

reviews.name: Melissa B.
reviews.review: If I read one more pretentious donkey say, "This is not Chinese food!" and have to imagine them turning up their virtual nose, I'm throwing my laptop out the window. It is NOT Chinese food! It's a Chinese "Bistro." It is related to Chinese food, inspired by Chinese food. This is not Tom Collichio paying $1000 per plate for food here. It's what your average American, your average diner, would be interested in. If you don't like chains, you probably won't like P. F. Chang's.Gah. Ok, now on to my review. My husband and I go to this location for dinner about every other week. I have tried several dishes, but my favorite to date is plain Chang's spicy chicken. I LOVE the flavor! Lately we've been on busier nights, so we've sat at the bar, and I've gotta say I love the bar service. There is a blonde chick and a younger gal named Emma who are awesome. I love the lettuce wraps and we get those almost every time, especially when we get there during happy hour.My husband gets some tofu stuff that I can't stand because I hate tofu. The egg drop soup is ok, and the crispy wontons are good but I never eat more than a few because they're a little greasy.I HATE Chinese food, but I like P. F. Chang's. So to reviewers who say this is for "people who don't know what Chinese food is supposed to taste like," I say GOOD!

reviews.name: Claire B.
reviews.review: I am not usually a fan of chain restaurants, but I really love PF Chang's and have to indulge my cravings sometimes. I know I'm not alone in having these cravings. My friends and I will sometimes book a reservation for a Friday or Saturday night and have a really nice, long relaxed dinner there. One of the best things to do is go with a bunch of people and just order appetizers. If you have enough people, you can order all of them and get a great variety of food. It makes for good picking and conversing, especially if you wash it all down with some cocktails. There are some fancy cocktails on the menu, which are worth trying (the Asian Bloody Mary  - I don't know its exact name, is really good for brunch), but I think PF Chang's, for some reason, makes the best gin and tonic I've ever had. Sounds silly, but don't knock it 'til you've tried it.Some favorites of mine on the menu are: the ahi tuna appetizer (which is huge and is more like a salad than an appetizer), the double pan fried noodles with tofu, the sea-bass, the spring rolls, and the cheesecake (seriously, they have a great cheesecake). Here's a hint: it's difficult to get into this location of PF Chang's on the weekends without a reservation, but it's easy to order takeout. Have the party at home and pick up the food. It saves time and money.

reviews.name: Gabriel M.
reviews.review: I absolutely love the food. I've had the Wok Seared Lamb (awesome), Chengdu Spiced Lamb, and the Pepper Steak Lunch Bowl. The food is flavorful, beautifully presented, and tastes fresh. I hadn't had lamb in quite some time before I ordered the Chengdu, and that first bite exploded my taste buds. I can't wait to order it again. My girlfriend loves egg rolls, unfortunately she says Chang's rolls are oily. What I liked best was the sauce that is prepared specifically for you using various spices, vinegars, and oils. I request some even for take-out. And the hoisin is fabulous.The food prices are priced fairly considering how delicious it is.

reviews.name: Heather R.
reviews.review: I had never heard of PF Changs before my move to Nashville. My, my I was sheltered. This place is a-ma-zing. The food is plated up family style, so when you order one thing, you're going to get a whole heck of a lot of it. We usually get the spicy eggplant to go with a chicken main dish, and we can never finish it all. It makes for some great leftovers for sure. This particular location is a bear to get parking at because it's in the Shops at 2525, because of that it loses a star. But we had the best server ever here, who even got our sweet tea refill to go and boxed up our leftovers with extra wraps and an extra box of rice. This place rocks.

reviews.name: Anna A.
reviews.review: I really don't know good Chinese from bad in that I've only been to Chinatown once (and I was a little drunk) and never to China so I don't consider myself an expert. I only have to go on my personal likes and dislikes. PF Changs, though far more expensive than "cheapie Chinese" is probably up there in my top 5 chain restaurants and certainly one of my favorite Chinese food options. For one thing, they aren't afraid of garlic. I love it, they use it, it really works out for me. Secondly, I could eat lettuce wraps until I explode if I could afford it. OMG.... YUM.. The Calamari is also most excellent. I have never been able to reproduce them and then when your server makes the little dipping sauce for them, it really is yummy. My husband gets the orange peel triple thing  which it's not on the menu any more but they will make it and it has chicken, beef, shrimp with the spicy sweet orange peel sauce. I have been more adventuresome in the past and gotten some of the lobster stuff and been underwhelmed. Black beans and chicken are most excellent and the Singapore street noodles are great!! All of it is available for take out if you don't want to deal with the wait or making a reservation. It's pretty loud in there and the parking is a pain in the ass.

reviews.name: Erin D.
reviews.review: Parking here always sucks. Yes, there is a garage, and no it is never full. But, if you're like me, you're tempted to run through the parking lot first. That's always a bad idea. I think once at 5am, I found a spot. It gets REALLY congested, and people do crazy things like try to pass others. So heed my warning and just go to the garage and get your ticket validated. As for the restaurant itself, I love me some PF Changs. I've always had good service and never a problem with the food. I used to order out on Mondays from here at lunch and pick it up - and they always got it right. It's a typical PF Changs set up, meaning there is a bar in the middle with seating around it. They even have a few outdoor tables. It's not traditional chinese, but it is good food. I like the honey chicken, lo mein (they took the chow mein off the menu) and the fried rice. I've never been impressed by their desserts though.

reviews.name: Tami P.
reviews.review: I went today for lunch & our food came out super fast!  Wonderful service!

reviews.name: Ron D.
reviews.review: PF Chang's is more of an upscale Asian bistro.  The food is really good and the service is fast.  The Mongolian Beef is my favorite item there.  I wish that Clarksville would get one.  I try to go to PF Chang's when ever I am in Nashville, DC or any other big city that has one.  I don't like chain restaurants but PF Chang's is one of the few exceptions.

reviews.name: Dante' T.
reviews.review: While PF Changs is not an authentic Chinese restaurant, it is a wonderful nod to Asian cuisine. I love that I can have a three course meal and remain healthy with my choices. As a Weight Watchers member this restaurant offers several options that are tasty and healthy. Several of the shrimp entrees are low in Points. And the steamed potstickers and mini desserts are excellent to round your meal out...

reviews.name: J R.
reviews.review: "You might say the secret ingredient is salt!"Seriously. I've never had such salty food as here. It's loud, overpriced, generic,and full of hipsters and Vandy kids. Want to impress someone with restaurant decor? Come here. Want better Americanized Chinese food? Check out Chinatown in Green Hills.

reviews.name: Janelle C.
reviews.review: I've been to PFChangs many times before. This particular time I was quite impressed.Our server Mary rocked. She told us what we should/shouldn't order, and guided us to some amazing fare. We did the dinner for 2 w/several options. I loved the hot and sour soup, but had been too nervous to try it before. Our pork dumplings were perfectly steamed. For our entrees we ordered the Kung Pao Shrimp, she added scallops for us, and the Sesame Chicken, the old way, with snap peas because I love them. Mary was an inspiration to me, to be a better server. She was so genuine, and only wanted to make sure we ate well. Love it!

reviews.name: kristen p.
reviews.review: P.F.Chang's food is fine. There are lots of vegetarian options and I would usually reccomend it if you were in the mood for a generic pan asian experience in the form of a chain.However skip this location in particular unless you enjoy apathetic wait staff. Besides there are plenty of better places in this part of town.

reviews.name: Sean W.
reviews.review: Like the layout but this seemed more like a cafeteria than a restaurant, I have been to the more upscale version of this in Boston and this seemed to be trying to hard to appeal to everyone. Admittedly coming having been to another restaurant in the chain I had an expectation set this did not meet it visually.  Once I saw the menu I felt much better about this place, this prices were  very reasonable and the selection seemed good enough. The service left something to be desired, and made it feel a bit rushed.  When the food arrived and I dug in I remembered why I wanted to come here in the first place, I was not disappointed. The proportions were more than adequate and the food tasted fresh and flavorful. Overall I would recommend this place on the food alone, the crowded seating and abrupt services made a cafeteria style atmosphere with mood lighting...

reviews.name: Kate K.
reviews.review: Wonderful food. I had a plate of scallops tonight that melted in my mouth. The Sichuan sauce was full of both bite and flavor. The chef indulged me in my special request to add some vegetables so I also enjoyed mushrooms and brocoli soaking up the sauce.When the food came out, though, I was a little surprised. The menu described "Sichuan from the sea" scallops as " Scallops prepared in a red chili pepper garlic sauce." It didn't mention the breading, and I would have made another choice had I known. Being hungry and having waited a while for our entrees, I didn't send it back and I wasn't disappointed, just very full. The sauce was piquant, full of both taste and heat. The added brocoli and mushrooms absorbed it beautifully. I also had a bite of the oolong-marinated sea bass and found it heavenly.The hostess was brisk and efficient, our server friendly, though it was hard to hear her over the din. Our meals did not come out all at once, this was apparently not supposed to matter because they assumed we were eating family style. We weren't. The appetizer one of our party ordered as her meal came out last, I found that a little strange.A fun night out overall.

reviews.name: Magan T.
reviews.review: This was my FIRST Chang's and I was a little weary. I've never liked Chinese food so I wasn't sure what to order. My date ordered the Changs Chicken and I fell in love... with the chicken and my date. LOL Since then I have eaten at many PF Chang's and somewhere along the way, decided to try them all. The food here was great and service was good as well. This specific location took my "Chang's Virginity" and it has a special place in my tummy!

reviews.name: Manuel C.
reviews.review: i went there tonight with my bf and the food was delicious, I visit few years ago one in Atlanta GA Galleria, but I think I enjoyed this one more since is in my hometown, the special of 39.95 for 2 was so good!! the food portions are great.!! i will def. come back again :)

reviews.name: Miss. Foodgurl S.
reviews.review: First off, this place was very crowded but they do get you seated relatively quickly. Our server was very friendly. We ordered the crispy wantons and lettuce wraps to start us off. I devoured the crispy wantons and my companions devoured the lettuce wraps exclaiming how delicious they were. I just loved the crispy wantons, the are obviously crispy on the outside but on the inside they are soft like a dumpling and stuffed with pork. I heard the lettuce wraps were fantastic. When you go your will bring you out six sauces that are good however two are really spicy (a mustard and spicy sauce), 2 are like soy sauces but one of the two has a sweeter taste, and then there are two others and I feel bad, but I only know that one is a white vinegar I believe it was to cool down too spicy sauces For dinner, I ordered their pork lo mein which was good but kind of bland so I drenched it in the sweeter soy sauce:) By the time dinner was complete I was far too full for dessert, but the dessert display looked to die for :)))

reviews.name: Dallas T.
reviews.review: It's a chain, I know. But, it is consistently good food, reasonably priced, and well served. Go for lunch, and sit at the bar. You'll get great service and good food.

reviews.name: Paul B.
reviews.review: Though I am not a huge fan of chain restaurants, I also do not want to exclude them when they serve a consistently excellent meal with consistently excellent service, and that is my experience with P. F. Chang's China Bistros. Yes, it's Americanized Asian cuisine for the masses, but I have eaten at multiple locations of this restaurant chain and never been disappointed. Our experience here was typical, with great service and top-notch meal. The Ma Po Tofu and double fried noodles were very good. Stop in and enjoy.

reviews.name: Nate C.
reviews.review: PF Chang's is a saaaaaaaaaaaaaaaks! i'd much rather go to panda express than to eat at pf chang's. need i to say more?!?!

reviews.name: Lester H.
reviews.review: Everyone always wants to eat at this damn place, but I could totally leave it.  The setting is nice, but I just don't get all the fuss.  I would rather eat Chinese food at a little family-run restaurant for 1/4 the price.

reviews.name: Joe C.
reviews.review: Hmm, I don't know about this one. When it comes to Chinese, I like the authentic ones and obviously we all know this isn't catered to the traditional Chinese foods. I only go there because my mom likes it. Like I said, we don't have authentic Chinese restaurant in Nashville, so I guess this will suffice for a Chinese dine out! However, I don't get it; it's always crowed. Our American folks seem to love and continue to rave about place!

reviews.name: Emily L.
reviews.review: The ambience is great.  The food is good but nothing great.  Service is pretty good and there's free parking.  A little pricey thought.

reviews.name: Julee E.
reviews.review: We stayed right down the road at Two Rivers RV Park, and stopped by here because Bring Fido's website said they allow dogs on the patio. On the first night there was no live music, but we enjoyed their Hot Chicken Bitchen Butch Bites (medium) and hubby loved them. (I drank my dinner, and got their fish dinner to go, to have for lunch the next day.) Good service, and good food.Two nights later we went back, so we could check out their live music. A lone guy was singing, and it was just okay. We are in Nashville, so we had hoped for country. He played a few old country songs, but then went on to sing things like Bruse Springstein, etc. Hubby ordered the Bitchen Butch Bites again, and they were just as good.The next night there were two guys playing, and they were better. They pretty much stuck with country songs, although mostly older stuff. This night hubby ordered the fish dinner, but got it served up with the medium heat, and it was a hit. He was sweating afterwards, and he was full after eating just one piece of the fish. The meal is really large, and comes with two sides! He got a Cesar salad and French fries. Once again, good service! They had a better crowd on this night (Thursday).We would definately return!!

reviews.name: Annette F.
reviews.review: Packer bar in Nashville!! I was really excited to come here and enjoy watching the Packer bar with some fellow Wisconsinites and Packer fans.  It's a very low key dive bar, but the folks that frequent the place are really nice and friendly. I'm giving this bar only two stars because of the extremely rude and non-attentive service we received. The waitress was non-attentive and oblivious to us. I had to go to the bar and grab some menus myself after waiting for 20min for a waitress to show up. 10 minutes after grabbing the menus, we flagged down a waitress. One member in our party wanted a chicken sandwich with buffalo sauce, and the waitress said we couldn't do that (how you can't swap out ranch for buffalo I'm not sure), so we asked another staff member and they said no problem. The bloody Mary's looked delicious, and when one member of our party ordered one it came non mixed and with no condiments. So once again, we went to the bar and asked for something...this time a piece of celery. The food arrived, most of it anyway, and was pretty good. Typical bar food. One member of our party waited over an hour for her sandwich to arrive. When she questioned the waitress if she put the order in, she gave a blank stare and said "yes". So we waited, and still no food. Finally another 20min pass, and a runner brings the sandwich. We asked what took so long, and she gave a really smart response of "have you seen how many people are here? We can't cook everyone's food at the same time." And then she quickly turned around and walked off.The waitress returned, and we asked for a manager. She said "Melissa" was the manager, and that she would be over to our table. A few minutes later, and older gentleman came to our table, and we explained our experience to him. He was equally rude, and told us that they were busy today because of the packer game. He did kind of apologize, but then he asked if we wanted him to fire the girl that was rude to us. We were shocked by that comment, said no, but that we felt some training on customer service might be needed.I get it, I was a waitress, they were busy. But, it's not like we the highest of expectations. Just be friendly and attentive. If it's a long wait for things, be nice and explain that. If there's a delay in food, the share that information with your customers. If you can't accommodate the number of people you serve, then think about having a limited menu on game days in order to get food out of the kitchen efficiently. I'd give this place one star, but the customers are cool, and they like the Packers, so two stars it is.

reviews.name: Katherine S.
reviews.review: The service was extremely slow, our original waitress never came back to check on us after she gave the us the menus. We had to ask one of the kitchen staff to take our order. The food was delivered fast, but was incredibly greasy. I ordered the cornbread and there was a puddle of grease on the plate. Good prices, but left a bad taste in our mouths for our last bit of BBQ before heading back home. There are many other restaurants in the area, so don't waste your time here.

reviews.name: Linda R.
reviews.review: Stopped in for a snack wanted to try their barbecue ribs. The waitress didn't hear the order for ribs only for the chili & by the time we realized she hadn't ordered them, I don't even want to stay any longer. My sister  ordered cornbread which was served with the chili - two interesting looking deep-fried patties, one not cooked on the inside & when we suggested she should let the cool know, she rolled her eyes and said the cooks been cooking up for so many years he knows what he's doing.

reviews.name: Katelyn B.
reviews.review: Decided to come join a group of friends today for lunch and beers to watch the packers game. it took nearly 25 minutes for someone to get us a drink order. We had to go to the bar to request menus. By the time we did have a waitress to come by most of our party was ready to  to order food in addition to a drink request. Short story... Be prepared to wait...I think the worst part of our experience was the food runner. The food runner (girl was short, brunette, wore a hot pink shirt and obviously has had a rough life) was beyond rude and obviously lacked skills to take we beyond the life of waiting tables and running food. lol but seriously I have never heard of a food runner be so nasty. I get your busy, I get that you have a lot of customers but your staff talking to customers like they are ungrateful and impatient is not acceptable. On our of guests waited more than 1.5 hours, we have every right to mention that our food took awhile. A food runner should apologize and say that the kitchen is busy. Instead we were insulted beyond belief . We asked for the owner (older white male) who came out and offered no sympathy for the way his staff behaved. Our party of 7 (all packers fan and local to nashville) will never be back.

reviews.name: Marisela S.
reviews.review: We got recommended here for a nice hole in the wall bar and it sure was. They had karaoke, a nice patio with music, the food was descent. The waitress could have checked on us a little more than she did and offer more water but overall it was alright. We had the wings that were hot and spicy and a burger and fries that were good and looked homemade, it was worth a try

reviews.name: Sarah E.
reviews.review: They allow smoking here, just so you know. There are 2 different sections but even the non-smoking section has an air of smoke. Not terrible tho. Bloody Mary's are to die for! $9 for build you own and they really let you load it up! My friend had the full rack of St Louis ribs and he said they were really good. I tasted his cornbread and it was impressive, nice and homemade. Service is slow but the poor girl waiting on us said they were short staffed and busier than expected. Overall, a decent place to watch the game.

reviews.name: Bill F.
reviews.review: What a great place! Friendly people who make you feel welcome on both sides of the bar, And the other reviews are right on about the hot chicken. I had the medium and it had good flavor with a nice bite.

reviews.name: George C.
reviews.review: Dive Bar that serves pretty solid BBQ. I ordered the pulled pork sandwich and a side of Mac & Cheese. The sandwich was fresh and I think a big part of that was because of the roll. It's was soft, buttery and delicious. Meat was fresh and smoky. Mac & Cheese wasn't bad. Loved the sweet tea!Smoking is allowed inside so I'm not a huge fan of that. Overall I would give it 3.5 stars.

reviews.name: Nikki B.
reviews.review: I cannot start to describe how horrible this place was. First off the waitress was horrible, I didn't  catch her name...not that it mattered, I never saw her again  after she took our drink order, the same drink order that was forgotten until the bus boy came around. Ridiculous. I'm sure you can guess how the rest of the meal went. The fries were old and soggy tasting and the draft beer was hot. VERY disappointed with this place.  Do not recommend at all.

reviews.name: Judy V.
reviews.review: Good bar for the area. Staff is very friendly and keeps your drinks fresh. Flat bread pizza is very good. Band on Thursday and Fridays out on the patio makes for an enjoyable evening.

reviews.name: Heather H.
reviews.review: My boyfriend and I were fortunate enough to stumble on this place a few days ago. The sign says "Famous Hot Chicken." They're not kidding. The chicken is amazing. Tender, lightly breaded and full of flavor. The levels of heat are up to you, but don't think they're kidding. The highest heat is "Satan's Tongue." Oh. My. Gosh. It's hot. As in, I'm a pepper head and it made me hurt. The "Hot" is actually hot, the Satan's Tongue is no joke.I'm no Nashville native, but I spend a decent amount of time there and would recommend Scoreboards to anyone who frequents the area. It's clear that they have some regulars and that there is a definite local vibe. I plan to go back and try to be one of those people that is a familiar face when I walk in the door. The prices are great and the atmosphere is very laid back and relaxing. And if you do try this place, obviously get the chicken. But go ahead and throw your diet out the window and try the pork rinds, onion rings, and mac & cheese. You will thank me later. Just don't go to the doc for any cholesterol tests immediately after lunch.

reviews.name: Brad K.
reviews.review: Googled "Packer Bar" while down for a fun weekend in Nashville.  And obviously there was one, as there is in every city.We showed up at 11:32 for the noon game, and it was indeed "Packed".   There was an outdoor bar by a pool that a ton of fans were at, but it looked overly crowded / loud.Inside there was much more availability - but when asked to be seated the owner / manager said that an entire area was reserved and that  "you need to get here by 9" as if we knew that or something. He then informed us he had one table available but the game might be only on one TV in that area, we reluctantly opted for our only option but to our pleasant surprise the game was on in that area.I've noted the time of arrival for a variety of reasons, but mainly for the service.  I've never had terrible service in the south so I'm weary of assuming everything is slower in the south and this is something I should learn to understand.  Also, this is a Packer bar, and it's Sunday during a Packer game - if you're understaffed that's poor management, it's not like you don't know people are going to be here during a Packer game.Either way, the service here was BY FAR the  worst I've ever had in any dining experience.  It took her 20 minutes to take our drink order.  After another 15-30 minutes, about 10 minutes into the game I just decided to go to the bar to order a beer.  I saw them pouring our drinks though, so I asked for them and decided to be the server.   One of the people in our party ordered the popular build-your-own-blood-mary and he had to wait an additional 15 minutes after I served our drinks for his drink to be made.  Finally about an hour into us being there, she came by and said she'll take our food order but then walked away.  And didn't come back for another 15 minutes.  We had to borrow a menu from someone elses table as those weren't brought to us either.   By the time we order we joked about whether or not we'd get our food by halftime, but it was a serious concern.  I would love to give this place one star for the complete lack of regard for service as it was the worst service I've ever encountered, BUT the food was fantastic.   Also, although it seemed like a rinky dink dive bar, the atmosphere was lively and fun.  They boo'd Bears fans viciously when they had to walk through the Packers area to go to the bathroom.  They handed out free game towels to everyone in Packers gear.  And there was some sort of raffle that was going on, but I didn't stay long enough to understand the prize.Hire more people, or figure out your waitstaff, because if this wasn't the only Packers joint in town - it'd be out of business.   I could've gone on three rides at  Six Flags before I had a sip of beer at Scoreboard.

reviews.name: Jim M.
reviews.review: If I were forced to visit 1000 bars in the Nashville area, this one would not be on that list. I'd rather go to the bar at the local TGO'Chili's than here.Also, the guy who runs the place, Barrett (claims he owns the place, but he doesn't), is a crook.

reviews.name: Valerie R.
reviews.review: Meh, I guess it's all about what you want & proper expectations. This is not fine dining or a trendy establishment. I'd say this is a local retreat from the touristy places nearby. It's a divey sports bar with bar food. I had a BBQ brisket sandwich & fries and it was pretty decent. The most distracting thing was the smoke. I've just gotten so used to non-smoking restaurants, I'm spoiled. But if you're a smoker and looking for a good local sports bar - give it a try.

reviews.name: Troy T.
reviews.review: Run!!! This place is horrible. It takes years to screw up Chicken and Waffles this bad. Everyone else's food sucked too. My complians to the chef. Barf o Rama. Go back to your room and have a ham sandwich, you'll be better off.

reviews.name: Darren G.
reviews.review: Atmosphere was okay.  Food was okay.  Our poor waitress was way overworked.  She was wonderful

reviews.name: Tokjan W.
reviews.review: If you like going into a place and leave after your meal smelling like cigarette smoke, then this is the place to go.  Add to that the mediocre dining experience and we found a winner.  I was expecting more more from the "Hot Chicken," and was disappointed as well.  The waitress, on the other hand, was attentive and did a very good job.

reviews.name: Mark V.
reviews.review: Great food and service. Would definitely recommend stopping in here. Gigantic tall beers!

reviews.name: Joe K.
reviews.review: This place is awesome, I used to just occasionally visit but now I'm there regularly and I'm always bringing new friends with me who also fall in love with the place! Hot chicken which was featured on the food networks heat seekers and is no joke, I order it about 90% of the time, but I have also had burgers and other sandwiches which have also been delicious! It's a great atmosphere and is always full of great people! The drinks are cheap and they have a good selection and great bar staff! And if your a packers fan, this should be your new Sunday hangout during the football season!

reviews.name: Tiffany O.
reviews.review: Excellent service and delicious food. We live 5 minutes from this place and let's just say it's our new favorite.Everything on the menu is great, especially the hot chicken and onion rings!! Check out this place, you won't regret it!

reviews.name: Stefinos L.
reviews.review: I been there with a few people, two of us including myself ordered the BBQ ribs.They have been served quickly. you could not get them off the bones. We both returned them and ordered Quesedillas.Nothing special either. I will not return to this restaurant. Service was below average.

reviews.name: Kenneth B.
reviews.review: I've been here a few times because a buddy dragged me down. Went the other night for food becuase it was late and there's not many options around. Totally disappointed. Ordered the "hot chicken", nothing good about it. Came with a side of bread covered in some kind of sauce which was disgusting and over flavored seemed like it was probably some sort of sauce they didn't mix right and it ended up with all the ingredients on my piece of bread.  Fries came with ordwrand they were overcooked. As for the service at the outside bar, not that personable. The staff was just not freindly enough to want me to go back. Last time we were there we ordered some beers and she brought me 2, I explained that 1 was good that I would be driving and she said oh its fine you can drink of. What would have happened of something tragic went down after...

reviews.name: Michael K.
reviews.review: I'm always amazed at the wide variances of experiences and expectations by fellow yelpers.  I came here to have lunch because the sign said they had the best hot chicken around.   Well I've never had 'hot chicken' but I've had a lot of chicken and this was excellent in my view.  It was quite hot, fresh, crispy, tender and the service was very good.  We didn't sit in the bar area but the restaurant area was perfectly fine for what the place is.   I'll definitely go back if I'm in the area again.  Lots of haters on this place but in my small experience there was nothing to hate, it's exactly as advertised.

reviews.name: Laura R.
reviews.review: I have heard so much about the ribs here, I was excited to try, but they turned out to be just average. They were cooked well, but not  quite "falling off the bone", the meat itself was pretty fatty. The sauce wasn't bad, had a mild flavor and the smoke was just an after taste- good if you're not into a strong, smoky flavor but I personally want to know with the first bite it's been smoked! We also had the nachos that we were surprised to find covered in a white cheese sauce. The Woobies were fun :) We sat on the back patio as per other reviews of the bar being nasty, and it was peaceful, with live music playing classics like 'take it easy' and 'chicken fried'. Overall not bad, but I think this place is better suited for a night at the bar rather than a dinner out.

reviews.name: Ckhris C.
reviews.review: Cold ribs, undercooked fries. Well, I tried it. The food network recommended it. They must have a relative that owns it.

reviews.name: Michelle C.
reviews.review: We came here for the BBQ based on reviews. Let's be very clear, this is a BAR not a restaurant....complete with cigarette smoke, drunks, and vomit in the bathrooms. That said, the food was ok. We had two orders of wings, one inferno hot and one mild. They were fine but nothing special. The ribs were better. Our server was fine, but the two older male managers lingered near us complaining loudly about the staff.If you are interested in a sports bar where you also can get food, you may be quite content.

reviews.name: Chad E.
reviews.review: While situated firmly in an area that is frequented by tourists (right across from Opryland!), this is not your tourist attraction. In fact, it's actually difficult to find since it's behind about everything - I don't think there is any way to get directly to this door unless you drive through someone else's parking lot.Once you do get inside, you might want to leave because they could stand to clean a bit - unlike some other locales that prohibit smoking on the inside, there seems to have been more than a little going on here. Whether that is from patrons or a kitchen fire, I don't know. It just has that smoked-in scent, and it's not from the barbecue. You might need a shower when you leave. Or before you leave. Just don't wear your Sunday best. Or your Friday best.Regardless, if you can handle it, you might want to give them a chance because the staff is friendly and unlike many other places in the area, you get a decent amount of food for a fair price. They even serve up hot chicken here.What is "hot chicken", you ask? Think of chicken strips with hot sauce and you're pretty much there. All you have to do is tell them how hot you want it. A word of warning - if you haven't had it before, you might want to start towards the low end of the scale, even if they look at you like you are a pansy. Don't say I didn't warn you.

reviews.name: Michael E.
reviews.review: Good food, I had wings and others had the chicken. Definitely would recommend the chicken. Only complaint is that some of the TVs were calibrated weird which made it harder to watch college football. Service was good.

reviews.name: Jermaine H.
reviews.review: I got the medium hot chicken strips. The chicken was a little chewy but I still ate it all. I figured with them being known for hot chicken that it would be hot but it was not that hot. I will got hotter next time. Can't wait to try the burger I will be back. The smoke and the service was the only draw back. The waiter was nice but since we were the only people in the nonsmoking section I guess it was weird for her.

reviews.name: Paul J.
reviews.review: It's good for cold beer and the bartender was very friendly. I had the smoked wings and they were not good. It tasted like they were made from a crockpot and just added liquid smoke to it. I have smoked many things and I can promise you those wings were not smoked.

reviews.name: Carol P.
reviews.review: The hot chicken isn't my go-to in Nashville, but it will suffice. The atmosphere of this bar is pretty laid-back (dive-y), and convienient for I-24 travelers passing through. It is a pretty smokey place, which I believe interferes with my hot-chicken-eating, but you sacrifice that for a good place to people watch.I'll probably be back.

reviews.name: Brandon A.
reviews.review: This review will center largely around their spicy fried chicken. I was out working an event, leading to some post-midnight dinner runs, and this was directly across from the hotel I was working at. They touted their chicken as being world famous, and had varying levels of spiciness. Being the adventurous eater that I am, my friend and I opted for the option justly named "Satan's Tongue". It was hot, and I mean hot, but delicious nonetheless. If you have a chance, be sure to try it out.

reviews.name: Kathie H.
reviews.review: So we found this bar AFTER watching the Packers elsewhere.  My husband being a hugh Packer fan was delighted to find this place.  We only had appetizers and drinks, but the atmosphere was the best.  I would highly recommend this bar for any Packers fan, you will not be disappointed.

reviews.name: Greg W.
reviews.review: I wanted to like this place and have been there 3 to 4 times but their food is so inconsistant tonight will be my last visit.  Tonight I tried the Brisket sandwich and what I got looked like a plain hotdog roll with two thin slices of meat on it.  The fries were soggy with grease.. $10 down the drain.This establishment is within walking distance of my office so I was hoping it would be a barbeque joint to hit once a month or so...  I have also sampled their hot chicken.  On my first visit it was great.  Nice level of heat on the mild and it was juicy.  The next two consecutive visits the chicken was over-cooked, dry and no where near the jumbo size they advertize on their menu.The staff was freindly enough and I always get the food to go so the smoking is not an issue for me.  When spending $10 for a meal I would hope for better quality than what this place has to offer.  I am taking them off my list of options when at work.For the prices they are charging you should be gettnig a decent portion and better consistancy of the meals.  I write this place up as a tourist trap/dive bar

reviews.name: Weston W.
reviews.review: Hands down the best hot chicken you will find around here. For all the people that complain about the smoke, let's remember it is a bar, and it's not against the law to smoke in them here. So if it's a problem don't go.

reviews.name: Kelly R.
reviews.review: Ok, totally a dive bar! However, it was clean, the waitress was pleasant and the food was great. Maybe I'm not the best judge of BBQ being from New York. The ribs were great!! Not too sweet, not too savory and just the right amount of smoke. The meat was tender and fell off the bone. Hot chicken was lightly battered, crispy and moist on the inside. But if your not used to heat, just be warned; The medium will seriously burn! Prices were decent after getting ripped off at the Gaylord Opryland the last few nights.

reviews.name: Adam C.
reviews.review: * Disclaimer* I'm just a silly Northerner so I don't know 'southern food'.I was in Nashville last week, and walked over to this place with a group.I have never had Hot Chicken before , so I  did not know what to expect.The place is an older dive bar ..it even has a cigarette machine...talk about throw backs...The apps were just so-so, and I would not do them again,.The hot chicken  I had was 'Medium' but still had some kick. It appeared to be over cooked and greasy ( But fried so I expected that) at first glance, but was juicy inside, the only negative, it was very salty.   If you are in a group and HAVE to go here, stick with the hot chicken

reviews.name: Stephen M.
reviews.review: Visited on night of NFL conference championships as a newbie in town looking for a great sports atmosphere.  The food was good and reasonably priced.  I had a rack of their bbq ribs and baked beans as the side.  Both tasty (probably the best spicy baked beans I've had out).  Also was introduced to a tasty TN dark beer, Blackstone.  Initially, service was very good.  But, at change of shift, it pretty much disappeared.  (The original waitress did close out before she left.)The biggest disappointment was the general lack of interest in the game, though I guess this is Titan country!

reviews.name: Kevin D.
reviews.review: I had heard so much about the Hot Chicken that i had to try it.  Friendly service, plenty of TV's the Hot chicken (medium) was actually HOT???!!! Crazy I know!  I'd go back in a heartbeat.

reviews.name: Amanda T.
reviews.review: We were in town and decided to eat here cuz it was close. First it was hard to find and when we went it was segregated by smoking and nonsmoking. The nonsmoking section was closed from the bar and there was practically no service. I gave it 2 stars because the food was delicious, all be it slow. The waitress was nice but she kept disappearing and at one point our drinks were empty for about 20 mins. Not worth the price or the pain of finding the place.

reviews.name: Matt U.
reviews.review: Enjoyed some much needed catching up time with friends here the other night.  Drink prices are really good in comparison to some of the higher end establishments I have been visiting.  They have a karaoke room as well as a couple of pool tables in the other room with the bar.  Jaime H. helped us out with our drinks before we moved to a table.  She was pretty awesome.  I feel like another girl that took care of us at the table was a little bit in the weeds when it took some time to get her over to the table a couple of times.  Nice place to hang out with friends and throw back a couple of drinks.

reviews.name: Mike M.
reviews.review: Service was average. BBQ the best thing about this place. True smoked in their smoker out back.  Cigarette Smokers can smoke here inside which I'm not used to being from Ohio where no smoking allowed in any restaurants or bars. Place is close to being a dive but enough tourists come to balance.

reviews.name: Lumnum W.
reviews.review: The food is great, location is odd. Try giving directions to a business inside a parking lot behind other businesses. ( no the pool is not for the restaurant). We used to come here a lot before the flood when it was a true dive bar. The expansion is for the better, with bbq/ hot chicken to chow on and a better beer flow. Biggest complaints are : smoking inside which even as a former smoker I can't stand while I'm eating, and the patio serves all the food but only half the drinks, wtf? That's going to be you biggest pull for drinks during summer and you are going to limit what is served? Then you are going to make me sit inside your smoked filled dining room to have what I truly want? I don't care if I like your food, if you are not going to accommodate my basic needs, I'm going to pass. Hope the tourist are from Wisconsin.

reviews.name: Jessica V.
reviews.review: My husband and I were feeling saucy so we decided to try something new and from the looks of Yelp Scoreboard was convenient and looked right up our alley.  I was wrong. First off it was a little confusing to find from the map directions on this app but we finally found it after circling the area for a minute. The waitress seemed bored, didn't smile much or seem appreciative that we chose their establishment. The tortilla chips with salsa and cheese dip appetizer is a complete rip off and my fries were over cooked. The mild (but pretty hot) chicken strips were tasty but I still felt it was either over cooked or cooked in old oil. Probably not going there again. I did enjoy my pitcher of Bud Light tho... I'll give em that.

reviews.name: Phil T.
reviews.review: I was in Nashville to attend a conference at the Gaylord Resort which is across the street from the Scorecard.  Went to Scorecard twice for lunch. Had the pulled pork sandwich one day and the BBQ chicken sandwich the next day. The sandwiches were delicious.  My conference buddies loved the food too. Just plain good food. Nothing fancy. As I always say, you don't have a lot to have a great meal. The only negative is that smoking is permitted there.   If you are at the Gaylord,  take a walk across the street to experience a local meal.

reviews.name: Jonathan B.
reviews.review: I was searching for a Sports Bar to watch Game 6 is the Stanley Cup Finals.  I found this place as it was near my hotel.  I am here to tell you that I am very happy that I came here!First off, my waitress Sarah was amazing!  She had a number of tables and she was flawless as she juggled them all at once!It was 35 cent wings night and Sarah recommended them highly.  I order the minimum of 10 wings with a medium sauce.  I finished the 10 wings in about 10 minutes time!  They were outstanding!Then right on cue, Brandy delivers my BBQ combo plate!  A little bit of everything....pulled pork, brisket, chicken, ribs and hot links.  There was so much food on the plate that it could have fed four people!  It did not disappoint!  The hot links were my favorite with the brisket a close second.Overall, a great place to eat with even better service!  I even bought a tshirt to remember my visit!  To say the least, I loved this place and Sarah was an amazing waitress!  You better believe I will be back!Keep up the great work Scoreboard!

reviews.name: Matthew H.
reviews.review: Must order the hot chicken. This place is a great find!!!

reviews.name: Pam S.
reviews.review: Best bbq pork sandwich ever! Friendly, quick service. A tad too smokey for my likes, but I could have moved away from the bar area of I needed to. Locals seem to love it, they were having fun yucking it up. If I am ever in the area again, I want to return and try the ribs!

reviews.name: Jesse O.
reviews.review: Here for a couple of weeks on vacation and staying up the road.  What great food and local atmosphere.  If you like hot wings, here is the place. Holy hot! Great happy hour and reasonable prices. A must try spot.

reviews.name: Tara J.
reviews.review: If I could leave no stars I would. We wanted to order drinks and food. Waited 15 minutes for a waitress. Another 10 for a pitcher of beer. Waitress took 15 to bring me a glass a water, which she rolled her eyes at when I ordered. We never got to order food. We left.

reviews.name: Mike F.
reviews.review: From up north and wanted to watch the Bruins play a playoff game while on business in Nashville. The front desk at my hotel sent me to the Scoreboard Bar.....figured how could I go wrong......First off, very hard to find, tucked away in a parking lot between a bunch of buildings.  Secondly, walk in and it they have plenty of TV's but most are on horse racing and bull riding. Staff was nice enough, tried to find the game but couldnt....... it was on a pretty common national station so we were very disappointed.  I am not expert on BBQ.... but I know good food.  This was not good.  Barely any meat on the ribs.......  the Brisket was mostly fat and sauce...... All in all there are a lot better places to watch a sporting event and have some ribs.... we found two close by.

reviews.name: Penny J.
reviews.review: Had an excellent time here. Didn't eat, but the food looked and smelled amazing. The bartender and waitresses here are super nice and very helpful. Drinks were good and nothing was overpriced. Will be going back next time we are in Nashville. This is a good time place with superfriendly people.

reviews.name: Craig C.
reviews.review: Really good BBQ.  Great hot sauce for chicken.   Sports decor, including Packer memorabilia.   But even non-smoking side smells of smoke.

reviews.name: Chris D.
reviews.review: The food is awesome, but the service was HORRIBLE!  Sat at a table for 15 minutes before anyone acknowledged us. The only other time I saw our waitress was when she brought us drinks and our food. Never asked if we needed a refill or needed anything at all. When we were done with our food we waited and waited and waited for the check. I ended up going to the bar to pay for my food. The place wasn't even busy. I think our waitresses name was Lisa. This place would be awesome if they had better service.

reviews.name: Tony L.
reviews.review: Love this place! Great prices, great bbq. BEST BRISKET I'VE EVER HAD. Woulda given this place 5 stars but on Sundays during football season it turns into a Packers bar. Go Bears!

reviews.name: Lana M.
reviews.review: Great food, great prices, very friendly staff. Lots of TVs for sports fans. Check it out if you're in Nashville!  Close to the Opry.

reviews.name: Victoria R.
reviews.review: We tried to test this place out since it had decent reviews. Unfortunately, we were only in this dump for about 30 seconds since the cigarette smoke was too thick to permit staying longer. They may have good ribs, but they definitely aren't good enough to warrant sitting in a cloud of smoke for dinner.

reviews.name: Brandon M.
reviews.review: Have you missed that smokey venue that you leave feeling like you got high off of everyone else's tobacco addiction?  Well Scoreboard racks up some points for remaining an old school, smoke filled bar.  What goes better with your lungs filled with second hand smoke than fried pickles and fried hot chicken.  Yep we decided to take our pinky in the air, California crazy, butts to a place where vegetables are only served one way...deep fried.  Our grease filled, drink pounding, smoke inhaling experience brought me back to when I first turned 21.  That being said I believe my good times were had only because of the people I was with.  The TV's were old and outdated.  The food was ok (The pickles were the best part of the food).  And the service was slower than our government trying to pass a bill.  It was a good time but not great.  If you like the people you are with...this is your place.  Otherwise I would find another watering hole.

reviews.name: Dylan R.
reviews.review: First place we ate in Nashville was pretty good.  Great fried pickles appetizer.  Able to watch the Panthers game no problem on Sunday, despite the bountiful Packers fans.  No doubt this is a Packer bar, as the Titans game was on one TV and this place is 10 miles from their stadium.  The chicken wings were pretty good and they had great deals for buckets on NFL Sundays. Great sports bar

reviews.name: Philly D.
reviews.review: Great hot chicken. Nashville in general has the best chicken in the world, but the hot chicken that this place makes is outrageously good. I didn't even know what hot chicken is until I tried this place out. I ordered the medium heat my first time. My friend ordered the hottest they had. The cook brought it out for him, put it down in front of him, and said, "I would not f$%& with that." Yeah, it was hot.Not a very happening spot, but there's always a seat and there's always chicken.

reviews.name: Mike M.
reviews.review: Great hot chicken! For the spice lovers, get the hot with the Satans Tongue on the side. You wont be let down!

reviews.name: Heather K.
reviews.review: Being a Nashville Newbie, this was the VERY first place my fiance and I stopped to eat and grab a beer, only hours after arriving in town. The fried pickles were awesome as was the house-made Ranch dressing. They have plenty of beer to choose from, not just Bud Light. I had a giant frothy mug of Newcastle as did my fella. Prices are average. Their hot chicken, better known as "Devil's Tongue" is darn-tootin' delicious. We eat TONS of hot/spicy food so it was not the hottest we've ever had, but for those folks who don't put Dave's Insanity Sauce on everything, it will probably kick your @$$. Our waitress was super nice and friendly, and after deciding she might have similar tastes as ourselves (she looks kinda rockabilly....yeah, we are judgemental like that), we asked her what are the hot spots/dive bars/attractions that a pair of beer-swilling, tattooed freaks might enjoy. Not only did she give us a list of some cool crusty hipster bars and museums, but she wrote it all down for us along with Tennessee liquor laws. Thanks, Alex! If everyone is as friendly as Alex at the Scoreboard, Nashville is a shining example if Southern Hospitality.

reviews.name: Chris L.
reviews.review: Located just across the way from the Opryland Hotel, the food and the service was excellent! BEST RIBS EVER! Everyone was friendly, great drinks (Jack Daniels Single Barrel of course) complete strangers were buying us pitchers of Fat Tire, we could not have found a better place to go. We went there every night of the convention, we were so glad to have found this place - highest recommendation!

reviews.name: Bryan L.
reviews.review: Excellent "Hot Chicken" and fried pickles!!

reviews.name: diane m.
reviews.review: We were dying for great food when we got in late to our hotel and this was just the spot.  Such a fun atmosphere, lots of sports, really friendly people and the best hush puppies I have had in years!  The barbeque was terrific and so was the catfish.  Loved our visit to Scoreboard

reviews.name: Kristin F.
reviews.review: I went here to watch the Worl Cup. The bar was pretty much empty.... which was... fine. I went there because I heard they had good hot chicken. The food was good... nothing to write home about but the service was TERRIBLE! Our waitress never brought us the beer we ordered. We had to finally go to the bar to order our beer. Our waitress repeatedly walked around our table to serivce the other tables and never once check on us. Thats ok, I had a surprise for her too when our bill came. I paid the bill and left no tip. I would never go there again or recommend that bar. There are other places in Nashville for hot chicken with MUCH better service.

reviews.name: Tiffany M.
reviews.review: This is the best Chinese food I've eaten in Nashville. Don't get too excited. All the Chinese food in Nashville is pretty bad. Really bad... Really, ask anyone who lives here where to order the best Chinese takeout. They'll think about it a bit and tell you there's no such thing here. This food at best wok is acceptable. I'll call it Acceptable Wok. The sweet and sour chicken is average, but nothing special the rice is decent... somehow so many of the other places in Nashville manage to even mess up something as simple as plain white rice... I don't know how. So it's worth noting that the rice here is what you would normally expect from a Chinese place. The lo mien is meh. The noodles are sort of... I don't know... Doughy? Soft? Something. Not the best, but not the worst. The dumplings are pretty good. Standard dumplings. I got some of the fried donuts as well. Can't really go wrong with deep fried buns tossed in sugar. Even my cat tried to eat one of those.I've had soup here a few times and remember it being fairly standard as well.So, I don't know. Overall, this is my go to place for Chinese. It's nothing special. Nothing is exceptional, but nothing I've had there has really been bad. The fact that Nashville has no better Chinese food to offer really kind of limits the options. We'll keep going here unless we find someplace else.

reviews.name: Alex P.
reviews.review: They estimated delivery to be 40 minutes but managed to get to my place in 20.  They're usually fast but never take longer than their expected time.  The delivery guys are usually frustrating (ie/ talk fast, hang up on you, can't figure out how to reach you, impolite, sometimes lazy, etc, etc).  Aside from that, I do like this place.  It's cheap and most of the menu items are good.Good- BBQ spare ribs - sweet and salty- steamed dumplings- general tso's chicken- downright addictive!- teriyaki chicken on skewers - chicken is tender - Beef Lo mein (fatter noodles)- pork egg foo young - it's basically an omelet with a salty sauce- pork chow mei fun (thin noodles)- sesame chicken- sweet and sour chicken - fried with dipping sauce- "chinese vegetables" - long beans in black bean sauce - it's salty- Boneless spare ribs- Chicken rice soup - especially great when you have the cold!- beef and broccoli - kind of blandMediocre (or bland)- pork fried rice- rice was hard- Scallops- pretty sure they're not scallops...- chicken with cashews.

reviews.name: Meagan G.
reviews.review: We ordered the General Tso's chicken and Hunan chicken for our entrées, and both were grossly soggy. However, our crab wontons and egg rolls were pretty good, and the delivery was quicker than the estimated time given, so I'll give two stars instead of just one. We probably won't order from here again, though.

reviews.name: Jetta H.
reviews.review: Okay... I am new to the area and live less than 2 miles. Family in town and was going to treat them to dinner. They wont deliver to is. Lady was SO rude. You people just missed out on a $200 dinner and great tip.   Feel like getting treated like crap?, call this place.

reviews.name: Luka S.
reviews.review: Really good Chinese food & supper cheap too. In the not so nice part of town but deff worth stopping by!! I had curry chicken and it was delicious.

reviews.name: Audrey S.
reviews.review: We got our food delivered and it arrived very quickly after we ordered. We got sweet and sour chicken and moo goo gui pan and they were both very tasty and hot upon arrival. We will definitely order from them again.

reviews.name: A B.
reviews.review: Hit or miss. Sometimes the food is pretty good, other times it's soggy. If you need something quick that's not pizza, it's worth a try.

reviews.name: Emma R.
reviews.review: Dined in - great food compared to the other Chinese places around Nashville. Great service as well. Really happy I came across this place and plan on returning.

reviews.name: Jonny A.
reviews.review: I'd rather eat diarrhea. I got soup, dumplings, and orange chicken. The dumplings were good, considering I got them down without vomiting. Can't say the same after I had the soup and orange chicken. The egg drop soup doesn't have broth... Just goo. The chicken was soggy and just nasty. God, I hate this place. Worst wok. Worst damn wok ever!

reviews.name: T N.
reviews.review: Ordered through GrubHub on Feb 16th during the ice storm. The guy delivered it early and because of road conditions parked his car at a near gas station and walked to my apartment. That is dedication. I have ordered from these guys before and their service is top notch, always arriving within 30-40min. Their food is great. Not greasy. Fresh and delicious. Always comes hot and packaged well. Even during the ice storm the food was hot. These guys are sincerely amazing. Wish GrubHub would allow bigger tips (after a certain amount the app resets the tip amount; could be an app glitch). Gave the guy 20+% tip because he was a hero.

reviews.name: Neil D.
reviews.review: Not such a great hood but worth driving just a couple miles down the road from the West End places.  Chicken with garlic sauce 3 days in a row was consistent and very good!

reviews.name: Elizabeth L.
reviews.review: Tried delivery as it is a rare Chinese place that delivers here....I got dumplings and those were of course good. The actual General Tso's and fried rice was terrible....the chicken was so crispy it was inedible. The rice was just greasy. I ended up throwing almost all of it away and I felt bad for having wasted the money.

reviews.name: Chuck S.
reviews.review: This wasn't the worst Chinese food I have had but it was definitely sub par. The fried dumplings were great, but Sesame Chicken, Chicken Chow Mein, Crab Rangoons, Generals Tso Chicken were all lackluster. I've found a lot better Chinese food for the same price in Nashville.

reviews.name: Misty M.
reviews.review: We had the General and a shrimp dish and they were tolerable but it was the worst hot and sour soup ever. Food was fast but not appetizing. I really wanted to like this place.

reviews.name: Harold T.
reviews.review: Are you in the ghetto and hungry for Chinese food?? Look no further!!This place is fantastic- You can order your food online, they have vegetarian options, the food is cheap, the food is filling, and the food is decently fresh. I also enjoy how friendly the staff is. They always greet me with a smile and cater to all my needs.

reviews.name: Emma C.
reviews.review: One of the worst meals I've ordered in a long time. Save your money, and go to a different place. My food was over cooked, not fresh, and lacking in flavor.

reviews.name: Karla Marie B.
reviews.review: Finally!! Delivery Chinese to Green Hills that's awesome. Loved the steamed dumplings and crab wontons. Lo mein and pepper steak were good. Price was great. Delivery quick. Very pleased :)

reviews.name: Sean H.
reviews.review: Not so good, if you're a fan of real Chinese food. Food took a long time to get here (I'm 2.5 miles away - took an hour), and when it did, it was cold. Egg roll was soggy and of the standard food service frozen kind. I ordered Tso's, and specified the following: "Please make **VERY** spicy!". No spice at all, cold, soggy, and made with the standard frozen chicken nuggets that so many purveyors seem to use these days. As far as the spice level goes, I like spicy food - really - but it's not like I said 'make it spicy!' and they did and it just wasn't spicy enough for some sort of capsaicin lunatic; what I'm saying is, there was zero. Nada. Not any. Other than that, all very standard stuff, 'conveyor line' Chinese. Delivery, yes, and if you just want something fast, sure, but if you're a real fan of Chinese food, you can skip it.

reviews.name: Jessica J.
reviews.review: They always take an hour to deliver, its never hot, usually warm, sometimes cold, and they are wishy washy on the orders, sometimes spot on other times not so much, they always forget the chopsticks and sweet and sour, even though i note it twice. the Lo mein was super nasty, but i always order the orange chicken and its really good except one time it tasted like generals not orange chicken...very strange

reviews.name: mike g.
reviews.review: The food is affordable so plus there. Its the service that always gets me. You get your food, you're in and your out, good deal.But try ordering food by phone in the evening. There is always this lady that answers who is  so rude. I understand that they sometimes need to put you on hold, that isn't the problem. Its that she is so damn impatient! The last time i ordered by phone, i cancelled my order infuriated and vowed i would never go there again. Needless to say, the food is so cheap and tasty enough that i have since gone back (with friends). The convenience plays such a huge factor, especially if you live near by. They deliver late and to places that other establishments wont deliver to.

reviews.name: Spencer H.
